jobDescription: Fraud Management Online eCommerce Product - LeadTake your career to new heights!   Would you like an opportunity to work in a dynamic organization where you will have the experience of being in the forefront of developing new technologies that will connect people and businesses around the globe?  Work with a financially sound organization that has a 160-year history of providing services to individuals and organizations in every corner of the globe.CDI Corporation is working with  this dynamic organization to locate technical talent to join their team!    They offer outstanding benefits and advancement opportunities.  The employees of  our client have been the backbone of our innovative spirit-and continued success-since our beginnings in 1851. And it's a proud tradition that continues today with the next dedicated, enterprising individual that joins our team-hopefully, you.   Right now, we are seeking an Online eCommerce Product Leader who has experience with large scale fraud work . Key Requirementsthat are A MUST include:Online fraud a technology side Rules Engine ImplementationComplex (Implementation) data algorithms,Middleware, J2EE BasedHigh transaction systemsThis position is responsible for accumulating data from multiple sources within the Web and Mobile commerce eco-system and apply advanced analytic techniques such as data mining and statistics to design, implement, validate, and refine mathematical models and algorithms to better manage fraud and risk within the digital world. A key attribute for this role is deep knowledge of the money service business industry, regulations and the various methods and industry best practices for in-depth transaction analysis, fraud detection and prevention. Qualified candidates have experience in organizational policy and procedure setting and are technologically proficient in communication protocols and security controls. The position requires the ability to come up with innovative technical solutions to help manage our potential exposure to online credit card and payment risk. This will include analyzing order and industry data to identify emerging fraud trends, developing and defining strategies to mitigate these trends and leading the engineering effort to implement these strategies employing both Mobile and Online commerce using established industry best practices. The Product Lead will play a significant role in detecting and analyzing trends, maintaining an appropriate balance between risk and control, while remaining focused on driving down the incidence of negative customer experiences relative to cancelled orders (false positives). It also involves providing analytics, reporting, business insights and recommendations that enable Risk Management to rapidly make strategic, insightful, and informed business decisions to manage losses and enable growth. The main function is to continually identify high-impact opportunities for improvement using advanced data mining, pattern recognition and other innovative solutions.Key Responsibilities:

Introduction: The Johns Hopkins University Applied Physics Laboratory (JHU/APL), a national leader in scientific research and development, located midway between Baltimore and Washington, DC, is seeking an engineer or physicist with expertise in remote sensing and data analysis to work on problems of national importance.Job Summary: Provide algorithm development and analysis of remote sensing data in support of undersea warfare and other programs of national importance.  Opportunity to work with a group of dedicated professionals from a variety of technical backgrounds involved in all aspects of in-situ and remote sensing of oceanic and atmospheric phenomena.  Projects span a wide range of technologies and include-end-to-end signature modeling, measurements, signal processing, algorithm development, and the analysis and interpretation of experimental data.Duties (Listed in order of importance with the estimated amount of time spent at each task): Analyze data and compare results with model predictions.  Develop physical understanding of phenomenology. (40%) Develop and apply algorithms to exploit remote sensing data. (40%)Plan and participate in field tests (10%)Communicate results effectively, in both written and oral form, to sponsors, peer organizations and applicable R&D communities. (10%)Note: This job summary and listing of duties is for the purpose of describing the position and its essential functions at time of hire and may change over time.Required Qualifications:M.S. in physics, engineering (electrical preferred), applied mathematics or related field, with at least 5 years of relevant work experience, which can include graduate-level research.  Well developed computer programming skills applicable to scientific analysis (e.g., MATLAB, FORTRAN) Desired Qualifications: Ph.D. in any of the above fields.  Knowledge of and  job-related experience in signal processing and data analysis.  Experience with optical and/or radar remote sensing systems.  Experience with NTM systems and associated infrastructure. Special Working Conditions: Expect to spend between 5 and 10% of the time on travel in connection with meetings and field tests.Security: Top Secret Clearance is required. Applicants selected will be subject to a Government security investigation and must meet the eligibility requirements for an SSBI and access to classified information. Preference for current SSBI. Eligibility requirements include US citizenship.Benefits: APL offers a comprehensive benefits package including a liberal vacation plan, a matching retirement program, significant educational assistance, a scholarship tuition program for staff with dependents, and competitive salaries commensurate with skills and experience. For more information about our organization, please visit our web site at www.jhuapl.edu Equal Employment Opportunity: Johns Hopkins University Applied Physics Laboratory is an equal opportunity/affirmative action employer that complies with Title IX of the Education Amendments Acts of 1972, as well as other applicable laws, and values diversity in its workforce.Additional Information:Travel Percentage: 10%

General Dynamics C4 Systems' Battle Management Systems designs, develops, and integrates highly sophisticated command, control, and communications, intelligence, surveillance and reconnaissance systems for the U.S. military, federal agencies, civil governments and select international customers. These systems combine advanced visualization software and multi-sensor inputs to provide near real-time situational awareness to tactical decision makers. Our engineers help transform large amounts of complex data into useful information that is clearly and intuitively presented to the user.  We design and develop systems and software for a wide range of global missions including: mission command; intelligence;  airspace management; crisis and emergency management; mission rehearsal and training; peace keeping and contingency operations; and public safety.The Research Scientist will be an important thought leader within this organization, located at the GDC4S facility in Arlington, Va  providing technical leadership in expanding GDC4Ss current Research programs, expanding GDC4Ss base of IP that can be leveraged across multiple projects, building new capabilities through internal Research & Development (IR&D) programs, and developing and pursuing new business opportunities. Recent experience working with government research customers  particularly DARPA, DoD labs, Intelligence Community, and DHS S&T activities  is highly desirable. The Research Scientist will report to the  BMS CTO and will  create R&D roadmaps for the short, medium, and long term. This position will will help grow the demand for Battle Management System solutions within the US Government, either directly from the sponsoring US Government agency or through partnership with another company or laboratory. This may later expand to non-US Government sponsors. Education and ExperienceBachelors Degree in engineering, a related technical field or the equivalent experience is required. Advanced degree is preferred.  In addition, a minimum of 15 years of related experience is required.  3 years of leadership experience is preferred.Qualified candidates will have an advanced degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, Artificial Intelligence, Computer Engineering, and/or another related or equivalent technical or scientific field. Has least 10+ years post graduate experience in research / advanced development experience, a successful record of proposal authoring, and project leadership/management experience. The candidate will have strong theoretical and practical background in relevant topic areas that may include: command and control, cyber security, ISR, algorithmic and visual analytics, and the human-information interface. Has 5+ years technical experience in software development with ability to quickly prototype in Java and possesses strong Computer Science fundamentals (data structures, algorithm design and analysis, etc). Preferred candidates have as at least 3+ years experience that include progressive leadership roles managing software project budgets and schedules. Experience with government development, contracting, and procurement process is a plus.Successful candidates will have a strong technical background, a keen business sense, and will be motivated by the impacts generated when the research products reaches users in the field, not just the research process. Excellent teamwork, oral, and written communication skills are a must, as is the desire to develop and execute research programs. Candidates will also have current familiarity with agencies and individuals who are logical sources of R&D funding and can identify and lead the pursuit of appropriate partnering opportunities and potential sponsor targets. Will have experience authoring proposals with research funding agencies such as DARPA, DoD service labs, and other funding agencies. Possesses ability to generate and develop and market new research ideas as demonstrated by a strong technical publication record in respected journals, books, and conference proceedings including keynote presentations.Must be able to travel 20% of the time. Applicant must be capable of obtaining a US Security Clearance. Applicant must be a US Citizen. Secret level U.S. DoD security clearance is required.    Submit Your Resume Online Now

Knowledge/competence in analysis using modern PC computer techniques, systems, and tools.7.       Excellent written and verbal communication skills, professional demeanor, customer service attitude, and multidisciplinary skills.8.       Prior experience working with Defense Advanced Research Projects Agency (DARPA) a plus.

Introduction: The Johns Hopkins University Applied Physics Laboratory (APL), a national leader in scientific research and development, located midway between Baltimore and Washington, DC is seeking a Combat Systems Test and Evaluation Engineer/Analyst.Job Summary: Apply software skills, signal processing skills, and system engineering and analysis skills to support Combat Systems development and Assessment programs in the Force Projection Department; specifically working Advanced Processor Builds (APB), Engineering Measurements Programs (EMP), and other related naval tactical tests, missions, and exercises.Duties:Assess developmental and fleet Combat Systems at the algorithmic, functional, technical, and system performance level by applying disciplined data analysis techniques to compute performance measures, and generate intuitive visualizations of results.  Capabilities assessed may include acoustic and visual detection, tracking, tactical control and/or tactical decision and technologies and system functions supporting the Fleet.  (35%) Interface with system developers, and analysis team members to determine analysis methodology, appropriate measures of performance and data required to execute analysis. (35%)Participate in planning and testing at developer or Fleet facilities in support of assessment of Combat Systems. (20%)Prepare detailed briefings on analysis methodology and results.  Brief results to sponsors and external organizations.  (10%) Note: This job summary and listing of duties is for the purpose of describing the position and its essential functions at time of hire and may change over time.Required Qualifications: BS in EE, mathematics, physics or equivalent.  Minimum of 5 years of relevant experience in field applicable to the positions.  Strong MATLAB skills for prototyping  algorithms and assessing algorithm performance.  Strong understanding of data analysis and statistics.  Excellent written, verbal and briefing skills. Willingness to participate in off-site Field Testing.Desired Qualifications: MSEE or MS Math.  Academic emphasis on signal processing, communications, or state estimation.  Experience with MATLAB GUIs, C/C++, and JAVA.  Demonstrated leadership capability.     Special Working Conditions:  Travel to include meetings (typically less than 3 days per month).  System Field Testing typically requires several weeks (non-continuous) of travel to system integrator site.Security: Top Secret Clearance is required. Applicants selected will be subject to a Government security investigation and must meet the eligibility requirements for an SSBI and access to classified information. Preference for current SSBI. Eligibility requirements include US citizenship.Benefits: APL offers a comprehensive benefits package including a liberal vacation plan, a matching retirement program, significant educational assistance, a scholarship tuition program for staff with dependents, and competitive salaries commensurate with skills and experience. For more information about our organization, please visit our web site at www.jhuapl.edu Equal Employment Opportunity: Johns Hopkins University Applied Physics Laboratory is an equal opportunity/affirmative action employer that complies with Title IX of the Education Amendments Acts of 1972, as well as other applicable laws, and values diversity in its workforce.Additional Information:Travel Percentage: 10%

The ideal candidate will have an MS or PhD in Computer Science or Biological Science, preferably with several years of relevant experience analyzing and manipulating genome scale data sets.  He or she will be working in a fast-paced start-up, interacting with scientists and engineers from a variety of backgrounds, to integrate and verify the secondary analysis algorithms.Responsibilities:- Support integration of bioinformatics algorithms.- Define metrics and develop test protocols to verify bioinformatics algorithms.- Implement and execute tests against test plans.- Analyze results and troubleshoot error conditions or departures from norm.- Document results and communicate test data to different teams.- Coordinate with various stakeholders in surface chemistry and primary and secondary analysis to drive issues to resolution.Position Requirements:- Advanced degree, or equivalent experience, computer science, computational biology, or related fields.- Software development skills and experience with Python, Java, and C# is required.- Experience with Linux and R is also desired.- Experience with the following is a must: next-generation sequencing tools and techniques, statistics and bioinformatics, relational databases, and data mining.- Experience with Galaxy and Jenkins is a plus.- Good understanding of algorithm testing best-practices is desired.- Experience with of software best practices, object-oriented design, and/or software architecture is highly desired.- Product development and / or industry experience in a multi-disciplinary Biotech environment is a plus.

Introduction: The Johns Hopkins University Applied Physics Laboratory (APL), a national leader in scientific research and development, located midway between Baltimore and Washington, DC is seeking a C2BMC Systems Analyst.Job Summary: Provide technical leadership to conduct requirements and performance analysis supporting the development of C2BMC sensor planning and tasking algorithms. Duties (Listed in order of importance with the estimated amount of time spent at each task):  Provide technical leadership in systems engineering to manage requirements analyses, trade studies, sensitivity studies and performance analyses of C2BMC planning, tasking, and sensor management development activities; develop analysis plans in coordination with the C2BMC customer, ConOps developers, system architects and algorithm developers; direct and manage analysis efforts; support the development and assessment of performance requirements; apply the results of analyses to guide ConOps development, modeling and simulation development and algorithm design. Evaluate system performance metrics associated with C2BMC planning, tasking and sensor management. (90%) Deliver formal presentations to program management and sponsors; interface with BMDS C2BMC government sponsors and contractors; document requirements analysis, trades, and sensitivity studies; participate in program milestone planning and scheduling. (10%) Note: This job summary and listing of duties is for the purpose of describing the position and its essential functions at time of hire and may change over time.Required Qualifications: BS engineering or science degree; 10 or more years of systems engineering experience in large defense development programs; practical experience in ballistic missile defense programs including C2BMC experience; experience conducting and managing performance analyses; active TS clearance with an ability to obtain SCI.  Desired Qualifications: MS engineering or science degree; 15 or more years of practical experience in developing C2BMC planning and sensor management algorithms; experience developing tracking algorithms; GMD and AEGIS experience; active TS/SCI clearance. Special Working Conditions: Required travel: 5-10% in connection with PTSS programs, some additional local travel to meet with sponsors and contractors.Security: Applicant selected will be subject to a government security clearance investigation and must meet the requirements for access to classified information. Eligibility requirements include U.S. citizenship.Benefits:APL offers a comprehensive benefits package including a liberal vacation plan, a matching retirement program, significant educational assistance, a scholarship tuition program for staff with dependents, and competitive salaries commensurate with skills and experience. For more information about our organization, please visit our web site at www.jhuapl.edu Equal Employment Opportunity: Johns Hopkins University Applied Physics Laboratory is an equal opportunity/affirmative action employer that complies with Title IX of the Education Amendments Acts of 1972, as well as other applicable laws, and values diversity in its workforce.Additional Information:Travel Percentage: 10%

Worcester Polytechnic InstituteAssistant Professor of Animation and Interactive Media  Department: 	Humanities & Arts  Location: 	Salisbury Labs  Position Status: 	Faculty/Research Positions  Position Description: 	Do you want to teach smart, talented, eager university students how to animate, develop computer games, including serious games, and other interactive media? Are you interested in character animation in a discipline that combines art with computer science? Do you embrace the incorporation of technology into your art? Do you want to work in an environment that fosters interdisciplinary education? If so, you should consider joining the faculty at WPI.The Interactive Media and Game Development (IMGD) program (imgd.wpi.edu) and the Humanities and Arts department at WPI are jointly seeking a unique individual whose talents and interests center on artistic computer animation but with a deep understanding of the underlying technology.The IMGD program provides an outstanding education in the principles and techniques of interactive applications and computer-based game development. Nationally recognized as a top game design program in the country by the Princeton Review, the IMGD program grants Bachelor and Master of Science degrees, with approximately 200 students nurtured by more than a dozen dedicated faculty. IMGD undergraduates build a solid foundation in game design and then specialize in either the technical (programming) or artistic (art, music, story) aspects of game development, combining both disciplines in their own work and in teams. IMGD graduate students focus on technical game development, game development management or serious games. Please visit imgd.wpi.edu or  http://www.wpi.edu/academics/hua/  for more information.WPI, founded in 1865 and located one hour west of Boston, is a highly selective private university with an undergraduate student body of over 3,800 and 1,500 full-time and part-time graduate students enrolled in more than 50 Bachelor's, Master's, and Ph.D. programs. WPI is consistently ranked among the top 60 research institutions by US News & World Report. The university is home to an innovative and intensive project-based curriculum that empowers students with the knowledge and skills to address real world problems around the globe, an approach repeatedly cited for excellence by the Fiske Guide to Colleges and the Princeton Review. Faculty collaborate with various regional institutions, including Worcester's WICN Public Radio, the Worcester Art Museum, Harvard Medical School, Berklee College of Music, and the Colleges of Worcester Consortium.The greater Boston area is a thriving region for game development, with over 75 game companies.  Requirements: 	Candidates should have an MFA in Art or a closely related field, and the potential for excellence in scholarship and teaching in Art.Applicants must demonstrate traditional animation skills, such as character animation as applied to storytelling, as well as have experience with 3D animation tools. The ideal candidate will also be a creative teacher and scholar with a passion for computer games and other forms of interactive media. Knowledge of coding, scripting, and game development are a plus.  Posting Date: 	08-21-2012  Closing Date: 	12-15-2012Special Instructions to Applicants: 	To apply, please submit Vitae Digital material supporting your application (for example, a portfolio)Research statementTeaching statementContact information of at least three references to be contacted for lettersFor full consideration, applications should be received by December 15th, 2012.Electronic applications should be submitted online via: http://imgd.wpi.edu/facultyhire.html Questions about the hiring process should be sent to:imgd-hiring@wpi.edu  	To enrich education through diversity, WPI is an affirmative action, equal opportunity employer.A Member of the Colleges of Worcester ConsortiumApplicants for this position must apply with the department directly. VIZ Media is looking for an Animation Marketing Manager to join our Animation team! and participating in interviewsWorks closely with the VP of Animation to manage annual marketing budgets and spendsResponsible for developing and implementing high ROI online  marketing campaigns leveraging social media and other online marketing  vehiclesMonitors, reviews, and optimizes campaigns by developing in-depth understanding of key performance driversManages day-to-day progress of areas including:  sales, production, creative, and operations to execute specific  marketing plans for each assigned brandPrepares marketing objectives and schedules for all phases of  product industryManages 3rd party relationships with external marketing partnersProduces competitive analysis materials comparing product with its key competitorsDevelops monthly, quarterly, & annual ROI PREFERREDExperience with 3rd party AD Networks PREFERREDProficiency with computer usage, including email, Internet, and standard softwareAbility to speak, read, and write effectively in EnglishAbility professionally with culturally diverse clients, providers, and staffAbility to work effectively in a small organization with an emphasis on teamworkAbility to work legally in the United StatesAbility to live in/commute to the San Francisco Bay AreaMUST be able to travel as needed MINIMUM PREVIOUS EXPERIENCE, TRAINING, AND EDUCATION 5-7 years of relevant business experience Demonstrated past demonstrates suitable  preparation for this position SUPERVISORY RESPONSIBILITIES This position does not supervise others, but may give guidance to the work of interns and freelancers. WORKING ENVIRONMENT/MINIMUM PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS Approximately 90% of time spent on the job involves  use of a video display terminal; therefore, must be able to sit for  extended periods and to utilize standard ergonomics practices. Primarily  works in an office environment, requiring the following activity:  lifting and carrying materials weighing up to 15 pounds, kneeling,  bending. Must be able to use standard office equipment such as copiers  and faxes. MUST be able to travel both domestically and internationally  as needed. Employees must be able to  cope effectively with deadlines and multiple demands.TO APPLY Please send your detailed cover letter, resume, AND salary requirements. Please specify "Animation Marketing Manager" when applying.

Media Arts & Animation Instructor    Job SummaryThe Media Arts and Animation instructor facilitates meaningful learning of the course competencies in the curriculum and proactively supports all facets of the learning environment. S/He provides education through learning-centered instruction that will enable graduates to fulfill the evolving needs of the marketplace. S/He encourages a culture of learning that values mutual responsibility and respect, life-long learning and ethics as well as personal and professional development. This position is part time/adjunct only. Incumbent must assure that the EDMC philosophy: quality services to clients; development, growth, involvement, and recognition of employees; sound economic principles; and environment which is conducive to innovation, positive thinking and expansion - is considered in carrying out the duties and responsibilities of this position. Key Job Elements          Provides competency-based education which aligns with the EDMC model of curricula as well as supports the EDMC style of system delivery.       Designs and delivers class instruction through the development of instructional plans to meet course competencies, the development of activities which support lesson objectives, and (in the case of online instructors ONLY) delivers the instruction as approved.       Enables the achievement of pre-described exit competencies for student achievement and evaluation of learning by providing instruction which fosters competencies and establish student performance criteria and evaluation.       Delivers learning-centered instruction by establishing a classroom environment conducive to learning and student involvement as well as effectively planning and preparing for classes and student success.       Promotes student success by showing flexibility in style and work schedule as well as exhibiting a passion for teaching and students and engaging students in the learning process.       Manages the learning environment through keeping accurate records, submitting grades and other reports on time, and enforcing school/campus academic and attendance policies.       Contributes to a learning culture by participating on curriculum and system task forces, supporting local campus events such as orientation and graduation, and participating in various other workshops and meetings.       Relates professional/life/industry experience to learning by the continuation of professional/technical skills development, the introduction of industry perspective into courses, and the active awareness of professional/industry trends and opportunities.     Reports To:Dean of System-Wide Programs, Academic Department Director Directly Supervises:NoneInteracts With:Academic affairs department, other school/campus functional areas, curriculum task force and other committees, other faculty, and students Job RequirementsKnowledge:           Master's of Fine Arts degree in Animation, Computer Art, or equivalant is required.  Profiency in 3D Max or Maya is preferred.       Zero to two years experience in instruction or formalized education process, preferably in a post-secondary or college institution.       Membership in a professional association tied to area of instruction preferred.     Skills:           Excellent verbal and written communication skills including the ability to build successful relationships with student populations.       Outstanding conflict resolution skills.       Demonstrated time management and detail-oriented skills       Computer based skills (i.e., software, analytical, and report writing skills )    Abilities:           Ability to work effectively under pressure and to meet frequently occurring deadlines.       Ability to develop a professional rapport with diverse school/campus constituents.       Ability to develop and complete projects without continued direct supervision       Ability to learn from students' participation, demonstrates fair and consistent behavior in all matters, and shows compassion without being ineffectual      Job Requirements Work Environment The work environment characteristics described here are representative of those an employee encounters while performing the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable qualified individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. The term "qualified individual with a disability" means an individual with a disability who, with or without reasonable accommodation, can perform the essential functions of the position. While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to communicate professionally in person, over the telephone, through email and other electronic means, move about the office or school, handle various types of media and equipment, and visually or otherwise identify, observe and assess. The employee is occasionally required to lift up to 10 pounds unless otherwise specified in the job description. Notice The intent of this job description is to provide a representative and level of the types of duties and responsibilities that will be required of positions given this title and shall not be construed as a declaration of the total of the specific duties and responsibilities of any particular position. Employees may be directed to perform job-related tasks other than those specifically presented in this description. Education Management Corporation is an Equal Opportunity Employer and embraces diversity as a critical step in ensuring employee, student and graduate success. We are committed to building and developing a diverse environment where a variety of ideas, cultures and perspectives can thrive.Click Here To Applyhttp://edmc.hua.hrsmart.com/pm_module/cgi-bin/click.cgi?job_id=14989&site_id=123

StartFragmentRoute 8 Design    Route 8 is a multidisciplinary graphic and web design firm in Louisville, Kentucky.  Our core strengths are in brand design and development, information architecture, new media, and spatial experiences. This includes identity, print collateral, packaging, showroom environments and exhibit design, press kits, trade advertising, websites and e-communications.    Seeking:  Rendering/Animation specialist with at least 5 years experience to develop realistic 3D visualizations.    The qualified candidate is proficient (intermediate to expert) and versed in animations and/or still renderings with strong design and photo-realistic rendering skills, and an advanced understanding of 3DSMax and Photoshop. 3DS Max proficiency is a must.    Qualified candidates must have skill sets in the following software: 3DS Max, (Mental Ray, V-Ray, Maxwell Render Engines), AutoCAD and Adobe Photoshop. Knowledge of additional design software (SketchUp, Illustrator, InDesign, etc) is a plus.     Job Responsibilities:  Responsible for hard surface modeling, texturing, lighting, and refining in Photoshop.  Will work closely with senior creative staff to visualize campaign ideas for use in 3D visualizations.  Ideation and visualization work is typically done within small teams under tight deadlines, so strong communication skills are required.  Resourceful; shows ingenuity in solving problems.  Dependable and detail oriented with an ability to learn and cope with rapid change.  The candidate is dedicated to the firm's high standards of quality.      To Apply:  For immediate, confidential consideration, please email your resume and work samples (including interior lighting, furniture, rendering and video) with your web link or as a pdf to:    info@route-8.com  EndFragment

Job Summary:       The role of the Program Coordinator is to work with faculty and others at the program level to provide students with a high quality educational experience and a high level of student support and service.      Incumbent must assure that the EDMC philosophy: quality services to clients; development, growth, involvement, and recognition of employees; sound economic principles; and environment which is conducive to innovation, positive thinking and expansion - is considered in carrying out the duties and responsibilities of this position.     Key Job Elements:      This position will teach a set number of courses as appropriate depending on program size.           Scheduling                           Develop schedule of course offerings that meets student needs and that meets key metrics including:  Average Registered Credits. Instructional Costs, Persistence, Student/Instructor Ratio.                     Faculty                           Recruit, manage, and mentor qualified faculty.           Subject areas to supervise: Digital Filmmaking & Video Production, Visual Effects & Motion Graphics, Media Arts & Animation, and Game Art & Design          Conduct ongoing faculty observations to improve instruction.           Provide annual faculty evaluation.           Work with faculty to resolve student issues.                      Students                           Foster student achievement, persistence, and success.           Improve the student experience at the program level by assuring that the program exudes a culture of learning and excellence.           Proactively work with students who are at risk of not performing to their potential.           Work with academic advising and other departments to support student success related to the following:  attendance, classroom performance, time to graduation.                            Assessment of Student Learning Outcomes                           Lead Student Learning Outcomes assessment for the program.           Work with faculty to improve student outcomes by developing and implementing improvements to the delivery of instruction including assignments, learning materials, and instructional strategies.                       Reports To:    Academic Department Director or Dean as appropriate   Directly Supervises: Faculty   Interacts With:    Inside contact encompasses the entire range of personnel.  Outside contacts may include community and professional leaders as well as other educators.     Job Requirements:      Knowledge:           Masters degree in fields such as Film, Animation, Visual Effects, Multimedia, or Game Art      Minimum of 3-5 years related work experience.      Held positions of increasingly responsible experience in the industry and/or Academic Affairs.        Skills:           Excellent communication skills, both written and oral.       Strong interpersonal skills with faculty and students.       Superior organization, prioritization, and self-motivation skills.       Strong computer literacy skills with the Microsoft Office Suite.       Technical Skills: Final Cut Pro, After Effects, 3Ds Max or Maya.        Abilities:           Ability to interact effectively as either a leader or as a member of a team and work collaboratively with other departments.       Ability to listen to customers (e.g. staff, etc.) and to understand and respond positively to their requests.       Ability to adapt to changing assignments and multiple priorities.       Ability to manage multiple tasks and successfully meet deadlines.      Job Requirements Work Environment  The work environment characteristics described here are representative of those an employee encounters while performing the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable qualified individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. The term "qualified individual with a disability" means an individual with a disability who, with or without reasonable accommodation, can perform the essential functions of the position. While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to communicate professionally in person, over the telephone, through email and other electronic means, move about the office or school, handle various types of media and equipment, and visually or otherwise identify, observe and assess. The employee is occasionally required to lift up to 10 pounds unless otherwise specified in the job description. Fraud Management Online eCommerce Product - LeadTake your career to new heights!   Would you like an opportunity to work in a dynamic organization where you will have the experience of being in the forefront of developing new technologies that will connect people and businesses around the globe?  Work with a financially sound organization that has a 160-year history of providing services to individuals and organizations in every corner of the globe.CDI Corporation is working with  this dynamic organization to locate technical talent to join their team!    They offer outstanding benefits and advancement opportunities.  The employees of  our client have been the backbone of our innovative spirit-and continued success-since our beginnings in 1851. And it's a proud tradition that continues today with the next dedicated, enterprising individual that joins our team-hopefully, you.   Right now, we are seeking an Online eCommerce Product Leader who has experience with large scale fraud work . Key Requirementsthat are A MUST include:Online fraud a technology side Rules Engine ImplementationComplex (Implementation) data algorithms,Middleware, J2EE BasedHigh transaction systemsThis position is responsible for accumulating data from multiple sources within the Web and Mobile commerce eco-system and apply advanced analytic techniques such as data mining and statistics to design, implement, validate, and refine mathematical models and algorithms to better manage fraud and risk within the digital world. A key attribute for this role is deep knowledge of the money service business industry, regulations and the various methods and industry best practices for in-depth transaction analysis, fraud detection and prevention. Qualified candidates have experience in organizational policy and procedure setting and are technologically proficient in communication protocols and security controls. The position requires the ability to come up with innovative technical solutions to help manage our potential exposure to online credit card and payment risk. This will include analyzing order and industry data to identify emerging fraud trends, developing and defining strategies to mitigate these trends and leading the engineering effort to implement these strategies employing both Mobile and Online commerce using established industry best practices. The Product Lead will play a significant role in detecting and analyzing trends, maintaining an appropriate balance between risk and control, while remaining focused on driving down the incidence of negative customer experiences relative to cancelled orders (false positives). It also involves providing analytics, reporting, business insights and recommendations that enable Risk Management to rapidly make strategic, insightful, and informed business decisions to manage losses and enable growth. The main function is to continually identify high-impact opportunities for improvement using advanced data mining, pattern recognition and other innovative solutions.Key Responsibilities:

We are seeking a Predictive Modeling Product Leader in the CTO organization. This position is responsible for accumulating data from multiple sources within the Web and Mobile commerce eco-system and apply advanced analytic techniques such as data mining and statistics to design, implement, validate, and refine mathematical models and algorithms to understand and optimize the value of user engagement with online and mobile sites using customer behavioral patterns and social sentiment data. The data scientist will synthesize, document, and syndicate Modeling results within the organization, with an eye to finding new applications for existing models and tools. The main function is to continually identify high-impact opportunities for improvement (e.g., marketing campaigns, propensity to buy and website optimization) in new and existing domains across Online and Mobile based on top business needs, surfacing the research questions that we should be asking next. The ideal candidate will have a keen interest in the study of an online and mobile social network, and a passion for identifying and answering questions that help us build the best customer experienceKey Responsibilities:a         Answer product questions by using appropriate statistical techniques on available data a         Design and analyze experiments that validate different optimization approaches.a         Act as an expert and evangelist in areas of data mining, machine learning, statistics, and analyticsa         Create data models for accurately solutioning the end to end dashboarding strategya         Individuals in this role are expected to be comfortable working as a software engineer and a quantitative researchera         Transform successful proofs of concept and working prototypes into scalable production-ready code in conjunction with BI engineering team

Our company thrives on creating the most inventive approach to any data challenge. Qbase delivers leading solutions in data enhancement, management and analytics to improve the quality of our clients' data, including scoring and predictive modeling. Innovative Qbase technology works smarter and faster to drive better results at lower cost. Along with our proprietary tools and web-hosted solutions which offer a fresh, intuitive approach to the way our clients manage and use data, we provide a full spectrum of information technology services to meet client mission-critical requirements in the government, military, healthcare and commercial markets. A SHARP FOCUS ON GETTING IT RIGHT motivates Qbase leadership, its engineers, and employees. Led by seasoned former executives and inventors from LexisNexis, Apptis, and other leading companies, the Qbase team provides hands-on consultation with analysis of your data to maximize its value.The Data Analytics/Modeling Analytics Engineer will play a key role on the Product Development Team to develop Qbase intellectual property and products in the Big Data and the geospatial integration space.  The role will contribute to a team that is developing new search, data mining and text analytics products within the geospatial domain as well as other domains using leading edge technologies. The Data Analytics/Modeling Analytics Engineer will join a dynamic team leveraging Qbase expertise in these areas.Responsibilities:         Contribute to the design of data mining and text analytics solutions that fit the business problem, may include custom algorithm development         Develop new features for existing products, implement proof of concept and prototypes         Work closely with product development teams and product stakeholders following an Agile product development methodology         Contribute to full life-cycle software product development, including requirements definition/refinement, software implementation, testing and quality assurance         Effectively communicate with fellow technologists and other stakeholdersKnowledge and skills:          Project experience in machine learning, statistical data analysis and predictive modeling          Strong working knowledge of data mining or pattern recognition algorithms including decision trees, probability networks, association rules, clustering, regression         Experience with Entity Extraction techniques         Strong programming skills in Python, Java, C++, or other similar languages within a Linux/Unix development environment         Experience with one or more of the following:  Matlab, SAS or SPSS         Experience with databases and SQLHighly Desirable Knowledge and skills:         Natural Language Processing (NLP)         Semantic Web, RDFEducation and work experience:         MS or PhD in Data Mining, Computer Science, Operations Research or related field         2+ years of machine learning, statistical data analysis and predictive modeling         2+ years with database modeling and data warehousing principles with a working knowledge of SQL         Experience developing commercial software products Clearance Requirement: None Location: This position will be based out of our Springfield, Ohio worksite.  This position offers an opportunity for flexible scheduling and telecommute arrangements.    Travel Requirement: None Driving Classification: This position is not classified as a Regular Driver.  Qbase develops proprietary data management tools, including Qbase Data DiscoveryTM and Qbase Data TransformerTM, to help you understand and improve your data. Qbase data analytics reveal new ways to drive revenue and increase profits. Our web-based applications and high throughput computing solutions can be custom-designed to solve your most complex data problems. Our IT solutions and consulting services help keep you proactive. Learn more about our technology at   http://www.4qbase.com/our_technology.html  Find our latest collection of Qbase resources, written by our data and technology experts, on a wide variety of topics covering IT, data analytics, data quality, data security disaster prevention and other important issues at  http://www.4qbase.com/resource.html  The Qbase team brings a diverse combination of skills and expertise developed in a range of fields and leadership positionsfrom CEOs of large companies to an officer leading IT initiatives in the U.S. Armed Services. Additionally, the team offers deep and broad experience in federal technology integration, database management and analytics, and in enterprise systems development. Learn more about Qbase leadership at http://www.4qbase.com/team.html EEO Statement: Qbase is an Equal Opportunity Employer/Affirmative Action Employer (M/F/D/V). It is the policy of Qbase to ensure equal employment opportunity in accordance with Executive Order 11246, as amended and all applicable federal regulations and guidelines. Employment discrimination against employees and applicants due to race, color, religion, sex (including sexual harassment), national origin, disability, age (40 years old or more), or veteran status is illegal. Qbase managers and employees will comply with state and federal equal employment laws, rules, regulations and guidelines experience. Qbase utilizes E-Verify

:Data Architect.  Location :Harrisburg, PA.  Duration :Permanent.  Sure Shot Placement.     IT Architect - Data Management:  The IT Data Architect is a key role in the Business Intelligence Technical Services and Architecture team and works closely with business leaders and users to define, develop and implement the data architecture for business intelligence applications. This includes working closely with business users to define data requirements, developing the data architecture design, logical data models (Dimensional Data Model Design, Star Schema, Snow Flake, etc.) and implementing and optimizing the physical data models. The IT Data Architect will also assist to define and document the technical architecture of the business intelligence platform, including the physical components and their functionality. This position will have broad knowledge of data sources, data integration and data flow. This position also designs processes to extract, transform, cleanse and load data. The IT Data Architect is a champion for data analysis, logical and physical data modeling, ETL Technical Architecture Design and provides technical mentoring to other IT staff to support skills development focused on the next generation TE Data Warehouse (TED 2.0) program.     Responsibilities & Qualifications:  Primary Responsibilities:  Data Management:  Developing and maintaining enterprise data strategy and roadmaps for Business Intelligence, Data Warehouse and Master Data Management.  Selection of new technology platforms to support the next generation data warehouse and facilitate development of proof of concept / prototypes.  Developing and maintaining guest/customer data management strategies, models and designs.  Work closely with business users to interpret the data needs of the business and translate those to logical / physical data models and data designs.  Develop entity-relationship / Dimensional data models for relevant projects with a focus on the next generation data warehouse.  Design the data integration architecture including selection of ETL Vendor products and implementation of ETL solutions using one of the leading ETL packages (e.g., SAP Data Integrator, Informatica.)  Design and implementation of an operational data store and data warehouse on one of the leading database platforms (e.g., Oracle, SAP HANA, Teradata.)  Document data management processes and mentor other IT staff to develop data analysis and data modeling skills.  Research new technologies in the Industry and make recommendations on the use of these technologies/ vendor products to support these business needs.  Provides input to management on accomplishing long-term goals and objectives for the TED 2.0 Program.  Drives results primarily through collaboration and influence within the team and across the TEIS Organization.  Collaborates with other colleagues and peers in the technical - business community.     Data Quality and Governance:  Ability to conduct discovery, perform root cause analysis, and make recommendations for the remediation of data quality issues.  The ability to design and recommend data policies and governance structures and control frameworks for the ongoing management of data.     REQUIRED TECHNICAL SKILLS:  Minimum of 12 plus years of experience in the IT Industry.  Minimum of 7 plus years of experience with Business Intelligence data architecture design for Data Warehouse / Datamart / Operational Data Store.  5 plus years in Dimensional Modeling (star schema) data modeling is required.  Expertise using data modeling tools ( For eg: ERwin, E/R Studio ..).  In-depth knowledge of BI Application development full life cycle.  Good understanding of data relationships in SAP modules such as MM, PP, QM, FI, Costing, APO would be a big plus.  Knowledge of business intelligence best practice processes, tools, standards and practices.  Strong analytical and conceptual design skills; strong problem-solving skills.  Demonstrated experience and success in facilitation of reporting and analytics business requirements would be desired.  Hands on experience in developing and implementing enterprise data architecture and complex data models for operational and data warehouse applications.  In depth knowledge of Data Integration concepts, approaches, and tools and the role of data architecture in successful implementation of data integration strategy.  Familiarity and preferably hands-on knowledge of Metadata Management and Master Data Management (MDM) concepts, approaches, and tools.  In depth knowledge of business processes and business information models in a data warehousing context preferably in a SAP BW Environment.     EDUCATION:  BS / BA in Computer Science, Business, Mathematics, Engineering or Equivalent with 12 Years IT Experience or Master's Degree with 10 Years plus experience in the IT Industry.        -------  Best Regards,  MD Javeed  Sr. Account Manager    _____     R&D International I, Inc.  6413 Gallery Street, Suite A  Bowie, MD 20720  Email: Javeed@randdcorp.com  Direct: 202-903-0391  Fax: (301) 262-4995  Website: www.randdcorp.com

Senior Cloud DeveloperLocation: Annapolis Junction, MD  CLEARANCE: ACTIVE TS/SCI with Full Scope Polygraph Superior Technical Resources has an immediate opening for a Senior Cloud Developer to join our team. The position provides an opportunity to develop the cutting-edge technology that supports some of our nation’s fundamental defense services. This position requires proven ability to solve difficult problems with special emphasis on the use of cloud technologies such as map/reduce and HBase/Accumulo to solve problems of interest to the intelligence community. Highlights of Responsibilities:Lead, conduct and/or participate in the research, design, and development of systems software, software applications and/or tools for new programs and subprogramsDefine and implement enhancements, modifications, and corrections to existing softwareResponsible for determination of computer user needs; analysis of system capabilities to resolve problems on program intent; documentation of system and subsystem requirements; programming techniques and controls; preparation of operating instructionsExercise creative thinking and thought leadership to advance our business performance Deliver innovative, flexible, integrated solutions to meet customers’ changing mission needsSupport and engage in programs, projects, and practices behind the NCI culture and strategy, and comply with all policies and procedures Follow industry and department trends and developments to ensure NCI services are consistent with industry best practicesTalent and Resources, Aligned. www.superiorjobs.com  EOE M/F/D/VRequired Skills / Qualifications:Active TS/SCI with Full Scope PolyHadoop/Cloud Developer CertificationAt least ten (10) years experience in software development / engineering including requirements analysis, software development, installation, integration, evaluation, enhancement, maintenance, testing, and problem diagnosis / resolutionAt least six (6) years of experience developing software with high level languages - Java, C, C++At least 3 years of experience with distributed scalable Big Data Store (NoSQL) such as Hbase, CloudBase/Acumulo, Big Table, etc.At least 3 years of experience with the Map Reduce programming model and technologies such as Hadoop, Hive, Pig, etc.At least 3 years of experience with the Hadoop Distributed File System (HDFS) At least 3 years of experience with serialization such as JSON and/or BSON At least five (5) years experience developing software for Windows (2000, 2003, XP, VISTA) or UNIX/Linux (Redhat versions 3-6) operating systems At least 3 years of experience in the design and development of an Object Oriented system At least 3 years of experience developing solutions integrating and extending FOSS/COTS products At least three (3) years experience in software integration and software testing, to include developing and implementing test plans and test scripts Preferred Skills / Qualifications:Bachelors DegreeUnderstanding of Cloud Scalability Experience designing and developing automated analytic software, techniques, and algorithmsExperience developing and deploying: analytics that include analytic processes that incorporate/integrate multi-media technologies, including speech, text, image and video exploitation; analytics that function on massive data sets, for example more than a billion rows or larger than 10 Petabytes; analytics that employ semantic relationships (i.e., inference engines) between structured and unstructured data sets; analytics that identify latent patterns between elements of massive data sets, for example more than a billion rows or larger than 10 Petabytes; and analytics that employ techniques commonly associated with Artificial Intelligence, e.g., genetic algorithms Experience with taxonomy construction for analytic disciplines, knowledge areas and skillsExperience developing and deploying analytics that discover and exploit social networksExperience documenting ontology’s, data models, schemas, formats, data element dictionaries, software application program interfaces and other technical specifications

Position Responsibilities: Design, develop, troubleshoot, debug, evaluate, modify, deploy, and document software programs for customer-facing applications. Perform machine learning, data mining, and large software system development to improve the products discovery technologies on Amazons e-commerce business. Participate in the full development cycle, end-to-end, from design, implementation, and testing to documentation, delivery and maintenance. Evaluate and make decisions around the use of new or existing software products and tools. Mentor junior development engineers. Position Requirements:Requires a Masters degree, or foreign equivalent, in Computer Science, or a related field PLUS one (1) year of experience in a related industry role. In lieu of Masters degree and one (1) year of experience, employer will accept a Bachelor's degree, or foreign equivalent, in Computer Science, or a related field PLUS five (5) years of experience in a related industry role. Experience must include: C++ or Java development in a Unix environment; Perl, Python or other high-level scripting language development in a Unix environment; algorithm design and analysis; web front-end development involving JavaScript/AJAX; Search or Ad Relevance; designing and developing distributed software using Hadoop, Pig or other map reduce frameworks; and domain expertise in at least one of the following: information retrieval, data mining, machine learning, computational linguistics, or artificial intelligence. One year of experience must involve optimizing algorithms, and designing and developing large-scale, multi-tiered, multi-threaded, distributed software applications, tools, systems and services using Object Oriented Design and C++, Perl, Python, or Java. Any suitable combination of education, training, or experience is acceptable.

Research Staff Member. IBM Corporation. Yorktown Heights, New York. Research state-of-the-art computer algorithms for extracting, searching and reasoning over information from natural language input and for answering cross-lingual natural language questions. Develop algorithms, tools and infrastructure for conducting large-scale statistical modeling, data extraction and mining. Manage and train an annotation team to produce quality annotation data for developing various statistical models. Perform role using techniques from Natural Language Processing, Information Retrieval, Machine Learning and Knowledge Representation. Utilize C/C++, Java/ PERL, Python, HTML, Javascript, UNIX Shells and Linux. For over 50 years, the BBN name has been synonymous with technological innovation. Since implementing and operating the ARPANET, the forerunner of today's Internet, we have been responsible for a number of networking firsts: the first packet switch, the first router, and the first person-to-person network email. We also designed, built and operated the Defense Data Network. Today at BBN, some of the same scientists involved in those projects are working with the brilliant young graduates of the country's top technical schools to pioneer new innovations.  Raytheon BBN Technologies (BBN), located in O'Fallon, IL, is looking for creative, talented individuals to work in a small, focused collaborative team environment solving challenging problems designing decision support systems. Our group brings together techniques of software engineering, cognitive psychology, visualization design, and artificial intelligence to design tools to allow human users to work symbiotically with automated processes. Our work spans research and development, proof-of-concept prototypes and deployed systems. BBN offers an exciting, fast paced, collaborative environment with the opportunity to contribute to revolutionary research. Career growth is encouraged through support for publications and participation in leading research conferences, on-site training, mentoring, and tuition reimbursement. BBN offers industry-leading benefits including a generous 401K matching plan, retirement contributions, and performance based bonuses. BBN currently has an exciting opportunity available for the right candidate. If you believe that you would thrive in a culture that emphasizes innovation and technical excellence, we want to hear from you. Desired Qualifications:* Experience with HTML5, Flash/Flex, JavaScript, JSP, PHP, CGI.* Experience in scientific visualization, graphic design, usability, or user experience design.* Graphics programming experience/skills (DirectX, OpenGL, Java2D, etc.).* 2D Graphic Design experience (e.g. Photoshop, Illustrator, The Gimp, Inkscape); 3D modeling experience is a plus (3D Studio Max, Blender, Maya, etc.).* Ability to mock up user interface design ideas in graphical form and present them to fellow team members and customers.**Raytheon BBN Technologies is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer**  RESPOND HERE! Business Segment Global Research  About Us At GE's new Software Center of Excellence in San Ramon, CA, some of the brightest minds in technology are developing the software, analytics, and user experiences that will transform industries and improve lives by connecting people and businesses to the nearly 50 billion machines and devices that build, move, power, and cure our world. GE calls this vision the "Industrial Internet," and GE developers are leveraging technology advances such as cloud computing, intelligent devices, and big data and analytics to deliver ground-breaking new ways of tackling some of the world's biggest challenges. Within GE Global Research, the Software Science and Analytics arm is an organization dedicated to the invention, development, and application of software, computing, and decision sciences applied to Equipment Optimization, Risk Management, Healthcare, and Market Growth. Our core disciplines are Computer Science & Software, Statistics, Applied Mathematics, Machine Learning, Operations Research, Quantitative Finance, and Signal Processing. The Machine Learning Organization at GEs Software Center of Excellence has been a world-recognized leader in applying machine learning and Artificial Intelligence I to solving industrial applications for complex, critical infrastructure developed by GE, including jet engines, gas turbines, locomotives, wind turbines, healthcare imaging and oil and gas extraction equipment, and much more. We are now building upon this legacy by assuming more leadership roles in creating new technologies to address GE's current and future needs and initiating a presence in the Bay Area. GE Software Center of Excellence is now seeking a leader of this new lab in San Ramon to enhance this legacy, and fully integrate "machine learning at scale" into GE's Industrial Internet initiative.At GE Global Research we redefine what's possible, finding answers to some of the world's toughest problems. Find out more at   www.ge.com/research, and connect with our technologists at   http://www.edisonsdesk.com  and   http://twitter.com/edisonsdesk  Role Summary/Purpose GE is an equal opportunity employer, offering a great work environment, challenging career opportunities, professional training and competitive compensation.  Essential Responsibilities We are looking for an experienced analytics leader with background in Machine Learning, Statistics, Data Mining or Artificial Intelligence or related quantitative areas, with a track record of innovation and leadership. Candidates should have a PhD in Engineering, Computer Science or equivalent discipline, and a minimum of 10 years' experience in quantitative analytics past the completion of their PhDs, with an outstanding reputation in the industry based on a solid track record of publications and research. As the Manager for the Industrial Internet Analytics Lab, you will lead a team of approximately 8-12 scientists at GE Global Research  San Ramon within the Analytics Organization. The focus will be to partner with the Technology Leader and businesses on the long-term applied analytics vision, drive applied analytics technology inventions, and transfer these inventions from GRC to the businesses. It will be important to establish key internal and external collaborations, and to recruit top technical talent. Our work at the GE Global Research Center is highly interdisciplinary and global in scope. Successful candidates will have the ability to lead a diverse team in collaboration with colleagues from other disciplines and with partners in GE business units. Typical applications of the lab include inventing and developing supervised and unsupervised learning and reasoning algorithms in an applied research environment, and developing and deploying modern machine learning and statistical methods (CART and Random Forests, clustering and classification algorithms, Bayesian models, neural nets, SVM etc.) for finding patterns/models from industrial data in diverse businesses such as GE Transportation, GE Energy, GE Aviation and GE Healthcare. As the Lab Manager of the Industrial Internet Analytics Lab you will: Provide and expand technical leadership in Machine Learning, reasoning and related quantitative analytics technology for GE businesses Recruit top talent and provide leadership and mentoring to a group of 10-15 lab members in different stages of their careers. Provide leadership in cloud-based, big data machine-learning applications. Ensure successful completion of the lab's technical project assignments, and meet broader organizational objectives, such as budgets and financial commitments Ensure integration of the group's work with the direction of the Software Sciences and Analytics organization Maintain and improve the group's external reputation, including hiring highly qualified machine learning experts Drive technology program execution and technology transition to the businesses, meeting deliverables, budgets, and schedules, while also contributing technically to projects; Develop networks in the GE businesses, with external commercial customers, and with Academia and External Research Partners. Represent and promote GE's Machine Learning research as applied to industrial internet applications in the technical community; Exemplify GE leadership values and make full use of GE initiatives  Qualifications/Requirements Doctorate degree in Engineering or Computer science with focus on machine learning or equivalent discipline with at least10 years of experience in machine learning related applications and theory.Demonstrated leadership competencies, including excellent communication skillsDemonstrated impact, leadership capability and ability to lead, build and energize cross-functional, global teams inhigh-impact technology.Demonstrated ability to understand customer needs and industry trends; simplify strategy into specific actions, makedecisions, and communicate prioritiesDemonstrated ability to influence at senior levels.Strong foundation in machine learning and statistical theoryDemonstrated ability to apply theoretical knowledge to solve practical statistical problemsDemonstrated ability to produce research recognized by the external statistical communityWillingness to travel periodically based on business needLegal authorization to work in the U.S. is required. Responsibilities  Our nation relies on NSA to lead the way in cryptology in order to gain a decision advantage for the nation and our allies. To maintain the technological edge over NSA's adversaries, a core group of Computer Scientists, Engineers, and Information Technologists are vital to provide the technical capabilities necessary to successfully execute NSA's mission. The increased complexity of supporting NSA's mission requires world class researchers and developers, who, while grounded in the tenets of computer science, operate in teams in areas such as software engineering, information technology infrastructure, high performance computer architectures, computer security, and networking in order to design and develop advanced tools, techniques, and systems.To advance the development of Information Technology, NSA has created the new Information Technology Development Program (ITDP) and is seeking full-time talented computer scientists, information technologists, engineers, and networking specialists to participate. Participants in the three-year program will have rotational operational assignments, and lab/classroom training, which will enable them to understand the breadth of information technology disciplines including system/security engineering, software engineering, software project management, system architecture, and database design, as well as in-depth knowledge in one of these disciplines. The ITDP participants will work in teams with each other and with NSA technical leaders to solve current and future challenging information technology problems.Upon successful completion of this program, the participants will be able to choose from a variety of information technology positions within the Technology Directorate.  .  Qualifications  Entry is with a high school diploma and 5 years of experience, or an Associate's degree and 3 years of experience, or a Bachelor's degree and 2 years of experience, or a post-baccalaureate certificate. Degree must be in Computer Science (Information Systems, Computer Technology and IFSM degrees will not automatically qualify). If degree is in a related area (e.g., Engineering, Mathematics), it must contain appropriate qualifying college level courses to fulfill the MQ. Upper level classes include: Analysis of Algorithms, Artificial Intelligence, Automata Theory and Formal Languages, Circuit Theory, Communications Engineering, Compiler Design/Theory, Computer Architectures, Computer Cryptography, Computer Engineering, Computer Forensics, Computer Network Architecture and Protocols, Data Communications Networks, Database Design, Data Mining, Digital Communications, Digital Signals Processing, Discrete Structures, Dynamic Systems, Electrical Circuits and Systems, Machine learning, Network Security, Neural Networks, Object Oriented Analysis and Design, Operating Systems Theory, Principles of VLSI Design, Programmable Logic Devices, Programming Languages Theory, Robotics, Signals and System Theory, Software Engineering, System Architecture, and Design, Systems Design and Programming. Also, Introductory courses in Computer Science, Circuit Design, Data Structures, Database Systems, Database administration, Database programming, Digital Design, Electrical Engineering, Microprocessors, Network Administration, Programming courses ' any language, Scripting/Query Languages (such as Perl or SQL), System Administration, Web programming, and a foundational low-level class required for an upper-level course. OR one or more of the following types of experience: 'Additional experience which is clearly professional Computer Science practice that is commensurate with the college level coursework described above (e.g., network administration, database management, artificial intelligence). 'Programming experience. 'Software development life cycle experience (e.g., software design, quality assurance, testing, planning, requirements gathering, deployment). 'Experience participating on a team software development activity.Additional qualifications:'A Post-Baccalaureate Certificate. 'Technical instruction experience (i.e., experience teaching relevant content).  .  Pay, Benefits, & Work Schedule  This is a full-time position, Monday through Friday.Salary range: $42,209 - $97,333  . Job description The SAP Business Intelligence Associate Partner is responsible for business development (sales) and delivery of business intelligence solutions involving technology, process and organizational change initiatives of IBM's clients. During the sales cycle the consultant will develop business value propositions, business cases, solution strategies, roadmaps and ultimately the proposal. As the delivery lead this resource will have accountability for managing scope, issues/risks, timelines, financials and quality deliverables of engagements. This is a hands-on consulting sales & delivery role providing leadership & direction to the team as well as managing client relationships. Business Intelligence engagements may span data management, datawarehousing and reporting/analytics domains and the consultant is expected to provide solution knowledge across these domains to our clients. The consultant must be able to understand business challenges and translate them into value add business intelligence solutions. Consultant should be very familiar with SAP's product roadmap for Business Intelligence solutions (including SAP BI/BW, Business Objects, HANA, BPC, etc.). Proven thought leadership in BI, demonstrated by whitepapers, presentations at Industry and/or SAP events is preferred. This position requires excellent communication skills, ability to interact with senior managers and executives of client companies and a proven track record of selling, managing and implementing change in complex businesses. The candidate must be a team player, able to lead or manage a project as well as be able to work independently. 100% travel required.  Required  Bachelor's Degree  At least 5 years experience in Experience leading and managing large complex SAP BI teams and projects  At least 5 years experience in Experience with Business Intelligence business development (presentations, business cases, proposals)  Readiness to travel Up to 5 days a week (home on weekends-based on project requirements)  English: Intermediate    Preferred  Master's Degree    IBM is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We are currently looking for a Principle Business Intelligence Solutions  Engineer on a full time, direct hire basis.  In this role, the Engineer will have responsibility for medium to complex projects in providing technology leadership to the Business Intelligence Applications Team in developing the most effective BI solutions for our internal products and our external customers. This position will work as the lead Engineer in designing pilot and subsequent implementations of Cognos and Business Objects based Business Intelligence Solutions.Responsibilities include designing and mapping the clients marketing information model to deliver performance management dashboards, scorecards, reports, and ad-hoc reporting environments using a combination of any or all of Cognos and Business Objects based BI and interactive visualization tools.The successful candidate will work closely with business stakeholders as well as the BI Application Team developers and analysts to develop guiding principles and best practices for determining which BI tools will be needed for a particular information requirement. For example, Discovery vs. Dashboards vs. Answers.This individual must be able understand business functional requirements and reporting tool functionality; synthesize the requirements and business intelligence capabilities into functional specifications; prepare technical specifications; and develop and test the final product. The solutions will contain ad-hoc query, drill-down, slice and dice capabilities, static reporting, managed queries, and dashboards.The successful candidate will have hands on, in depth, experience and expertise with the Business Objects XI suite of products (in particular XI 3.0).  The candidate will have the knowledge and understanding of how to structure and design data to optimize the use of these products. Additionally working with Micro-strategy, Cognos and Business Objects to build BI solutions against existing dimensional and relational schemas.Responsibilities:             Focus on the development of solution approaches and designs for individual projects based on functional requirements and project objectives.             Oversee the design, development, customization and integration efforts to deploy these solutions.            Works with Architects and Systems Engineers on case by case and is also responsible for supporting the development team during the implementation phase.             Responsible for evaluating and incorporating emerging standards, best practices, and new technologies.
