Sargento Foods has an exciting new position for a Manager - SAP Business Intelligence.  Reporting to the Director  Shared Technologies, this position will have responsibility for the strategic planning and overall management and deployment of SAP Business Intelligence (BI) systems and related reporting tools, including the SAP Business Intelligence Suite and SAP Business Warehouse (BW). The Manager  SAP Business Intelligence will be responsible for the overall design, monitoring, tuning, realignment, and security policy development for all BI, SAP Business Warehouse, and related reporting initiatives. This role coordinates the daily tasks and projects of the Business Intelligence Team, making appropriate task assignments to achieve defined objectives. In addition, this is a hands-on position requiring a working Manager with relevant, up-to-date technical experience and a willingness to perform hands-on analysis and development in addition to management tasks.   DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES include the following. Other duties may be assigned.          Assumes the lead developer/analyst role in addition to guiding other team members          Develops long-term strategic plans for BI and related reporting. Must stay abreast of the latest technological and strategic developments in the Business Intelligence arena.          Develops reporting standards for use with BI related reporting tools.          Defines the requirements for Business Intelligence tools by meeting with Application Developers and Business Users to ensure their reporting and analytical needs will be or are being met.          Leads the effort to select new Business Intelligence tool sets when needed.           Consults with Application Developers to ensure the appropriate data is being extracted from SAP or other non-SAP systems to be utilized in the Business Intelligence systems.          Collaborates with other members of the BI Team, Database Team, and IT Technical Team to ensure proposed BI solutions are technically sound and will conform to both the existing technical landscape and corporate security policies.           Prepares proposals for purchase and deployment of any new toolsets or upgrades.         Implements or upgrades the BI tool set, provides training and support on its use and features, and maintains the product throughout its lifecycle.  The Manager  Business Intelligence is ultimately responsible for the execution of the following tasks, either by directly performing the functions or through delegation of tasks to team members or a combination thereof.  BI Team tasks include:         Performing data analysis and modeling for new data targets.          Creation of technical specifications for, as well as the creation and maintenance of, SAP Business Warehouse (BW) DataStore Objects (DSOs) and InfoCubes in SAP BW and BW in SAP Supply Chain Management (SCM)          Preparation of data, verification of data extraction, transformation, and loading (ETL) between the SAP Enterprise Resource Planning (ERP), SAP BW, SAP BPC, and SAP SCM systems as well as any other potential third party systems.          Managing integrity checks for required master data and transaction data.  Cleansing the data and formulating processes for ongoing data integrity verification to ensure data quality across all SAP BW and recipient systems.           Research and execution of data realignments as needed in the affected systems  SAP BW, SAP SCM, and SAP BPC.          Analysis and tuning of the SAP BW environment and creation of aggregates as necessary to increase query performance.          Creating and maintaining reports and dashboards utilizing BI reporting tools per business requirements.          Creating and maintaining relevant planning areas in the SAP SCM system.          Researching new options and resolutions to existing SAP issues using SAPs Support Portal.           Testing  BI systems during IT Disaster Recovery testing.          Supporting SAP BW, SAP ERP, SAP SCM, and SAP BPC system upgrades and support package applications as well as any new product implementations from BI perspective.          Maintaining appropriate documentation of key BI processes. Responding to all off-hour calls regarding BI issues in a prompt and reasonable timeframe.  Must be accessible to receive off-hour calls by carrying a functioning cell phone at all times, except when on vacation, to facilitate prompt problem resolution. SUPERVISORY RESPONSIBILITIESDirectly supervises non-supervisory employees on the Business Intelligence Team including consultants as needed.  Carries out supervisory responsibilities in accordance with the organization's policies and applicable laws.  Responsibilities include interviewing, hiring, and training employees; planning, assigning, and directing work; appraising performance; rewarding and disciplining employees; addressing complaints and resolving problems.  Development of subordinates and programs to enhance employee skills and abilities. REQUIRED EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE         Must have a Bachelors Degree in Computer Science or a related field from an accredited four-year college or university.         Must have a minimum of 7+ years of progressive relevant experience.         Must be willing to assume a management role that includes substantial hands-on analysis and development.         Must be fully skilled in the complete lifecycle of SAP BW development, including analysis, design, testing, implementation and support.         Must have solid interpersonal, customer service and project management skills.         Must have strong communication skills, both written and verbal and be able to effectively present information to project teams, management, clients, customers and non-technical groups.         Must have a proven ability to work in a fast-paced, collaborative environment. OTHER SKILLS AND ABILITIESStrong computer skills are necessary for this position, including word processing, presentation, and spreadsheet software, SAP, Internet, E-mail, database applications, general IT skills, programming and programming logic, and strong technical skills; knowledge of most office equipment. PHYSICAL DEMANDSThe physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job.  Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. While performing the duties of this job, the Mondelez International  Company Overview    Mondelez International is a whole new company that has been reimagined with a single focus in mind: create delicious moments of joy by sharing the worlds favorite brands. Launched on Oct. 1, 2012, and employing around 100,000 people around the world, Mondelez International comprises the global snacking and food brands of the former Kraft Foods Inc.     While Mondelez International is new, our brands are as diverse and rich with heritage as the 170 countries in which our products are marketed. As the worlds pre-eminent maker of snacks, Mondelez International has leading shares in every category and every region of the world in which it competes. The company holds the No. 1 position globally in Biscuits, Chocolate, Candy and Powdered Beverages as well as the No. 2 position in Gum and Coffee.       Mondelez Internationals portfolio includes several billion-dollar brands such as Nabisco, Oreo and LU biscuits, Cadbury and Milka chocolate, Jacobs coffee, Tang powdered beverages and Trident gums. Mondelez International has annual revenue of approximately $36 billion and operations in more than 80 countries.        For more information, visit www.mondelezinternational.com and www.facebook.com/mondelezinternational.     This position is part of the Global Business Intelligence team for Mondelez. In this position, the candidate will be part of the Global BI Americas sub team having the opportunity to work in an evolving IS organization. While working in this position, the candidate will act as an overall SAP Business Warehouse, Business Objects and SAP BI 4.0 Support Manager responsible for the integrity and availability of the environment with emphasis on defect resolution & root cause identification, optimization of the BW infrastructure, delivery of Americas BI enhancements and projects and proactive management of the BW asset.   Mondelez is looking for a SAP BI/BW lead with extensive experience in implementing and managing SAP solutions. Experience with other areas such as ECC configuration is a plus.  In this role, the candidate will support the existing Business Intelligence solutions implemented on the SAP BI software platform and Qlikview applications.  Role includes:  management of outsourced resources,  technical design reviews, small enhancement development management, testing, implementation of new and enhanced reporting & analysis capabilities, client interaction, communications, project planning and resource estimation. Candidate ideally would possess strong back end BI expertise, including data model experience as well as query building. The candidate must possess strong analytical and communication skills and be able to work well with minimal direction. Experience with SAP BI/BW version 3.5 and 7.0. is required.  Business Objects experience desired.     Job duties include:           Managing the Americas SAP-BI Support organization with emphasis on support ticket management, support team resourcing, issue resolution, root cause identification, and data load monitoring.              Proactive management of the BW production architecture with focus on data load trending, query usage and statistics, BW Accelerator and BI Objects governance, capacity planning and management, support ticket trending and analysis.              Implementation of BI best practices in the area of performance optimization, architecture design, and infrastructure management.             Working collaboratively with business clients & other project partners including IS Service delivery, Master Data, Security, and Strategic partners to provide new and enhancement reporting solutions and establish a secure, effective, and efficient data warehouse architecture supporting multiple business subject areas.            Understanding existing BI architecture & delivering estimates for new projects and  small enhancements.         Qualifications          Must have a Bachelor's Degree          Must have 5 years experience of working on IS BI projects           Four (4) to six (6) years experience with SAP BI tools  BW and Business Objects          Experience managing software development and maintenance vendors           Must have strong communication, listening & problem solving skills

Mondelez International  Company Overview   Mondelez International is a whole new company that has been reimagined with a single focus in mind: create delicious moments of joy by sharing the worlds favorite brands. Launched on Oct. 1, 2012, and employing around 100,000 people around the world, Mondelez International comprises the global snacking and food brands of the former Kraft Foods Inc.   While Mondelez International is new, our brands are as diverse and rich with heritage as the 170 countries in which our products are marketed. As the worlds pre-eminent maker of snacks, Mondelez International has leading shares in every category and every region of the world in which it competes. The company holds the No. 1 position globally in Biscuits, Chocolate, Candy and Powdered Beverages as well as the No. 2 position in Gum and Coffee.   Mondelez Internationals portfolio includes several billion-dollar brands such as Nabisco, Oreo and LU biscuits, Cadbury and Milka chocolate, Jacobs coffee, Tang powdered beverages and Trident gums. Mondelez International has annual revenue of approximately $36 billion and operations in more than 80 countries.    For more information, visit  http://www.mondelezinternational.com/  and www.facebook.com/mondelezinternational.    Global BI PMO ManagerDescription This position is part of the Global Business Intelligence team of Mondelez International.   In this position, the candidate will have the opportunity to work in an evolving IS organization. While working in this position, the candidate will act as the Global BI PMO manager, delivering global BI solutions utilizing SAP BW and Business Objects tools.  This position will also provide global coordination, communication and financial tracking of projects.   Mondelez International is looking for a seasoned BI lead with extensive experience in coordinating and implementing large BI projects.  In this role, the candidate will provide thought leadership, solution shaping, estimating, resource planning, team management, design and implementation of business intelligence solutions utilizing the SAP Business Warehouse software platform. Role includes delivery management, resource planning and management, financial tracking, client interaction, business analysis, technical design, management of development, testing, and implementation of new and enhanced reporting & analysis capabilities . Candidate must possess proven track record of delivering SAP BI projects, SAP BI expertise,  methodology expertise, strong resource management and financial tracking skills. The candidate must possess strong analytical and communication skills and be able to work well with minimal direction. Candidate must have delivery expertise in SAP BI/BW report delivery and development approach. Functional or technical experience with SAP BI/BW reporting required.  Job duties include:          Providing thought leadership and expertise to the business during solution shaping and estimating for upcoming project work.  Communicate potential BI solutions; effectively articulate the limitations of proposed solutions.          Providing strong technical leadership to ensure BI solutions and architecture are capable of being effectively delivered, usable and sustainable.          Coordination with regional BI leads and leads communication to share solutions.          Manages financial funding and tracking of projects and the global BI budget.           Delivering projects that are on-time, on-budget and produce expected value for the given areas. Lead and direct project resources to accomplish delivery milestones and deliver business value.           Developing resource plans and effectively staff to meet upcoming delivery demands.  Effectively manage and leverage external strategic partners to staff projects.          Developing work plans, assign and track work packages, provide status reporting, effectively estimate and perform financial and work tracking for the BI portion of a project.          Leading and directing internal and external project resources to accomplish delivery milestones and  value.           Ensuring alignment is maintained with associated functional team, infrastructure team, and support teams           Actively grows and develops any direct internal staff. Coach and mentor team members.          Designing and delivering operational and analytical reporting & interface solutions for specific global processes.          Leading full development cycle including participating in BI workshops to gather reporting requirements, transforming business requirements into technical requirements, directing all aspects of technical delivery,  post go live support, defect resolution, key user training & creating appropriate documentation.          Provide guidance around implementation and re-use within the architecture.           Demonstrating SAP BI standard content, front-end tool capabilities. Actively contribute to the SAP BI software roadmap and working closely with Global Technical services on building out the new architecture. Qualifications          Must have a Bachelor's Degree          Must have 5 years experience of working on IS projects           3-5 years acting as a systems/technical project lead          3-5 years proven track record of delivering BI projects          2-5 years of leading SAP BI efforts          3-5 years of resource management          3-5 years of I.S. portfolio and budget/financial process experience          2-3 years of experience either functionally or technically with SAP BI/BW          Must have strong communication, listening, coordination & problem solving skills         Must have a Bachelor's Degree          Must have minimum of 5 years experience of working on IS projects           Minimum of 3 years experience acting as a systems/technical project lead          Minimum of 3 years experience and proven track record of delivering BI projects          Minimum of 2 years experience in leading SAP BI efforts          Minimum of 3 years experience in resource management          Minimum of 3 years experience in I.S. portfolio and budget/financial process experience          Minimum 2 years of experience either functionally or technically with SAP BI/BW          Must have strong communication, listening, coordination & problem solving skills   Mondelez International is an equal opportunity and Affirmative Action employer. We actively seek to maintain a diverse work force, and Mondelez International therefore recruits qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, gender, national origin, age, disability, or Vietnam veteran status.

POSITION CONCEPT:The Senior Business Intelligence (BI) Analyst is a technical expert with knowledge of the full data warehouse lifecycle.  This position is responsible for providing expertise on BI projects including dimensional data modeling, ETL (data Extract, Transform, and Load processes), and reporting. Utilizes appropriate development tools and technologies in keeping with the IT architecture.  Additionally, the Business Intelligence Analyst Senior collaborates on all phases of the software development life-cycle (SDLC) with a focus on the design, development, and implementation phases for BI components of applications.  This position provides 24x7 application support and requires occasional travel to our operating locations.PRIMARY DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:1. Develops complex software based on specifications provided.  Collaborates with Business Systems Analysts and/or Business Partners to develop software specifications.2. Implements software packages for which in-depth configuration and integration is required; drives substantial interaction with vendor resources.3. Integrates applications with complex interfaces based on specifications provided.4. Provides 24x7 primary and/or secondary support for one or more applications classified as niche, core, or mission-critical.  5. Supports the request and analysis phases of SDLC by producing required documentation and estimates; reviews deliverables produced by junior staff.6. Executes the design, development, and implementation phases of SDLC by producing the prescribed deliverables; reviews deliverables produced by junior staff.7. Participates on an Application Development and Support team as well as project teams under the direction of their manager or project managers.  May function as Technical Lead on any project.8. Acquires and maintains knowledge of business areas relevant to projects and application support assignments.9. Acquires and maintains appropriate technical skills and mentors junior staff.  Participates in developing and driving standard practices within their team.EDUCATION, LICENSES/CERTIFICATIONS AND EXPERIENCE:Required: Minimum of eight (8) years of direct work experience performing the Duties & Responsibilities of this position is required; including a minimum of four (4) years of experience in SAP NetWeaver. A minimum of one professional certification in specific job-related disciplines. A valid High School Diploma or a valid GED**** A college degree may be considered in lieu of equivalent experience of two (2) years with an Associates degree and four (4) years with a Bachelors degree from an institution accredited by the Commissions on Colleges.  Note:  minimum of four (4) years of SAP NetWeaver experience still required with degree.****Preferred: Work experience in electric and gas utility industry. Certification in Business Intelligence from SAP or Microsoft. Associates degree or Bachelors degree in Information/Computer Science, Business Administration, Engineering, Mathematics, Information Systems or equivalent discipline from an from an institution accredited by the Commissions on Colleges.KNOWLEDGE/SKILLS/ABILITIES:Required: Strong knowledge of SAP Business Warehouse (BW) data modeling extraction, transformations, process chains, BEX query development, and BOBJ reporting. Understanding of SAP ECC metadata and functionality of FI, CO, SC and HR SAP modules to support BW development. Proficiency in enhancing data sources using ABAP. In-depth knowledge of BW security, and the ability to provide optimization and tuning of DSOs, cubes and multiproviders. Familiarity with Structural Authorization, expertise with Microsoft BI technologies, including:  SQL Server Reporting Services, Integration Services, and Analysis Services are preferred.Solu Technology Partners is an Equal Opportunity Employer

Yoh has a contract opportunity for a BI (Business Intelligence) Solutions / Data Architect to join our Client in Atlanta, GA. Client Overview: This position is a long term contract with SAP Americas. SAP was founded in 1972 and is today one of the world's largest independent business software providers and one of the three largest independent software companies based on market capitalization Job Overview: SAP North America Education is embarking on a project to establish a unified reporting and analytics platform. The initial focus of this platform will be on the requirements of the Operations and Delivery functions, with subsequent expansion to address Finance and Sales requirements. This position will require a thorough understanding of information architecture as it relates to overall business objectives, as well as the high-level technical architecture. The ideal candidate will have extensive SAP BusinessObjects BI 4.0 experience with data warehousing, reporting and analytics architectures, portals, as well as scorecards and dashboards. Job Responsibilities:  Solution Design/Architect - Lead the definition, design and development of a standard reporting and analytics platform and associated business warehouse information model to enable cross functional operational reporting and LOB performance optimization Recommend and create the organizational-wide Business Intelligence technology strategy leveraging SAP Business Warehouse, Business Objects (BO Enterprise, OLAP Universes, Webi, Dashboards(Xcelsius), Explorer, Crystal Reports, Mobile, Integration Kits, Data Services, Metadata Management) and drive senior alignment for execution support.- Identify, create and influence an advanced BI business analytics agenda to increase benefits realization and process optimization.- Overall responsibility for the BW backend data architecture for all systems and data sources.- Ensure a secure, scalable and extendable BI platform that is high performing and optimized for large data volumes.- Develop BW / BO standards, processes, and procedures for consistent execution and administration. BI/BW Development - Translate complex Functional Specifications into detail Technical Designs and Technical Specifications.- Model and build SAP BO metadata and architecture.- Load data warehouse systems from different source systems (such as ECC) and flat files or tables using standard extraction tools.- Perform testing, develop user guides and end-user training.- Be familiar with techniques and technology for managing very large database/data warehouses including SAP HANA, BIA, indexes, statistics, compression, partitioning and data deletion to all applicable BI objects.- Design and build BI reports and queries using all applicable tools.- Design and build Extraction, Transformations, and Loading (ETL) through SAP BO Data Services from all data sources.- Develop creative solutions for complex requirements, including use of flexible and configurable products.- Act as a technical consultant for the SAP team and internal business teams; Serves as a Subject- Matter Expert in technical field of knowledge.- Research and implement new technologies to increase productivity and performance.Job Qualifications: - Proven experience in full life-cycle design and development of BOBJ applications integrated with SAP BW is preferred.- Strong knowledge of SAP BW standard business content and ECC data sources / standard and custom extractors (Good experience with ABAP).- Experience of successfully integrating external data sources with SAP BI/BOBJ such as SQL Database Applications.- Experience in SAP Business Objects platform (esp. XCelsius, Explorer) against SAP BW is strongly preferred.- Hands on experience in BW development, SAP ETL tools, data staging techniques, metadata tools, and data base designs.- Experience in conceptual, logical, and physical data modeling.Discover all that's possible with Yoh. Apply now. Yoh, a Day & Zimmermann company, is an Equal Opportunity Employer, M/F/D/V. Energy Future Holdings Corp. is a Dallas-based, privately held energy company with a portfolio of competitive and regulated energy companies. TXU Energy, Luminant and Oncor, EFH's primary businesses, serve the high-growth Texas electricity market, which is one of world's largest and among the nation's most successful competitive markets.  These businesses serve the high-growth Texas electricity market, which is one of the world's largest and among the nation's most successful competitive markets.      This position is a Grade Level 11   Summary:   A unique opportunity to assist in the financial management and strategic analysis of a recognized leader in the energy industry, serving as a platform to gain hands-on business experience with high-level exposure to critical decision making processes in a fast-paced environment.  The successful candidate will be energetic and team-oriented with rigorous analytical and quantitative skills and strong strategic thinking ability.    The position is responsible for developing key analysis and recommendations related to EFHs ongoing decision making and long-term strategic planning.   The position will have significant exposure to senior management, working on a team that directly reports to the CFO on strategic and operational topics, ranging from analysis of new business opportunities to the assessment of current business strategies. The team is also responsible for supporting the CEO with preparation for Board of Directors meetings, internal executive management meetings and external presentations.  Expertise in problem solving, accounting (with an emphasis on cash flows), finance, modeling and communication are required.   Key Roles & Responsibilities:   The Analyst will be one of Financial Planning & Analysis lead analytical experts, responsible for understanding and modeling key operational and financial drivers, and their impacts on EFH.  In this position, the candidate will be required to:   Serve as a primary operator of the Long Range Plan model and associated outputs	 Develop, prepare, and review Free Cash Flow statements and analyses (expected, actual, and variance explanation) for internal management reporting purposes and to support the external reporting process	 Serve as subject matter expert to ensure delivery of high quality cash flow forecasting, reporting and analysis associated with a range of complex scenarios driven by changes in commodity, operational, financial and other assumptions	 Lead the preparation of reports comparing actual cash flows to plan	 Fully understand the cash flows associated with a range of complex scenarios driven by changes in commodity, operational, financial and other assumptions	 Model operational and financial assumptions for EFHs major business units leveraging a model that details income statement, cash flow statement and balance sheet effects	 Identify emerging operational and financial opportunities and issues facing EFH	 Develop, summarize and communicate key findings to EFHs management with clear and concise storylines describing the fact-based analysis in writing as well as verbally	 Serve as thought partner with team members and across business units to resolve complex financial issues	 Perform scenario and sensitivity analysis that drive a deep understanding of key value levers in the energy industry	 Perform in-depth research and analyses supporting key business and strategy initiatives	 Evaluate trade-offs, risks and benefits embedded in strategic alternatives, and assist in the subsequent decision-making process	 Ensure accuracy and quality control in all aspects of financial planning and modeling    Required Skills:   This position requires expertise in problem solving, accounting, finance, Excel modeling and communications/presentations.    Experience/Attributes:   5+ years experience with a demonstrated track-record of success in an Big 4 accounting firm, investment bank, top tier management consulting firm, or at a Fortune 500 company in a strategy, planning, or business development role	 Self-starter with the ability to drive independent problem-solving	 Significant experience with excel based models and techniques	 Energetic with a strong work ethic, intellectually curious and performance driven	 Able to thrive in a team environment and across functions and businesses	 Undergraduate degree in accounting, engineering, finance, economics or related discipline	 Experience working in Hyperion Planning and/or Hyperion Strategic Finance preferred	 Experience in modeling and evaluating detailed financial statements including cash flows preferred

Requisition ID 10659BRTitle ASSOCIATE BRAND DIRECTOR - NOVOLOG MIX 70/30Job Category MarketingJob Description PURPOSE:This position is accountable for leading the development and implementation of pre-launch marketing activities (Positioning, Messaging, Creative etc.) and developing the business plans for designated product. Responsible for brand strategy development, tactical execution and the achievement of Novo Nordisk P&L goals. Champions Centers of Excellence (COE) integration across the brand and ensures brand/portfolio alignment with internal and external customers. Participates on cross-functional and global Extended Brand Teams and interacts extensively with other functions within Novo Nordisk. Leads expert advisory discussions and represents the product plans in management discussions.RELATIONSHIPS:Reports to a Vice President in Diabetes Marketing. Works closely with other Brand teams, Managed Markets, Customer Relationship Marketing, Market Shaping, and Marketing Effectiveness. Works in close collaboration with other departments such as Field Sales, Managed Care, Trade and Government, Medical, Regulatory, Legal personnel as well as participating on global teams for designated product. External relationships include professional services vendors such as agencies, consultants, etc.ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS:Brand Leadership/Planning: Accountable to manage the brand/portfolio budget process - makes sound decisions to optimize spend and ensure that resources are appropriately allocated and quality of services are maintained while costs remain on track and according to budget. Monitor agency expenses by looking for opportunities to maximize value while minimizing agency costs. Follow internal and external procedures in managing contracts. Regularly tracks and reconciles expenses to ensure budget is on track. Develops and executes the overall brand plan - develops personal and non-personal HCP promotional materials; ensures alignment of brand positioning, messaging and overall objectives. May refine messaging based on specific customer segments. Identifies and implements improvements to prepare for launch, development and/or life cycle activities. Develops and oversees the implementation of pre-launch and launch plans, and post launch business plans/strategies. This includes in-depth market analysis, market research activities, thought leader development, HCP and patient marketing, medical education, sample planning forecasting, pricing strategy, etc. within specific assignment. Develops and presents compelling plans for management endorsement. Ensures alignment with POA Working Teams for key customer segments. Implements pre-marketing strategies and develops marketing thought-leader relationships and involvement. Proactively communicates and collaborates with Centers of Excellence (COEs) and others to ensure transparent communications and alignment of strategies and tactics within and outside the department.Brand Leadership/Planning: Responsible for providing interface with key stakeholders. Represents the organization as prime internal and external contact on projects, contracts or operational decisions. Works closely with field sales to ensure marketing programs that are developed strongly support their direct and indirect needs with customers and drive appropriate ROI. Works closely with international marketing and medical team members in identifying effective marketing strategies for designated product for the US. Serves as an advocate for the US marketing initiatives in the context of global marketing. Coordinates closely campaign development, competitive defense and strategic evolution of the product. Works effectively with key support functions to ensure alignment with the brand objectives and goalsBrand Market Analyses/ Product Investment: Develops relationships with and receives commitment from relevant NNI and NNAS departments to ensure the successful execution of strategies. Maximizes revenue and profitability and understands return on investment (ROI) concepts to ensure program effectiveness. Understands the definition of the market and develops accurate sales projections/forecasts for designated product.Brand Promotions: Develops and implements marketing plan. Develops, manages and disseminates the implementation of promotional programs, including coordination with Sales Training and with external suppliers and agencies. Effectively addresses competitive obstacles for the brand through the course of the year to ensure brand success.PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS:Approximately 35% overnight travel.DEVELOPMENT OF PEOPLE: Ensure that reporting personnel have 3P forms with annual goals and measurements that are consistent with the priorities of the business, and that interim reviews are held so that their work is focused on those priorities, and they understand their level of accountability for results and the measurement process. Ensure that the IDP forms include completed Learning and Aspiration plans and are in place for all reporting personnel to enable the achievement of goals and capability to assume increased levels of responsibility. Manage the application and communication of all Novo Nordisk policies, procedures, and Novo Nordisk Way of Management.KEY SUCCESS FACTORS: EDUCATION, EXPERIENCE, KNOWLEDGE AND SKILLS 7 years progressive sales and brand management/marketing experience within the pharmaceutical industry required of which 2 years was in a Sr. Brand Manager role or equivalent A Bachelors degree or equivalent required, MBA preferred. Outstanding planning and organizational skills with exceptionally high attention to quality of detail and proven track record of results and follow up Previous management and team leadership experience highly preferred Proven track record in new product marketing preferred Solid understanding of the pharmaceutical marketplace including medical, regulatory and clinical processes, preferably within diabetes Successful launch experience in a marketing role preferredDepartment DM - NOVOLOG MIX 70/30 & DEVICES (1)Position Location US - Princeton, NJCity Princeton, NJState/Provinces US - NJDegree Required Bachelor's Degree or equivalent experiencePercent Travel 30 - 40%

Job Description:  Currently, we are seeking qualified candidates for a Demand Planning Process and Performance Manager.  Day to Day  The Demand Planning Process and Performance Manager is responsible for the demand planning process, developing forecasting tools and reporting, as well as leading and implementing strategy improvement activities to drive higher forecast accuracy and process sustainability. This position supports the S&OP process and has indirect shared accountability with sales and product demand forecasters to ensure process consistency, accountability and training. The Demand Planning Process and Performance Manager also hold the responsibility of maintaining the relationship and process improvement with our 3rd party statistical forecast provider.      What You Will Do     Facilitate the relationship with our 3rd party statistical forecasting partner. Work with the vendor to streamline the process, measure performance, develop and implement strategy and proactively work to improve the statistical forecast.     Collaborate with sales and product demand forecasters to communicate areas of opportunity in the current forecast and identify areas of concerns that can be addressed through process adherence.     Document and communicate points of conflict within the demand planning process with the responsibility for escalation and resolution.     Lead demand planning process reviews by identifying areas for process improvement, discussing trade partner and industry trends and recommending actions for changes/modifications to the demand plan.     Communicate and coordinate sales and product team demand plans with operations and supply planning to assist in identify strategic opportunities.     Help develop and provide input to the supply planning organization for demand planning strategies on existing items, new products and product phase-outs.     Responsible for maintaining and communicating the demand planning balanced scorecard to ensure accountability and adherence to agreed upon goals and metrics.     Identify and recommend changes to the Company's strategic business forecasting plan based on areas of opportunity identified through demand/forecast data and trends.     What You Need to Succeed     Years of Experience:     3-5 years of experience in Statistical Forecasting, Business Forecasting and communication to large teams and upper management. Supply chain background is beneficial.      Education/Training:     BA/BS college degree or its equivalent, SAP-APO or other related Demand Planning software.     Licenses/Certificates:     APICS, Professional Forecaster Certification (CPF) through IBF or other forecasting Certification preferred.     Other:     Proficiency in demand planning methods with an understanding of their operational impacts. Understanding of supply chain operations and their systems and requirements of the demand planning process and output. Demonstrated leadership skills with experience leading a team of educated and motivated analysts. Understanding of software related to demand planning is required.     Experienced with other Demand Planning software packages, Windows, and Microsoft Office. This position requires strong communication, analytical, organizational, decision making, and presentation skills. Strong interpersonal skills are also essential to effectively interact with all teams, driving resolution across cross functional areas and levels of business affecting the forecast process. Good facilitation skills are required.     Endless Opportunities  Whirlpool has big plans for the future, just like you. We understand that it takes preparation and hard work to get there. So, we offer challenging purpose, ownership of your role, great teams, and tools to build your capability. In our performance-based setting, you can take your career in exciting new directions - and as far as you want to go.     Please send your Resume to: renee.heininger@myrecruitmentservices.com     Company Description:  Whirlpool is the industry leader in the manufacturing and marketing of home appliances. Whirlpool is a global company and markets Whirlpool, Maytag, KitchenAid, Jenn-Air, Amana, Brastemp, Bauknecht, Consul and other major brand names in more than 170 countries around the world.   Whirlpool is a company that creates innovative solutions and products to meet consumer needs. As a result, we have been recognized as one of the world's 100 most innovative companies by Business Week magazine and the Boston Consulting Group. Additionally, Whirlpool Corporation was ranked among the Top 20 Innovators in Consumer Products by The Patent Board and has been consistently ranked as one of the Top 20 Companies for Leaders by Hewitt Associates and Fortune magazine.  Our unique business strategy provides us with an unmatched leadership position and ability to build and sustain loyalty to our brands. Our strategy allows us to move with greater speed to better serve our trade customer and end consumers around the globe.

Our client, an exciting fast growing pre-IPO high tech firm located in SoMA, is looking for a Financial Analyst joint their team.  This is a newly created position designed to help out the Controller and CFO with FP&A and other projects.    Responsibilities: - Develop detailed annual plans that support the business strategy  - Develop sales forecasts - Recap and analyze business results versus plan and forecast on a daily, monthly, quarterly and ad-hoc basis  - Build ad-hoc projections and provide decision support to leadership - Support the financial evaluation and business case development of new business opportunities - Present monthly budget variance packages to the executive team  - Responsible for ensuring budget compliance  - Provide general accounting support including cost center accruals, purchase request account coding and open PO analysis / accruals   Requirements: - #1 requirement - MUST HAVE Adaptive Planning in your background - Advanced Excel user - v-lookup, pivot tables, even some macro work - 2+ years of financial analysis experience (budgeting, forecasting, financial modeling, etc) - BA in Finance, Accounting and/or Business Administration - Willingness to work for a fast paced startup that has a very horizontal org chart.  This role needs someone who can roll up their sleeves and take on a multitude of projects rather then one defined position.  If you feel you are qualified for the above position, please send your resume to scott.dicke@roberthalf.com  Intermediate Budgeting/Forecasting, Intermediate Financial Reporting, Intermediate Financial Planning, Intermediate Financial Modeling, Intermediate Financial Analysis, Advanced MS ExcelRobert Half Finance & Accounting pioneered specialized financial recruitment and today is the worldwide leader. We specialize in placing professionals on a full-time basis in a variety of areas, including accounting, finance, bookkeeping, payroll, credit & collections, audit and taxation. For six decades we have been matching highly skilled accounting and finance professionals with our clients' positions. Our relationship with industry-leading companies in more than 350 locations around the globe gives you unparalleled access to exciting career opportunities. Our company again was named to FORTUNE® magazine's "World's Most Admired Companies" list, ranking #1 in our industry (March 19, 2012). Robert Half Finance & Accounting is an Equal Opportunity Employer

Currently, we are seeking qualified candidates for a Principal - Capacity Management opening to join our Global Information Services (GIS) organization. Day to Day (what a typical day or week look like in this role)    Ensure that the quality of service delivered meets the business needs.    This role will support and promote service improvements, monitoring and controlling the services delivered by a Global Outsource Provider to ensure that agreed upon services continue to be performed in the expected manner.    This includes performance targets, cost, and quality of service and end user satisfaction levels.    To oversee and work with the global outsourcer to develop, maintain and drive a value-based relationship, developing operational strategies to support overall business goals.    Work closely with Project Engineers and Basis SMEs' to ensure appropriate processes are implemented and followed.   Establish and manage the Global Infrastructure Services capacity management program by directing the global outsourcing partner to provide the required data, evaluate performance of systems platforms and generating reporting, work with operational personnel to determine optimum configuration and communicate with IS and business management to plan and implement a capacity management program.    This role also includes tactical and strategic planning, budget management, technical consulting and engineering technology tasks. What You Will Do  Manage the day to day relationship with the service provider to meet SLA and KPI objective and ensure the resolution of service delivery issues. Be the technical resource for some or all of our base technologies including Wintel, AIX, Linux, SAP Basis, Middleware, Tivoli products, batch scheduling, z/OS, Mainframe environment, Enterprise email environments, Storage (IBM, EMC, NetApp), VMware, Security, Oracle / DB2 / SQL Server and TSM. Ensure a seamless transition and ongoing steady state of activities being performed by the service provider for your respective tower and the entire contract as applicable. Provide administration, oversight and facilitation of the service delivery work for the respective tower and the said service delivery results. Communicate the desired directions and expectations to the service provider management. Participate in the incident, problem, escalation and formal change management control and approval processes. Manage to contractual objectives and the changing service demands. Develop collaborative working relationship with the supplier team. Review all quality Service Levels and contractual commitments for the respective Tower (includes Critical Service Levels, Key Measures, and Critical Deliverables) Oversee and manage the applicable service delivery invoice charges. (EG: ASC, ARC/RRC.) Review and approve/decline project work requests that are in excess of the pre-established expenditure amounts Act as liaison for operational supplier issues related to day to day operations Provide support to Whirlpool regions regarding service delivery questions & issues Submit documentation for service level and/or contractual language changes for committee approval Review and Promote Service Improvements working with the service provider Focus on "What needs to be done" rather than how it gets done to ensure we affectively meet Whirlpools objectives. Acceptable technical knowledge of the services and technologies being outsourced. Review continuous improvement/innovation efforts Ensure the technical design, development and the implementation by IBM meets Whirlpool's requirements Work with our Enterprise & Platform Architecture team on Technology Planning & Strategy Review quarterly technology ideas from supplier and integrate with EPA strategy Engage supplier in strategic planning activities Ensure visibility and action for innovation pipeline. Identify new service options Improve operational processes Ability to facilitate problem resolution, root cause analysis and exercise the appropriate judgment in decision making using excellent problem analysis and resolution skills Work with other towers to define and drive seamless processes across platforms and applications ensuring service delivery to meet the business needs. Model capacity forecasts using systems and business metrics Manage workload assignments across environment achieving optimal performance Perform second level problem determination using monitoring and data collection tools in capacity related disciplines Analyze performance data identifying bottlenecks and recommending alternative resolutions Produce ad hoc resource usage reports and analysis Work closely with application teams What You Need To Succeed    Technical or Business degree or equivalent experience is required. Industry expertise in vendor management and working knowledge in multiple platforms including Wintel, AIX, Linux, SAP Basis, Middleware, Tivoli products, batch scheduling, z/OS, Mainframe environment, Enterprise email environments, Storage (IBM, EMC, NetApp), VMware, Security, Oracle / DB2 / SQL Server and TSM as applicable to manage the respective tower. Strong leadership, communication and interpersonal skills required.    Possess strong analytical and problem solving skills.    Must be able to engage and guide global cross functional teams to consensus.    Excellent knowledge of business tools such as financial analysis, process design and productivity measurements.    Experience in vendor management and outsourcing contractual agreements strongly preferred. "This opportunity offers relocation assistance".Endless OpportunitiesWhirlpool has big plans for the future, just like you. We understand that it takes preparation and hard work to get there. So, we offer challenging purpose, ownership of your role, great teams, and tools to build your capability. In our performance-based setting, you can take your career in exciting new directions - and as far as you want to go. Please send your Resume to: Mariana.couceiro@kenexa.com Company Description: About Whirlpool Corporation Whirlpool is the industry leader in the manufacturing and marketing of home appliances. Whirlpool is a global company and markets Whirlpool, Maytag, KitchenAid, Jenn-Air, Amana, Brastemp, Bauknecht, Consul and other major brand names in more than 170 countries around the world. Whirlpool is a company that creates innovative solutions and products to meet consumer needs. As a result, we have been recognized as one of the worlds 100 most innovative companies by Business Week magazine and the Boston Consulting Group. Additionally, Whirlpool Corporation was ranked among the Top 20 Innovators in Consumer Products by The Patent Board and has been consistently ranked as one of the Top 20 Companies for Leaders by Hewitt Associates and Fortune magazine. Our unique business strategy provides us with an unmatched leadership position and ability to build and sustain loyalty to our brands. Our strategy allows us to move with greater speed to better serve our trade customer and end consumers around the globe.

The Optical Security and Performance Products (OSP) business segment leverages its core technology strengths of optics, vacuum coatings, and materials science to deliver innovative and differentiated solutions that manipulate light or create color effects.  With over six decades of experience in optical coating technology,  OSP aspires to be a customer focused, market driven enterprise serving  attractive and sustainable market sectors including currency security, defense, biomedical instruments, and consumer electronics, with products and technologies valued by customers.   The Director of Healthcare Product Management is responsible for all Product Management activities related to OSPs offerings in development for  the pharmaceutical and medical device industries including business planning, product road mapping and visioning, strategic sales support, and product planning activities. Qualified candidates will have instrumentation and/or thin film optics product management experience with a focus on the healthcare vertical. This position reports to the Vice President of OSP Marketing and Product Management.Essential Duties and Responsibilities (Detail): 	Manages product lines (including JDSUs recently introduced Near IR Spectral Engine) through entire product life cycle including conception, research, design, pricing, marketing, sales, distribution, and obsolescence	Manages team of Product Managers who are domain experts in their own product/technology areas; provides leadership to company and to clients alike	Establishes a product roadmap based on an understanding of internal capabilities and business strategy to market/customer requirements	Develops effective marketing strategies and tactics by identifying appropriate target markets and tracking market trends and market expertise	Guides the product development organizations objectives	Works collaboratively with Sales on revenue forecasting including cross-functional reconciliation; pricing strategy and account-level implementation	Responsible for managing product applications engineering assistance to Sales and for direct customer communication in connection with New Product Introductions	Develops market analysis for projection of demand and competitive capabilities and strategic moves; guiding the operations organization in the establishment of a manufacturing strategy	Provides internal communication to upper management of business conditions; leading business case development in support of investments including R&D and capital	Key leadership/membership in a cross-functional product team that includes Finance, R&D, Operations, Sales and Engineering                                    QualificationsRequired Qualifications Education/Experience/Knowledge Qualifications: 	Bachelors degree; advanced degree desirable 	10 plus years of experience leading teams developing products for the pharmaceutical and/or medical device industry 	Demonstrated knowledge of the associated trends, technology, and competition that surround this area of the healthcare industry	Product life cycle experience including a strong working knowledge of the instrumentation development process and roll out of new and legacy solutions including developing product roadmaps, working with Research and Development on project estimates and making trade-offs on release requirements	Works effectively in a matrix environment and is experienced in managing by sphere of influence across all levels in the organization,  from senior management on to cross-functional teammates                                    Full-time employees of JDSU in the United States enjoy a competitive package of employee benefits that include:Medical Dental Prescription Vision Life Insurance Voluntary Supplemental Life and Accidental Death & Dismemberment (AD&D) Short Term and Long Term Disability Insurance Employee Stock Purchase Plan (ESPP) Flexible Spending Accounts Vacation Sick Leave Educational Reimbursement Employee Assistance Program (EAP) Business Travel Accident Insurance JDSU (NASDAQ: JDSU; and TSX: JDU) innovates and markets diverse technologies that enhance the way people experience the world every day. We enable fast, high-quality communications, secure financial transactions, reliable consumer electronics, green energy, differentiated brands, and a host of other solutions. We provide these solutions through three business segments: Communications Test and Measurement, Communications and Commercial Optical Products, and Advanced Optical Technologies. To learn more about JDSU please visit www.jdsu.com, www.jdsu.tv, and follow JDSU on Twitter:  http://www.twitter.com/jdsu .We are proud to be an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employer.

Sr. Business Manager (USA)-723279DescriptionSenior Business ManagerSenior Business Manager position with Capital One Services, LLC in Plano, TX; Multiple positions available:- Manage economic research and planning to develop strategic insights to support business strategy.- Manage the compilation, analysis, and reporting of economic data using econometric data modeling and sampling techniques to support strategic proposals.- Apply knowledge of quantitative and qualitative analysis; SAS; SQL; Teradata or similar relational database tool; statistical modeling; and regression analysis to direct and manage the study of economic and statistical data to understand industry growth trends, other mega-trends and drivers; key competitors and other market participants; and the companys presence in the market, as well as the overall economic impact of these factors on business strategy.- Manage multiple research projects concurrently.- Manage the preparation of quarterly and annual forecasts and reviews of economic performance of a business line or a product.- Provide advice and consultation on economic relationships to business partners to coordinate strategy and business plan development and implementation.- Manage ad-hoc strategic presentations addressing economic guidelines and standards and points of view used in forecasting trends and formulating economic solutions as dictated by senior management.- Manage up to 10 analysts.QualificationsThe position requires a Masters degree or foreign equivalent in Economics, Finance, Engineering, Mathematics, Science, Business Administration, or a related quantitative analytical field, 2 years experience performing business analysis of statistical and econometric data, and the following skill set through formal education or work experience: business strategy development, quantitative and qualitative analysis; SAS, MATLAB or similar statistical analysis tool; SQL; Teradata or similar relational database tool; statistical modeling; and regression analysis.Must pass companys analytical assessment.

Description:OptumInSight's Strategy and Advisory team is looking to bring on Senior Consultant that will assist multiple hosptials through Meaningful Use and Strategic Development projects.   The Senior Consultant will:Participating as a key resource in various strategy, advisory, and planning engagements that assist in client prioritization, structuring, and review of IT and/or business investments.  Desired experience includes:Executive facilitation / presentation development Strategic system planning Revenue cycle transformation Program Management Office development Big "x" consulting experience IT governance Meaningful use attestation Systems implementation, particularly EHRs/EMRs or major ancillaries Project management experience (PMP preferred) Vendor selection / contracting Workflow analysis Cost reduction Clinical or financial analytics Medical staff / physician relations Affiliate clinic / physician relations COBIT, ITIL, Six Sigma, or other methodologiesWithin the Consulting job family, consultants provide end to end life cycle consulting services to external clients to improve operation and information management for all segments of healthcare. Help a Nonprofit Pro Bono Do good for your community while using your professional expertise and  work with talented peers on a highly structured pro bono project! Taproot makes  it easy to make a difference. Taproot Foundation is a nonprofit organization that makes business  talent available to organizations that are working to improve society. We  engage marketing, technology, strategy, design, and HR management professionals  on pro bono projects, called Service Grants that benefit local nonprofits. Our  goal is to ensure that one day all organizations with promising solutions will  be equipped to successfully take on urgent social challenges. To date, we have  engaged close to 5,000 professionals on close to 2,000 pro bono projects  benefiting education, health, environment, social service, and arts  initiatives.  Now its your turn to join the movement and Make It  Matter .   Pro Bono  Strategy Associates NeededA Taproot Strategy Associate provides much of the data for Strategy  Management projects and helps to conduct analysis. They carry out research and  data collection, conduct complex quantitative, strategic and financial  analysis, and structure their findings for presentation. With a more senior  team member, they work to develop and present perspectives and insights for the  client.  A successful pro bono Strategy Associate:        Has 2+ years of experience working for a leading  consulting firm on strategy management, for a leading financial institution in  equity analysis or M&A, or performing similar functions in a corporation;  or is a recent MBA graduate        Has at least Associate, Analyst, or  Consultant-level experience A Service Grant project is designed to work around your schedule and  requires a 3-5 hour commitment each week over the course of approximately 6  months. You can also provide your expertise directly through our online  forumsdo some micro-bono in your spare time! Youll:      Meet a tremendous group of like-minded  professionals        Deepen  your connection with your community        Keep your skills sharp by applying them  in the nonprofit sector        Share your expertise with others        Boost your resume and portfolio        Stand out from others in your field        Create lasting relationships       Network with an active online community of professionals  Learn more and apply today: https://www.taprootfoundation.org/giveprobono/apply.php

Vice President of Business Development, Marketing and Strategic PlanningCompany Information: Our Client, one of the largest privately held Contracting / Engineering Firms in North America, has been in business well over 75 years, with over 5000 employees in Offices all over the US and a proven reputation as one of the most reliable, innovative and diversified firms in the Engineering and Construction industry, has hired us to locate them a dynamic, driven, and experienced individual to join their Firm in the role of Vice President of Business Development, Marketing and Strategic Planning as part of their future growth strategy plans. Position Overview: The Vice President of Business Development, Marketing and Strategic Planning is a key contributor to the strategic planning process for our Client and is responsible for the identification of opportunities in the four major markets of Gas, Power, Communications and Renewables the company now serves. In conjunction with the Market Analysts, the VP of Business Development, Marketing and Strategic Planning is responsible for the development of companywide business development plans and strategic planning efforts. These plans are developed by integrating market research, market analysis, regulatory trends general economic conditions with the companys core market segments to formulate competitive market strategies. A critical component of this position includes the identification of, planning for, and penetration of specific markets through networking and the strategic positioning of the company with existing and potential customers. This position is also responsible for providing various levels of marketing and proposal support to the operating regions as needed to maximize their own business development activities. Primary Outcomes:          Provide Market Research; at the industry, market, environmental, governmental and economic level...using all available resources internally as well as externally.         Develop customer (current and new) based research and feedback through specific programs, contacts and networking to insure company is well positioned in the markets they serve. Participate in corporate and regional bid and proposal reviews         Provide Marketing Support; through advertising efforts, proposal support, trade show participation and the development of relevant marketing materials.          Market Strategy Development by using research and competitive analysis, provide leadership to companywide Senior Management on the overall market strategy for the companys existing and future markets.         Using active collaboration, foster alignment with regional operating units and the strategic business development initiatives for the company. Insure market research is customer based through direct networking  and contact with current  as well as prospective customers. Identify regional market trends through research in support of regional business development activities.         Develop a core research process to track key competitors activities...market development, bidding activity, talent movement, regional activities.  Brand Management:          Develop a comprehensive company brand strategy for the markets company serves.         Implement and manage company branding activities within markets and regions to consistently advance companys identity in our markets.  Market / Business Development Relationship Generation:          In conjunction with the Regional Management, actively participate in identifying specific business opportunities.         Participate with Regional Management to develop key relationships directly with current customers, potential customers or through network affiliations.         Manage the development and implementation of company wide networking activities and events.            Provide research and analysis on potential alliance or joint venture opportunities / partners.         Work with Regional Management in closing new business, including assisting in contract or alliance partner negotiations.         Gain, foster, and maintain proactive relationships with key national and regional accounts Marketing / Business Development Support:            Oversee and provide Regional Management with comprehensive proposal development support services to includes creating and maintaining the Proposal Log, reference data base, resumes, account profiles, etc.          Oversee and facilitate major proposal and presentation efforts for regional and national accounts.         Manage Sales Force.com as the companys primary business development tracking platform and insure customer sales activity is updated and reported on a monthly basis         Provide custom marketing and business development support to corporate and field operating units as required, including trade show support, specific branding activities, communications, H&M website development and multimedia support          Participate companywide  in Bid / no Bid reviews and capture strategies for key projects and programs         Serve in an executive capacity on strategic reviews for major proposals, ensuring fit with strategic objectives, by market and for the company Strategic Market Development          Provides market direction and technical advice, identifying and prioritizing potential markets and customers, and reporting on a quarterly basis, or as otherwise determined by the Executive Team         Through analytical research, help identify and introduce nontraditional market opportunities or geographies for strategic advancement of the company.         Participate with Executive Management  in the development short, medium and long term business plans.     Business Development Platform Development          In cooperation with the Market Analysts, Regional Vice Presidents, Regional Business Development personnel ensure the development of market sales plans and objectives by region and by customer, based on industry environmental factors and the companys market strategies and help determine critical success factors to meet these objectives.          In concert with Regional Vice Presidents, Regional Business Development and line of business Directors, assist and advise operations in planning and organizing the overall sales and marketing activities of the operating regions including account development and account maintenance.         Using a standard proposal platform, maintains consistent contact with regional vice presidents and their respective operations staffs to provide timely responses to bid questions in RFPs.         Works with the Corporate Training Department and Regional Vice Presidents, to further develop sales, marketing and business development capabilities within regional operations. Management: the ability to organize and manage multiple priorities.          Marketing and service systems development and deployment.          Problem analysis and problem resolution at both a strategic and functional level. Strong customer orientation         Excellent interpersonal and communication skills including presentation skills.          High performance teams and a strong team player.
