PCHA BUSINESS DEVELOPMENT ANALYST This paragraph summarizes the general nature, level and purpose of the job.Packard Childrens Health Alliance (PCHA) is a new foundation associated with Lucille Packard Childrens Hospital. The foundation brings the best community physicians together into a network that provides healthcare for children and expectant mothers across the Silicon Valley and East Bay Area. Research, develop and produce financial and management reports, strategic business analysis and related projects in support of business development and strategic planning. Analyze performance of existing practices and develop business plan projections for proposed acquisitions.JOB RESPONSIBILITIES Mergers/Acquisitions:      Assist in developing practice assessment reports for practices under consideration for acquisition including:o       Assist in gathering data from the practices and working with them to ensure the integrity of the datao       Assist in development of detailed assessment reports on the practices on productivity, revenue, expenses, benchmarked against known industry standardso       Assist in creating, updating and maintaining due diligence check-lists.      Assist in developing budget projections for practices for revenue, expenses and productivity under PCHA.      Assist in creating compensation models for physicians.      Assist in developing business cases for practice acquisitions.      Prepares presentations for MD practices, Board and related entities. PCHA Budgeting/Reporting:      Create/maintain monthly/quarterly/annual reports for actual expenses tracked again budget.      Coordinate with department staff to develop quarterly, semi-annual and annual reports to relevant to performance tracking.      Extract relevant data elements from various systems and other sources for business planning and analysis. Business Development/Strategy      Analyze market, financial, demographic and other internal and external data to determine business development opportunities and risks.      Assist in development of business plans for existing and new ventures, with an emphasis on data analysis and market viability.       Support PCHA business development and strategic planning projects and presentations.Required Minimum Qualifications and Experience      Education: Bachelor's degree in a work-related discipline/field from an accredited college or university      Experience: Four (4) years of progressively responsible and directly related work experience either in mergers/acquisitions, accounting or decision support/analysis. Healthcare experience strongly preferred. Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities      Ability to conduct detailed analysis, build business cases, create financials projections and formulate conclusions.      Ability to make effective oral presentations and prepare concise written reports to a variety of audiences.      Ability to plan, organize, prioritize, work independently and meet deadlines.      Ability to solve technical and non-technical problems.      Ability to work effectively both as a team player and leader.      Ability to work well with individuals at all levels of the organization.      Knowledge of financial concepts such as capital budgeting, discounted cash flow, financial statement analysis and financial forecasting.      Knowledge of computer systems and software used in functional area, with emphasis on Microsoft Excel, Microsoft PowerPoint and Microsoft Word.      Knowledge of basic decision support systems, basic database querying and related analytical software.      Knowledge of basic accounting principles preferred.

MISSION:The Vice President, Finance, Communications Segment is the senior financial executive overseeing all financial functions for the communications segment business. Oversees financial planning, forecasting, and budgeting for the Communications segment. Supports business units with financial and operational analyses.  Will partner with the senior management team of the Communications segment to drive the financial performance of the segment.  This individual will be responsible for overseeing all activities around the day-to-day finance function for the Companys Communications segment and will also play a key leadership role in the Finance organization around process improvement, scaling finance infrastructure and operations, and building and developing a team of professionals.TECHNICAL SKILLS & QUALIFICATIONS:Bachelors Degree in Finance or Accounting or related field.  MBA and/or CPA are desirable. 8+ years of active experience in financial planning and analysis and/or corporate finance dealing with some combination of (i) financial analysis, (ii) resource planning and budgeting within a global organization, (iii) investment banking, (iv) and/or management consulting. 5+ years experience in managing a team of analysts. Demonstrated experience with profitability analysis, expense analysis, forecasting and budgeting, strategic planning and financial analysis of new business opportunities. Experience in developing and executing business strategy. Strong analytical and problem solving capabilities. Excellent written and verbal communication skills. Strong presentation, self-confidence and organizational capabilities. Ability to meet multiple deadlines while maintaining the highest standards of completeness and accuracy. A collaborative, customer-centric approach with the ability to work with other functions. Experience within the technology/Internet sector is a plus. DUTIES:Responsible for the creation and maintenance of the Communications segment financial models used in annual budgeting, periodic forecasting and long range planning. Works with the Communications segment president and managers to prepare accurate forecasts and properly identify risks and opportunities to the forecasted results. Leads the annual budgeting process for the segment.  Works with the budget owners to prepare the annual budget. Prepares variance analyses of actual financial results to previous forecasts, budgets and prior periods, including preparation of presentations to senior management. Prepares Board materials and other formal financial materials. Develops clear and informative methods of presenting financial data, special projects and studies of a financial nature. Reviews business plans and presentations and provides recommendations with respect to financial opportunity and strategic fit with the Companys objectives. Develops growth strategy for the Communications segment and drives the growth initiatives. Identifies cost saving and/or revenue enhancement opportunities.  Analyzes new projects for profitability and risk. Drives profitability, process improvements and quality initiatives. Collaborates with Accounting to ensure GAAP compliance and adherence to UOL policies and procedures. Develops ad-hoc financial metrics analysis and operational efficiency analyses, including revenue per user, CRM, distribution, customer acquisition costs and financial projection analyses. Develops long-term financial projections for the Communications segment.Cross-functional ActivitiesProvides sound business judgment, strategic thinking, and broad financial and business perspective across the organization and add value as a senior member of the Finance team. Supports Corporate Finance initiatives around efficiency improvements, due diligence for mergers and acquisitions (M&A) and related activities, inter-segment sales initiatives, etc. Provides cross-functional leadership on FP&A matters related to shared services (e.g., Purchasing, A/R, A/P, etc), cash flows, financing and investments. Interfaces with Tax, Legal, Accounting, Financial Reporting and Human Resources. Ensures that the Communication segment finance team supports the accounting and finance teams to facilitate monthly closes. General FP&A Management, IT Systems and Internal ControlsIntroduces and drives functional Performance Management: establishes goals and objectives by which to determine individual and team results. Manages Communications finance staff; provides strategic direction to the department in order to achieve Company goals and objectives; ensures the department is properly staffed with individuals who have the necessary training and tools. Mentors, coaches and develops the individuals within the Communications finance team to ensure appropriate organizational development, succession planning, and performance management across all areas of the function. Manages departmental costs. Identifies ways to reduce cost by streamlining processes and systems and striving continuously to improve value to the internal customers.LOCAL CANDIDATES ONLYNO OUTSIDE AGENCIES

Working At Aetna -- the Value To YouWhat does it mean to work at Aetna? A lot.  From programs and benefits that support your financial, physical and emotional health to opportunities to build your knowledge and expand your career, the company makes working here a valuable experience in many ways.  Emerging Businesses GroupThe healthcare industry is undergoing significant change, driven by the combination of health reform, increasing healthcare costs and the need for improved quality of healthcare. Aetna is at the forefront of this shift, and has been focused on how to improve quality, cost of care and connectivity throughout the healthcare ecosystem.Emerging Businesses was created as a separate division within Aetna and is responsible for building a portfolio of new businesses outside of Aetnas core insurance products. The group is comprised of innovators, operators and investors, thus the approach to building these new businesses draws on a combination of incubation, acquisition, and partnership. Healthcare information technology is a key component of these businesses, as Emerging Businesses also seeks to leverage the existing Aetna assets of Medicity, ActiveHealth, iTriage, and other businesses in the portfolio.  New payment models such as Accountable Care Organizations represent a significant opportunity for Emerging Businesses and play a strong role in the go-to-market strategy.Emerging Businesses team members are responsible for developing the business case, building out the new business, identifying and structuring potential transactions, executing acquisitions in concert with Aetnas Corporate Development team, and managing the new businesses for Aetna.   In addition traditional processes, team members also participate in an industry-changing rapid innovation process called SlingShot  a bi-monthly week long event.  During this event, team members cross M&A, strategy, technology/IT, subject matter experts, and customers team up to rapidly develop new business concepts and high-level prototypes.Strategy Managing Associate Job DescriptionPOSITION SUMMARYResponsible for leading workstreams, including the identification, research and development of business cases for new businesses, incubating business concepts through prototype and pilot, and supporting the development of cross-Emerging Businesses strategy and strategic partnerships. This position reports into the Head of Strategy and/or a Director of Strategy as appropriate.EDUCATIONMBA or Masters DegreeREQUIRED SKILLSThe Strategy Managing Associate will exhibit analytical, business strategy, and leadership skills, including:- Evaluating and defining new business opportunities- Demonstrating business and industry acumen- Leading small to medium-complexity workstreams- Structuring work products and driving towards execution; delegating work as appropriate- Engaging and guiding small to medium-sized cross-functional teams as needed- Mentoring and guiding staffADDITIONAL JOB INFORMATIONFundamental Components:- Work closely with business leaders to lead the development of business cases for new businesses opportunities, including solution and opportunity definition, market research and sizing, competitive analyses, pricing analyses, etc.- Support business incubation activities for early-stage companies, including:Strategy developmentPrototype development and pilot identificationInvolvement in operational build-outs and strategic partnership developmentPlanning and project management activity- Assist in the development of strategic/operational business plans for mature portfolio companies, including:Conduct research associated with business issues and roadmap developmentSupport roadmap and product development integration activities- Lead the development of strategic and financial analyses of business opportunities and M&A target companies- Collaborate with EB Finance to develop comprehensive financial models and analyses, including pro formas, company valuations, business operating plans, and scenario analyses- Research and utilize market information from external sources such as strategy consultancies, government regulators, and research organizationsBackground/Experience Desired:- 2-3 years post-MBA related experience in strategy or management consulting, private equity, or internal strategy at blue-chip company- Domain knowledge in healthcare industry, including payer, provider, and / or HCIT- Ability and willingness to travel on occasion (- Very strong strategic, analytical, oral and written communication, presentation skillsLOCATION:This position will be based in New York, NY (ideally) or San Francisco, CA (for the right candidate).Please note that benefit eligibility may vary by position. Click here to review the benefits associated with this position.Aetna does not permit the use of tobacco related products or drugs in the workplace.  How to apply Please  use the "Apply" link to apply to this position.   If you cannot view  this link, you can find this position on our website by visiting: www.aetna.com/working, click on apply online, search openings, and enter 9117BR  in the keyword field.  Additional information on what its like to work for Aetna and more can also be found on our website.We value leadership, creativity and initiative. If you share those values and a commitment to excellence and innovation, consider a career with Aetna.  We conduct pre-employment drug and background testing. Aetna does not permit the use of tobacco related products or drugs in the workplace.Aetna is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. M/F/D/V Aetna is committed to maintaining an environment in which all employees are treated equitably and given the opportunity within the context of the business to achieve their potential. Aetna's Affirmative Action responsibilities extend to women, minorities, persons with disabilities and veterans. Company policy also provides for equal opportunity for qualified individuals regardless of race, color, sex, national origin, religion, age, disability, veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or marital status.No search firms please.You will not be asked for personal information until you have been fully evaluated through Aetna's screening processes. Aetna will never ask applicants for money. If you want to verify the identity of someone who contacts you from Aetna, call 1-800-AETNAHR (1-800-238-6247).

Identifies benchmarks in financial performance, hospital throughput, cost per case, length of stay and productivity metrics. Prepares and presents financial presentations as necessary to review operating performance. Provides oversight for business operations of the Institute, including financial reporting, billing and reimbursement, informatics, and outside strategic business ventures. Develops, implements and assists with the administration of business management and policy of the Institute; assists in developing and implementing financial strategic business plans, assists with interpreting Institute policies and integrating activities of departments' short and long term planning. Sr. Business Manager (USA)-720567DescriptionSenior Business ManagerSenior Business Manager position with Capital One Services, LLC in Richmond, VA; Multiple positions available:- Manage economic research and planning to develop strategic insights to support business strategy.- Manage the compilation, analysis, and reporting of economic data using econometric data modeling and sampling techniques to support strategic proposals.- Apply knowledge of quantitative and qualitative analysis; economic modeling and forecasting; project management; and deliverables planning to direct and manage the study of economic and statistical data to understand industry growth trends, other mega-trends and drivers; key competitors and other market participants; and the companys presence in the market, as well as the overall economic impact of these factors on business strategy.- Manage multiple research projects concurrently.- Manage the preparation of quarterly and annual forecasts and reviews of economic performance of a business line or a product.- Provide advice and consultation on economic relationships to business partners to coordinate strategy and business plan development and implementation.- Manage ad-hoc strategic presentations addressing economic guidelines and standards and points of view used in forecasting trends and formulating economic solutions as dictated by senior management.- Manage up to 10 analysts.QualificationsThe position requires a Masters degree or foreign equivalent in Economics, Finance, Engineering, Mathematics, Science, Business Administration, or a related quantitative analytical field, 1 year business analysis experience, and the following skill set through formal education or work experience: quantitative and qualitative analysis; economic modeling and forecasting; project management; deliverables planning; and making presentations to non-specialist audience.Must pass companys analytical assessment.

Manager, Senior Corporate Strategy and Research   Purpose/Role Statement:  The Senior Manager, Corporate Strategy and Research is responsible for assisting the team that delivers:  The annual corporate strategic planning deliverable – helping to guide, structure and synthesize the annual strategic plan including the corporate inputs such as competitive intelligence monitoring  Corporate competitive intelligence – further developing the Corporate CI function to help the business assess competitive strategic action  Project-based decision support – research and business analytics to inform critical business decisions within division and/or at the corporate level She/he is expected to develop relationships with business partners, perform creative analytics and research to develop compelling recommendations, and provide excellent project management. Key Responsibilities: As the Sr. Manager, Corporate Strategy and Research, this individual will take responsibility for managing the execution of strategic analyses at both the Corporate and Divisional levels.On a corporate level, he/she will play a key role in: Supporting the annual global strategic planning process  Consolidating strategic plan outputs and supporting Senior Management and Board of Directors presentations  Corporate Competitive Intelligence efforts that provide key competitive insights to the organization  Collaborating with Competitive intelligence practitioners throughout BSC to collect and synthesize inputs  Supporting Divisional Competitive Intelligence War-Gaming exercises  Corporate strategic projects (e.g., white space analysis) as identified by executive leadership with development of structured, practical, fact-based approach to strategy, valuation and business planning On a divisional level, he/she will play a key role in: Working with franchise teams to develop high impact marketing and business strategies  Evaluating / understanding the marketplace, identifying market trends and growth opportunities, diagnosing customer needs and behaviors, predicting likely competitive dynamics, and analyzing the economics of the business so that marketing can make effective choices to maximize competitive advantage  Conducting market and product opportunity assessments, strategy formulations and valuations for: new products developed in-house, potential acquisitions, and growth opportunities / performance improvement strategies for existing businesses These activities will require: Strong financial, analytical and quantitative skills  Exceptional communication skills  Excellent interpersonal skills with the ability to work cross-divisionally & cross-functionally, with key stakeholders including finance, business development, R&D, clinical, marketing, and sales  Development and implementation of structured, practical, fact-based approach to strategy development, valuation, and business plans  Utilizes a broad range of secondary research, and qualitative / quantitative primary research techniques to derive market and customer insights; defines potential approach selecting from a range of techniques and then performing/overseeing the execution of the analytical plan  Integration of broad corporate/divisional business performance needs into franchise level decision-making  Excellent project management: planning and organizing project assignments of substantial variety and complexity; defining and managing overall schedule for project and milestones (both owned & assigned to others); often serving as project lead coordinating activities of a cross-functional team  Works with little direction on specialized projects  Quality Systems Duties and Responsibilities:  Build Quality into all aspects of their work by maintaining compliance to all quality requirements.  Establish and support a work environment of continuous improvement that supports BSC's Quality Policy, Quality System and the appropriate regulations for the area they support.   Qualifications:  Bachelor's Level Degree required. MBA or other advanced degree preferred  4+ years of experience at a top-tier management consulting company and/or 5-7 years of experience in a strategic/ analytical role within the healthcare field required  Experience managing cross-functional projects in the healthcare industry required  Experience in diagnosing business problems and building and executing multi-faceted, long-term, strategic plans based on business challenges required  Experience working as an internal or external consultant with responsibility for line customers preferred, preferably in the medical device or pharmaceutical industry  Maturity to know when to take directions, when to ask for support and when to lead/act  Ability to function independently in small teams without constant supervision  Comfortable influencing others without authority and building relationships across the organization  High level of self-awareness and integrity  Proficiency in Excel, Powerpoint, and Word The above statements are intended to describe the general nature and level of work being performed by people assigned to this classification. They are not intended to be construed as an exhaustive list of all responsibilities, duties and skills required of personnel so classified.Please contact your local EH&S department for more information on physical requirements.Boston Scientific is an equal opportunity employer.

Amazon Web Services (AWS) is the world leader in providing a highly reliable, scalable, low-cost infrastructure platform in the cloud that powers hundreds of thousands of businesses in 190 countries around the world! At AWS we are continuously innovating and expanding our pay-as-you-go cloud based services to meet the growing needs of our customers. Today our services cover a wide range of computing, networking, storage, database and application deployment domains; providing IaaS, PaaS and SaaS solutions to a broad range of customers and use cases.Today AWS provides the widest set of storage service choices to help our customers solve their specific use case needs. These include Simple Storage Service (S3) - scalable storage in the Cloud, Glacier - low-cost storage archiving in the Cloud, Elastic Block Service (EBS) - Elastic Cloud Computing (EC2) block storage volumes, and Storage Gateway - an on-premise appliance integrating our customer’s IT infrastructure with Cloud storage. As we are continuously innovating for our customers’ growing service needs, AWS is now forming a team to deliver additional highly innovative cloud services.Delivering a reliable, scalable, and high-performance service requires engineers with exceptional technical expertise and fearless creativity. In addition, at Amazon, along with superlative technical strength, we expect our engineers to interact with customers, to understand our business goals, and to innovate rapidly, delivering high-quality and ground-breaking functionality.The ideal candidate is excited about the incredible game-changing opportunity that cloud computing represents, and is passionate about delivering high quality high value services for our customers in a hyper-growth environment where priorities can shift fast. Join a team that is super smart, driven to serve customers, and fun to work with in a start-up like environment.Bachelor’s degree or higher in Computer Science, Engineering or related field5+ years professional experience in commercial or web-scale system software development and deliveryProven object-oriented design and implementation skills (Java, and/or C++), preferably on LinuxDeep understanding of scalable computing systems, software architecture, data structures and algorithmsProficient in network, distributed, asynchronous and concurrent programmingProven track record designing, building and delivering high quality software on timePossess a passion for technical leadership and mentoringPossess strong verbal and written communication skillsPossess strong analytical skills, with excellent problem solving abilities in the face of ambiguityExperience in Agile/SCRUM enterprise-scale software developmentExperience developing storage software with knowledge of storage protocols and high-performance mapping constructsUnderstanding of storage performance challenges and their solutionsFamiliar with building secure software and security algorithmsExperience building and operating scalable infrastructure software or distributed systemsDemonstrated ability to achieve stretch goals in a highly innovative and fast paced environmentTeam leadership experience*LI-AL1 ** For more information on Amazon Web Services, please visit http://aws.amazon.com **

Johnson & Johnson IT Shared Services, a member of Johnson & Johnson's Family of Companies, is recruiting for a Sr. Technology Manager, Cloud Architecture located in Raritan, NJ.   The Sr. Technology Manager, Cloud Architecture will be responsible for defining system architecture and design strategy for J&J IT's cloud services offerings. Must have demonstrated the ability to orchestrate industry-leading datacenter and cloud computing solutions into enterprise services with a proven record of innovation in the infrastructure services domain. Knowledge of emerging datacenter, IaaS, PaaS and SaaS trends and standards is critical as is the ability to determine solution direction for a 12 - 18 month window. Must be able to carry out multiple complex tasks in parallel with a minimum of guidance and be comfortable providing detailed guidance to others. The position requires frequent interactions with cross functional team including Risk Management, CTO office, and external vendors; strong negotiation and persuasion skills are required. Success in this position will be measured by individual's ability to lead the delivery of the most operationally competitive Cloud Computing solutions.   This position will be responsible for the design and architecture definition for complex cloud computing services. Write functional requirements/specifications documents. Review and analysis of technical, and user documentation. Direct interaction with vendor, SW and HW engineers in a collaborative development environment. Assessing various technologies and designing orchestrated cloud solutions for IaaS, PaaS, and SaaS environments. Act as a consultative resource for customers to assist them in achieving their business objectives.  QualificationsThis position requires a minimum of a bachelor's degree and 10 years of overall IT experience is required. In addition this position will require 5 years of combined experience in successful delivery of IaaS, PaaS or SaaS capabilities or in orchestrating those technologies to deliver tangible business value. Extensive working knowledge of one or more core technology areas: storage, compute, networking, security is required. This position requires the ability to drive problem-solving strategies for complex issues involving cross-functional disciplines. Excellent verbal and written communication skills and strong team leadership skills are required for this role. Strong domain knowledge in cloud computing technologies and related disciplines is also required. In addition, candidates with knowledge of network concepts such as the TCP/IP stack, load balancing, firewalls, iRules, and network routing are preferred. This position requires a goal oriented individual who is motivated to succeed in a dynamic environment. The ability to handle stressful situations and demanding customers is required. Candidates with a solid understanding of virtualization technologies are preferred. Experience with common scripting languages (Java, Python, Perl, .NET, VBScript, WSH) is preferred. Experience working with mission-critical applications such as SharePoint, Exchange, MS SQL and Oracle are preferred. Linux knowledge is preferred. Windows Certifications is also preferred. This position will require 5-10% travel and will be based in Raritan, NJ.   BE VITAL in your career, Be seen for the talent you bring to your work. Explore opportunities within the Johnson & Johnson Family of Companies.

The companys patented hardware & software technologies have been in the works for over 7 years & theyre now engaged with several strategic customers.  The company itself is a collection of incredibly bright & high performing type of individuals. The entire Executive team has a successful track record of building companies from start to finish & foster a collaborative environment with a company culture that encourages a creative & flexible working style. With over 200M+ subscribers waiting for our clients product launch in late 2012, our client is actively looking for a Director of their Scalable Cloud technology. Senior Cloud ArchitectAtlanta, GA or Irvine, CA I.T. Solutions, Inc. is searching for a Sr. Cloud Architect for our client in Atlanta, GA.  The right candidate can reside in Atlanta, GA or Irvine, CA.  The Sr. Cloud Architect is the most senior architect position within the North American business unit.  This highly strategic, influential and visible position is responsible for providing strategic architecture direction around various Cloud initiatives across North America in addition to performing the hands-on work required of a software architect. This critical player will be accountable for strategy and direction while simultaneously performing as a detailed software architect.   Responsibilities:         Provide leadership to the Architecture peer group across North America comprised of the top technical minds in the Company.         Perform as an influential thought leader/evangelist that has the ability to earn the trust and successfully lead distributed peer groups in a matrix environment. This position is an individual contributor.         Lead, influence and direct at all levels from the Developers to the CEO.         Role requires collaboration with various product architects, developers, product managers, and customer application experts to arrive at architectural recommendation and follow through.          Serves as the technology expert on building technical requirements with a focus on Cloud solutions and transitioning on-premise solutions to the Cloud. This critical role will ensure our client successfully launches new products in online environments.          Responsible for maintaining the technology road map, standards and perform architectural analysis for various initiatives across North America.          Works with respective Product team to design, communicate, develop and maintain the architecture needed to enable Cloud vision across product portfolio as required.          Deploy solutions in public, private, and hybrid clouds including integration scenarios that require mixed (hosted / on premise) environments.         Captures technical requirements and defines technology solutions; creates the conceptual, logical, and physical design of the solution to ensure appropriate technology is acquired and implemented          Evaluates technologies and determines strengths and weaknesses of technology architecture, implementation and suitability; recommends solutions to ensure consistency with the company vision.          Ability to identify technology trends and be able to articulate the impact to the clients product portfolio. Provide demonstrable proof points needed to evangelize and arrive at recommendation on utilizing relevant new technologies. Qualifications:         10+ years of experience in Product architect roles  defining concepts, guidelines, policies to be followed by multiple development groups          Must have a demonstrated history of performing as an influential thought leader/evangelist that has the ability to earn the trust and successfully lead in a matrix environment. Ability to forge strong diverse teams of people with multiple perspectives to arrive at recommendations to pursue.          Direct experience in the creation of architectural recommendation of large Cloud based product/services. Direct experience in transitioning existing on-premise products to the Cloud.          Must have experience deploying applications on various Cloud Public/Private or Hybrid. Well aware of Amazon, EC2, Azure or Rackspace Cloud servers          Understanding of Utility and elastic computing experience; SaaS billing/costing models and analysis experience; SaaS support frameworks and governance experience          3+ years of experience in interfaces-related projects  defining, implementing and/or releasing APIs and SDKs.          Leverages social media to evangelize and foster community of technology people.         Requires strong leadership skills to be able to lead by influence and earn the trust of a strong product architect community.          Strong software product development experience using cloud computing technologies.          Ability to work with diverse technology stacks/architectures: Microsoft; Java/J2EE; HTML5; Virtualization Technologies; Ruby on Rails; REST based protocols; etc.          Deep understanding of multi-tenancy.         Deep understanding of load balancing and scalability techniques.         Deep understanding of database partitioning and cataloguing as well as master / slave setups.          Deep understanding of database scaling and failover techniques applicable in Cloud environments.         Solid understanding of complex IT systems and software with a consistent knowledge of evolving and emerging technologies.         Direct experience in working with agile and distributed organizations both onshore and offshore          Strong formal communication and presentation style to articulate vision, align peers, and arrive at technology recommendations to pursue. Ability to build excitement and, in persuasive terms, gain alignment to the overarching strategy.          B.S., M.S., or PhD in Computer Science, Engineering (or related discipline).         Must have the ability to travel up to 30%.Please email resumes to Shelley Schmidt at sschmidt@itsoli.com.

Premier Enterprise Software Company Known for Setting the Standard In Managing, Processing and Optimizing Very Large Volumes of Data in the midst of Re-Defining their Product Offering.Extremely Stable and Profitable Company with Thousands of Very Long Term Customers is Adding New Customers Weekly and needs to keep up with customer demands for cloud and grid based Big Data Solutions.Excellent Working Environment: Extremely Bright, Inquisitive, Collaborative Team Environment, AGILE/SCRUM Development Environment.Desired Skills/Experience: (culture: our team has a curiosity about SW internals)Must be naturally curious about Software Internals, Problem Solving, Troubleshooting and creatively developing code/programming based solutions surrounding new technology that will address real world customer pain points and customer demands.Experience coding in Core Java, C, C++, Perl and/or Unix Shell scripting for solutions involving Big Data and/or Cloud and/or Grid (parallel processing and/or Massively parallel computing, massively parallel processor arrays [MPP / MPPA], Grid Computing, MapReduce especially for HadoopExperience and/or Knowledge Developing and Coding Solutions surrounding NoSQL (i.e.: MongoDB or Cassandra) and/or SQL Based RDMS: should have solid core knowledge and/or experience with Database internals coding and accessing databases (particularly large data sets within NoSQL and/or SQL based databases) for the purpose of speed/optimization and/or allowing for cloud or Grid based integration into a new or existing application or Software utility.Experience Developing Cross Platform Software for Windows, Linux and Unix is preferred.Pluses:A BS, MS or PhD in Computer Science is Strongly Preferred.Experience with OLAP, Datawarehousing or similar areas.Experience or Knowledge with Hadoop based concepts and technologies such as Hive, HBase, Zookeeper, Pig, HDFS, hCatalog, hadoop kernal, mapreduce, cdh, hdpExtremely Competitive Compensation Package and Great Benefits, Relocation Assistance and Visa Transfer are Offered.Please Call, Inquire or Apply In Confidence for More Information.

Windows Cloud Engineer RightScale are the leaders of Cloud computing management. The Professional Services team builds Clouds and deploys applications across a wide variety of Cloud providers and platforms. We are seeking to hire talented and experienced Cloud Engineers to join our global team in a variety of company and remote locations. We use our technical experience and coaching skills to ensure projects are a success when delivered by RightScale, our Customers or our Partners. The Windows Cloud Engineer duties include, but are not limited to the following:          Act as a subject matter expert for Cloud deployments and solutions          Lead the technical development of Cloud deployments including installation, configuration and troubleshooting scripting to achieve portable multi-Cloud application-level deployments          Coaching customer and partner teams to ensure success and best practices          Work with RightScale's Support team to assist with technical queries and troubleshooting The ideal candidate has the following skills & experience:          A minimum of 5 years experience providing installation, software engineering and deployment support.          Cloud concepts, Web Services and API's (Amazon Web Services, Rackspace, Microsoft Azure)          Deep knowledge of Windows Server 2008/2012 installation, configuration and systems administration          Expert OS automation using Windows PowerShell          Deploying and administering .NET-based Cloud solutions          Packaging IIS-based applications with Web Deploy (msdeploy)          Microsoft SQL Server database deployment and administration          High availability, scalability and performance optimization (e.g. distributed deployments, HTTP traffic Load balancing, content caching, Principal-Mirror database replication, sharding)          Virtualization & hypervisors (E.g Hyper-V, Citrix XenServer)          Networking configuration (I.P, routing, VLANs, VPN's)          Identity and access management (Active Directory, LDAP, OpenID, oAuth and SAML)          Secure engineering practices + systems hardening Education & Certifications          A minimum of a Bachelors degree in Computer Science (or equivalent) is requested          Technical development or systems engineering qualifications such as Microsoft Certified Solutions Expert (MCSE) or Solutions Developer (MCSD) All applicants are expected to possess the following skills:          Familiarity with the RightScale management platform          Self-starter and self-managing work style; Capable of working from home or remote locations without direct supervision          Be available for business travel and partial mobility as customer projects require          Open minded, flexible and adaptable to changing opportunities          Motivated to work in a growing company; interested in developing the business          Continual learning and skills development to maintain technical currency          Client facing and commercially aware          Solid communication skills, both written and verbal  RightScale is a great place to work and we are looking for only the best.

The Associate Application Developer will work with experienced application developers to design, implement and support EMC's SAP BPC application. You will build a strong competency in business processes and SAP application functionality relevant to their area. Demonstrates good knowledge of and adherence to IT processes and standards. Works well in both a team environment and independently. The Associate Developer is expected to demonstrate a strong desire to learn new technologies and skills. This individual may also be required to work in a team environment that consists of offshore resources.Participates in translating Business Requirements into Functional and Technical Design documents.Presents work for review and sign off by peers and/or management in his workgroup.Develops and tests programs and interfaces as specified in Technical Designs and ensures all programming standards and policies are adhered to.Provides production support of applications and is responsible for determining root cause as well as proposing and implementing solutionsMNSTAccelerate your career as you help reinvent the value and impact of information for business everywhere. At EMC, we are leading customers on their journey to cloud computing by enabling them to store, manage, protect and analyze their information assets in a more agile, trusted and cost-effective way. If you are passionate about technology and want to be part of the information management revolution, join more than 50,000+ EMCers around the world who are leading the journey to the cloud. Each and every day, EMC's IT organization develops and delivers innovative solutions to support EMC's growth and goals, while enabling more than 50,000 employees around the globe to work more productively. At the heart of the EMC journey to cloud computing and IT as a Service, EMC's dedicated and driven IT professionals continually strive to enhance our environment; embrace a broader spectrum of technologies; and accelerate their careers. Join us as we build the IT organization of the future. When you choose EMC, you join a diverse world of innovative thought leaders. At our core is a commitment to workplace diversity, the sustainability of our planet, and community corporate involvement. We offer highly competitive salaries, bonus programs, world-class benefits, and unparalleled growth and development opportunities-all to create a compelling and rewarding work environment.

The Microsoft BI Developer works within the IT - Enterprise Reporting Group (ERG) and is responsible for the development and implementation of Microsoft BI solutions for all persistent data structures across the enterprise reporting environment.This is a hands-on position that requires both a technical understanding of the custom developed reporting environments within EMC as well as a strong understanding of the business function. The individual must have expertise in the areas of relational theory, data modeling as well as dimensional modeling.The candidate must have broad understanding of BI tools, architecture, functions, and features with strong technical background including relational databases, multi-dimensional databases, OLAP and/or reporting tools and metadata management.The individual in this position will interact with project managers, business analysts, co-developers and business users.The Microsoft BI Developer has the following responsibilities:Develop a strong working relationship with the appropriate business users and provide business-impact-driven analysis and communicate results to stakeholders utilizing state-of-the-art development processes and architectureParticipate in analysis phase of ERG projectsCreate logical data models for all ERG projectsPerform source system data quality analysisBusiness requirements definition, mapping, and gap analysisTechnical design document preparationMicrosoft BI application design and prototypingTest scenario definition, script development, and schedulingSupport Microsoft BI power usersWork with cross-functional user and technical teamsEducation Required: Bachelors DegreeExperience Required:Minimum 5 years' experience in data warehousing development in large reporting environment(s)Minimum 3 years Hands on experience with SQL Server 2008/ 2008R2, SQL Server Integration Services 2008/ 2008R2, SQL Server Analysis Services 2008/ 2008R2 and SQL Server Reporting Services 2008/ 2008R2.Minimum 3 years Hands on experience with T-SQL and MDX languagesExperience with STAR schemaBusiness Intelligence features in SharePoint 2010MNSTAccelerate your career as you help reinvent the value and impact of information for business everywhere. Amazon Web Services (AWS) is the world leader in providing a highly reliable, scalable, low-cost infrastructure platform in the cloud that powers hundreds of thousands of businesses in 190 countries around the world! At AWS we are continuously innovating and expanding our pay-as-you-go cloud based services to meet the growing needs of our customers. Today our services cover a wide range of computing, networking, storage, database and application deployment domains; providing IaaS, PaaS and SaaS solutions to a broad range of customers and use cases.Today AWS provides the widest set of storage service choices to help our customers solve their specific use case needs. These include Simple Storage Service (S3) - scalable storage in the Cloud, Glacier - low-cost storage archiving in the Cloud, Elastic Block Service (EBS) - Elastic Cloud Computing (EC2) block storage volumes, and Storage Gateway - an on-premise appliance integrating our customer’s IT infrastructure with Cloud storage. As we are continuously innovating for our customers’ growing service needs, AWS is now forming a team to deliver additional highly innovative cloud services.Delivering a reliable, scalable, and high-performance service requires engineers with exceptional technical expertise and fearless creativity. In addition, at Amazon, along with superlative technical strength, we expect our engineers to interact with customers, to understand our business goals, and to innovate rapidly, delivering high-quality and ground-breaking functionality.The ideal candidate is excited about the incredible game-changing opportunity that cloud computing represents, and is passionate about delivering high quality high value services for our customers in a hyper-growth environment where priorities can shift fast. MCU32 group is seeking Principal/Staff level design engineer responsible for all aspects of rtl-to-gds design. In this role you will be taking ownership of Synthesis, static timing analysis and power analysis in sub-micron designs. In addition, this position requires simulate, design, optimize and validate the device variants for the 32-bit product family.     Core Responsibilities: 1.    Take ownership of RTL synthesis. Closely work with RTL designer to understand and debug constraints and facilitate logic changes to improve timing. 2.    Perform timing, SI and noise analysis. Closely work with place and route engineer on timing closure. 3.    Run formal verification tools to verify the construction of gate level netlist. 4.    Perform Power analysis and provide feedback to the design team. 5.    Investigate new methodologies to improve the timing, power, QoR etc 6.    Help design engineer to create timing ECOs.  Ideal candidate will have following qualifications:   1. Hands on experience with Synopsys tools such as Design Compiler, Prime Time SI, DFT compiler and Formality.  2. Experience in deep sub-micron technologies and have good understanding of MCMM, cross-talk, noise and OCV concepts. 3. Good understanding of Place and Route tools such as IC Compiler. 4. Familiarity with System Verilog, Perl and TCL. 5. Experience with power and noise analysis tools is a plus.  “Regular and predictable attendance is an essential function of the job.”  *L1-TA1 % of Travel Required : None Skills : Engineering -> Simulation, R & D, Project Management, Electrical, Design Offer Relocation : Maybe

MCU16 group is seeking an engineer to implement DFT for the 16-bit product family. Responsibilities include implementing DFT including but not limited to test mode logic, memory bist, boundary scan and jtag, and verifying the logic at chip level. The person will also be responsible for scan insertion, ATPG and post silicon validation.   Ideal candidate will have following qualifications:   1. Working with design, validation and test team on DFT architecture, design, verification and silicon bring up. 2. Hands on experience with Synopsys tools such as DFT compiler and Design Compiler.  3. Experience with mentor tools such as FastScan, testkompress and mbist architect. 4. Perform HDL design using the Verilog Language. Simulate at the module level and full-chip level to guarantee data sheet functionality and timing. 5. Good programming skills in languages such as perl and tcl. 6. Experience with Primetime and timing closure is a plus.  BSEE with 7+ years experiences  *LI-TA1% of Travel Required : 0-10% Offer Relocation : Maybe

Company:  Mentor Graphics Job Title:  Corporate Application Engineer - Place and Route Job Location: US - CA - Fremont Job Category:  Applications Engineering Mentor Graphics Corporation (MENT) is a global technology leader in Electronic Design Automation, providing software and hardware design solutions that help engineers around the world create new and innovative products. Each year, our customers use our tools to push the boundaries of technology in order to deliver smaller, faster and more reliable products that run the world's high tech devices. Position Overview Work with customers as a world leader in electronic software design solutions, providing services for the world's largest electronics and semiconductor companies. Continue to learn and support state of the art, Mentor Graphics place and route tools. In this position, you will have very close involvement with customers, software engineering and product marketing. You will become a member of a team of highly motivated individuals committed to providing award-winning technical support to customers and field personnel using Mentor Graphics Olympus SOC. You will work closely with the customer to understand their current and future needs, as well as ensuring successful deployment of Mentor Graphics Olympus SOC in their design flow.Responsibilities include providing in-depth technical support and training to our customers, staying up to date with new capabilities, working with customers on issues they may experience with Mentor Graphics Olympus SOC. As a team member, you will focus on customer advocacy and product supportability to influence product quality and direction. Capture and share problem resolutions in application notes, provide input to product documentation and training materials, reproduce customers' problems and provide resolution or workaround, and provide well documented Defect Reports. Job Qualifications The successful candidate will possess the following combination of education and experience: BSEE (or equivalent experience) with 5 or more years of demonstrated experience in semiconductor layout of large designs in state-of-the-art processes. Preferred candidates will have experience in complex state-of-the-art place-and-route experience, VLSI, digital design, clock-tree and timing analysis, and basic Tcl/Perl programming. Effective communication skills, written and verbal. The position will involve direct interaction with the customer as well as internally with appropriate disciplines of QA, Marketing, Product Engineering, Development Engineering, Documentation and Training. An ability to work in a diverse "global" environment. Experience with one industry standard Place and Route tool is required [Mentor (Olympus-SoC), Synopsys (IC Compiler, Physical Compiler), Cadence (SoC Encounter), or Magma (Talus, BlastFusion)]. Experience with Perl, TCL and UNIX scripting are a plus. Technical applications engineering or customer support experience is also beneficial. The successful candidate will have the ability to work independently, will be self-motivated, have excellent interpersonal skills and technical curiosity and motivation to learn and succeed, as well as leadership traits to ensure customer success. Customer sensitivity, the ability to multiplex many issues, and the desire to help customers exploit new technologies are essential for success in the position. Some travel may be required. Work - Life Balance Mentor Graphics believes in fostering a work environment that promotes a healthy work-life balance.  Our world class benefits package includes up to 32 days of vacation/holiday pay per year, 401k matching, Stock purchase plan, annual performance reviews/bonuses, education reimbursement, partially paid Medical/Dental/Vision insurance and much more.

This project involves the design and development of an evaluation platform used to test the functionality of new design for our client, a high-visibility computer manufacturing brand. The hardware design of the board for this project requires a Windows GUI to drive the operation of the microcontrollers and the automation of the collection and storage of functional output from the power management controllers. OVERVIEW:   * Translate architectural and software requirements into functional code  * Test, debug, and validate software blocks and revisions through release  QUALIFICATIONS:   * at least 3 years building Windows based applications, including various GUI elements  * Excellent development and debugging skills (C, C#, and C++)  * Proven track record of solving complex technical problems and writing technical design documents  * C/C++/C#, .NET skills  * Software localization skills  * Visual Studio skills  * Strong communication and presentation skills  * Use of software development tools, environments, and lifecycle  * Demonstrated ability to design and implement real solutions  * Experience developing applications on IA  * Experience with debugging user- and kernel- mode problems using Microsoft development tools (Visual Studio, WinDBG, etc.)  Additional Skills (Nice to Have):   * Python / Perl / Bash  * Linux basics  * Compiler technology, especially performance tuning and optimization, debugging and optimization in multithreading environment  * OS internals  * Computer architecture on processor and virtual machines  Estimated length of assignment: 4 months+Number of positions: 1Estimated hours per week: 40 hours% of travel required: 0Telecommuting: No Please include a daytime phone number where you can best be reached along with your resume. Please also include a brief cover letter outlining your experience as related to this job requirement. CompuCom is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Candidates must have the unrestricted right to work in the US. No 3rd party / recruiters please.

Programming experience in C and C++. Experience with Object-Oriented Programming. Experience in embedded systems. Specialization in modeling & simulation and control systems. Programming experience in MATLAB. Experience with Simulink or Model Based Design software. Programming experience in a scripting language such as Perl or Python. Knowledge of industry standards, Software Development and Quality Engineering process. Industry experience in Aerospace, Automotive, DSP or similar domains.

Work for a renowned technologly leader making some of the best-loved products worldwide. Seeking innovative, talented and creative thinkers driven to push the boundaries in all engineering specialties.This compiler position is for an individual contributor with background in the following:Implementing OpenGL (ES) and OpenCL compilersWorking with OpenGL and OpenCL and vendor teams to implement features and debug issues within the GPU-specific driversValidating GPU ISA features for new chipsets (includes working on FPGAs and pre/post-silicon bringup)Integrating GPU compilers into the larger driver, kernel and surrounding operating system.Analyzing possible future GPU architecturesRequirementsBSCS/MSCS or higherExcellent programming skills and knowledge of C/C++Development experience on Unix, Linux or Mac OS XExcellent software design, problem solving and debugging skillsExperience with GPU architecturesStrong background in compiler architecture, optimization, code generation and overall design of compilers.Experience with developing optimizing compilers for modern architectures.Familiarity with analyzing generated code for optimization/code generation opportunities.Experience with experience on OpenGL or OpenCL or other GPU programming APIs such as GLSL, HLSL, Cg Ideal candidate will have experience in implementing compiler technology for OpenGL or OpenCL or Direct3DExperience with FPGA and hardware simulators a plus.Experience with operatic systems and driver development is a plus.Ideal candidate will have experience with LLVM and ClangStrong communication and teamwork skillsStrong track record of building high performance, production quality software on schedule.Please send cover letter with your relevant compiler experience to: margaret@juliacortrecruiting.com

As a Program Development Lead, you will lead the creation of new business for an entrepreneurial organization of world-class researchers and developers performing contract R&D for government sponsors such as DARPA and AFRL, in computer science, artificial intelligence, and decision support systems. You will work closely with our team and with government sponsors to shape significant research agendas, formulate programs, and communicate value propositions. You will create winning bid strategies incorporating academic and industry teammates and innovative technical approaches. You will lead the development of high-quality, compelling written proposals to develop ambitious leading edge capabilities. Qualified candidates will have an advanced degree in Computer Science, Engineering or related field, and broad applications and technical experience, including depth in one or more of the following technical areas: compilers, parallel computing, programming languages, secure and resilient computing, computer architecture, tools development, optimization, modeling and simulation, symbolic and/or probabilistic reasoning, knowledge representation, mixed-initiative systems, and programming language and tools for the above areas. Strong writing and presentation skills are a must, as is a successful record working with organizations such as DARPA to create and win programs.BAE Systems Technology Solutions (http://www.eis.na.baesystems.com/ts/index.htm) - Advanced Computing and Decision Systems is an entrepreneurial organization that focuses on research and development in computer science and artificial intelligence. We deliver state-of-the-art decision support and system analysis design and integration technologies for many customers in the defense and intelligence communities. We are based in Burlington, MA, and are part of a 1979 MIT spinoff company that was acquired by BAE Systems in 2004 and has since grown to more than 300 researchers, system engineers, and software developers, over 70 percent of whom hold advanced engineering and science degrees.    dl{margin:0 0 .8em}dt{font-weight:bold}dd{margin:.4em 0 0 2em}Required Skills:- Advanced degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or related field- At least 7 years of research/advanced development applications and technical experience, including depth in one or more of the following technical areas:     compilers, parallel computing, programming languages, secure and resilient computing, computer architecture, tools development, optimization, modeling and simulation, symbolic and/or probabilistic reasoning, knowledge representation, mixed-initiative systems, and programming language and tools for the above areas. - Excellent writing and presentation skills- A record of winning significant business from organizations such as DARPA.    BAE Systems is a premier global defense and security company with approximately 100,000 employees delivering a full range of products and services for air, land and naval forces, as well as advanced electronics, security, information technology solutions and customer support and services.People are the greatest asset in any Company ... BAE Systems is committed to a high performance culture and provides an environment that challenges our employees to be remarkable and obtain their full potential. We are an EEO/Affirmative Action Employer that understands the value of diversity and its impact on a high performance culture. Join us ...

Requisition ID 10842BRTitle Associate Director, Diversity & InclusionJob Category Human ResourcesJob Description PURPOSE:This position will drive Novo Nordisks (NNI) Diversity and Inclusion strategy in the U.S. Act as a consultant to key stakeholders across the business as well as serve as a leader on policies and practices in the Diversity & Inclusion arena. Envision the big picture and translate it into actionable goals and plans. Advise on the use of diversity to enhance growth and profitability. Ensure seamless integration of diversity into talent management systems and processes in order to meet business and diversity objectives.RELATIONSHIPS:Position reports to the Vice President of Talent Management. The incumbent will work independently with limited direction. Decision-making authority will be fairly broad. This is a high level specialist position that calls upon technical knowledge. Collaborates with HR business partners, Legal, Talent Acquisition colleagues, Corporate Communications, Strategic Sourcing, employees at all levels, managers and business leaders, as well as peers from Denmark and other affiliates. Primary liaison with communication vendors and consultants.ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS:STRATEGY DEVELOPMENT and IMPLEMENTATION Consult and develop strategies in collaboration with leaders across the business on strategic plans for diversity & inclusion that support business needs Help shape strategy for and implement key people initiatives, especially in relation to inclusiveness Lead the Diversity Council - The council members serve as an enterprise wide steering committee committed to driving diversity and inclusion programs and strategies. Facilitate enterprise wide communications, membership, meetings, and best practices for the council operation and ensure goals and objectives are aligned with business needs Serve as a subject matter expert and advisor for diversity and compliance work related to talent attraction efforts. Focus on developing community partnerships with local organizations Discuss and review strategies, approaches, program materials and communications from other COEs. These should embed inclusiveness within the organization and align messaging with priorities Develop, implement and advise on policies, initiatives and programs to attract, retain and promote a diverse workforce, and to promote the use of diversity to grow our business Gain a strong understanding of key business and financial drivers that determine the organizations success Find ways to incorporate diversity initiatives with the field Serve as Novo Nordisk Inc. liaison to corporate Diversity and Inclusion group, sharing better practices Provide active participation in global community of practice relative to Diversity and Inclusion issues and topics Ensure compliance with OFCCP requirements Oversee the development of the Affirmation Action PlanEMPLOYEE RESOURCE GROUPS Pull through toolkit and other supporting tactics to ensure successful ERGs are sustained Build a strategy to interface with leaders who chair employee resource groups across all levels Research and develop best practices to share across the organizationBUDGET Allocate and manage budget resources through highly developed reporting methods Analyze budget trends; make decisions on actions to be taken regarding budgets Communicate with the Finance department to ensure compliance with Finance budgetary standards Ensure accurate processing of vendor billing Update budget reports on a monthly basis and justify against the General Ledger to prepare for Rolling Estimate reviews Prepares, justifies and administers budgets in accordance with organizational goals and strategies; and identifies cost-saving opportunitiesAWARENESS EDUCATION & TRAINING Leverage relevant change management tools for culture transformation, where this relates to diversity/inclusion Develop and execute inclusiveness learning/development programs for employees and managers Represent diversity within and outside the company, with a specific focus on external diversity conferences and organizationsMEASUREMENT and EVALUATION Provide expertise to business and HR Leads on diversity metrics and analytics, including interpretation of engagement and workforce composition data in order to build a more inclusive environment Collaborates with stakeholders to design and execute analyses to support decision-making and planning Design and provide diversity related people metrics that speak to business issues and inform decisions Provide current external best practice and emerging trends in Human Capital and diversity management in order to inform business planning Understand and position data trends and metrics associated with demographics and compliance Effectively communicate and distribute D&I metrics and analysis to leaders. Provide quarterly report outs on diversity analyticsPHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS:Approximately 10 - 15% overnight travel requiredKEY SUCCESS FACTORS: EDUCATION, EXPERIENCE, KNOWLEDGE AND SKILLS Bachelor's degree required; in a related discipline or equivalent work experience in a multi-cultural environment, advanced degree preferred Requires a minimum of ten to twelve years of progressively responsible experience in in diversity program management, with HR Business Partner and/or HR Operational background Superior knowledge of inclusiveness/diversity frameworks High level of analytical and diagnostic skills for solving complex business and organizational issues Ability to interpret EEO data and reports An experienced program/project manager and facilitator with high level delivery skills Demonstrated success in creating strategic direction/plans and proven ability to implement and sustain business improvement and results; strong business acumen required Strong consulting and influencing skills with all levels of management Outstanding strategic and conceptual thinking skills. Excellent communication skills with ability to simplify strategy into specific actions with clear accountability Displays an expert level of critical thinking in applying principles, theories and concepts on a wide range of problems Demonstrated track record in change management/organization design knowledgeDepartment HR - TALENT MANAGEMENTPosition Location US - Princeton, NJCity PrincetonState/Provinces US - NJDegree Required Bachelor's Degree RequiredPercent Travel 10 - 20%

RESEARCH Staff Member, San Jose, CA. Generate highly novel ideas in the areas of business architecture (BA) and enterprise transformation. Invent and design approaches to advance the state-of-art by developing new tools, concepts, models and methods for the creation and reasoning of BAs and the transformation of companies. Disseminate, internally and externally, results of such innovation activities through publications, patent disclosures, seminar participation, and internal documentation. Utilize demonstrated research ability in the area of component business modeling, business process modeling, performance management models, process transformation tools, consulting experiences, as well as software tool development experience. Support internal consultants through the involvement in client engagements. Requires IT Investment Analysis/ Cost Sensitivity Analysis, Business Transformation, Software Development, POC, and Academic Writing and Patenting. Requires a PhD in Computer Science, Economics, or a related field and one year of experience as a Post-Doctoral Research Fellow. Send resumes to IBM, box #A510, 71 Fifth Avenue, 5th Floor, NY, NY 10003.

Assistant Computational BiologistArgonne National Laboratory, 25 miles Southeast of Chicago, IllinoisJoin a dynamic team of researchers conduction experiments to identify the molecular mechanisms that underlie the response of organisms and microbial communities to environmental conditions.  Advanced capabilities for generation of sequence data will enable the application of novel bioinformatic methods to generate system models that facilitate experimental design and allow for prediction and reengineering of system response to environmental changes.Typical responsibilities include:Conducting basic research in computational biology,Analyzing and interpreting high-throughput data and generates computational models for biological processes,Collaborating with researchers lab-wide and partner with universities and laboratories to establish and test working hypotheses, Contributing to the submission of proposals to funding agencies, Publishing scholarly papers in scientific journals and giving presentations at symposia and conferences, and Serving on committees and particpating in professional societies.Job requirements include:Qualified candidates will typically hold a Master's Degree and 3+ years' work experience or a Ph.D. in the biological sciences, computer science or computational science, Excellent knowledge of statistical and computer analysis of short read biological sequence data, PERL, and data visualization techniques, Substantial expertise in the utilization of computational methods, algorithms, databases of genomic information for the development of models predictive of system response, Considerable experience in the use of biological databases and resources (e.g. KEGG, Genbank, TAIR) to develop models for cellular metabolism, regulation and signaling at a molecular resolution sufficient for system engineering, and Considerable background in molecular biology, genomics and the biological attributes of procaryotic and eukaryotic organisms and
