Janssen Research & Development, L.L.C., a Johnson & Johnson company, is recruiting for a Senior Scientist, Computational & Systems Biology (CSB) to be located in Spring House, PA.    Janssen Research & Development, L.L.C. is a fully integrated biopharmaceutical and biotechnology company. As a world leader in the field of biomedicines, Janssen strives to develop innovative treatments to improve the health of people worldwide. At the forefront of monoclonal antibody technology and manufacturing, Janssen Research & Development manufactures products including REMICADE® (infliximab), STELARA (ustekinumab) and SIMPONI (golimumab) for the treatment of various immunological diseases.   Thriving on a diverse company culture, celebrating the uniqueness of our employees and committed to inclusion. Proud to be an equal opportunity employer.   Janssen Pharma R&D seeks scientists with expertise in creatively applying quantitative analysis to pharmaceutical and/or biomedical research. He/she will be part of the Computational & Systems Biology Group (CSB) which is a new, dynamic program that brings together a team of researchers with expertise in mathematics, computer/computational science, physical/natural sciences, and engineering to apply their expertise to areas of biomedical and pharmaceutical research in close collaboration with the other research programs within Janssen. Areas of current focus include computational/systems biology, systems pharmacology, genomic analysis, population genetics, neuroscience, immunology, oncology, cardiovascular and metabolic diseases, infectious diseases, and signal and image processing. Integration and analysis of information across modalities and space/time scales, spanning genomes, cells, circuits and behavior remains an extremely challenging problem, which we expect these researchers to address. We seek senior scientists with strong training and experience in applied quantitative methods and a track record of scholarship. Candidates should possess outstanding communication skills as well as broad biological interests that will enable them to facilitate interactions between laboratory-based researchers throughout Janssen. Previous experience in research within a pharmaceutical environment is a plus. He/She will support therapy areas and other stakeholders from a integrative, systems-level perspective and advance the scientific mission of the business groups. This person will work with other members of the CSB group to plan and execute training programs for scientists and engineers throughout Janssen and enhance the ability of researchers to exploit Informatics in their work. He/she will perform research relevant to the mission of the organization and publish high quality research. This individual will lead computational analysis efforts of high-dimensional datasets from experimental medicine (non-interventional trials) and clinical trials implementing methods and supporting tools for analyzing high-dimensional datasets Identifying novel targets, biomarkers, mechanisms of resistance, and effective therapeutic combinations through the translation of bioinformatics data. He/she will design and implement approaches to solve complex computational and mathematical problems as they relate to interpreting biological data. This includes development of new research directions in the application of Informatics in support of the evolving needs of the R&D business groups.   QualificationsA M.D. and/or Ph.D. in computational sciences, natural sciences, physical sciences, mathematics, medicine or engineering is required. A minimum of 3 years post-graduate experience in the field of bioinformatics, computational/systems biology, drug discovery, computational/statistical genetics or systems pharmacology is required. Candidates with industry experience preferred. Extensive experience analyzing high-dimensional datasets for disease understanding and biomarker discovery is required. Experience with drug discovery and development practices and project support in a large pharmaceutical setting is a plus. Independent, self-motivated and innovative and the ability to excel in a goal-oriented, multifaceted and fast-moving team environment is required. Outstanding communication, organizational and leadership skills, with a successful track record of collaborating with cross-functional scientific teams is required. The role will require up to 25% domestic/international travel. The role will be based in Spring House, PA.

PROJECT DESCRIPTIONThis is an exciting opportunity working under the direction of Broad Institute Fellow Mitch Guttman whose lab will be transitioning to Caltech in the summer of 2013.  Candidates must be willing to relocate to California at that timeOur team recently described a new class of mammalian non-coding genes (lincRNAs) with important roles in human biology and disease. These lincRNAs exert their regulatory influence on the genome in uncharacterized ways. We are looking for a highly motivated individual to join our integrative team to help characterize the function and mechanism of this new class of non-coding gene. This project will include systematic pull-downs of RNA and their associated protein complexes to define lincRNA complexes. In addition, it will include perturbations of lincRNAs and their associated protein complexes to determine their functional roles in embryonic stem cells.  This project will make use of various biochemical, molecular biology, and cell biology techniques including (but not limited to) RNA complex purification, in vivo crosslinking methods, RNA-protein immunoprecipitations,  RNA-Sequencing, RNA-DNA interaction mapping and embryonic stem cell culture and functional manipulations. Training in established techniques will be provided as needed. OVERALL RESPONSIBILITYWe are seeking a dependable and creative individual with scientific knowledge, technical expertise, and outstanding practical skills in biochemistry and molecular biology.  The candidate will design and perform bench level experiments and small projects that support the overall research objective of an integrative computational and experimental lab in a fast paced and dynamic environment. The successful candidate will possess a broad knowledge of molecular biology and/or RNA and protein biochemistry techniques. Techniques will include RNA-Protein crosslinking methods, RNA pull-downs, protein-RNA immunoprecipitations, RNA-protein purification, RNA-DNA interaction mapping, and protein detection by quantitative mass-spectrometry. Some techniques will be adaptations of previously established protocols but all will require significant protocol development requiring systematic optimization and troubleshooting. The candidate will adapt easily to changing needs and priorities of a fast-paced research environment, facilitate project completion, address technical problems, determine the methods to be used in research, and summarize and present results. CHARACTERISTIC DUTIES•	Designs and carries out small independent projects as well as basic bench level experiments and techniques.•	Makes detailed observations, analyzes experimental data, and interprets results.  Documents and compiles data. •	Summarizes key data verbally and in writing.•	Maintains a detailed plan to ensure successful and timely completion of required tasks.•	Analyzes experimental data and identifies methodological problems.  Adjusts experimental protocols to ensure project completion in a timely fashion.•	Works with team leader to refine experimental protocols and thereby ensure project completion in a timely fashion. •	Writes and revises molecular biology/biochemistry protocols. Responsible for training of technical staff as needed. •	May train or supervise technical staff and directs experimental plans to ensure overall project success.•	Attends team meetings to share results, plan projects and experiments, provide advice, and to ensure that projects support current team goals in a dynamic environment.•	Consults with scientific literature as needed.•	Other tasks as required. •	Bachelor’s degree in biology or related field required with at least 8 years of experience in a research laboratory or Master’s degree in biology or related field with at least 5 years of experience in a research laboratory. •	At least 2 years of supervisory and/or lab management experience strongly preferred.•	Excellent technical knowledge and hands-on experience with molecular biological methods and RNA and/or protein biochemistry techniques required.•	Excellent knowledge regarding the operation of standard lab equipment required. •	Excellent communication skills and the ability to interact professionally with all levels of staff and with external contacts in a fast paced environment required.•	Excellent organization, time management, and project management skills. •	Ability to handle a variety of tasks simultaneously required.•	Must be able to use sound judgment to handle a variety of tasks and to shift priorities simultaneously, as well as to effectively solve problems.•	Ability to solve complex problems.•	Must be able to work independently as well as part of a team in a fast-paced environment•	Excellent communication skills and the ability to interact professionally with all levels of staff required.•	Strong organizational, time management, and project management skills required•	Creativity, curiosity, and the desire, persistence and ability to create technological advances required•	Must possess a high level of initiative and the ability to work with little supervision.•	Experience with RNA or protein biochemistry techniques a plus.•	Experience with mouse embryonic stem cell culture techniques a plusDisclaimer: immediately upon transition of the Guttman Lab to Caltech, this position will formally terminate at the Broad Institute.Broad will not offer visa sponsorship for this position.

descriptionProject Title: Target Guided Selection of Macrocyclic Inhibitors by Peptidyl-Prolyl IsomerasesDescription of Opportunity: We have an exciting opportunity for a synthetic organic chemist to join the Infection Innovative Medicines (iMED) department. There you will embark on a research project to design and synthesize tool compounds to study an important class of enzymes relevant to both infection and oncology disease areas. The work will investigate how different structural features impact substrate recognition in peptidyl-prolyl isomerases. This knowledge will then be used to study how this class of enzymes may be used to facilitate the synthesis of macrocycle inhibitors in a target-guided selection approach. This important research will contribute to the development of future target classes in the Infection and Oncology areas.Your activities will be centred on design of tool compounds and reaction schemes, synthesis of target compounds, and biological testing to validate your hypotheses. You will also be working with an academic partner using NMR spectroscopy to study the enzyme kinetics of the tools you develop. Your scientific research will also give you the opportunity to work with (and influence) fellow scientists across many other disciplines. You will be expected to deliver the results of your novel research in-house via global working groups and externally via meetings and through publications.Working hours: 8-5The role's major responsibilities--Develop hypotheses and design ideas on novel substrates for peptidyl-prolyl isomerases.--Develop synthetic procedures and synthesis of key tool compounds which test your scientific hypotheses.--Show strong initiative in developing ideas, and bringing them to functional use within AstraZeneca.--Interface with scientists from across many disciplines while at the same time being able to work independently.--Communicate results both within AstraZeneca via global working groups and externally at meetings and through publications.--Work collaboratively with other experts within Structural Biology, Computational Chemistry and Medicinal Chemistry.--Publish scientific papers describing the discovery of novel substrates, novel inhibitors and the technology which was developed to identify them.Minimum experienceA PhD the following areas:--Organic synthesis with expertise in method development and execution of complex multi-step reaction sequences.Randstad is a world leader in matching great people with great companies. Our experienced agents will listen carefully to your employment needs and then work diligently to match your skills and qualifications to the right job and company. Whether you're looking for temporary, temporary-to-permanent or permanent opportunities, no one works harder for you than Randstad.

Genomic Health is seeking an exceptional individual with strong scientific leadership, coupled with insightful managerial and organizational skills to lead the Bioinformatics Department, reporting to the Chief Scientific Officer. This person should have extensive experience in developing and evaluating bioinformatics tools to manage and analyze complex genomic data, and in collaborating with cancer biologists, clinicians, and other statisticians in the analysis and interpretation of data. The VP, Bioinformatics and their staff will participate in developing methodologies and implementing bioinformatics pipelines that contribute to the design, analysis and reporting of large scale controlled clinical trials and observational studies in oncology.  These studies span multiple phases of clinical biomarker discovery and development, including methods development studies, clinical feasibility studies, gene identification studies, and large scale clinical validation studies.   The bioinformatics methodologies and pipelines will be tailored to run on a state of the art high performance compute environment specifically built for these activities.                                                                                                                          The successful candidate should be motivated by the opportunity to contribute to the discovery and development of diagnostic tests that are clinically useful in the treatment of cancer.   He or she should be familiar with leading edge genomics technology platforms, e.g., next generation sequencing, and interested in leading technology-oriented scientists both to develop new bioinformatics methods and to develop production pipelines for clinical studies and support product development and for the clinical laboratory that supports patient care. The candidate should be a strong organizational leader and manager, with the desire and ability to oversee, mentor, and develop a staff of 15 or more to interact productively across functions with our Research, Medical, Biostatistics and Information Technology organizations as well as the rest of senior management and external collaborators in a manner that is consistent with our values and culture.POSITION RESPONSIBILITIES / DUTIES : Sets overall strategy for bioinformatics at Genomic Health, that will support the collaborative efforts of Research and Development to discover and develop validated genomic tests, and that enhance the company's reputation for excellent science and technology.Direct managerial responsibilities include, but are not limited to, recruiting bioinformatics personnel, mentoring, and developing staff of 15+ staff and building the necessary infrastructure for the Department. Provides organizational leadership, in part, by building strong collaborative relationships with both internal and external groups, including, but not limited to, external collaborators and internal Departments, including Cancer Biology and New Technology groups in Research, Information Technology, Clinical, Biostatistics, Development, Process Engineering, Business, Intellectual Property, and Commercial Operations.Creates collaborative networks with external bioinformaticians, cancer biologists and clinical researchers and influences decisions to ensure quality of study designs and analyses, appropriateness of inferences and conclusions, and alignment with GHI strategic interests.    Day to day leadership of the Bioinformatics Department, including evaluation of data as it is obtained. The candidate is expected to work on significant and unique issues that require creative solutions. Establishment of multiple pipelines that support the efforts in three different environments - for research studies, for development clinical studies, for patient care in the Genomic Health clinical laboratory.ESSENTIAL KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS & ABILITIES The candidate could have either an academic or industrial background, ideally experience in both.10+ years of experience leading a large group (this may include play a significant leadership role in large collaborative studies). Strong track record of publications in leading scientific journals desired.Demonstrated excellence in bioinformatic/genomic research in oncology desirable. Strong communicator with ability to maintain open communication with internal employees, managers and customers throughout all levels and external scientific colleagues as needed.Able to integrate and apply feedback in a professional manner. Able to prioritize and drive to results with an emphasis on quality. Ability to work as part of a team. Able to conduct independent research in bioinformatics methods to support GHI goals.Demonstrated ability and experience in leading collaborative efforts to obtain and analyze complex data.Strong verbal, written, and presentation skills.Ph.D. in Bioinformatics, Computational Biology, Physics, Genetics or comparable demonstrated technical ability.Experience in analyzing and publishing the results from next generation sequencing experiments required.Some travel required - less than 10%

J. Craig Venter Institute (JCVI) is looking for a Post-Doctoral Fellow specializing in Computational Biology and Bioinformatics to join its San Diego, CA location.  The Post Doctoral Fellow will undertake metagenomic and metatranscriptomic analysis of prokaryotic and eukaryotic microbial communities. Some portion of the position might also involve analyses of transcriptomic (mRNA and non-coding RNA) and protein interaction data (ChIP-Seq) for diatoms generated from next generation sequencing platforms. Therefore, we are especially interested in development of analysis pipelines geared toward integrated analysis of next-generation sequencing data. The successful candidate will report to Dr. Andrew Allen in the Microbial and Environmental Genomics group in our San Diego office.  The Post Doctoral Fellow will be expected to initiate independent computational analyses related to evaluation of primary metabolism and patterns of genome evolution and adaptation in various marine environments. The successful candidate will work closely with research groups in the Bioinformatics and Environmental and Microbial Genomics groups at JCVI. We are especially interested in development of analysis pipelines geared toward identification and evolutionary analysis of genes, pathways, and populations responsible for influencing key components of major biogeochemical  cycles.  An overall theme within the JCVI group is the elucidation of links between molecular evolution, cellular metabolism, and ecosystem biogeochemistry. Successful candidates will have a PhD in a relevant scientific discipline plus a strong background in programming (Perl or Ruby, C/C++, Unix). Candidates should also have demonstrated interest and experience bioinformatics and microbial ecology and evolution. JCVI offers an excellent working environment and a competitive benefits package. For more information and to apply to this position, please visit our website at www.jcvi.org Equal Opportunity Employer M/F/D/V.

Expertise in Next Generation Sequencing (NGS) data analysis is essential.The successful applicant will have a combination of bioinformatics, statistical, computer and biological expertise. Essential skills and experience for this position include the following:Hands-on experience in the analysis of RNA-seq, ChIP-seq, and/or genome resequencing dataR programming skills and BioconductorUnderstanding of statistical methodologies widely used in omics data analysis, such as statistical tests for differential expression, multiple testing corrections, clusteringStrong verbal and written communication skillsIndependence, creativity, and ability to learn new skillsDemonstrated productivity through co-authorship of peer-reviewed publicationsSkills or experience in any of the following areas (in addition to the essential skills and experience listed above) will be a plus:Experience working in a bioinformatics core or similar environmentMicrobial biology experience, with yeasts or bacteriaBioenergy research experienceGeneral purpose programming language(s) such as Perl, Ruby, Python, C/C++ or Java, including specialized bioinformatics packages such as BioPerlExperience analyzing other types of high-throughput data, e.g. microarrays, metabolomics, high-throughput screening, proteomicsIntegration of multiple types of high-throughput dataBiological data mining software, such as Partek or SpotfireRelational databases: SQL; MS Access, Oracle, MySQL, or PostgreSQL; relational database design principlesHigh performance computingBiological data visualizationBiological pathway and/or network analysisPlant biologyPrincipal duties:The Great Lakes Bioenergy Research Center (GLBRC) is housed at the University of Wisconsin and partners with Michigan State University along with other academic, private sector and national laboratories. The GLBRC is one of three Department of Energy Bioenergy Research Centers (BRCs) to conduct fundamental, genomics-based research on microbial and plant systems required to realize the national need for low-cost biofuels. The GLBRC's mission is grand, but simply stated: to perform the basic research that generates technology to convert cellulosic biomass to ethanol and other advanced biofuels. GLBRC represents a multidisciplinary partnership with expertise spanning the physical and biological sciences, including genomics, microbial and plant biology, analytical chemistry, computational biology and bioinformatics, and engineering.The incumbent will become a key member of the Computational Biology Core Group. The principal responsibility of this position will be top-quality support of the various GLBRC research projects at the experimental design, data analysis and publication stages, ultimately resulting in co-authorship on peer-reviewed papers. Examples of current and future projects include analysis of RNA-seq, ChIP-seq and metabolomics data in bacterial and yeast fermentation time course experiments, analysis of microbial growth curves in high-throughput phenotype screens, and integration of multi-platform data. An ability to derive biologically meaningful and statistically rigorous results and effectively communicate them to multi-disciplinary teams will be essential. This will require regular and effective communication and collaboration with bench scientists and other bioinformaticians.Another important responsibility will be participation in design and development of in-house data repositories and custom software. Specific duties may include database design, setting up analytical workflows, developing requirements for user interfaces, and participation in software testing. This will require effective communication and collaboration with end users (primarily bench scientists), other bioinformaticians, programmers, LIMS developers, IT personnel, and knowledge management professionals.This position offers an opportunity to play an important role in creating a keystone research center for the first great national challenge of the 21st century, sustainable energy independence. For additional information regarding the GLBRC, visit our website:  http://www.glbrc.org .A criminal background check will be conducted prior to hiring.A period of evaluation will be required*************************TO ENSURE CONSIDERATIONApplication must be received by: NOVEMBER 16, 2012HOW TO APPLY:Unless another application procedure has been specified above, please send resume and cover letter referring to Position Vacancy Listing #73320 toPam Arnold1539 Microbial Sciences Bldg1550 Linden DrMadison, WI 53706-1521    Phone: 608-890-2286Email: parnold@glbrc.wisc.edu    Relay Access (WTRS): 7-1-1 (out-of-state: TTY: 800.947.3529, STS: 800.833.7637) and above Phone numberNOTE: Unless confidentiality is requested in writing, information regarding the names of applicants must be released upon request. Finalists cannot be gu aranteed confidentiality.UW-Madison is an equal opportunity/affirmative action employer. We promote excellence through diversity and encourage all qualified individuals to apply.

This is an exciting opportunity working under the direction of Broad Institute Fellow Mitch Guttman whose lab will be transitioning to Caltech in the summer of 2013.  Candidates must be willing to relocate to California at that time.Our team recently described a new class of mammalian non-coding genes (lincRNAs) with important roles in human biology and disease. These lincRNAs exert their regulatory influence on the genome in uncharacterized ways. We are looking for a highly motivated individual to join our integrative computational and experimental lab to help develop computational methods to analyze and integrate various high throughput datasets. Specifically, the candidate will develop and optimize methods for computational analysis of high-throughput data to probe the function and mechanism of lincRNAs. This will include algorithms to analyze and integrate data from lincRNA-protein, lincRNA-DNA, and lincRNA-RNA interactions. The candidate will implement algorithms within an existing framework of sequence analysis tools developed in Java.OVERALL RESPONSIBILITYWe are seeking a dependable and creative individual with scientific knowledge, superb statistical intuition, and excellent programming skills. The candidate will design and implement novel statistical methods and computational tools for the analysis of various distinct high throughput datasets.  The candidate will have a unique opportunity to work with cutting-edge experimental datasets generated in the lab and will be an integral part of the data generation process through direct communication with experimental scientists to facilitate project completion, address technical problems, and helping to determine the methods to be used in research. The candidate will adapt easily to changing needs and priorities of a fast-paced research environment, facilitate project completion, address technical problems, determine the methods to be used in research, and summarize and present results.  CHARACTERISTIC DUTIES•	Designs and assists in developing statistical methods and computational algorithms for analyzing large-scale datasets that are essential to the overall project success.•	Distills information into biologically relevant findings which are communicated to the team in writing and/or verbally.•	Analyzes experimental data and identifies methodological problems.  Adjusts existing algorithms to ensure project completion in a timely fashion.•	Works directly with team leader to refine computational methods to ensure project completion in a timely fashion.•	Works closely with experimental scientists to analyze and iterate through experimental data and designs.•	Interacts directly with various scientists in the group to ensure project success. •	Attends team meetings to share results, plan projects and experiments, and to ensure that projects support current team goals in a dynamic environment.•	Maintains a detailed plan to ensure successful and timely completion of required tasks.•	Consults with other senior scientists or scientific literature as needed.•	Other tasks as required.•	Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in computational biology, mathematics, bioinformatics, computer science, statistics, or related quantitative field required.•	Strong knowledge and interest in biology required.•	Excellent skills in at least one programming language required, preferably Java.•	Excellent background in statistics/biostatistics and data analysis required.•	Excellent working knowledge of the Unix operating system.•	Excellent communication skills and the ability to interact professionally with all levels of staff across different areas of expertise (both experimental and computational).•	Excellent organization and time management skills. •	Ability to handle a variety of tasks simultaneously required.•	Must be able to use sound judgment to handle a variety of tasks and to shift priorities simultaneously, as well as to effectively solve problems.•	Must possess a high level of initiative and the ability to work with little supervision.•	Experience working in R or Matlab a plus•	Prior experience working in biology-related sciences a strong plus•	Experience with high-throughput sequencing data analysis a plusDisclaimer: immediately upon transition of the Guttman Lab to Caltech, this position will formally terminate at the Broad Institute.

COMPUTATIONAL BIOLOGISTAncestry.com is the world's largest online resource for family history. We have helped pioneer the market for online family history research, taking a pursuit that was expensive and time-consuming and making it easy, affordable and accessible to anyone with an interest in their family history. The foundation of our service is an extensive collection of billions of historical records that we have digitized, indexed and put online over the past 15 years. These digital records and documents, combined with our proprietary online search technologies, tools and collaboration features, have enabled our 2.0 million subscribers to create nearly 39 million family trees that contain nearly 4 billion profiles, make meaningful discoveries about the lives of their ancestors. With over 1,000 employees around the world,we are committed to hiring the very best talent. We are known for our cutting-edge technology, phenomenal innovation, and we offer a compelling and rewarding workplace where you will thrive. We seek out passionate people to join our mission of helping people discover, preserve and share their family history. We invite you to explore and discover the many opportunities that await you at Ancestry.com. Job Description:Ancestry.com is seeking an exceptional candidate to join the Ancestry.com team as a Computational Biologist creating and implementing novel algorithms for genomic analysis. We are mounting a major effort to use genomics to shed light on human diversity, origins and relatedness. The successful candidate will join our efforts to develop, test and apply algorithms for defining the genetic markers that define families and shed light on genetic genealogy.In this position, you will extract robust signals from human SNP data. You will develop and apply state-of-the-art methods to identify statistically significant markers that define regional or ethnic groups. You will develop and evaluate software, using tools such as MATLAB, R, etc. and collaborate with software engineers to generate robust and stable production versions. You will work closely with biologists in analyzing data and members of the product development team. This position offers an exciting opportunity to apply cutting edge computational approaches to an unprecedented, large-scale set of pedigreed human genome data.Characteristic duties will include:Developing and implementing strategies for the analysis of large genome variation data with respect to human diversity and originsDeveloping and implementing strategies for integrating genomic data with pedigrees.Developing and implementing data analysis pipelines and quality assessment procedures.Help develop new analytical approaches that yield the greatest possible insight from genetics, genealogy and genomics data sets.Communicate results effectively to a diverse community of scientists and lay people.Required Skills:Advanced degree in genetics, biology, mathematics, computer science or related field (Ph.D. or M.S. with significant relevant experience).Proven scientific background demonstrating a strong understanding of genetics, genomics and the quantitative analysis of large biological data sets.Deep programming and analysis abilities demonstrated by formal training in computer science, statistics, applied math, physics, engineering, bioinformatics or equivalent. Must possess excellent general computational and programming skills; familiarity with SQL, Java (or C/C++), Python (or Perl), and analysis tools like MATLAB and/or R. Excellent organizational skills.Superior oral and written English communication skills required. Must be able to manage multiple simultaneous long-term computational projects while meeting frequent project deadlines in a fast-paced environment. Must be able to translate high-level data processing and analysis requests into concrete tasks and operate independently and interface with team members to achieve the needed results.Working for Ancestry.comAncestry.com is a profitable, growing company with a positive, high-energy environment. Together, our dedicated teams are harnessing the power of technology and using it to simplify the way people connect with their families and their unique legacies. Our work environment is fast-paced and challenging, but also extremely exciting. You'll work with a team of passionate, engaged individuals. We offer excellent benefits and a competitive compensation package. For additional information, regarding our benefits and career information, please visit our website at http://ancestry.com/careers. Ancestry.com Inc. is interested in you and we are dedicated to building a diverse workforce with equal opportunities for employment.Ancestry.com is not accepting unsolicited assistance from search firms for this employment opportunity. Please, no phone calls or emails. All resumes submitted by search firms to any employee at Ancestry.com via-email, the Internet or in any form and/or method without a valid written search agreement in place for this position will be deemed the sole property of Ancestry.com. No fee will be paid in the event the candidate is hired by Ancestry.com as a result of the referral or through other means.

Background:* Discovery Sciences provides scientific support to early drug discovery across the global Innovative Medicines portfolio (small molecule and biologics). * Discovery Sciences is organised into eight distinct scientific and technical competencies: Sample Management, Screening Sciences, Assay Development, Bioreagents, Structure and Biophysics, Computational Sciences, Statistics and Medicinal Chemistry* This role reports to the Director Chemistry Innovation Center and will be based at Gatehouse Park, Boston and is responsible for leading and developing its Chemical Biology capability Job Purpose: * Deliver an effective strategy for the identification and incubation of novel chemistry technologies with specific emphasis on the implementation of a chemical biology strategy for the delivery of chemical probes to support target identification and validation. * Lead a Chemical Biology section to deliver this strategy in support target identification and validation in iMed projects globally. Enhance this capability to meet the future needs of iMed projects.* Key member of the Chemistry Innovation Centre Leadership team, providing input into the overall strategy for personnel and scientific development of the Department, and ensuring alignment with business objectives. * Lead a Medicinal Chemistry section by providing clear leadership for section members. Accountable for managing all aspects of the output from the sections work including the overall quality and delivery towards section objectives. * Ensure flexible resourcing of iMed projects according to agreed priorities using the full potential of the section in order to deliver to the section and department objectives.* Accountable for ensuring that objectives, calibrated performance evaluation, salary reviews and bonus setting are in place for all direct reports and that consistency exists across the section.* Accountable for strategic planning and the long term development of the section with emphasis on the sections ability to meet increasing demands on delivery and quality. * Manage high level risk by making complex judgments, developing innovative solutions and applying a comprehensive cross-functional and industry understanding.* Drive innovation and scientific excellence of the section capability through internal scientific development, external collaborations, and competitive awareness. May also include managing external collaborations.* Accountable for maintaining and developing the scientific standards and productivity within the section by securing that adequate development plans are in place for section staff.* Accountable for ensuring compliance with the AstraZeneca SHE standards and Code of Conduct within the section.Key success factors for role:* Excellent leadership skills.* The role requires a high level of interactive, effective communication to set clear direction for the section and directly advising others at a high level, as well as cultural sensitivity. * Ability to create an environment that promotes an advancing scientific environment focused on efficient problem solving and delivery to meet project needs.* Well developed understanding of key aspects of medicinal chemistry, lead generation and drug discovery as well as related disciplines. Clear understanding of the impact of the contribution of the individual components in the success of own team, department and Discovery Sciences.* Ability to keep up to date with current developments in the drug design medicinal chemistry and chemical biology literature as well as among competitors. Ability to analyze and understand consequences of external and internal trends and developments.  Functional Knowledge:* Will require at minimum: a Ph.D (or equivalent experience) in the Chemical Sciences . and 8+ years pharmaceutical industry experience in their specific scientific discipline; or a Ph.D. and have relevant postdoctoral academic experience in chemistry including a significant number of years leading a team of highly qualified personnel.* Will have ability to operate effectively in a multidisciplinary matrix research environment, providing leadership and insight in their discipline. Will be an outstanding scientist with a proven track record of innovation and delivery in drug discovery projects. May also have experience as a project leader involving multi-disciplinary resource management. * Will require significant experience in chemical biology, ideally in its application to target validation and identification* This role demands in-depth people management experience and extensive experience in leading, motivating, developing and organizing personnel.Business Knowledge: Have an in-depth understanding of the Chemistry sciences and how these interface with other disciplines and how they contribute and influences drug discovery projects.Have excellent insights on how the drug discovery process functions within discovery. Understands and impacts on the discipline contribution into the discovery projects and is fully able to represent own discipline and lead cross-disciplinary project teams.Ensure access to the best external science relevant to synthetic and medicinal chemistry (e.g., universities, biotech companies, government programs). Encourage, support, and directly contribute to papers and presentations in world class scientific journals and meetings to develop external reputation.Awareness of the latest advancements in the discipline field systematically followed through evaluating current literature and from scientific contacts and scientific meetings, in order to ensure the competitiveness of drug discovery teams and the department as a whole.

 	mso-para-margin-bottom:.0001pt;  	mso-pagination:widow-orphan;  	font-size:10.0pt;  	font-family:"Times New Roman","serif";}  </style>  <![endif]Canfield Scientific, Inc. is the leading supplier of 2D and 3D photographic equipment, software, and systems for advanced patient imaging serving both physicians and the healthcare industry. We provide the highest quality products and services and have established a reputation for innovation and service excellence. Canfield is a 25-year old, privately held company with tremendous energy and a bright outlook. We are located in northern ?xml:namespace prefix = st1 ns = "urn:schemas-microsoft-com:office:smarttags" /New Jersey.?xml:namespace prefix = o ns = "urn:schemas-microsoft-com:office:office" / Our 3D products are aimed at the following purposes: improving communication between patients and physicians, providing tools for surgical planning, and providing tools for measurement and analysis based on 3D surface data. The ideal candidate for our 3D Software and Algorithm Engineer is an expert C++ programmer (including familiarity with templates and the C++ standard library), has good algorithm development/tuning skills, and enjoys challenges. Job Description:Product development - with research as necessary in order to deliver the desired results (including some support to researchers using our 3D systems and technology)Simulating the results of various medical proceduresImproving our underlying 3D data-structures and algorithmsUser-interface developmentIncreasing ease of use (by automating more and/or improving the user interfaces)  Core Requirements Expert C++ programming abilitiesGood algorithm development and tuning skillsStrong communication skills   Desired Experience with any of the following would be advantageous: Image Processing, Machine Vision, Computational Geometry, Computer Aided Geometric Modeling, Physically Based Modeling, Statistical Shape Modeling, OpenGL, and Qt

Job DescriptionAmazon Fulfillment Services is looking for a motivated individual with strong analytical skills and practical experience to join our Modeling and Optimization team. We are hiring specialists at all levels into our scientific team with expertise in machine learning, network and combinatorial optimization, control theory, and/or numerical analysis. Amazon.com is a $48 billion dollar company that is growing rapidly. Because we are driven by faster delivery to customers, a more efficient supply chain network, and lower cost of operations, our main focus is in the development of analytical modeling and visualization tools fed by our massive amounts of available data. You will be responsible for building these analytical tools that improve the economics of the North American, European, and Japanese fulfillment networks as amazon increases the speed and decreases the cost to deliver product to customers. You will identify and evaluate opportunities to reduce variable costs by improving the fulfillment network topology, inventory placement, transportation operations and scheduling, fulfillment center processes, and the execution to operational plans. You will also improve the efficiency of capital investment by helping the fulfillment centers to improve storage utilization and the effective use of automation. Finally, you will help create the metrics to quantify improvements to the fulfillment costs (e.g., transportation and labor costs) resulting from the application of these optimization models and tools.  The ideal candidate will have the following machine learning experience and skills:Ph.D. in Statistics, Applied Mathematics, Computer Science, Operations Research, or a related field with publications in refereed academic journals.Good communication skills with both technical and business people. Ability to speak at a level appropriate for the audience.Experience writing scripts (Perl, Ruby, Groovy) to manipulate data and developing software in traditional programming languages (C++, Java, Clojure, Python).Experience implementing machine learning algorithms, tailored to particular business needs and tested on large datasets.Familiarity in GIS, geocoding & computational geometry.Familiarity with data visualization (e.g. R, ggplot, ggobi, Tableau).Familiarity with forecasting and time series analysis.Experience designing simulation and optimization models in for business decisions (e.g., staff scheduling, vehicle routing, and facility location) and/or feedback and/or predictive control.The ability to implement models and tools through the use of high-level modeling languages (e.g. AMPL, Mosel, R, Matlab) is a plus.Basic QualificationsMaster's degree in Statistics, Applied Mathematics, Computer Science, Operations Research, or a related field and at least 2 years work experience, or a PhD with demonstrated practical experience through industrial internshipsExperience implementing machine learning algorithms, tailored to particular business needs and tested on large datasets.Experience writing scripts (Perl, Ruby, Groovy) to manipulate data and developing software in traditional programming languages (C++, Java, Clojure, Python).Published at least 2 refereed academic papers in at least two areas (mathematical optimization, specifically linear programming, combinatorial optimization, integer programming, network flows, and dynamic programming.Preferred QualificationsPhD and at least 3 years work experience.Familiarity with data visualization (e.g. R, ggplot, ggobi, Tableau).Familiarity with forecasting and time series analysisThe ability to implement models and tools through the use of high-level modeling languages (e.g. AMPL, Mosel, R, Matlab)Practical experience developing decision support tools based on optimization technology (LP, MIP, NLP) for planning and execution support (e.g., staff scheduling, vehicle routing, facility location).Amazon is an Equal Opportunity Employer

Geometry C++ Engineer  You will be responsible for implementing complex 2D geometry routines, including intersection testing, unioning, and clipping. Applicants should have:                          2+ years professional C++ experience                          1+ years Win32 programming experience                          Extensive background in 2D geometry                          Expertise in computational 3D geometryHelpful, but not required:                          Previous experience working on CAD applications a plus                          Direct3D programming experience                          OpenGL programming experience                          Experience with 3D modeling tools, such as 3DS Max, Maya, ZBrush                          Experience with Plugin development for 3D modeling tools

Job description IBM is seeking Network Architects for Cisco and/or Juniper Solutions. These individuals will be responsible for leading reference architecture projects such as the Data Center and Campus LAN reference architecture projects. In addition the individuals are expected to engage directly with sales teams, delivery teams, and clients for the purpose of selling and delivering strategic services engagements. This role requires individuals with deep knowledge in routing, switching, IP, optical and network virtualization technologies. These individuals will also need current skills in Cisco and/or Juniper products and architectures. The need is for individuals with strong architecture and communication skills more so than deep technology specific skills. The skill list includes, in priority order: General Network architecture skillsIssue based consulting skills (consultant report writing skills, developing functional and infrastructure requirements, developing a multi-level architecture, communicating the architecture to stake holders as well as detailed designers and implementers, and ability to tie business drivers and requirements to architecture decisions and features)Data Center Network Architecture skills, (i.e. data center interconnection technology selection, data replication and synchronization requirements and design considerations, server/storage/network interdependencies and solutions, especially with regards to virtualization, network traffic segregation and network virtualization design considerations, network security design considerations, techniques for providing secure access both internal and external, local load balancing technology usage, selection and design considerations, geographic load balancing technology usage, selection, and design considerations, caching and other application aware network solutions usage and selection, real time application hosting (voice, video, instant messaging, gaming) requirements and design considerations, high availability requirements and design considerations, and power and cooling requirements and design considerations) Routing skills including: OSPF, BGP, etc. design skillsLAN Switching skills includingLayer two design skills including virtualization, spanning tree, switch selection, etc.QoS skills including: QoS technology selection and trade-offs between the technologiesVendor Skills including: Cisco and/or JuniperExperience: Large scale network implementationPrefer candidates with Bachelor's Degree in Information Technology, Computer Science or Engineering.Candidates may be located in ANY US City. Preferred locations are: Georgia (Atlanta); Florida (South Florida); North Carolina (Raleigh/RTP); Oregon (Portland or Eugene); Washington (Seattle); California (Los Angeles)  Required  At least 3 years experience in Voice and Data Network Architecture and Design  At least 3 years experience in Network Architecture and Solution Design  At least 3 years experience in Cross-Platform Integration  At least 3 years experience in Engagement Leadership  Certified in CCNA and/or JNCIA  Readiness to travel 75% travel annually  English: Fluent    Preferred  Bachelor's Degree  At least 5 years experience in Voice and Data Network Architecture and Design  At least 5 years experience in Network Architecture and Solution Design  At least 5 years experience in Cross-Platform Integration  At least 5 years experience in Engagement Leadership  At least 5 years experience in performing IT Infrastructure Architecture Assessments  At least 5 years experience in performing Vendor/Product/Design/Implementation Tools Selection  At least 5 years experience in developing a set of NFRs from Business and IT Requirements  Certified in one or more of the following: CCNP, CCDP, or CCIE; and/or JNCIP or JNCIE    Additional information IBM Global Technology Services, the largest Information Technology services provider in the world, integrates IBM's broad range of services, hardware, software and research to help meet the IT needs for a wide range of companies. The IBM Global Technology Services portfolio includes: Business Continuity and resiliency services, Integrated Technology services, Security and privacy services, Strategic Outsourcing Services, Managed Business Process Services and Applications on Demand. For more information on IBM Global Technology Services please visit www.ibm.com/services   IBM is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status.

Responsibilities  The NSA/CSS Threat Operations Center (NTOC) is the focal point for mission discovery of cyber threats, characterization and attribution of those threats, creation and sharing of situational awareness, and the development of mitigation strategies. The mission, with operations running continually around the clock, enables us to defeat adversaries - efforts to exploit and attack our networks. NTOC is looking for talented people to execute the NTOC mission. These positions are idea for individuals interested in working the fast-paced and exciting world of cyber operations. Individuals selected for positions in NTOC will work closely with the customers and other NTOC personnel to fulfill their mission requirements and perform in-depth analysis using cutting edge technology and techniques.Software Engineer: Analyze, design, verify, validate, implement, apply and maintain software systems. Appropriately apply discrete mathematics, probability and statistics, and other relevant topics in computer science and supporting disciplines to complex software systems. Generalize techniques, as appropriate, to apply to multiple domains. Develop and provide appropriate documentation and training. Technology Vulnerability Analyst: Identify vulnerabilities of and attacks to various physical, chemical, and electromagnetic characteristics and properties of signals, equipment, and security mechanisms. Characterize those attacks with respect to resources and capabilities required to accomplish those attacks and relate those missions supported by those systems. Compare and contrast signals and equipment attack techniques and develop operationally effective countermeasures. Produce formal and informal reports, briefings, and perspectives of actual and potential attacks against the technologies being studied.Project Director: Perform one or more functions that contribute to the management of a system or software project including: needs analysis, market surveying, system requirements management (assessment and tracking), project planning, resource allocation, cost and schedule projection, tracking and analysis, project tracking and oversight, subcontract management, quality assurance, configuration management (change control and configuration tracking) and asset management, and process improvement activities. Supply timely, accurate, and relevant information to assist in making policy decisions by planning and directing technical efforts of a team.Program Manager: Ensure the optimum mix of cost, schedule, performance, and system supportability throughout the life cycle (design, development, testing and evaluation, production and disposition) of the program. May have responsibility for one or more acquisition programs.System Administrator: Provide computer support to achieve core mission objectives by actively managing the functioning of enterprise computer systems and networks, analyzing technical problems, and developing and implementing corrective actions. Observe and interpret visual outputs indicating the operating status of systems and system components throughout designated portions of the computer infrastructure. Translate user requests into technical diagnoses, then apply diagnoses to develop technical solutions that meet user needs. Remove and replace major components of desktop systems (such as monitor or CPU).Computer Scientist: Design, develop, deliver and operate solutions to hard cryptologic computer science problems within a scientific framework. The solutions may arise in the forms of forensics and attack attribution, protection of critical networks, active systems warnings and indicators, active penetration into target systems, knowledge discovery of passive and active systems, or other cryptologic computer science mission support. Requisite computer science skills (operating systems, compiler theory, database theory, algorithm analysis, computer architecture, discrete math, programming language theory, and data structures) are applied to each problem to provide state-of-the-art techniques, tools, and approaches.  .  Qualifications  NTOC is looking for professionals at all career levels. The successful candidate will have a degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Networking, or Information Assurance or certificates in CISSP, NET+, or Security+ to work in this highly technical organization. Software Engineer: Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or related area (e.g., Engineering, Mathematics). Upper level coursework or work experience should include some of the following: Computer Forensics, Computer Network Architecture and Protocols, Network Security, Programming Languages Theory, Software Engineering, System Architecture and Design, Systems Design and Programming. Experience and/or coursework in the following is highly desired: Java, Oracle/SQL, Cloud Technology / MAP Reduce, HADOOP, Software development life cycle experience.Technology Vulnerability Analyst: Degree in computer science, engineering, information technology or a related field preferred. Prior work experience in information security, information technology, or information assurance field is highly desirable.Project Director: Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or related area (e.g., Engineering, Mathematics). Upper level coursework or work experience should include some of the following: Automata Theory and Formal Languages, Computer Forensics, Computer Network Architecture and Protocols, Network Security, Programming Languages Theory, Software Engineering, System Architecture and Design, Systems Design and Programming. Program Manager: Bachelor's Degree in engineering, systems management, computer science, program management, or a related field. Specialized experience in program management or systems engineering, and DAWIA I certification desired.System Administrator: Entry is with a high school diploma and 5 years of experience, or an Associate's degree and 3 years of experience, or a Bachelor's degree and 2 years of experience, or a post-baccalaureate certificate. Degree must be in a computer science-related field or technical/vocational training certificate. Experience must include at least two of the following: system administration, IT support, IT management, database administration or application administration, web programming, and/or using or administering operating systems. Technical instruction experience (i.e., experience teaching relevant content) will be considered. Ideal candidates for this challenging position should have a background in information technology, hands-on system administration, and LINUX experience. Proven outstanding customer skills, as well as excellent interpersonal skills ' with high emphasis on teaming - are requirements. Candidates should have the ability to take responsibility for work, setting and/or meeting priorities, and organizing and using time and resources efficiently and effectively; be able to effectively comprehend and convey information verbally and in writing; have ability to use logic, analysis, synthesis, creativity, judgment, and systematic approaches to gather, evaluate and use multiple sources of information to effectively inform decisions and outcomes.Computer Scientist: Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or related area (e.g., Engineering, Mathematics). Upper level coursework or work experience should include some of the following: Computer Forensics, Computer Network Architecture and Protocols, Network Security, Programming Languages Theory, Software Engineering, System Architecture and Design, Systems Design and Programming. Experience designing, developing, delivering and operating solutions to cryptologic computer science problems within a scientific framework and experience with operating systems, compiler theory, database theory, algorithm analysis, computer architecture, discrete math, programming language theory, and data structures are all highly desirable.  .  Pay, Benefits, & Work Schedule  This is a full-time position. This position may require shift work on a rotational or compressed schedule.Salary is commensurate with education and experience.Salary Range: $42,209 - $97,333  .  How To Apply - External  To apply for this position, please click the 'Apply Now' button located at the top or bottom of this page. After completing the application and clicking the `Submit Final' button, you will receive a confirmation email. Emails regarding your application status will be sent periodically. Please ensure your spam filters are configured to accept emails from noreply@nsa.gov  ***PLEASE NOTE: U.S. Citizenship is required for all applicants. Reasonable accommodations provided to applicants with disabilities during the application and hiring process where appropriate. NSA is an equal opportunity employer and abides by applicable employment laws and regulations. All applicants and employees are subject to random drug testing in accordance with Executive Order 12564. Employment is contingent upon successful completion of a security background investigation and polygraph.  .  DCIPS Disclaimer  The National Security Agency (NSA) is part of the DoD Intelligence Community Defense Civilian Intelligence Personnel System (DCIPS). All positions in the NSA are in the Excepted Services under 10 United States Codes (USC) 1601 appointment authority.

Business Unit: ServiceMaster CorporateTitle: IT ArchitectLocation: TN - MemphisCity: MemphisMetro Area: MemphisState: TNPostal Code: 38103Functional Area: CorporateBranch Number: 46Requisition Number:147658First Open Date: 12/06/2011Post Date: 12/09/2011Description: ServiceMaster is committed to Diversity and Inclusion. We encourage diverse candidates to apply to this position.An Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer - AA/EOE/M/F/D/VPosition OverviewThe Information architect has an enterprise focus and encompasses aspects of data architecture, metadata management, and knowledge management to provide a holistic view of information assets to enable a cohesive platform for delivering information in the correct context to the right people. A key deliverable for information architecture is the enterprise data model, comprised of a subject area model (SAM), enterprise conceptual data model (ECDM) and enterprise logical data model (ELDM). The enterprise data model is technology and application neutral, and defines how the business sees information.Define and enhance the Enterprise Information Architecture strategy models for business application. Build, integrate, and manage enterprise technology platforms that align with the company's goals, objectives and direction. Serve on architectural review team.Responsibilities- Document and effectively communicate a data or information architecture across multiple audiences, including senior management.- Formulate/design data and information requirements and objectives for a major project or multiple lesser projects.- Demonstrate an understanding of the data/information lifecycle and the appropriate management of these assets at each stage of the lifecycle.- Must be able to lead and influence technology and business partners on multiple projects or enhancements and work closely with other Architects.- Logical data modeling directed toward the documentation of business requirements.- ODS, Data warehouse and data mart design and implementation.- Create the Enterprise Information Architecture (EIA) strategy describing the current state, future state, and guidance necessary to flexibly share and exchange information assets.- Create requirements, principles and models supporting the Business Intelligence strategy.- Act as a facilitator, planner, change agent, champion and coach for Business Intelligence projects.- Lead evaluation, selection, implementation and adoption of new enterprise data tools, standards and processes.- Actively mentor, train and provide leadership to junior members of the data management staff including assessment in development and delivery of architecture material for ServiceMaster.- Maintain knowledge of technical developments, staying informed as to industry practices, knowing how to apply relevant technical processes to appropriate business needs.- Serve on Architectural review teams as necessary for project review and approval.Competencies- ServiceMaster Commitment- Customer Orientation/Positive Impact- Results Orientation/Sense of Urgency- Change Mastery- Relationship Building/Sensitivity- Problem Solving and Decision Making- InitiativeEducation and Experience Requirements- B.S./M.S. in Computer Science, Engineering, or equivalent formal training preferred.- 9+ years in IT with at least 7 years of designing information architectures for different architectural environments (web, mainframe, client/server, thin-client).- Performance-based enterprise and strategic thinker who can manage multiple projects simultaneously.- Self motivated, hard working, sociable, and driven by professional success.- Proven experience in evaluating cross-functional decisions that will enable an organization to achieve its objectives.- A demonstrated successful track record of delivering programs of medium or above priority and risk is required.- Professional IT Architect certification is a plus.- Must have experience in leading, building and implementing a large scale transition to Enterprise Information Architecture including application development, integration, and data integration/data exchange.- Must have an expert level competency in at least one of the Enterprise architecture frameworks (Zachman, TOGAF, other).- Require strong communication skills and the ability to understand and simplify complex material.- Generally recognized as a qualified expert in information and data management methodology and technique.- Expert understanding and can speak to application development life cycle and methodologies.- Proven ability to influence cross-functional teams.- Strong leadership ability with a track record of developing people and achieving challenging objectives.Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities- Data/information modeling expertise at the enterprise level, working with large and complex logical data models.- Experience with various information modeling techniques (such as data flow diagrams, entity-relationship diagrams in 3NF and create/read/update/delete matrices).- Understanding of differences between relational modeling and object modeling.- Understanding of meta-models.- Able to understand business concepts and ideas in context to data model implications.- Ability to establish and maintain a high level of customer trust and confidence, communicating and explaining logical data models to individuals with diverse background.- Strong analytical and conceptual skills; ability to create original concepts/theories for a variety of stakeholders.- Familiarity with business intelligence and data warehousing development techniques. I.e. experience with a data warehouse 3-tier data model approach (staging area, core layer, semantic layer) and the approach as described by Inmon instead of Kimball- High-level understanding of relational database management systems and other data structures.- Working effectively in a team of strong individuals for achieving a shared goal.- Use of ERWin, DBArtisan, Rational, ARIS or similar data modeling tool.- Experience with one or more of the following is desirable but not mandatory: Meta data management and strategy building, master data management and data quality, service oriented architecture.- Experience with one or more of following products is desirable but not mandatory: JDEdwards (Finance), Informatica (Master, meta data and archival management), 1010data (Data Warehouse and Business Intelligence).- An ability to quickly recognize solutions to arising issues A drive to meet SLA's and develop metrics that ensure that SLAs are met- An ability to identify and leverage department resources to accomplish goals- Performance-based enterprise and strategic thinker who can manage multiple projects simultaneously- Must have an expert level competency in at least one of the Enterprise architecture frameworks (Zachman, TOGAF, other)DisclaimerThe above statements are intended to describe the general nature and level of work being performed by associates assigned to this classification. They are not to be construed as an exhaustive list of all responsibilities, duties, and skills required of personnel so classified. All personnel may be required to perform duties outside of their normal responsibilities from time to time, as needed.

Acentia is a premier provider of technology and management solutions that provides state-of-the-art lifecycle information technology (IT) services to Health, Government, and Commercial IT clients. At Acentia, we understand that our employees are our greatest asset. Our goal is to create an environment where employees can do important, purposeful work and be rewarded for individual and team success. You will work among the best and brightest in the industry. You will be a part of an organization dedicated to advancing your career and one that embraces participation and rewards achievement. We are looking for individuals that are passionate about the mission they support and are committed to the customers they serve. Acentia is seeking a Technical Standards/Enterprise Architecture Analyst to join our team.The an Technical Standards/Enterprise Architecture Analyst to will advise and assist staff principals, and their teams, within Office of the Chief Information Officer, for the client on matters of technical standards, enterprise architecture, healthcare IT data standards, information management, interoperability with other US government agencies, IM/IT governance and policy, strategic planning, and program/project management.Responsibilities will include (but not be limited to) the following:Being the subject matter expert (SME) on technical standards related to healthcare information technology (HIT). Being familiar with relevant data standards (e.g., HL7)Reviewing and interpreting standards, and recommending their implementation. Monitoring changes to individual standards, the broader IT/HIT standards environment, and related Department of Defense, Federal, and Industry policies and guidance.
