ABOUT CATALINA:  The world is changing, consumers are changing and so is Catalina- we are becoming a consumer-centric, multi-channel, loyalty company, committed to helping manufacturer and retail brands deliver unprecedented performance by unleashing the power to know, engage and empower the worlds consumers. With integrated in and out-of-store marketing platforms, Catalina pioneers breakthrough consumer loyalty solutions that transform the shopping experience. We have the unique ability to listen, understand and respond to consumers over time, and we are creating ways to connect with her whenever, wherever, and however she chooses on her path to purchase. Catalina leverages the world's largest, transaction-level, shopper-data warehouse to develop, deliver, and measure consumer and patient-driven engagements. With average promotional response rates of 6.8% - one of the highest in the industry, only Catalina knows the evolving buying decisions and individual needs of shoppers. Catalina uses this understanding to create customized, measurable campaigns that motivate high-value consumers to try new products, increase consumption and stay loyal to brands. Catalina Health adopts similar methodologies working to improve behaviors one health consumer at a timewith highly relevant and personalized messages. At Catalina, we have the privilege of helping people make the best choices for themselves and their families. This purpose is at the heart of Catalinas transformational change. Catalina is based in St. Petersburg, Florida, with operations in the US, Europe and Japan. To learn more, please visit www.CatalinaMarketing.com Job Summary:Catalina operates platforms that are large, complex, geographically dispersed combinations of IT staff, third party service providers, automation, networking, telephony, storage, computing, data warehouse, monitoring and related user administration and support services. The Sr. Director, Infrastructure Architecture & Strategy is responsible for leading the Infrastructure Architecture & Strategy team that ensures Catalina designs, plans, architectures, processes, etc., retain compatibility with enterprise and solution architectures, and conform to appropriate standards (corporate, industry, national and international) within constraints of cost, security and sustainability. Core responsibilities aremanaging infrastructure architecture, infrastructure technology innovation,technology roadmaps, technology strategy, and infrastructure standards management. The range of technologies includes networks/connectivity, enterprise computing, storage, database technology and personal/mobile computing. In addition, this role is responsible to provide technical expertise for the existing services portfolio. The team supports/collaborates with the Design & Delivery, Service & Support, Information Security, and Enterprise Architecture teams in creating a customer excellence culture that promotes a secure computing environment. The Sr. Director, Infrastructure Architecture & Strategy partners with Product and Platform Managers to generate new enterprise-wide strategies for improving effectiveness to match changing business and technology requirements. Build and sustain collaborative relationships and alliances across internal, external and organizational boundaries. Conduct best practices and benchmarking studies in order to recommend optimal solutions. This position is responsible for the creation and roll-out of infrastructure and Operations (I&O) architecture standards,roadmap, infrastructure strategy, promote infrastructure innovation, and provide direction and guidance to staff, management and all related stakeholders on all aspects of the development of, and modifications to, Infrastructure architecture and standards. Essential Functions and Responsibilities:         Ability to critically evaluate information, anticipate and understand the implications of decisions, and develop and execute action plans based on overall business strategy         Knowledge of the enterprise systems and architecture standards and how they apply to business functions/process, as-well- as the implications regarding hardware and software         Ability to develop technology and investment priorities based on business needs         Experience with developing and maintaining enterprise infrastructure architecture plans and associated technology roadmaps         Lead the Infrastructure strategy development and creation of an infrastructure roadmap that will support enterprise wide deployment of new technology based products and services         Participate in the formulation of the IT Strategy and Business Plan as a member of the IT Leadership Team.         Significant multi-technology experience and understanding of applications development as well as infrastructure management         Perform all functions related to staff management including: mentoring and coaching for high performance; performance planning, development and monitoring including mid-year and annual reviews; recruiting and termination.         Lead staff in the adherence to the IT Operating Model best practices including all aspects of program and project life cycle management.         Prepare timely status reporting (daily issues, weekly status, etc.) with accurate, appropriate information.         Develop and monitor the annual Capital and Expense plans and budgets.         Monitor activities and processes to ensure the quality of technical and business solutions.         Additional Duties and Responsibilities:         The incumbent may have one or more of the following additional duties and responsibilities:         Recognizes potential strategic application of I&O, and initiates investigation and development of innovative methods of exploiting I&O assets, to the benefit of organizations and the community. Plays an active role in improving the interface between the business and I&O.         Co-ordinates the identification and assessment of new and emerging hardware, software, and communication technologies, products, methods, and techniques.         Identifies new and emerging hardware and software technologies and products based on own area of expertise, assesses their relevance and potential value to the organization, contributes to briefings of staff and management.         Ensures compliance between business strategies, enterprise transformation activities, and technology directions, setting strategies, policies, standards, and practices.         Leads the development of infrastructure architectures for complex systems, ensuring consistency with specified requirements agreed with both external and internal customers.         Establishes policy and strategy for the selection of infrastructure architecture components, and co-ordinates design activities, promoting the discipline to ensure consistency. PRINCIPAL CHALLENGES:  Most typical - Recommending to VPs and SVPs in other parts of Catalina that they operate within, and adhere to, specific constraints regarding technology roadmaps, technology strategy, and infrastructure standards management. A typical challenge that the incumbent faces will include influencing others without direct authority while defining and overseeing design plans and architectures. The successful adoption and implementation of these plans and conformance to these architectures is critical to the success of ability to deliver and support infrastructure platforms that support application software and services to stores, customers, .com and all IT-supported services. The incumbent must lead collaboration and negotiation with his/ her peers on other to ensure development of technology roadmaps, technology strategy, and infrastructure standards management. The incumbent must communicate effectively with IT, business and partner/vendorexecutives, sell the values of technology roadmaps, technology strategies, and infrastructure standards, and serve as an advocate for maturation within the architecture and strategy space. Most complex - Synthesizing and deciding upon correct courses of action given conflicting input regarding technology roadmaps, technology strategies, and infrastructure standards expectations from various sources across Catalina. The incumbent requires solid understanding and experience with cross-functional Technology processes for infrastructure and service strategies, development, delivery and operations in order to direct, monitor and govern architectures and plans for same. The incumbent must be capable of varying his/ her communications style by audience to work effectively with all levels of IT professionals including project managers, engineers, functional managers, Directors, Vice Presidents, Sr. Vice Presidents, vendors and business leaders to understand their work processes and leverage IT best practices to develop appropriate I&O architectural plans and strategies. Short term - Rapidly developing a sufficient understanding of Catalina environment and capability in order to staff manager roles with the correct skill sets. Quickly building trusting and valued relationships with key resources from functions across I&O and IT. Long term - Making recommendations to evolve the function and operation of Catalina Infrastructure. AUTHORITY AND RESPONSIBILITY:  The incumbent will have the authority to make decisions on resources and spend within the pre-determined budget for the program. The incumbent will determine the budget and resources needed to be successful and propose for senior management or executives for approval. The incumbent will direct development of plans, policies, agreements and commitments for architectural guidelines, strategies, and innovation for I&O, and participate with other Catalina architectural groups, bodies and functions, including the Enterprise Architecture team. The incumbent will also have the responsibility to hire the resources he/ she needs (external or internal) and will have accountability to take corrective action for resources that are not performing. The incumbent will manage performance for direct reports including salary increases and have input into the performance evaluations for indirect reports. The incumbent will have the authority to determine methodology to be used for architecture and strategy for I&O, and the platforms and services I&O provides. The incumbent will also direct and agree criteria for success of I&O design and delivery initiatives including how to measure adherence to architectures, and methods and formats (such asbalanced scorecard, dashboards) for presenting performance and highlightingactions required. Required Qualifications:         Four-year degree in Computer Science, Information Systems or related technical or process design or architecture fields, or equivalent relevant experience, and business experience.         Ten (10) or more years of systems development, engineering technology management experience with increasing levels of management responsibility.         Five (5) or more years experience developing and communicating complex I&O architecture and strategy plans (innovation, design, architecture, etc.)         Five (5) or more years project/program experience and demonstrated ability to manage complex assignments including the use of established project plan development, resource planning and allocation, project scheduling, contingency planning, risk and issue management.         Experienced with IT processes including portfolio planning, Infrastructure Lifecycle (ILC) or Software Development Lifecycle (SDLC), project management, IT Service Management (ITSM) and ITIL.         Expert understanding and experience of IT architecture and strategy formation, analysis, tools, frameworks, and processes.         Large multi-store Retail systems knowledge.         Expert level of proficiency in Microsoft Excel,Word, PowerPoint, and Microsoft Project required         Knowledge of Information Engineering Methodology         Proven IT and I&O strategy development Position Title: Architect Reports to: Vice President, Strategy Location: Home Office - New Albany, OH   Description:   Primary responsibility of the architect will be to work within the A&F IT and business community to ensure systems are architected according the guidelines in the A&F Blueprint and the quality attributes specified in the project requirements.   Oversee that system architectures meet the required scalability, reliability, testability, modifiability, integration, and flexibility required for A&F.   Facilitate reuse of software and hardware to maximize efficiency, reduce development time, and increase quality.  Work with others to define best practice architecture design patterns for IT systems and publish best practices/patterns in the IT Blueprint.   In addition, the architect will be responsible for understanding emerging IT architectures (SOA/ESB, portals, virtualization, mobile, Web 2.0, Cloud, Mobile, NoSQL, etc...) and making recommendations on incorporating appropriate emerging architectures into the A&F Enterprise architecture.     Responsibilities:Tie the development teams together to ensure architectural integrity, use advanced design analysis and implementation, leverage software and/or component re-use, global standards and methodology compliance. Company Description      Synaptics is the leading worldwide developer of user interface solutions for mobile computing, communications and entertainment devices. Our mission is to enrich the interaction between users and their intelligent devices. Synaptics products emphasize ease of use, small size, low power consumption, advanced functionality, durability and reliability, making them applicable to a multitude of markets, including notebook computers, PC peripherals, mobile phones, and portable entertainment devices such as MP3 players.   Job Requirements      The IC Design team is searching for a hands-on, team oriented, IC design engineer with strong analog expertise. In this role, the engineer will be responsible for the design and verification of mixed-signal integrated circuits that implement innovative touch sensing and mobile display driver technologies. We are looking for a self-motivated experienced engineer who will take a lead role in our development teams, working closely with our marketing and applications team as well as directly with customers in the definition of new projects. This will likely involve extensive interaction with existing and future customers to ensure that the architectures employed represent the optimum balance of power, size, cost and accuracy.  Responsibilities include:         Help define new products, circuit designs and architectures for the touch and display controller markets        Interface with test, product and applications engineers to successfully bring new products from initial concept through release to production        Carrying out detailed analog and mixed-signal circuit analysis using both hand analysis and computer simulation at both the transistor & top level        Writing internal and external documents and publications that describe the new circuit architectures and designs        Gain an in-depth knowledge of process technologies used        Drive silicon performance evaluation in the lab and analyze pre-production test data        Assisting customers with new and existing designs regarding noise and interference mitigation        Work closely with Layout Team on critical blocks        Schedule tasks and goals to complete designs on time that meet all specifications.        Produce or contribute to product design support materials (data sheets, articles, app notes, develop design tools, etc.)   Required Qualifications      The candidate should have excellent knowledge of analog and mixed-signal electronics, be capable of accepting technical lead responsibility and have good interpersonal skills. The person should have a track record of initiative and innovation in their previous design experience. The successful candidate will be highly motivated and quick to adopt new technologies. Exceptional interpersonal, time management and communication skills are critical for working with engineering and product development groups. He/She must have the ability to multi-task, thus ensuring timely completion of several complex independent tasks.         MS or PhD in electrical engineering (or equivalent) with expertise in analog and mixed-signal CMOS IC design        Over 4 years of industry experience in transistor-level design of full-custom CMOS analog building blocks (especially low voltage) including but not limited to: amplifiers, comparators, mixers, data converters (both Nyquist-rate & oversampled), active filters (continuous time & switched capacitor), oscillators, high speed serial interfaces, and power supplies (LDO, DC/DC Converters).        Keen knowledge of physical layout and thorough understanding of related issues.        Experience in using Cadence custom IC design tools: analog circuit simulation (Spectre and Ultrasim), mixed-signal simulation (Analog Artist, AMS-Designer).        Must have excellent communication skills and ability to work independently.        Candidate should be prepared to discuss successful experiences in solving problems creatively, innovative circuit designs, taking initiative and ability to follow through.        Hands-on measurement lab skills and familiarity with lab equipment such as oscilloscopes and spectrum analyzers   Desired Qualifications              Top-down design using analog and digital hardware description languages (i.e., Verilog/VHDL, Verilog-A, and Verilog-AMS)        Experience with specification, architecture, and floorplanning for mixed-signal integrated circuits        Experience with system-level issues and top-down design methodology; high level circuit modeling experience using a tool such as Matlab        Display Driver architecture development and design experience on Liquid Crystal Display (LCD) or similar platforms        Hands on circuit design experience in RF communications systems        Digital design skill and experience (Verilog RTL and Synopsis)

Position Description:RANGE POSITION DESCRIPTION –  Job duties are for a system administrator, working under general technical guidance, specializing in communications, communications switching, data transport and support systems  within a real-team mission support environment.  Perform network and system management and administration tasks on systems comprising the Federated Edwards Digital Switch (FEDS) Communications Systems, Range  Data  Acquisition  and Transmission System (RDATS)  and  associated  data distribution, conversion  and  support  systems  in  accordance  with  standard  industry  practices,  manufacturer data applicable  DoD  polices  and  directives.  Perform  daily monitoring and provide status of all work center networks.   Implement  and  update existing and establish new network and system administration policies.  Monitor and enforce approved network practices and policies.  Identify network and system administration weaknesses and problem areas and provide recommendations for corrective actions.  Applicant will maintain networking equipment to include problem isolation and repair to the lowest repairable unit level.  Applicant will perform Preventive Maintenance Inspection (PMI) activities on applicable networking equipment and will  develop  and  maintain PMI procedures as required.  Applicant will create Operating Instructions for general network and system administration tasks within the work-center. Desired Qualifications: Experience  with  Marconi and  ADC Telecommunications equipment such as: AAC-2, AAC-3, Terawave TW400, Marconi AXS-200, ASX-1200.  Experience with Orion digital voice switches.  Practical knowledge of telemetry,  data,  voice,  and  video  transmission.  An  active or previous DoD security Clearance and an understanding of Test Range mission support operations. REQUIREMENTS - EDUCATION, TECHNICAL AND WORK EXPERIENCE - Associates or higher degree in Computer/Information Technology, or equivalent academic/technical training.  Possess 7 years related experience or combination of experience in computer system basics and/or related areas of expertise.  Must possess and apply a broad knowledge of principles, practices and procedures in computer science, graphics, and information systems.  Must have specific experience in the use of MS window server environments and various CAD/CAM, database, MS Office and Web enabled applications The incumbent must possess planning/organizing skills and must be able to work under deadlines.  Employee is expected to routinely cross fields in the completion of somewhat difficult and varied assignments. Must be capable of updating or repairing computer systems. Candidate must interface directly with customers as needed to report network and system status.  Applicant must be able to resolve simple to complex problems in a high-pressure real-time mission environment.  Applicant must possess knowledge of networking and data link protocols such as IP, Ethernet, Frame-Relay, SONET, T1 and have knowledge of cabling  standards  including  T1, Fiber, Ethernet and coax and a working knowledge of and the ability to troubleshoot, data and telecommunications networks and equipment.  This job requires the applicant work long, odd and shifting hours and week-ends on an as needed basis.  The applicant must be able to obtain and maintain a DoD security clearance up to Top Secret with Special Access.  The applicant must be able to work independently  or as  a member of a team and must have strong verbal and written communications skills.

Role: Scalability Senior DeveloperLocation: Redmond,WA Job Description: Throw away good projects, keep the great ones. We can be selective because hundreds of the top professors and researchers around the world want to work with Microsoft Research Connections. Each year we choose the top three ideas and put a team in place to deliver the software engineering to make them real. Some of our projects come from collaboration between MSR and product groups that we facilitate. Try F# (http://www.tryfsharp.org) is a co-production of MSR Cambridge and Developer Division to promote Microsofts thought-leadership in functional-first programming. Some of our projects come from external professors like Walter Alvarez from UC Berkeleys Earth & Planetary Sciences department who had an idea to use computer graphics to improve his students understanding of the geological scale of time. The result is Chronozoom (http://www.chronozoomproject.org) which uses HTML 5 Canvas to create a DeepZoom-like experience to help visualize 'Big History'. We need hands-on coding, technical breadth and depth, and hardcore software engineering. You'll be expected to help make architectural choices and choose technologies. Qualifications:     7+ years software development with strong engineering experience.     Strong design and development skills using C++ & C#.     Deep knowledge of web scaling algorithms such as DHTs and Distributed Caches. Graph algorithms a plus.     Experience with Azure Table Storage & Azure Caching.     Helpful to have experience with scaling technologies such as Cassandra, memcached, and MongoDB.

Enjoy finding elegantly simple solutions to complex problems?Interested in taking enterprise UI to the next level?  RSA, the Security Division of EMC, is looking for a Principal User Experience Designer (UXD) who has a passion for translating requirements and user needs into intuitive user interface designs and interactive prototypes. This opportunity is located in our Research Triangle Park, North Carolina office and will support our growing Security Management product line.  This position requires a unique blend of UI experience: the ability to design user interfaces mockups and fluidly transition them into interactive, dynamic prototypes. In some cases, the prototype will be the mockup, and vice versa. You must have expert interface design and web development skills. As a Principal UXD with a focus in UI Design/Prototyping, you will work with other UXDs, product managers, software engineers & architects, QA engineers, technical writers, and—in some cases—directly with customers to design and realize usable products and solutions.  You have…  · Designed and implemented UIs for complex browser-based applications.  · An open mind, a can-do attitude, and a bent for creative problem-solving.  · Experience presenting your work to others and explaining the thinking behind it; experience making positive change based on feedback from peers.   Responsibilities  :   Conceptualize new or improved user interfaces based on user research conducted by the UXD group and requirements from Product Management and Engineering; produce low fidelity wireframes of those concepts as needed.   Design modern, usable pixel-based mockups that support user workflows.   Rapidly develop functional prototypes to demonstrate concepts and support intra-release, iterative usability testing; observe usability test sessions to gain firsthand knowledge of usability issues.   Develop prototypes to accompany design specifications and communicate user interactions.   Produce standards compliant code using CSS/HTML, JavaScript, AJAX, and related browser-based UI frameworks, such as Ext JS.   Partner with Engineering to ensure that prototyping techniques and technologies translate through to shipping products. “Real artists ship.”    Qualifications:   Over eight years of experience designing and producing usable interfaces.   Experience using JavaScript frameworks (Ext JS preferred) as well as building with front-end technologies such as HTML 5, CSS 3, AJAX and JSON.   Passion for new UI design and development trends and associated technologies.   Experience in Enterprise product development, the security software industry,Visual Design, Data Visualization desirable.   Bachelor’s degree or higher is desirable, but comparable real-world experience is preferred.    Who is RSA, The Security Division of EMC?   RSA, The Security Division of EMC is headquartered in Bedford, Massachusetts. RSA is the expert in information-centric security, enabling the protection of information throughout its life cycle. RSA enables customers to cost-effectively secure critical information assets and online identities wherever they live and at every step of the way, and manage security information and events to ease the burden of compliance. They offer industry-leading solutions in identity assurance & access control, encryption & key management, compliance & security information management and fraud protection. These solutions bring trust to millions of user identities, the transactions that they perform, and the data that is generated.MNSTR

FAST FORWARD TO YOUR GROWTH                                                               As part of Battelles Health and Life Sciences Global Business, you will touch every aspect of human health. We deliver far reaching solutions to some of the worlds most pressing health challenges  from developing medical products that change individual lives to pharmaceuticals that address potentially devastating health conditions on a global scale. Battelle supports your career by offering you the opportunity and resources to solve the most critical health problems, breakthrough technology developments, mentorship opportunities, upward mobility, and company ethics and reputation.  Are you ready to Fast Forward To Your Growth?   Our Health and Life Sciences Division is currently seeking a User Experience Designer to be part of our Human Centric Design (HCD) Team, located in Columbus, Ohio.   Primary Function  As part of the HCD team, you will focus on translating user needs into relevant solutions that change peoples lives. You will be a utility player, moving seamlessly between user research and concept development into final design and development.  With a focus on Visual Design and UI/GUI, you will collaborate with software and hardware engineers and be a champion for human-centered design approaches.     Major Responsibilities  Collaborate with human factors experts, industrial designers, hardware and software engineers. 	 Participate on research teams to collect gather needs/insights from diverse environments (from clinical setting to in-home use)	 Design screen layouts in any medium, from paper sketches to fully functional UI simulations.	 Collaborate with other UI designers to create frameworks, and navigation flowcharts to communicate workflow	 Design compelling interfaces across all desktop and mobile platforms, as well as non-screen interactions	 Author UI style guides and specifications.	 Participate in formative and summative usability studies        THE FOLLOWING REQUIREMENTS MUST BE MET TO BE CONSIDERED FOR THIS POSITION: Exceptional ability to visually communicate complex interactions and information	 Proven experience in translating business and user needs into final designs	 Proven experience using Adobe CS and other industry leading UI prototyping techniques and design tools to produce user flows, wireframes, prototypes, UI specifications and final graphics]	 Proven understanding of software development processes and how UXD intersects.	 Excellent communication, presentation and intrapersonal skills.	 A strong online/electronic portfolio containing proven examples of successful participation on multi-disciplinary teams.	 Proven ability to work in a fast-paced, deadline oriented environment as part of a team, as well as individually	 Formal education in Design, Interaction Design, Computer Science, HCI, User Experience, Interaction Design or a related field	 3+ years experience in UXD       THE FOLLOWING IS DESIRED, BUT NOT REQUIRED TO BE CONSIDERED FOR THIS POSITION: Prior experience of designing user interfaces for medical devices.	 Ethnographic research skill and experience.	 Experience participating in design validation activities.    BENEFITS Battelles competitive benefits program includes comprehensive medical and dental care, matching 401K, employee pension, tuition reimbursement, work/life balance, paid time off, flexible spending accounts, disability coverage, and other benefits that help provide financial protection for you and your family.   Battelle is an Affirmative Action/Equal Opportunity Employer and supports diversity in the workplace. Applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability, veteran status, marital status, or sexual orientation. For more information about our other openings, please visit www.battelle.org/careers

If you call yourself a UI or Usability Expert, Usability Architect, or Usability Designer, then we want to talk to you!Company DescriptionAccruent was founded in 1995 to help real estate and facilities professionals deliver long-term, best-in-class, operational and financial performance. Our customers are leaders in major industries, including retail, wireless, higher education, property management and the corporate world. Additionally, Accruent was named to the Austin Business Journals Top 25 Software Developer in Austin list, and the companys CFO was recently recognized as the 2012 CFO of the Year by the Austin Business Journal.Job SummaryThe Sr. Usability/User Interface Architect will be responsible for driving product success through improving the usability of our products in collaboration with Product Management and Engineering. The ideal candidate will responsible for the product design areas including user interface, navigation, interaction design, and business/user process engineering for Accruent products. This involves application of user-centered design methods to translate user needs, business objectives, and technology capabilities into a world-class user experience.Primary responsibilities include:Work closely with product management to analyze business workflow, validate requirements, construct design prototypes and create a formal UI specification document Create user requirement specifications, including personas, scenarios, task analysis, flowcharts and organization and navigation models, detailed wireframes, mockups and interactive prototypes to effectively communicate the user experience and user interface elements Perform usability reviews of applications and test components for usability employing standard usability testing techniques Work with Product Management to define the user model and interface for new and updated features and functionality Lead research efforts to understand user needs such as heuristics, usability testing, focus groups, stakeholder interviews, web analytics and competitor evaluations to create forward-looking, usable and best in class new products Develop and present user experience recommendations to key stakeholders for large-scale complex initiatives Represent and advocate the user experience perspective and serve as a resource throughout the organization by answering questions, facilitating decisions, sharing opinions and perspectives and suggesting new and innovative ideas Design and assist to implement new user-interfaces and navigation to drive more efficient application workflow and improve the customer experience Ensure a consistent user experience across all Accruent products Work closely with development teams to ensure that the solution is accurately translated to the final application Maintain an up-to-date understanding of new technologies and best practices in website navigation, browsers, information architecture and usability. Requirements and Qualifications7+ years of solid, relevant, on-the-job experience in a user experience role designing enterprise software applications Candidates must be versed in user-centered design methods and techniques and information architecture Proven ability to understand target users and design user experience appropriate for those users Experience planning and conducting usability tests & user research, summarizing results, and making recommendations Must understand design constraints such as browser capabilities, media types, platform differences, and operating systems. Experience performing within an Agile environment Experience working on enterprise software products, with a practical understanding of design issues for web-based interfaces Experience designing user interfaces for mobile applications (iPhone, Android and Blackberry) Quick learner with exceptional organizational and prioritization skills to deliver on multiple projects simultaneously Highly motivated, engaging, able to work effectively within a team environment, and will stretch to deliver results on time Excellent written and verbal communication skills, interpersonal skills, management skills with a strong attention to detailEducation Requirements:Bachelor's degree required; preferred in design-related discipline: Interaction, Information or Interface design; Human-Computer Interaction; Design Planning; Graphic Design; or Communications; Computer Science

The User Experience (UX) Designer will own the look and feel of  Autonomous Solutions, Inc.s flagship command and control software  package for unmanned ground vehicles, Mobius. The designer will work  with the Director of Product Management, the Director of Software  Engineering, and software engineer teams to ensure that upgrades and new  releases are aesthetically and functionally sound, and are moving  toward simplicity for end users. The UX designer will be the linchpin  between developers and end users to develop software assistance tools,  storyboards, prototypes, and workflows that will increase the comfort,  usability, and productivity of all ASI software solutions. Classification: Exempt Location: Petersboro, Utah Essential Education, Work Experience, Job Skills Bachelors or Masters degree in computer science, cognitive psychology, human-computer interaction, or other related field4-6 years of experience in UX design with a proven track record of successful design implementationsUnderstanding of and experience with Agile/SCRUM software development techniquesDemonstrate a high degree of creativity, problem-solving skills,  attention to detail, rapid prototyping skills, and passion for usability  and simplicityDemonstrate teamwork, negotiation, and presentation skills with the ability to sell ideasSound understanding of user-centered design principles and toolsExperience using graphic design tools Essential Duties and Responsibilities Develop an expert-level understanding of competing and complimentary software solutions in the industryCollect and define innovative user interface designsImagine, storyboard, prototype, and implement software interface  designs that simplify user experience and increase user productivityWork with steering committee members, product managers, and software  developers to ensure that ASI software products reflect customer needs  and maintain consistency across featuresEngage as a team member with Agile/SCRUM software development teamsPersuasively convey design solutions to the executive team, product managers, developers, and customersConduct formative and summative usability tests, contextual inquiries, surveys, and interviews with focus groups and end usersFormulate UX design standards that can be used to guide future software development  The above statements describe the general nature and level of  work being performed in this job function. They are not intended to be  an exhaustive list of all duties, and indeed additional responsibilities  may be assigned, as required, by Autonomous Solutions, Inc. The  employee must possess the essential knowledge and skills described  below. Company Description Autonomous Solutions, Inc. designs and manufactures unmanned vehicle  systems, software, and components for a variety of industrial and  military customers. We have extensive experience in the automation of  both large and small scale robotic vehicles with an emphasis on  multi-vehicle command and control, mission planning, sensor fusion,  obstacle avoidance, tele-operation, and point-and-click ease of use. ASI was founded in 2000 by a group of researchers in order to take  the ideas and technologies developed at Utah State University into the  commercial sector. From this beginning, ASI has grown to become one of  the largest privately held robotics-focused companies in the world. We  employ a team of world class computer, electrical, and mechanical  engineers and support staff at our 100 acre proving ground facility in  Northern Utah.

Our Digital Media Client is seeking an Oracle Database Architect to join their team.  The successful applicant will be responsible for identifying database technologies that will keep the Enterprise IT department a proactive participant in business critical technology solutions, and will become new standards for the enterprise.  The Architect will be responsible for proving out those technologies through hands-on proofs of concept; defining best practices for relational and non-relational databases; assisting the Data Warehouse and Database Administration teams with the planning and designing of relational, non-relational and big data database systems; and reviewing both database-centric and non-database centric projects for adherence to Enterprise Architecture Standards. The Architect will define and implement new database reference architectures and document them fully, including new standards for RDBMSs, DBaaS, and NoSQL databases such as MongoDB, Cassandra, and Hadoop.  The candidate must have the ability to define reference architectures, develop written specifications, install and configure the underlying technologies independently, develop, document and execute test cases, make recommendations supported by findings, develop and execute operational readiness tests, and fully document the configurations, tests, results and recommendations.  Must have the ability to work with database administrators, and present to technical executive-level management.While this position is database-centric, the candidate must also have the ability to review proposed project implementations for adherence to Architecture Standards, and write Architecture Reviews and Recommendations based on findings.  This work will be done independently or in conjunction with other Architects.Required Skills:. Expert knowledge of and extensive experience with Oracle RDBMS is required, including its architecture, administration, backup/recovery (RMAN) and performance tuning. . Familiarity with emerging commercial and/or open source database technologies (such as MariaDB, PostgreSQL, NoSQL), and data warehouse appliance architectures. . 10+ years of experience as an Oracle DBA and expert in the use of SQL and PL/SQL.. Experience with MicroStrategy, Informatica, and real-time heterogeneous database replication technologies (GoldenGate, SharePlex) desired.  . 5+ years of experience with various database design architectures including OLTP, OLAP, and ROLAP.. 2+ years of experience in the implementation and support of Oracle Real Application Clusters (RAC).. 2+ years of experience in the administration of Microsoft SQL Server.. Experience working with VLDB (Very Large Data Base) architectures a plus (5TB or above).. Solid understanding of server and storage technologies (SAN, NAS, iSCSI, etc.), and database backup strategies.. Proven ability to document complex systems, infrastructure and process flows, using Microsoft Visio and Microsoft Office tools.. Netezza experience a plus.. Oracle Enterprise Manager Grid Control and Oracle Internet Directory (OID) a plus.. Excellent interpersonal and communications skills.Bridgette Marks Direct: (212) 792-6367 Northeast (NY): (212) 268-5800Nationwide: (877) 677-6566

SUMMARY:  The Database Developer II  Marketing Systems position for Green Mountain Coffee Roaster is responsible for database design and implementation of complex marketing systems applications at the enterprise level and the implementation of consumer marketing data management services to support GMCRs Consumer multichannel marketing strategies.  The position also includes report development, data mining development, exploratory data analysis, data management and cross business unit data services to support all GMCR marketing services applications and systems.  The role develops business relationships with all digital direct departments to ensure successful implementation of marketing service projects.  SUPERVISORY RESPONSIBILITIES:  No ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:      Design and develop marketing business applications using SQL, database utilities, ETL tools and business intelligence systems.  Activities also include troubleshooting and optimizing SQL Stored procedures and supporting data transfers/extracts leveraging using ETL technologies (SSIS).      Participate in data modeling design, customer data integration and marketing data architecture design to support consumer database marketing development initiatives.     Develop and support load and extract scripts and technical processes to manage GMCR consumer strategy level data assets     Create reports, universes, dashboards and scorecards using Business Objects tools including drill, hierarchy navigation and customizations as per specifications.       Design and develop Business intelligence queries and scripts using SQL for our data analytic practices.     Perform general database administrative tasks to include the design and development of new schemas, security management, and creation of scripts to automate tasks across development, test and production systems.     Support analytical development and application of propensity models to our data warehouse systems     Support our cross business unit data integration through new and existing data marts/data warehouses.       Participate in the development of enterprise data policies that outline the appropriate data ownership, stewardship and audit requirements, as well as service-level agreements, that must be established and maintained to guide the appropriate use of information in business and IT processes.      Highly motivated self-starter, detail and quality oriented and able to work independently   OTHER NECESSARY FUNCTIONS:      Follows all policies, procedures, ergonomic standards and safety requirements directed by GMCR and the department.     Performs other duties as requested by managementQUALIFICATIONS:   BS Computer Science or a related field         Minimum 3+ years of hands-on experience with MS SQL of various versions, predominantly SQL 2008. Experience with Microsoft database architecture and technologies; indices, stored procedures, replication, performance tuning.          Experience with ETL process and technologies used to realize an enterprise level data warehousing solution; SSIS, SSAS, SSRS, etc.          Business Objects Development experience including developing BO universes, reports, dashboards and scorecards.  Experience with Web Intelligence.            Experience in design/development of data marts and data Warehouses for supporting marketing and sales systemsExperience requiring in-depth knowledge of data cleansing/data quality and consumer data integration practices         Knowledge of database architecture, design and implementation.  Ideally, in Consumer Packaged Goods, Branded Goods or Grocery/Retail Industry          Ability to construct architectural deliverables related to data architecture (data structure diagrams, data/information models, process models, etc.).  Must be able to clearly document technical specifications          Strong problem-solving and analytical skills.          Able to multi-task and manage multiple project/task assignments simultaneously           Strong  written and verbal communication skills with ability to facilitate change          MS Certified SQL Developer a plus    PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS/WORKING CONDITIONS:  Predominately sedentary light office position with high frequency of keyboarding/computer work required (67% - 100% of the workday).         Occasional travel as required (up to 20%)          Provide support outside normal business hours as required. This individual will also be required to authorize GMCR to run a Criminal Background Check.  The examination and criminal background check must be completed prior to the first day of employment. As one of the worlds leading providers of business software, SAP delivers products and services that help accelerate business innovation. We are looking for candidates who are committed to a technology career path. Your set of application documents should contain a cover letter and tabular CV, copies of the obtained degrees and references (if available).EDUCATION AND QUALIFICATIONS/SKILLS AND COMPETENCIESWe require that you meet the core competencies and skills listed below.University degree in computer science, engineering or related areaVery good analytical skillsGood knowledge of data base architectures Advanced LINUX and UNIX skills and experience (specifically with multi-threaded architecture, synchronization mechanism etc.,)Familiar with debugging and analyzing complex problems Programming languages: SQL, C++Eagerness to have a very good customer satisfactionAbility to work well in close teamwork in an distributed team over several international locationsExcellent English both spoken and writtenA plus will be skills inUsing code profilersUsing C++-Debuggers (like GDB)Python, Shell-ScriptingDistribution strategies for dataDistributed  file systemsFamiliarity with Assembly Language (Intel)Experience dealing with Customers and handling customer issues

Description:Position Description: The Senior Marketing/Production Database Analyst is responsible for accurately architecting campaign design and code within the Unica Campaign tool to support a variety of marketing partners. This position requires end to end campaign delivery from Target Selection Criteria submission through campaign design, quality assurance, approval, list delivery and pre and post campaign administrative and tracking functions. This position requires an intimate knowledge of the Unica Campaign data model, data relationship and data processes/transformations within that model and will use this knowledge when interacting, consulting and advising marketing partners on the best campaign structure to achieve optimal business needs/intent. This position will participate in identifying campaign automation opportunities and enablement and in the user acceptance testing lifecycle for system enhancements. Positions in this function are technical roles that develop and support marketing/product systems and information. Employees in information management roles develop and enhance technology tools that support Marketing/Product team operations and provide reporting capabilities to measure or track performance levels. May develop system enhancements to accommodate new products, alliances and acquisition products.Bring your marketing bravado, and help change the world one bold idea at a time. You can help drive the change that improves the health care system for the benefit of millions. Primary Responsibilities:Assesses and interprets customer needs and requirements. Identifies solutions to non-standard requests and problems. Solves moderately complex problems and/or conducts moderately complex analyses. Works with minimal guidance; seeks guidance on only the most complex tasks. Translates concepts into practice. Provides explanations and information to others on difficult issues. Coaches, provides feedback, and guides others. Acts as a resource for others with less experience. Generally work is self-directed and not prescribed. Works with less structured, more complex issues. Serves as a resource to others.Qualifications:Requirements:High School Diploma/GED 3+ years Consumer Marketing experience Experience with Unica Campaign Tool as a Power User Previous experience with all aspects of relational databases (i.e. structure, queries, warehousing, etc.) Previous project management experience Proficiency with MS Office Suite (Word, Excel, and Access) Assets:Bachelor's Degree Previous experience with Business Objects Previous experience with the Unica Software Suite (i.e. marketing resource management) Prior healthcare industry experience UnitedHealthcare Medicare & Retirement is part of the family of companies that make UnitedHealth Group one of the leaders across most major segments of the US health care system. Imagine joining a group of professionals and clinicians who are working to improve health care for people over 50. Consider the influence you can have on the quality of care for millions of people. Now, enhance that success with enthusiasm you can really feel.That's how it is at UnitedHealthcare Medicare & Retirement. Everyday, we're collaborating to improve the health and well being of the fastest growing segment of our nation's population. And we're doing it with an intense amount of dedication.Here, you will discover a culture that grows through challenge. That evolves by being flexible. That succeeds by staying true to our mission to make health care work effectively and efficiently for seniors. Put your best to work for us, and discover extraordinary opportunities for growth.Diversity creates a healthier atmosphere: equal opportunity employer M/F/D/VUnitedHealth Group is a drug-free workplace. Candidates are required to pass a drug test before beginning employment. In addition, employees in certain positions are subject to random drug testing.

BUSINESS INTELLIGENCE ARCHITECTBI Architects envision, develop and support strategic operational business Intelligence to provide the right information to the right people at the right time. The Business Intelligence Data Architect is responsible for designing and implementing BI Software and systems, including ensuring successful integration with databases and data warehouses. Related activities include:  selecting, blueprinting, gathering requirements, designing, and rolling out BI solutions to end users. As part of the BI management team, the BI Architect's responsibilities also include managing direct reports, mentoring other team members, educating clients and prospects in the latest technology developments in BI, and  supporting the growth of the Business Intelligence Practice.SPECIFIC RESPONSIBILITIESThe Data Architect is responsible for the day-to-day management and delivery of Business intelligence projects to our clients, who span a diverse range of industries, products and services. Primary responsibilities include the following: Guide clients in developing and implementing BI-related strategic goals that will assist them in achieving their business objectives.   Direct, organize, and lead projects in the implementation and use of new BI software tools and systems. Lead the integration efforts for merging BI platforms with enterprise systems and applications. Design, code, test, and document all new or modified BI systems, applications, and programs. Develop the semantic layer, metadata, reports, and report definitions. Lead the design of databases and data warehouses to ensure interoperability with BI solutions. Analyze user requirements and, based on findings, design functional specifications for BI front-end applications. Work with project managers to ensure that data entry, retrieval, change and delete functions meet business requirements for project completion. Perform job duties according to the organization's business systems development methodology and/or its Systems Development Life Cycle (SDLC) and Agile methodologies. Design and deliver end-user training and training materials; provide technical support as necessary. Troubleshoot BI tools, systems, and software; performance-tune these applications as necessary. Act as evangelist for BI benefits across the organization; promote BI usage to relevant clients and prospects. Evaluate and select database/data warehouse components, including hardware, relational database management systems, ETL software, metadata management tools, and database design solutions. Conduct research and provide recommendations regarding BI products, services, and standards to support client procurement and development efforts. Mentor and/or provide leadership to junior members of the team. Develop, design, implement, enhance, maintain and analyze database systems, queries, and procedures in SQL Server 200 to 2008 environments. Develop complex SQL 2008 SSIS packages for ETL data to Data Warehouse projects and assignments and be able to modify existing Data Warehouse structure (SQL Server various versions) to incorporate data from different data sources. Create ETL design specifications  Perform development and unit testing of ETL processes Assist client personnel in migration of ETL components to test environment Participate in integration testing of solution that involves database, OLAP and reporting components in addition to ETL Assist client personnel in execution of acceptance testing and perform bug tracking and resolution of ETL defects as necessary Perform initial data load and data validation in production environment Conduct knowledge transfer sessions with client personnel Facilitate user requirement discussions with the business BI/Database DeveloperJoin our team as a BI/Database Developer to develop new solutions and enhance existing platforms in alignment with business processes and in pursuit of improved performance, maximized effectiveness and increased profitability. Provide initial and ongoing support to client projects and serve as a subject matter expert for internal software solutions employing SAP's Business Objects business intelligence platforms and custom Microsoft stack software development. Collaborate with project managers and clients in the development of user documentation and training for program implementations (charts, handbooks, etc.). Location is Windsor Mill, Maryland 21244. The professional in this role will: - Perform business analysis of client data processes and procedures;- Design database schemas and resulting SQL scripting to support business intelligence needs;- Serve as or work with Database Administrator (DBA) to create and manage physical databases;- Design and implement ETL processes to populate data models;- Install, configure and develop reporting within the SAP Business Objects platform;- Build role-based user security models for data access;- Design and develop Transact-SQL stored procedures to integrate BO with MS SQL;- Design and develop additional web forms in Microsoft technology stack as required;- Perform unit, integration and system testing of software solutions;- Support acceptance testing of software solutions;- Perform configuration management of software solutions, including release promotions;- Perform regression testing of production-promoted solutions;- Manage operational solution performance via application and data tuning;- Enhance operational solution as new business features are illuminated;- Define & maintain Data Naming and Data Definition Standards;- Create & Maintain Conceptual & Logical Data Models;- Adhere to US Government policies with regards to confidentiality of information - PII.To be qualified for this opportunity, candidates must possess:- Bachelors degree;- Competency working at the highest technical level of software development; - Strong problem solving and analytical skills;- Experience with SAP's Business Objects (BI) platforms (XI, Edge, Crystal Reports);- Experience with Microsoft SQL Server 2000/2005/2008 development and administration;- Experience with the Agile/Scrum software development methodology;- Knowledge of Extract, Transform and Load (ETL) theories and procedures;- Knowledge of Online Analytical Processing (OLAP) data design and database tuning principals;- Knowledge of role-based user security permission models;- Strong interpersonal, communication and organization skills;- Strong writing and verbal skills;- Experience mapping data models to business processes related to financials and/or workflow desired;- Business knowledge of government agencies and standards preferred;- Continued education in technical field preferred;- Experience with Microsoft stack development (ASP.NET, C#) focused on data processing and web presentation desired.The BI/Database Developer position is a full time opportunity, including a competitive salary and a strong benefits package. The salary range for this position is commensurate with experience.

Job DescriptionThe MySQL/MSSQL database administrator (DBA) is responsible for the planning, maintenance, and development for multiple high-volume, distributed databases and their support systems. Working as a part of a quickly growing team the MySQL/MSSQL DBA will ensure the database environment is designed and managed to meet business and IT demands for availability, performance and manageability. Will additionally be responsible for implementation of industry best practices in systems administration, stability, data security and recovery control, monitoring and management tools, grid implementations and management, tuning and capacity planning.Job RequirementsEssential Duties & Responsibilities*Content automation (ETL work  Extract Transform Load)     1. Using native sql (MsSql/ MySql) scripting       2.  Using native OS(Microsoft/Linux) command line scripting     3. Using some version of one of the following languages: C, Basic, Java, PHP, Cold fusion, etc..*Proficiency in relational schema analysis and discovery (both documented and undocumented).*Ability to recognize, analyze and apply design patterns.*  Works as member of team of MySQL/MSSQL and DB2 DBAs to provide cross-platform design and support capabilities. Proactive maintenance and monitoring of all instances of the MySQL/MSSQL databases servers *  Works with application development projects to evolve the database architecture and design*  Participates in the creation of development, staging & production database instances, and the migration of those instances from one environment to another*  Serves as the point of contact for advanced level troubleshooting issues, and performs hands-on systems administration as required.*  Provides tools, alerts, and monitoring capabilities for automating database operations *  Analyzes and responds to performance and other maintenance issues. *  Tests and corrects errors and refines changes*  Tunes the performance of all the staging and production database instances*  Designs and performs, or automates, back-up and recovery processes with other support teams and ensures they are functioning correctly*  Plans and executes tests of fault tolerance capabilities, including: backup/recovery; replication; cluster failover and disaster recovery*  Maintain data standards and security, including adherence to the Data Protection Act, PCI, and/or other requirements as needed *  Writes database related documentation, including data standards, procedures, and definitions for the data dictionary*  Work closely with Systems, QA and Development teams on designs, SQL development and performance*  Extensive knowledge of administration, replication, backup and restore of relational databases, specifically Microsoft SQL Server 2008.*  Experience working with very large databases.*  Understanding of Windows Server (2008 R2) configuration and management, specifically as it relates to MSSQL Server installations and mission critical systems.*  Excellent understanding of coding with Microsoft T-SQL and stored procedures.Qualifications*  3-5 years minimum experience with MySQL/MSSQL (multiple versions IE Microsoft SQL Server 2000/2005/2008 as well as InnoDB and such). Candidate must have deep hands-on knowledge of MySQL/MSSQL internals, monitoring, tuning, setting up and administering databases*  Demonstrated database design and SQL programming skills to perform troubleshooting and data manipulation tasks*  Experience with multi-master clustering (HA) and MySQL/MSSQL replication, experience with grid management structures a plus*  Experience with performance tuning and optimization. (Query optimization, index tuning, caching and buffer tuning)*  Hands-on experience with multiple native and partner-developed storage engines (i.e. MyISAM, Memory, InnoDB, Microsoft SQL Server 2000/2005/2008 etc.)*  Experience with deployment and management of grid technologies a plus*  Hands-on background with backup, recovery and upgrade procedures*  Extensive experience interpreting data models and developing database structures for scalable applications, specifically web driven structures, data profiling, meta data analysis, data modeling and relational schema design*  Experience with design and maintenance of large-scale, multi-faceted environments*  Strong attention to detail and willingness to take ownership for their domain*  Ability to diagnose and resolve a broad range of technical problems, including those not specifically attributed to the DB itself, in person, over the phone, and via email*  High degree of independence and exceptional work ethic*  Experience with other relational databases a plus *  Knowledge/experience in Linux, scripting, (Perl, ksh, etc.) and creating automated tools and custom handlers*  Strong teamwork, leadership and collaboration skills. Team leadership or management a plus*  Excellent verbal, technical writing and documentation skills are necessary for interaction with other teams and departments

Database AdministratorRESPONSIBILITIES:1. Determine, implement, and manage database backup and recovery strategies, with focus on PIT recovery. 2. Installation of new SQL Server database, shared features (SSRS, SSIS, SSAS) and upgrades. 3. Management of database and resource capacity planning. 4. Implement and enhance database security using proven methodologies. 5. Assist development staff with the debugging and optimization of SQL queries and stored procedures.6. Ongoing database performance tuning and upgrades, including: monitoring and evaluation of all database patches and service packs. 7. Design and manage database import/export processes used to populate test databases and global data marts. 8. Design and implementation of database replication strategies for both internal and Disaster Recovery (DR) requirements. 9. Transact SQL and stored procedure development. 10. Research problems, troubleshoot, and recommend corrective actions to development teams. 11. Setup and maintain documentation and standards.12. Setup mirroring and log shipping.13. Work as part of a team and provide 7x24 support when required.14. Other duties as assigned.  QUALIFICATIONS:1. 7 or more years of relevant industry experience. 2. 5 or more years of database administration/design experience with RDBMS. 3. 3-5 years experience with MS SQL Server 2000, MS SQL Server 2005, MS SQL Server 2008. 4. Experience with MS SQL Server backup and recovery techniques in a VLDB environment. 5. Proven experience in maintenance of SQL Server in VLDB environment. 6. Proven experience using Transact SQL, Stored Procedure and UDF. 7. A good knowledge of MSSQL security management.8. Experience with MS SQL Server DTS & SSIS. 9. Familiarity with SQL Server replication services. 10. Prefer experience designing and implementing data warehouses, including experience with MS SQL OLAP services. 11. Demonstrated experience in troubleshooting and resolving database problems. 12. Demonstrated experience in tuning database and its objects. Understanding of databases indexes. 13. Understanding of database design practices, including database normalization concepts. 14. Ability to handle multiple projects and deadlines.15. Prefer background in Microsoft networking. 16. Proven ability to work within a team environment. 17. Excellent verbal and written communication skills.

Job Summary  The part time instructor facilitates meaningful learning of the course competencies in the curriculum and proactively supports all facets of the learning environment. S/He provides education through learning-centered instruction that will enable graduates to fulfill the evolving needs of the marketplace. S/He encourages a culture of learning that values mutual responsibility and respect, life-long learning and ethics as well as personal and professional development. This position is part time/adjunct only. Incumbent must assure that the EDMC philosophy: quality services to clients; development, growth, involvement, and recognition of employees; sound economic principles; and environment which is conducive to innovation, positive thinking and expansion - is considered in carrying out the duties and responsibilities of this position.  Key Job Elements     Provides competency-based education which aligns with the EDMC model of curricula as well as supports the EDMC style of system delivery.    Designs and delivers class instruction through the development of instructional plans to meet course competencies, the development of activities which support lesson objectives, and (in the case of online instructors ONLY) delivers the instruction as approved.    Enables the achievement of pre-described exit competencies for student achievement and evaluation of learning by providing instruction which fosters competencies and establish student performance criteria and evaluation.    Delivers learning-centered instruction by establishing a classroom environment conducive to learning and student involvement as well as effectively planning and preparing for classes and student success.    Promotes student success by showing flexibility in style and work schedule as well as exhibiting a passion for teaching and students and engaging students in the learning process.    Manages the learning environment through keeping accurate records, submitting grades and other reports on time, and enforcing school/campus academic and attendance policies.    Contributes to a learning culture by participating on curriculum and system task forces, supporting local campus events such as orientation and graduation, and participating in various other workshops and meetings.    Relates professional/life/industry experience to learning by the continuation of professional/technical skills development, the introduction of industry perspective into courses, and the active awareness of professional/industry trends and opportunities.    Must be available to work a flexible schedule including weekends and/or night classes   Reports To: Academic Department Chair Directly Supervises: None Interacts With: Academic affairs department, other school/campus functional areas, curriculum task force and other committees, other faculty, and students  Job Requirements  Knowledge:     Bachelor's degree in a field related to the classes to be taught with a Master's degree and a minimum of 18 credit hours in photography & industry experience.     Zero to two years experience in instruction or formalized education process, preferably in a post-secondary or college institution.    Membership in a professional association tied to area of instruction preferred.    Applicants should have working knowledge in current imaging technologies including digital capture methods, Adobe Photoshop CS3, Adobe Photoshop Lightroom, and all camera size formats.    Previous teaching experience in a post-secondary edcuation environment is preferred.  Skills:     Excellent verbal and written communication skills including the ability to build successful relationships with student populations.    Outstanding conflict resolution skills.    Demonstrated time management and detail-oriented skills    Computer based skills (i.e., software, analytical, and report writing skills )  Abilities:     Ability to work effectively under pressure and to meet frequently occurring deadlines.    Ability to develop a professional rapport with diverse school/campus constituents.    Ability to develop and complete projects without continued direct supervision    Ability to learn from students' participation, demonstrates fair and consistent behavior in all matters, and shows compassion without being ineffectual   Job Requirements Work Environment  The work environment characteristics described here are representative of those an employee encounters while performing the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable qualified individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. The term "qualified individual with a disability" means an individual with a disability who, with or without reasonable accommodation, can perform the essential functions of the position. While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to communicate professionally in person, over the telephone, through email and other electronic means, move about the office or school, handle various types of media and equipment, and visually or otherwise identify, observe and assess. The employee is occasionally required to lift up to 10 pounds unless otherwise specified in the job description.  Notice  The intent of this job description is to provide a representative and level of the types of duties and responsibilities that will be required of positions given this title and shall not be construed as a declaration of the total of the specific duties and responsibilities of any particular position. Employees may be directed to perform job-related tasks other than those specifically presented in this description. Education Management Corporation is an Equal Opportunity Employer and embraces diversity as a critical step in ensuring employee, student and graduate success. We are committed to building and developing a diverse environment where a variety of ideas, cultures and perspectives can thrive. CLINICAL RESEARCH ASSOCIATEFOR DERMATOLOGY RESEARCH Job Description:              Academic physician with a busy practice in medical dermatology has a large volume of clinically relevant data. Data consists of clinical profiles, treatment regimens and follow up.  Many patients with only mucosal diseases. Seeking a physician who can assist in data collection, literature review, assimilation, analysis, and preparation of manuscripts.  Individual will be co-author on manuscripts based on their involvement and contributions.  Presentations at local and national meetings are possible.  Work will include collaboration with physicians, scientists and other institutions, locally and nationally. Previous experience is not essential.   The research is not industry-sponsored and does not include drug trials.  Position is located in Boston.Position is ideal for:o       Foreign medical graduates to get publication prior to residency applicationo       Physicians wanting to change their specialty to dermatologyo       Medical students wanting to get into dermatology residency programso       Physicians leaving the armed forces or public health service and indecisive as to their future career paths.   Requirements:         Education:  M.D. or D.O.         Speak, read, and write English very well.         Mandatory:  Must be a U.S. Citizenship or possess U.S. Green Card / Work Authorization  We cannot provide U.S. Visa Sponsorship          Digital photography skills necessary to take photographs of diseased patients         Excellent computer skills, especially in PubMed, word processing, Photoshop, PowerPoint, and others.         Organized, methodical and systematic worker         Individual must have demonstrated reliability, responsibility, dependability, and capacity to work independently         Must be a team player and willing to work with other staff members when needed.         Previous publications would be an asset, but not an essential requirement. Availability:              Position currently open - Willing to wait if candidate needs time to join. Remuneration:         Modest stipend negotiable, based on experience, training and productivity. Please submit resume and the names of 3 references, with their contact information, that can attest to your abilities. Clinical Research Associate for Derm Research JOB DESCRIPTION October 2012

Proficient in multimedia/Web e-learning development using packages such as the Adobe eLearning Suite (Captivate, Presenter, Flash, DreamWeaver, etc.). Proficient in creating and editing images in Adobe Photoshop, Illustrator, Fireworks, and/or similar software packages. Experience with digital photography, videography, sound recording, and sound editing desired. We firmly believe each employee plays a part in our continued growth and success.Our Retirement Solutions Division's in-house marketing team is seeking a dynamic Graphic Designer with skills and experience in creating print design, illustration, and logo design. Responsible for the initial design and maintenance of a wide array of collateral materials, including photography selection and typography to create effective high-end marketing materials that support the marketing, sales, and branding goals of the division. The ability to both understand strategic business objectives and communicate unique selling points is critical to the success of this position. The Graphic Designer will be entrusted with introducing, developing, and presenting creative marketing and advertising solutions as well as executing designs that bring those ideas to life. Also responsible for identifying, documenting, and sharing tasks related to departmental standards and procedures; including maintaining the design standards manual, periodically managing electronic media library, and identifying areas for increased efficiency or organization when possible. Requirements:* 5-10 years of experience designing identity systems and corporate collateral * Degree in graphic design or equivalent combination of education and experience.* Expert proficiency in Adobe CS5 (including inDesign, Photoshop, and Illustrator)* Strong print, typography, illustration, and logo design skills* Experience designing for mobile applications with Interactive and Electronic Publishing (EPUB) preferred* Strong digital photography, color correction, and photo retouching experience* Working knowledge of Microsoft Office* Meticulous attention to detail and procedure* Strong portfolio that showcases exceptional conceptual and design skills* A great attitude, and the ability to work well with othersJoin the Pacific Life team and watch your career grow! We offer competitive pay/ bonus program and a comprehensive benefits package including: * Medical/dental coverage* TWO retirement plans: 401k retirement plan with company match and company-paid Retirement Benefit Account where company contributes 4% up to taxable wage base and 8% over to IRS compensation maximum * Vacation/holiday pay * Medical and dependent care flexible spending accounts* And much more!For more information, and to apply online, please visit our web site: www.pacificlife.com *Pacific Life Insurance Company is an Equal Opportunity /Affirmative Action Employer, M/F/D/V*If you are a qualified individual with a disability or a disabled veteran, you have the right to request an accommodation if you are unable or limited in your ability to use or access our career center as a result of your disability. To request an accommodation, contact a Human Resources Representative at Pacific Life Insurance Company.
