About us:  Charles & Colvard, Ltd., based in the Research Triangle Park area of North Carolina, is the global sole source of moissanite, a unique, near-colorless created gemstone that is distinct from other gemstones and jewels based on its exceptional fire, brilliance, luster, durability, and rarity. Charles & Colvard Created Moissanite is currently incorporated into fine jewelry sold through domestic and international retailers and other sales channels. Charles & Colvard, Ltd. is headquartered in Morrisville, North Carolina, and its common stock is listed on the NASDAQ Global Select Market under the symbol "CTHR". For more information, please access www.charlesandcolvard.com.     Description:  Charles & Colvard, a gemstone manufacturer and jewelry retail company located in Morrisville North Carolina is seeking an enthusiastic, self-motivated, high end and experienced product photographer with a minimum of 5 years experience. Jewelry and small product lighting, image capture, Jewelry photography, retouching, set building, styling and database management skills are necessary for this position. This individual must be able to work in a fast paced, challenging environment.     The photographer/digital imaging specialist will work closely with marketing initiatives which include producing images for our website, collateral, catalogs, social media and more. This is an extremely hands-on position. Candidate must have the ability to see an idea through from start to finish. Must have strong retouching, and graphic design skills. Must have proficiencies as a jewelry photographer with fine-tuned lighting skills and solid raw workflow practices.  Videography and video editing skills a plus.     Responsibilities:  Proper file naming skills for organization's image database  Monitoring of image capture process and raw workflow ensuring that all images are captured properly.  Communicate with Marketing, Creative, IT, Merchandising to facilitate proper workflow between teams.  Deliver files to web, production, merchandising, database and client servers.  Raw conversion to deliverable file formats  Collecting copy and graphics for website collateral  Photographer for in-house jewelry product and staff  Working with our CRM system or similar database management systems.      RequirementsEducation:  Bachelors degree in commercial photography with at least 5 years of professional experience.     Computer skills:  Knowledge of data backup principals  Proficient in Microsoft Office Products  Web and Print design experience using Adobe Creative Suite 5.5  Experience in RAW file types and color management workflow     Experience:  Prior experience with professional photography lighting photo shoots & workflow           Design Skills:  Photoshop- Advanced working knowledge and must have experience processing from RAW to PSD, TIF, and JPG etc...   Color Management- must have a working knowledge of color profiling.  Color Theory- must have a solid understanding color, color space, color corrections, color conversions within a wide array of photo processes.  Digital capture management- daily management of image archives.  Creativity and Innovation- Exceptional problem solving skills, creative color layout and photo composting a plus.  Workflow & Communication- Project management from RAW to final output; we are looking for someone who can take care of a project on their own and communicate effectively with our in-house marketing team.                  Other Skills:  Ability to work closely with others and be part of a team experience  Videography a plus  Light video editing skills a plus  Ability to work under pressure to exacting standards and deadlines              Qualities:  Fast and efficient without compromising the integrity of the image.  Attention to detail and process.               There is no relocation assistance for this position. Amazon Web Services (AWS) is the world leader in providing a highly reliable, scalable, low-cost infrastructure platform in the cloud that powers hundreds of thousands of businesses in 190 countries around the world! At AWS we are continuously innovating and expanding our pay-as-you-go cloud based services to meet the growing needs of our customers. Today our services cover a wide range of computing, networking, storage, database and application deployment domains; providing IaaS, PaaS and SaaS solutions to a broad range of customers and use cases.Today AWS provides the widest set of storage service choices to help our customers solve their specific use case needs. These include Simple Storage Service (S3) - scalable storage in the Cloud, Glacier - low-cost storage archiving in the Cloud, Elastic Block Service (EBS) - Elastic Cloud Computing (EC2) block storage volumes, and Storage Gateway - an on-premise appliance integrating our customer’s IT infrastructure with Cloud storage. As we are continuously innovating for our customers’ growing service needs, AWS is now forming a team to deliver additional highly innovative cloud services.Delivering a reliable, scalable, and high-performance service requires engineers with exceptional technical expertise and fearless creativity. In addition, at Amazon, along with superlative technical strength, we expect our engineers to interact with customers, to understand our business goals, and to innovate rapidly, delivering high-quality and ground-breaking functionality.The ideal candidate is excited about the incredible game-changing opportunity that cloud computing represents, and is passionate about delivering high quality high value services for our customers in a hyper-growth environment where priorities can shift fast. Join a team that is super smart, driven to serve customers, and fun to work with in a start-up like environment.Bachelor’s degree or higher in Computer Science, Engineering or related field2+ years professional experience in commercial or web-scale system software development and deliveryProven object-oriented design and implementation skills (Java, and/or C++), preferably on LinuxProven understanding of scalable computing systems, software architecture, data structures and algorithmsProficient in network, distributed, asynchronous and concurrent programmingExperience designing, building and delivering high quality software on timeSolid verbal and written communication skillsPossess strong analytical skills, with excellent problem solving abilitiesExperience in Agile/SCRUM enterprise-scale software developmentExperience developing storage software with knowledge of storage protocolsUnderstanding of storage performance challenges and their solutionsFamiliar with building secure software and security algorithmsExperience building scalable infrastructure software or distributed systemsDemonstrated ability to achieve stretch goals in a highly innovative and fast paced environment*LI-AL1 ** For more information on Amazon Web Services, please visit http://aws.amazon.com **

Senior UI Developer –  Front End – New York (HTML5, ASP.Net MVC3)  Inviting exceptionally talented and seasoned Senior UI Developers, to join our team of professionals in building the next generation of our Software Applications. This is a unique opportunity to contribute as a member of a skilled and creative product team designing, developing and delivering the next generation of Media Applications. You will embark on an intellectually challenging and rewarding product development journey and work with top-tier software professionals on a variety of projects that explores the frontiers of modern technology. Our Product development group focuses on developing and building world class, high performance enterprise software solutions that deliver media tools to our 400+ clients worldwide. Using World class technology, we are building an exciting next generation product that leverages the latest advancements in database tools, grid computing, hardware-based acceleration techniques, and visualization optimization. Our Enterprise Platform utilizes restful web services, 100+ TB of data warehousing/OLAP solutions, large scale distributed data processing technology, best-in-class virtualization technology, and GPU-based computing in a SaaS environment. This is a hands-on position that will cater to your craving for design and development of World Class Software Products. This is an important time for AMD, our customers and partners, this shift changes the game for our industry. We have captured our industrys interest and attention. Executives from ARM, Amazon, Dell, Facebook and Red Hat touting our new direction are a direct reflection of the industry readiness to support and embrace this shift. ARM Technology coupled with AMDs SeaMicro Freedom Fabric will give us leadership to handle exploding data workloads the Cloud is creating, with the benefit of low-power optimization. This will uniquely position us to become the leader in the low-power dense server space. Well accelerate our roadmap expansion to include designs for the higher growth dense server market enabled by both 64-bit ARM and X86 solutions, and expect to bring our first ARM-based solutions to market in 2014.AMD announced its collaboration with Microsoft and key OEM partners to power more than 125 PC designs across a multitude of form factors, including tablets, ultrathin and mainstream notebooks, all-in-one and traditional desktops, home theater PCs and embedded designs. With an all new, hardware accelerated user interface, Windows 8 is specifically optimized to unlock the high performance graphics capabilities found in AMD APUs and discrete AMD Radeon GPUsAs we move more fully into the gaming, industrial and communications markets, the dense cloud server markets and the ultraportable and ultra-low-power form factors that continue to grow rapidly, we have opportunities for key contributors in Design for APUs and GPUs for these markets.We are continuing to invest in graphics IP; both in low power architecture and to improve performance/W/mm^2If the thought of playing a bigger role, or contributing where an individual has direct impact to the bottom-line, or perhaps its time to leverage your career  into a superior role, the Director of Engineering is available to talk about these and any other  points of interest.Regardless of the challenges we face, we will push forward and will meet these challenges with the passion and innovation that is at the heart of AMD. This position is for a design engineer in AMDs graphics group working on next-generation high performance graphics architectures. Responsibilities will include test planning, testbench creation, test writing, debug, and documentation.  While you probably have completed 2-3 full product development cycles with 5+ years  of experience in the large ASIC designs,  were more interested in what youve accomplished.  Experience in the following areas is valuable:         High performance processor designs, particularly highly parallel compute systems; GPUs, CPUs, DSPs or other novel systems         Cache systems, particularly multiple level caches and multiprocessor cache schemes          High performance graphics hardware architecture A great background for this role will include the following experience:Architecture and micro-architecture developmentRTL coding and debugIntegration of 3rd party IPVerification plan, test case and test bench developmenSynthesis and timing methodologyLab equipment such as high-speed digital oscilloscopes and logic analyzerSilicon bring-upProgramming of embedded processor systemsProgramming languages: Verilog, C/C++, scripting (Perl, Python, TCL) I can be reached at daniel.gieber@amd.comLinkedIn profile  http://www.linkedin.com/in/gieber

Contract to hire, 6 month contract period.Senior Firmware Engineer (Embedded Systems Software)     Job Description   Overview:  Be part of a team of firmware engineers developing new instruments. We develop firmware that controls instruments used in gene expression research and testing. Some of our core values include: good engineering practice, quality, communication, and meeting customer needs (internal and external). We place an emphasis on creativity, problem solving, and innovative solutions. We believe in: Teamwork, ownership, responsibility, and getting things done.  Job description:       Design, code, debug and test embedded systems firmware for scientific laboratory instruments.       Developing image processing algorithm in embedded systems environment.       Algorithm development in real-time control, data acquisition, motion control.       Develop unit and system tests to exercise the firmware and hardware.       Develop automated manufacturing test fixture software.  Required Experience        BS, MS or PhD in EE or CS.       At least 10+ years of experience developing embedded systems software/firmware for instruments.       Expert level C and C++ programming experience for embedded systems.       A solid background in: embedded software development, object oriented design, object oriented programming, real time programming.       Extensive experience with data-acquisition and instrument control.       Excellent algorithm design and implementation skills including coding, testing and debugging.       Experience working with Embedded Linux/Android Kernels or other real time OS.       Experience with board-level debug & bring-up.       Ability to read schematics, datasheets in order to develop firmware.       Familiarity with electronic test equipment, oscilloscopes, meters, logic analyzers, etc.       Solid experience working with hardware engineer(s) to deliver solutions,       Excellent organizational and documentation skills. Commitment to quality.       Experience with Visual Studio/.NET.        Experience working with ARM microprocessors.  Nice-to-haves:       FPGA/CPLD design experience, HDL programming experience.       Experience with developing automatic software test benches.       Experience working with USB drivers, SD card and compact flash drivers.  Department   Software Development

The Embedded Systems Software Engineer will lead and execute the design, development, and testing of firmware for our embedded control applications. Technologies include, sensor and device control, real-time and embedded programming, data collection, RF, low power management and windows based GUI development.  Core responsibilities include embedded controls software architecture development, coding, hardware and software testing and debugging, resolution of issues, and addressing manufacturability challenges.  Qualified candidates will have a solid understanding of real time control systems, topologies and software control schemes. They will also possess good written and verbal communication skills, the ability to multi-task and manage several projects in parallel, and be productive in a fast paced (startup), small team environment where self-sufficiency is paramount.  Skills Required:Languages: C, C++/Visual Studio, Assembly language (8051), Programming:  Embedded /Real Time programming, RTOS/POSIX, Multi-threading, Message Queue, Object-Oriented Programming (OOP), Interrupt, DMA, Power management.Device Drivers: USB, UART/RS232, SPI, IIC, Timer, LCD, NOR flash, Test equipment: Emulator, Protocol Analyzer, Oscilloscope, Logic Analyzer and other basic lab instruments. Algorithms: Checksum, CRC, tree search, linked list, Sort/Search algorithms (List, Tree, etc.), Digital Logic Circuit Design, IC, Semiconductor, TI CC2530 is a plus.Additional Skills:Familiarity and experience in real-time embedded systems Good documentation practices  specifications, commenting, and requirements of testing. Ability to creatively design high-quality custom solutions drawing from experience. Ability to plan, schedule, and follow through on projects to completion, testing, delivery, and validation and on-going production support. Fast and eager at learning and applying new technology. Design, problem solving, debug and analytical skills. Strong hands-on hardware troubleshooting and software debugging skills. Education:BS in Engineering disciplines such as Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Electrical Engineering, Physics or similar with 7 years related work experience, or MS with 5 years related experience.

Amazon Game Studios, makers of Living Classics (https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Ml-jlpds90o), offers a highly creative, fast paced, pioneering work environment where you will be working on both existing and new game titles for the casual, social, and mobile game space  As a Software Development Engineer for the games team, you will be a creative, natural problem solver with a passion for gaming. You are someone who enjoys interesting problems and can weave through complex use cases and develop simple but elegant solutions. You enjoy iterating with game designers, artists, and business owners to deliver experiences that delight customers. You’d love to experience the fun and community of being in a start-up company with the solid management and resource advantages of Amazon.  To be successful, you'll need broad game development experience and software engineering skills. You are able to focus on the customer’s needs and you are able to communicate effectively. You have a strong grasp of software architecture, advanced software engineering principles and design patterns. You are a fast and efficient developer who can make coding and design decisions with multiple simultaneous dimensions in mind. You are the kind of person who naturally creates new opportunities and drives projects to completion, sometimes across several functions and groups.The Role:  Be responsible for designing, developing and deploying major new game features. Ensure features are integrated elegantly with existing features and platform infrastructure.  Solve difficult problems that are sometimes not well defined by writing a lot of elegant and practical code.  Own broad swathes of an entire game end-to-end.  Assist in developing project plans and commitments, then deliver consistently against those commitments.   Help drive the architecture and technology choices that enable a world-class user experience.  Utilize user feedback and metrics to deliver iterations of software features.  Be a champion for the user: Insist on the highest standards, and create functional and engaging features that delight customers.Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or Computer Engineering or equivalent experience.3+ years of professional software engineering experience, working on multi-discipline teamsLI*CH At least 1 released game on which you were a primary contributor. Self-published titles are acceptable. Computer Science fundamentals in object-oriented design, algorithms, and data structures. Advanced programming skills, able to write high quality, maintainable and robust code in a major object oriented language like Java, C#, or C++ Good communication skills and ability to work effectively on shared projects with designers, artists, testers, and other developers. Experience with Flash & actionscript Experience working on large scale, commercial online game services. Java experience Android and iOS game development experience Ability and willingness to multi-task and learn new technologies quickly.  Experience working in Agile/Scrum.  Excellent judgment, organizational and problem solving skills.  Exceptional communication skills.

Brief Description[if gte vml 1]> https://hire.jobvite.com/images2/spix.gif " style='width:.75pt; height:6pt;visibility:visible;mso-wrap-style:square'> [endif]The Director of Program Management will be responsible for overseeing the Kabam game portfolio to ensure projects are on schedule, on budget and scope is in line with plan. In this role, you will manage the GDF gates, actively identifying risk for projects and impact on the business. The Program Management Lead will work in close collaboration with the Division Controller and Product Strategy Lead, and report into the VP of Studio Operations.Description[if gte vml 1]> https://hire.jobvite.com/images2/spix.gif " style='width:.75pt; height:6pt;visibility:visible;mso-wrap-style:square'> [endif]Kabam is revolutionizing the video games industry by improving how gamers access and pay for their entertainment. Based in San Francisco with offices in Austin, Beijing and Luxembourg, Kabam is the #1 company developing core games for mobile devices, the Web and social networks. Kabam delivers deep crafted experiences for gamers who love competition, strategy, role-playing-games and social gameplay. Are you a creative self-starter who is passionate about games? We want to meet you! The Director of Program Management will be responsible for overseeing the Kabam game portfolio to ensure projects are on schedule, on budget and scope is in line with plan. In this role, you will manage the GDF gates, actively identifying risk for projects and impact on the business. The Program Management Lead will work in close collaboration with the Division Controller and Product Strategy Lead, and report into the VP of Studio Operations. WHAT YOU'LL DO:* Own and manage the GDF process and gates to guide projects to launch.* Work collaboratively with Studio project managers on a monthly basis to track project progress.* Aggregate best practices to implement across the organization.* Manage the release calendar of projects to ensure smooth work process with central shared services such as technical operations and Kabam.com platform teams.* Spearhead resource management for cross-Studio allocations and training programs to continuously invest in the Studio development teams.WHAT WE'RE LOOKING FOR:* Experience across all aspects of game development as a producer or project manager - experience with online live games preferred.* Management, or management by influence, experience working with people of multiple disciplines.* Flexible and agile, ability to adapt quickly and be effective in new situations in a highly dynamic environment.* Proven experience in assessing issues and risks in a complex project across multiple disciplines including technology.* Familiarity with a variety of front and back-end technologies.* Strong project management skills, ability to multi-task and prioritize.* Strong oral and written communication skills.* Passion for F2P online games.Check out what is like at Kabam on our Facebook page - Life@Kabam Keep updated with us and Follow us on Linkedin! Note to Candidates:Kabam does not accept paper applications at this time and requests that all candidates submit their information online by either applying directly to an open requisition or submitting a general profile.Note to Placement and other 3rd party Agencies:Kabam does not accept unsolicited agency resumes sent to our website or to any Kabam employee, and will not incur fees to any third party agency as a result. If there is a need for third party agency assistance, then a representative from the Recruiting team will contact you. Kabam is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer **Successful applicants will be asked to show proof that they can legally work in the U.S**

This job is located in Berlin, Germany. If you cannot re-locate, do not apply. The aurionPro Solutions Recruitment Team is currently seeking a Senior Flash Developer for our client a large IT Staffing Company located in Berlin, Germany.  Please review the below description and if you are interested please contact Akif Mirza ASAP at akif.mirza@aurionpro.com or 925-526-4646 as we are looking to fill this position immediately.  **This is a Permanant position. This client cannot offer sponsor at this time. Please reference job # 1811** Senior Flash Developer Job Description: The client is Europes most successful social games developer. Creating a new game takes approximately 6 months, but development continues after that initial period for more than a year.During this time, one cross-functional team is responsible for all aspects of the game: product definition, graphics, development of the (Flash) client and the backend, as well as operating the overall system when its live. This team is autonomous from other teams and is responsible for its own decisions. Depending on the game, it usually consists of 10-15 people. Our development is agile  while the team can decide how to organize itself, it must remain flexible to changing requirements and be able to produce high quality software in weekly iterations. Test-driven development and continuous integration are standard. As part of a cross-functional team you will be responsible for the development and design of a flash based game using Adobe Flash. So grab the chance to develop global games which will reach millions of users all around the world.Required skills and experience Superhero skills in Flash development (CPU / memory optimization, Javascript / Flash bridging, Cross-browser compatibility, Flex, AIR). In-depth knowledge of ActionScript3, XML, MXML, CSS, Eclipse / Flex Builder/ FDT, SVN, Design Patterns including MVC. Experience in the development of Flash Applications with heavy server communication (Remoting, Sockets, JSON). Community awareness with new technologies, frameworks, resources, and open source libraries. Eye for detail, performance, and optimization.Any of the following are a plus Game addiction and understanding of Back-end and Database technologies. Facebook ActionScript API, Experience in Low-Level (bytes level) development.  About Us: aurionPro is a publicly traded technology company providing software products and expert level consulting services to an extensive global customer base. G100 Network seeks a Content Manager to support the content platform.  This role is focused on curating external content, capturing content developed through G100 Network programs, and developing original content through our network of senior advisors to develop our agendas, retain members, and recruit prospects. This position reports to the Vice President of Marketing and is located in Aspen, Colorado.  Responsibilities for the role include:            Managing the execution of annual content strategies for the G100 Network and each learning community (G100, G100 Europe, G100 Talent Academy, and G100 Next Generation Leadership) in support of:  o   program development  researching potential topics and speakers for G100 Network programs  o   content development  compiling and developing products for regular member outreach including monthly newsletters, pre-meeting materials, post-meeting summaries, and original content o   member and prospect recruitment  researching prospects through interviews and profiles o   original content manage the development and publication of original content as scheduled and in collaboration with Network senior advisors          Track and analyze the success of content campaigns across learning communities           Contribute to, leverage, and maintain member content library on G100 Network website, and maintenance of online content and speaker database   Job requirements include:            3-4 years of professional experience           Bachelors degree (required) in English, Communications or Business preferred         Strong interpersonal skills with the ability to work effectively in teams         Excellent analytical skills required to effectively curate content         High level of initiative and responsibility with a dedication to quality and attention to detail         Excellent communications skills, both verbal and written, MOBILE GAME ENGINEER (ANDROID EXPERIENCE REQUIRED) NAMCO BANDAI Games America is looking for an experienced Android game engineer.  Candidates must have work experience programming realtime game applications, and are preferred to have lead professional experience on a project in the past.  You are a product-focused team player that thrives in a highly creative, multi-disciplinary atmosphere. Further, you have professional experience programming games through more than one full product cycles.  You will be responsible for maintaining and updating several game application code bases on Android, and also possibly Apple platforms (iPhone, iPod touch, iPad). The Engineer working in this role is a strategic thinker, problem-solver, detail-oriented, and must be an effective communicator.  This is a mid-level position that will be expected to plan and work independently, with minimal supervision, and will be working closely with Producers, Designers and Artists. ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIESDevelop games for Android and/or iOS platforms. Maintain and update application code for games that are in our current catalog. Create builds from code provided by external developers and troubleshoot issues.Create and maintain technical documentation. Create and maintain utilities for use in development. Work closely with the development, design, and QA teams to meet completion deadlines for each project. Integrate change requests and playtesting feedback. SUPERVISORY RESPONSIBILITIESNo supervisory responsibilitiesEDUCATION/EXPERIENCE REQUIREMENTSBachelors Degree in Computer Science or equivalent work experience2-4 years of professional Android game programming experienceProfessional Android programming experience is required, and NDK experience is desirableiOS programming experience desirableJ2ME or BREW programming experience a plusUnity experience a plusProgramming experience in Java is required, with C++, Objective C or Unity being a plus WORK ENVIRONMENTThe work environment characteristics described here are representative of those an employee encounters while performing the essential functions of this job.  Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. The above statements are intended to describe the general nature and level of work being performed by employees in this position.  They are not intended to be an exhaustive list of all duties, responsibilities, and qualifications of employees assigned to this job.   NAMCO BANDAI Games America Inc., part of NAMCO BANDAI Holdings Inc., is a leading global publisher and developer of interactive content  including all major video game consoles, iOS, mobile and online.  The company is known for creating and publishing many of the industrys top video game franchises, including PAC-MAN, Tekken, SOULCALIBUR, NARUTOTM, NARUTO SHIPPUDENTM, Dragon Ball, GALAGA, RIDGE RACER and ACE COMBAT.  More information about the company and its products can be found at www.namcobandaigames.com or www.facebook.com/namco.

Game Console Software Engineer, YouTube    Location: San Bruno (YouTube) Team: Software  This position is based in San Bruno, CA. The area: YouTube and Video The first video posted on YouTube was a 19-second clip called "Me at the Zoo." Today, more than 72 hours of video are uploaded every minute. The YouTube and Video team helps budding filmmakers and musicians build careers, creates products like Google TV and YouTube Live and runs collaborative projects like Life in a Day and the YouTube Space Lab. We are changing how people entertain, inform, share and change the world, one video at a time. The role: Game Console Software Engineer, YouTube As part of our team you'll be working as a Software Engineer developing versions of YouTube to work with next generation game consoles. You will have an opportunity to try novel and unconventional ideas and launch frequent experiments to the YouTube user base. You will have a chance to get immediate feedback on user interface, human interaction design, and interest. You will be working with a variety of languages during the development process. Responsibilities:  Build the next generation game-console-based TV experience with You Tube video content. Deliver a compelling lean back experience with monetization and e-commerce offerings (ie, pay-per-stream, ads). Integrate and optimize with distribution channels and devices including all major game platforms. Develop leading edge User Interfaces and delight users with innovative media rich solutions.  Requirements:  BS in Computer Science preferred (Master's a plus) At least 3 years of professional video game programming experience Experience with engine development on at least one major platform Deep technical knowledge of Microsoft Xbox 360, Sony PlayStation 3 and/or Nintendo Wii Skills: C++, Java, Javascript, HTML, Python, ActionScript, Systems, UI Design and Implementation Credited on at least 1 published video game in a programmer role

Seeking a talented and intelligent software engineer to join the core development team of a video game studio.QualificationsCandidates must have at least an Associates degree in computer science or a related field and at least 2 years of professional game development experience, or 4 years of other software engineering experience.  The candidates must be an Expert in at least one of the following languages and Proficient in at least one other: ActionScript 3, JavaScript, C#, or Lua.Candidates with experience developing on mobile platforms (iOS, Android, etc.) is a big plus.BenefitsGet to work with a fun and creative group of developers and make a real impact on the final productFrequent and fun company events!Competitive benefits including: health/vision/dental, a flexible spending account, 401K retirement plan, subsidized metro travel, discounted gym membership and generous paid time off and extended holidays.

Programmer-Analyst Senior Designs, modifies, develops, writes and implements software programming applications. Supports and/or installs software applications/operating systems. Participates in the testing process through test review and analysis, test witnessing and certification of software. Provide technical application support for MDOTs PowerBuilder systems. Work directly with system owners during all phases of a project o Build a strong working relationship with system owners and understand their business needs o Review user requests, capture and analyze requirements, design solutions, code and implement system revisions o Troubleshoot problems as they occur. Prepare testing scenarios, procedures, test data and coordinate User Acceptance Testing (UAT). Create and/or modify database stored procedures and make other database changes as required. Initiate action to resolve ambiguous or non-standard business requirements. Plan small to medium size maintenance projects (less than 1000 hours) using the standard development methodology Senior Programmer-Analyst capabilities with 8 or more years of experience, relies on experience and judgment to plan and accomplish goals, performs a variety of complicated tasks, may lead and direct the work of others, may report directly to a project lead or manager, a wide degree of creativity and latitude is expected. The Resource needs good working experience with Java/Struts/Spring/Hibernate & Oracle as an application framework to maintain and/or modernize legacy business applications. Work associated with this project will follow the DTMB standard SUITE Methodology. This covers the system maintenance life cycle and supports project planning best practices for small to medium size projects. Tasks: Senior Programmer-Analyst support is required to assist with the following tasks, in a production setting:         Provide support and assistance to users of specified systems as required, using Oracle and PowerBuilder. Maintain and enhance specified systems as required, using Oracle and PowerBuilder.          Test and implement new releases of specified systems as required Develop new, related systems using Oracle and PowerBuilder.          Document all system changes. Arrange and facilitate meetings with clients to evaluate system needs and gather business requirements.  Work on system design using Use Case Diagrams & Reports. Build logical/physical data models.          Attend weekly meetings to keep the team and management aware of deadlines and changes that affect other outside responsibilities. Maintain constant availability to the clients/customers via e-mail and telephone during working hours.          Work with the Configuration Manager on the Configuration Management needs for the supported system. Work with other DTMB team members when tasks call for a cross-team solution. ? Troubleshoot system problems when production errors occur.          Use the appropriate tools to analyze and document proposed new applications. Use the appropriate tools to coordinate and document maintenance on existing applications.          Learn and understand the client's business process. Use software debugging tools to isolate problems. Use IDE tools to develop and maintain system source code. Use appropriate programming languages to develop and modify procedures, functions, and packages in the client/server environment using PowerBuilder.           Follow Department procedures and development coding standards when developing code. Use appropriate tools to develop and maintain GIS and Mapping capabilities of the system. Document and recommend alternative solutions or application requirements for assigned projects.         Utilize the department's development methodology to research, build, test, document, and implement assigned tasks. Prepare presentation materials for technical review meetings, approval sessions, and application demonstrations. Provide for a document trail of module modifications so that any team member can step in and troubleshoot problems for a specific module.          Assist clients with preparation of help documents and procedure manuals affiliated with assigned projects.  Learn the client's business environment.           Deliverables: Deliverables will not be considered complete until the DTMB Project Manager and/or the system owner has formally accepted them. Deliverables for this project include:  Project Plans for projects greater than 200 hours (estimated).         Detailed documentation for requirements and design solutions. Regular and frequent communication with system owners and users. Application code. Screen design documents. Application release documents and UAT sign-off       Testing scenarios/test cases and test data. Documented test results. Maintain workflow, information notes and attachments for maintenance requests. Coordinate for Users Guides & other documentation with a business audience. Creation and/or update of technical documentation. Data models and standard data dictionary contents using tool provided. Risks and Issues Log. 8+ years of generic IT experience as defined for a Senior Programmer-Analyst. 8 years experience developing complex computer systems using Powerbuilder V9.x + with PFC . 5 years of experience in designing RDBMS objects ,Oracle 10g or higher . 5 years of experience writing PL/SQL code for Stored Procedures ?

CSC, one of the world's most innovative and successful IT services firms, is looking for candidates to help grow our talented consulting team. We are looking for individuals who:Strive for excellence in everything they doBring a partnering approach to their jobFocus on the innovative use of technology to overcome business challengesSeek to work in a environment that respects individual ideas and diversitySpecifically, we are seeking to hire Senior Java/Spring Developers with broad skills to work with clients to design and deliver solutions that meet their specific business objectives. You will provide technical consulting services to clients; contribute to the design and delivery of technical architecture solution components; support the efforts of more experienced consultants; play a quality assurance role by reviewing team work products for accuracy, consistency and ensuring they meet client requirements; and serve as a technical resource on a team or a team leader for other technologists. You will leverage and grow your knowledge and skills in a fast-paced, rewarding environment -- working side-by-side with our team of world class consultants. In addition to a rewarding work environment, CSC offers an outstanding set of benefits. Responsibilities:Develop Java-based applicationsProduce high quality code, on time and on targetEngineer software through its complete life-cycleResearch and understand product requirements to ensure successful beta test, product launch, etc.Participate in testing and system integration testing Technical Skills:6+ years software design and development in Java and Spring Additional experience with J2EE, WebSphere, WebLogic and/or JBoss highly desiredStrong object-oriented analysis & programming skills a plusExperience building high-performance Java systems, performance tuning, and stress and load testingConsulting Skills:Must have excellent interpersonal and communication skills, energy and passion for software developmentAbility to work well with a variety of resources across multiple disciplines including CSC team, vendor team and clientAble to produce high quality code, on time and within effort estimatesMust possess excellent client-facing skillsMust have a proven track record working in a collaborative software development environment.Desire to work in a dynamic team environmentMust be open to national travelThe Company: CSC is one of the world's leading providers of information technology services, helping organizations achieve business results through the effective use of technology. Since its formation in 1959, CSC has earned a customer-centric reputation for developing and managing solutions specifically tailored to each client's needs. No other company offers the same range of professional services and global reach as CSC does in areas such as business and technology strategies, management consulting, information systems consulting and integration, application software, and IT and business process outsourcing. CSC is a leading provider of management and information technology services to commercial and government markets in over 70 countries. Our consulting portfolio spans the full life cycle - from strategy and business process design to technology services, systems integration, application outsourcing and hosting. Our clients benefit from the breadth and depth of our global expertise, but more importantly, CSC goes to market using a team of local experts, creating a relaxed, professional-casual atmosphere, while maintaining a family and people-oriented culture. Are we right for you? CSC offers a variety of challenging opportunities that will draw on your talents while enabling you to grow your intellectual capital in a supportive environment. Learning experiences are offered as a blend of relevant work assignments, training, tools, mentoring and other growth opportunities. We offer many avenues to mastering your chosen profession, while giving you everyday exposure to brilliance in business, technology and people. As one employee puts it "you have the freedom to explore different technologies, the mobility to move from one role to another (or one country to another), and the possibilities of learning from 98,000 colleagues worldwide - without changing employer or losing benefits."  Career Advancement: Your career belongs to you. At CSC, we recognize that you are in control of identifying and achieving your career goals. CSC enables you to take the lead through our formal development planning process. We will help you create a plan for enhancing your skills and experience by providing information, tools, and people that will support your career planning efforts. We have identified over 60 standard roles that exist across CSC Consulting, as well as the corresponding skills needed to succeed in those roles. You can use this information to identify your next assignment or an entire career path anywhere in the U.S. or potentially the world. A career at CSC can be as targeted or eclectic as you are. Expectation for Travel: For the Global Business Solutions division of CSC, all roles require a commitment to 100% travel. This doesn't mean that a person will always be traveling for assignments, but new Consultants joining the CSC team need to understand that they could be assigned to a travel role. The staffing process focuses on assigning people to local roles as a first priority, however, if a Consultant is available and has the right skills for an assignment for another CSC office across the United States, the Consultant may be staffed into that travel assignment. When this happens, they travel to the project location at the start of the week, return at the end of the work week and are home during the weekends.  --------------------------- Below is the generic description for this position ------------------ Essential Job Functions  Gathers technical requirements and translates requirements into hardware and software capabilities (Technical). Communicates technical architecture direction and coordinates technical proof of concept analyses (Technical). Assists in solving technical and performance problems within the technical infrastructure (Technical). Develops required work products for technology, application, and data domains of change (Methodology). Leads a team of 3-5 resources (company, client and third-party resources), in area of expertise, to conclusion of a project phase (Management). Participates in providing gap analyses, from a technical perspective, highlighting current state, future state, client needs, best practices and competition (Business). Establishes credibility at all levels with clients and builds problem-solving partnerships with clients and colleagues (Relationship Management). Assists sales staff in qualifying leads and generating proposals (Leverage). Provides leadership and work guidance to less experienced personnel (Leadership). Communicates in formal presentation settings including proposal orals, client workshops and regional internal events; develops proposal sections, methodology work products and formal written deliverables covering area(s) of expertise (Communication).  QualificationsTechnical Skills:6+ years software design and development in Java and Spring Additional experience with J2EE, WebSphere, WebLogic and/or JBoss highly desiredStrong object-oriented analysis & programming skills a plusExperience building high-performance Java systems, performance tuning, and stress and load testingConsulting Skills:Must have excellent interpersonal and communication skills, energy and passion for software developmentAbility to work well with a variety of resources across multiple disciplines including CSC team, vendor team and clientAble to produce high quality code, on time and within effort estimatesMust possess excellent client-facing skillsMust have a proven track record working in a collaborative software development environment.Desire to work in a dynamic team environmentMust be open to national travelBasic Qualifications Bachelor's degree or equivalent combination of education and experience Bachelor's degree in a related field preferred Five or more years of consulting experience with technical architecture analysis and design Experience working with CSC Catalyst and/or equivalent client or vendor-mandated methodology Experience working with one or more technical platforms Experience working with technical infrastructure communication issues of low to medium complexity Other Qualifications One to two years of additional relevant experience in one or more technical specialty areas Good technical infrastructure design skills Good communication skills Ability to manage competing priorities in a complex environment Ability to devise creative technical solutions Ability to convey a strong presence, professional image, and deal confidently with complex technical problems Willingness to travel

We are a Microsoft-centric development company in west-central NJ seeking a seasoned Asp.Net, C#, SQL Developer to create functionality for client websites and web/mobile applications. Deliver technical training and training materials for other functional organizations in the company. Bachelor of Science degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, or a related field. Principal Engineer, Systems ApplicationsSUMMARY Acting as the assigned team focal, and with the minimal supervision, this individual is responsible for defining, documenting, and reviewing all requirements for assigned application development projects and the coordination with software development and test teams. The Principle Systems Applications Engineer is expected to establish and lead the following standard practices and procedures, ensure that all requisite documentation is developed and reviewed with peer groups and stakeholders. The Principle Systems Application Engineer is also expected to work closely with the Product Line Manager, Software team or 3rd party software vendor for each assigned application to ensure that the application that is being developed meets product requirements and take required actions should the team deviate. The Principle System Applications engineer is expected to work with minimal supervision, drive development activities and take accountability for associated scope, schedule and budgets and provide direction and leadership within the development team; being able to make informed decisions relating to their development responsibilities. We are in need of a permanent full-time Microsoft ASP.Net/SQL developer to work at a client location in Florham Park, NJ. This position will be at this location for several years at which time the employee could then transfer to our Washington (Warren County) office permanently. Since you will interact with our client directly, you must possess excellent verbal communication skills. The successful candidate will be a seasoned Asp.Net, C#, SQL Developer who can create functionality for client websites and web applications. We have been in business for 14 years. Ideally, you will have 5+ years of experience writing code, business objects, and SQL queries. All work is done in ASP.NET using C# and Microsoft SQL Server using Microsoft Visual Studio. The work is very interesting and we are constantly implementing new technologies and supporting new lines of business.  JOB DESCRIPTIONYou will work directly at the client location and will be assigned tasks by the project manager. Tasks are of all types, but generally include the following:         Create and design databases, or update existing ones to support new functionality         Create new ASP.Net web based applications from client-approved wireframes.         Maintain existing applications by adding new features or fixing bugs or generating ad hoc reports.         Create business objects to support the application, and implement them using our own list of standard practices.         Document your code using code comments and/or separate documentation.REQUIREMENTS          At least 5 years of experience developing web based applications in C# and ASP.Net using Microsoft Visual Studio.         Solid experience developing Microsoft SQL databases to support the application. You should know how to create stored procedures, temp tables, user functions, table relationships, views, indexes, primary keys, etc.         Solid experience writing code that is efficient and readable. You should know how to create classes, constructors, generic types, code-behind files, and web services. You should know how to wire up datagrid events, forms authentication, field validators, and understand the view state and how to manage it.         You should be able to do basic HTML layout (understand tables and divs and such) and have experience with CSS, JavaScript and DHTML.         LINQ, AJAX or JQuery experience is a must.         Data Warehouse/SSAS/SSRS experience is also a plus.

CSC, one of the world's most innovative and successful IT services firms, is looking for candidates to help grow our talented consulting team. We are looking for individuals who:Strive for excellence in everything they doBring a partnering approach to their jobFocus on the innovative use of technology to overcome business challengesSeek to work in a environment that respects individual ideas and diversitySpecifically, we are seeking to hire Senior Java/Spring Developers with broad skills to work with clients to design and deliver solutions that meet their specific business objectives. You will provide technical consulting services to clients; contribute to the design and delivery of technical architecture solution components; support the efforts of more experienced consultants; play a quality assurance role by reviewing team work products for accuracy, consistency and ensuring they meet client requirements; and serve as a technical resource on a team or a team leader for other technologists. You will leverage and grow your knowledge and skills in a fast-paced, rewarding environment -- working side-by-side with our team of world class consultants. In addition to a rewarding work environment, CSC offers an outstanding set of benefits. Responsibilities:Develop Java-based applicationsProduce high quality code, on time and on targetEngineer software through its complete life-cycleResearch and understand product requirements to ensure successful beta test, product launch, etc.Participate in testing and system integration testing Technical Skills:6+ years software design and development in Java and Spring Additional experience with J2EE, WebSphere, WebLogic and/or JBoss highly desiredStrong object-oriented analysis & programming skills a plusExperience building high-performance Java systems, performance tuning, and stress and load testingConsulting Skills:Must have excellent interpersonal and communication skills, energy and passion for software developmentAbility to work well with a variety of resources across multiple disciplines including CSC team, vendor team and clientAble to produce high quality code, on time and within effort estimatesMust possess excellent client-facing skillsMust have a proven track record working in a collaborative software development environment.Desire to work in a dynamic team environmentMust be open to national travelThe Company: CSC is one of the world's leading providers of information technology services, helping organizations achieve business results through the effective use of technology. Since its formation in 1959, CSC has earned a customer-centric reputation for developing and managing solutions specifically tailored to each client's needs. No other company offers the same range of professional services and global reach as CSC does in areas such as business and technology strategies, management consulting, information systems consulting and integration, application software, and IT and business process outsourcing. CSC is a leading provider of management and information technology services to commercial and government markets in over 70 countries. Our consulting portfolio spans the full life cycle - from strategy and business process design to technology services, systems integration, application outsourcing and hosting. Our clients benefit from the breadth and depth of our global expertise, but more importantly, CSC goes to market using a team of local experts, creating a relaxed, professional-casual atmosphere, while maintaining a family and people-oriented culture. Are we right for you? CSC offers a variety of challenging opportunities that will draw on your talents while enabling you to grow your intellectual capital in a supportive environment. Learning experiences are offered as a blend of relevant work assignments, training, tools, mentoring and other growth opportunities. We offer many avenues to mastering your chosen profession, while giving you everyday exposure to brilliance in business, technology and people. As one employee puts it "you have the freedom to explore different technologies, the mobility to move from one role to another (or one country to another), and the possibilities of learning from 98,000 colleagues worldwide - without changing employer or losing benefits."  Career Advancement: Your career belongs to you. At CSC, we recognize that you are in control of identifying and achieving your career goals. CSC enables you to take the lead through our formal development planning process. We will help you create a plan for enhancing your skills and experience by providing information, tools, and people that will support your career planning efforts. We have identified over 60 standard roles that exist across CSC Consulting, as well as the corresponding skills needed to succeed in those roles. You can use this information to identify your next assignment or an entire career path anywhere in the U.S. or potentially the world. A career at CSC can be as targeted or eclectic as you are. Expectation for Travel: For the Global Business Solutions division of CSC, all roles require a commitment to 100% travel. This doesn't mean that a person will always be traveling for assignments, but new Consultants joining the CSC team need to understand that they could be assigned to a travel role. The staffing process focuses on assigning people to local roles as a first priority, however, if a Consultant is available and has the right skills for an assignment for another CSC office across the United States, the Consultant may be staffed into that travel assignment. When this happens, they travel to the project location at the start of the week, return at the end of the work week and are home during the weekends.  --------------------------- Below is the generic description for this position ------------------ Essential Job Functions  Gathers technical requirements and translates requirements into hardware and software capabilities (Technical). Leads a team of 3-5 resources (company, client and third-party resources), in area of expertise, to conclusion of a project phase (Management). Participates in providing gap analyses, from a technical perspective, highlighting current state, future state, client needs, best practices and competition (Business). Establishes credibility at all levels with clients and builds problem-solving partnerships with clients and colleagues (Relationship Management). Assists sales staff in qualifying leads and generating proposals (Leverage). Provides leadership and work guidance to less experienced personnel (Leadership). Communicates in formal presentation settings including proposal orals, client workshops and regional internal events; develops proposal sections, methodology work products and formal written deliverables covering area(s) of expertise (Communication). Basic to advanced knowledge of PLC programming and HMI configuration with Allen Bradley products is preferred.  Knowledge of the principles of operation and selection for mass, pressure, temperature, flow, and speed sensors and transducers  Knowledge of equipment and tooling selection and design based on process and cleaning requirements  Knowledge of mass and energy balances  Cleaning cycle development and design including evaluation of detergents, test methods, and calculation of residual limits  Familiarity with standard industry analytical techniques and equipment (HPLC, FTIR, Gas Chromatography, NIR, etc.) is preferred  Familiarity with obtaining physical and chemical properties from various resources: USP, BP, EP, Merck Index, Handbook of Pharmaceutical Excipients, PDR, etc.  Familiarity with mathematical modeling of real world processes  Familiarity with root cause analysis and risk assessment techniques (e.g. FMEA)Physical/Mental Requirements:  Mathematical and scientific reasoning ability  Ability to interpret and execute a variety of instructions furnished in written, oral, diagram, or schedule form  Ability to learn quickly and seek out resources to remediate gaps in ones knowledge base.  Ability to work effectively under pressure to meet deadlines. Be accessible to laboratory and pilot plant area(s) and office staff and to use required office equipment. (Distribution types, standard deviation, failure rates, etc)          Comfortable working in CAD environments.          Knowledge of general design and manufacturing methods.          Programming skills are not necessarily required but would be highly desirable. The Mechanical Design Engineer will be working with a team of mechanical and materials engineers, assembly technicians and CNC operators to manufacture the products you design. The work is "hands on", fast paced, challenging and enjoyable. Competency Requirements:         Machine design, machine manufacturing and thorough knowledge of 2D/3D modeling using SolidWorks. Knowledge of SolidWorks Simulation is beneficial.         Minimum of 5 years of machine design experience including bearing types and fits, motor types and drive systems. Experience specking out parts a must.         Possess excellent mechanical and mathematic aptitude         Familiarity with ASME Y14.5 Geometric Dimensioning & Tolerancing (GD&T) Standards.         Extensive knowledge with Engineering Change Orders (ECO) process, ensuring update, prompt review, release, and distribution of related documents and files.          B.S. or M.S. degree in Mechanical Engineering or equivalent work experience.         Must be a self-starter, goal oriented, highly organized, and team oriented. Have a proven track record of on-time, design excellence. Duties and Responsibilities:          Learns companies design practices, systems, processes, and procedures.         Provides imaginative practical solutions to resolve complex problems where program and technical objectives are known.         Participates in customer, project and design review meetings relating to project assignments.         Creates complete product layouts, working detail drawings, sub-assemblies, final assemblies and BOMs.         Performs final drafting review to ensure drawings contain complete dimensional data for engineering and manufacturing purposes.

Product Design Engineer (ESD1012) Company Description:         Magpul Industries Corp. (Magpul) is an innovative design and manufacturing company of firearms accessories for police, military and shooting enthusiasts.   Magpul was founded in 1999 with the intent of developing a simple device to aid in the manipulation of rifle magazines while reloading under stress. The companys name comes from this original product called the Magpul. Over the last decade Magpul has continued to grow and develop using much the same mission and process with a focus on innovation, simplicity, and efficiency.   As a growing industry leader, Magpul is in constant need of talented people who share our vision and passion for our products and our industry. Job Description:         Magpul Industries Corp. is seeking a Product Design Engineer who has a passion for robust and creative product design and the ability to work as part of a team within the design group.  Specific Duties and Responsibilities:          New Product Design & Validation: Works within the Design Department to advise on core engineering aspects during the development of new products.  Major objectives include: 1) Reviewing and analyzing engineering designs for functionality, durability and manufacturability, 2) Reviewing engineering documentation for completeness and clarity 3) Assisting designers with design concepts to meet new product specifications, 4) providing recommendations to optimize designs, 5) Working closely with the data management group to produce the projects technical data package (TDP) including establishing Bills of Material and critical design components tolerances 6) Developing and conducting lab experiments to validate designs, 7) Evaluating and qualifying prototypes, first-article samples, new suppliers and manufacturing processes, 8) Advising on assembly tooling and fixtures, and 9) Working closely with the manufacturing group to facilitate the transition of new products from design into manufacturing.          General Support: Promote Magpul Foundations and enforce internal policies, procedures, goals, objectives, and good manufacturing practices.          Other Duties: Perform other duties as assigned.Education and Experience Requirements:         Education: BS Mechanical Engineering from an accredited college.         Experience: Applied Design Engineering with 5+ years experience. Job Knowledge, Skill and Ability Requirements:         Communication: Must have proven skills and be an excellent verbal and written communicator.         Design: Proven track record of consumer product or related design experience with extreme attention to detail.  Design of polymer-based consumer products is desirable.Mechanisms: Experience in mechanism and mechanical system design with strong kinematic background.Manufacturing Engineering: Broad spectrum knowledge of manufacturing concepts with knowledge and experience of plastic injection molding.  An advanced specialization in plastic injection molding is desirable.  CAD/CAE: Must be proficient with solid modeling and finite element analysis (FEA) software packages.  SolidWorks and COSMOS knowledge is preferable.TDP: Ability to read, analyze, interpret and correct mechanical drawings including tolerancing, Geometric Dimensioning & Tolerancing (GD&T) and related engineering specifications.Mechanical Aptitude: Very strong, demonstrated mechanical aptitude required.Time Mgmt: Ability to prioritize multiple projects.Adaptability: Must be proficient in learning new concepts while working in a highly dynamic environment.  Must be able to seamlessly work across boundaries and interact with management, factory personnel, other engineers, suppliers and customers.         Attitude: Enthusiastic, cooperative, and positive behavior with solution-oriented focus.         Leadership: Lead engineer experience is a plus.Weapon Systems Knowledge: Must be a firearms enthusiast.  Working knowledge of firearms and related systems is highly preferable.Job Knowledge, Skill and Ability Requirements:         Organizational: This position reports to the Design Manager         Salary: Competitive salary commensurate to experience.         Benefits: Benefits include medical, dental, vision, life and long-term disability insurance as well as voluntary short-term disability and accident insurance.          Background: Must be eligible to work in the United States for any employer. The applicant must be authorized to receive Technical Data and/or Technology under U.S. export control laws.  Any offer made is contingent on the applicant passing a background check that will include a restricted party screening and, for prospective employees who are Foreign Persons, on the Company obtaining all necessary export licenses.  In addition the applicant will be required to pass a criminal background check and drug screening.  Active or former security clearance is a plus. Reply with resume, product portfolio, salary history and requirements by email to hrm@magpul.com    Please refer to the listed job title and code in the subject line of your email (Product Design Engineer (ESD1012)).     Magpul is an equal opportunity employer.

Perform as the lead mechanical engineer on hardware development projects, with responsibility for prototype designs through verified deliverables.   Immediate duties will focus on the design, analysis and test of a micro-satellite spacecraft and associated mechanical ground support equipment for the CYGNSS mission. SUPERVISION RECEIVED:This position reports to the SPRL Assistant Director for Technical Operations.  Project direction will be received from Principal Investigators and Project Managers within the Laboratory. SUPERVISION EXERCISED:This position will direct engineers and technical staff within project teams.DUTIES:  Develop and coordinate requirements and specifications for mechanical elements of spacecraft, instruments and ground support equipment  Design, document, specify, assemble, and test mechanical systems, mechanisms and components  Develop reduced analysis models and perform finite-element analyses of spacecraft and instrument designs to predict structural and thermal performance in their intended environments  Conduct structural and thermal tests of spacecraft and instruments to validate analysis predictions  Prepare and present requirements, designs, analyses and test results at formal project reviews  Support new project proposalsMINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS:  Bachelors Degree in Mechanical Engineering   5 years experience in Finite Element Analysis, using NASTRAN or ANSYS  Experience in the performance of classical stress, modal and thermal analyses for aerospace or automotive structures and systems.  2 years design experience using solid modeling tools (i.e., SolidWorks, Pro-Engineer, etc.)  Demonstrated understanding of common mechanical design and manufacturing processes and of mechanical design and documentation standards  Significant experience working constructively as a member of project teamsDESIRED QUALIFICATIONS:  Experience in the design of equipment for high-voltage, vacuum, optical, radio frequency, space, and airborne applications  Experience with thermal vacuum and vibration table test equipment  Experience in the design of structures and thermal management systems for space applications.  Experience with Geometric Dimensioning and Tolerancing (GD&T)  Experience with Failure Modes and Effects Analyses The University of Michigan, as an equal opportunity/affirmative action employer, complies with all applicable federal and state laws regarding nondiscrimination and affirmative action. Consistently develop unique and innovative approaches in the solution of critical problems and broad design issues, impacting the product success and addressing future products and technologies.7. Assign and check work of mechanical designers, eliminate ordinary difficulties and report on results. Knowledge of LABVIEW required.

Knowledge and familiarity of underlying technologies and architectures for HPC system capabilities. TrueCar helps achieve these goals by providing unbiased market information on new car transactions and by supplying an online communications platform through which dealers and consumers can communicate with each other. TrueCar's market-based information provides both consumers and dealers with an accurate and comprehensive understanding of what others actually paid recently for similar vehicles, both locally and nationally. TrueCar's communications platform then allows informed, ready-to-buy consumers to communicate directly with participating dealers. Some of the nation's largest and most well respected membership and service organizations, including Consumer Reports, AAA, USAA, GEICO, Progressive and American Express, rely on websites powered by TrueCar to help educate their members and customers who are in the automotive market. TrueCar's nearly 5,000 participating dealer partners have sold over 600,000 new and used vehicles to TrueCar users nationwide. TrueCar is headquartered in Santa Monica, CA, and has offices in Santa Barbara, San Francisco and Austin, TX. Weve made the list of fastest growing companies for both Inc. Magazine and Los Angeles Business Journal and are developing a suite of products and services centered on radical clarity through the comprehensive analysis of market data and information. Now, we need more great people to help us pull off the next big thing. Join us.

Would you like to develop a massively scalable and high-throughput distributed system that provides insightful analytics that power multi-billion dollar decision making? Are you looking to make true impact to the bottom line of a growing new company? Our Direct client is building the next generation analytics platform for hedge funds using the latest in distributed computing and data visualization. The firm distills the subtle signals in large datasets to highlight the strengths and weaknesses of investment decisions, guiding investors to better results. The company is growing rapidly and is looking to expand their Back End Engineering team with the industrys top talent. This is a young product, offering an opportunity to shape the core platform while learning the ins and outs of hedge fund investing. The firm approaches finance with a fresh perspective, relying on the best in open source, computational algorithms, big data analysis, functional programming, and distributed computing. You will join a highly skilled team of passionate, innovative, and intellectually curious engineers that come from diverse backgrounds and share a common thirst for growth, impact by innovation, and open source participation.. The environment is highly collaborative and multi-disciplinary.   Responsibilities     Take ownership of various initiatives to build client      solutions, new products, and internal toolsArchitect and develop core platform infrastructure to      scale with the growth of users, products, and dataInvestigate, select, and implement various      infrastructure libraries for distributed caching and computingWork across the development stack to build various      products driven by R&D, CEO, and Product OwnersCollaborate with Front End development team to      implement business logic based on UX needs Become an expert in Scala, Mongo DB and various      open source libraries we use Build reusable and clean code and ensure quality      through thorough unit and regression tests      Qualifications     A Computer Science degree from a top university program      (Undergraduate or Graduate)2 + years of experience working with complex Core Java      or Scala Enterprise SystemsDeep knowledge of the JVM, Core Java (5,6,7) and      general development toolsetsSerious experience with building high traffic, scalable      and high performance systemsStrong appreciation for architecture, problem solving,      testing and agile developmentAptitude and interest in distributed computing and      caching paradigmsRudimentary skills using SQL and an understanding of      various NOSQL offerings (Mongo DB)Experience in the following is a plus but not required:      Scala, SQL, Mongo, NoSQL, Open Source      Personal Traits     High enthusiasm, high integrity, and low ego; the focus      is on a strong team rather than individual starsCreative thinker able to solve complex problems with      inventive solutionsMust enjoy a fast-paced, results oriented environment      with an agile product life-cycleAptitude for flexible component based architecture and      clean design while remaining pragmaticDriven strategic thinker with ability to take a product      from inception to releaseClear verbal and written communication, attention to      detail, and high level of professionalismDesire to work across the development stack and learn      technologies outside of core competencyDesire to pursue an deeper education in finance through      courses, CFA, CAIA or MBA program                       <!--  /* Font Definitions */ @font-face 	{font-family:"Courier New"; General Dynamics Advanced Information Systems (GDAIS) is part of General Dynamics and has been a trusted partner to the U.S. intelligence, maritime, space and homeland communities for more than 50 years. With the expertise to lead, the insight to deliver and the commitment to succeed, we staff each mission with a carefully selected team of seasoned professionals. Headquartered in Falls Church, Va., General Dynamics employs approximately 91,000 people worldwide. The company is a market leader in advanced information systems, intelligence collection and processing, business aviation, land and expeditionary combat systems, armaments and munitions, shipbuilding and marine systems, and information systems and technologies. General Dynamics is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer that is committed to hiring a diverse and talented workforce.General Dynamics Advanced Information Systems (GDAIS) has an immediate opening for a Software Engineer - High Performance Computing Systems to join our team. The position provides an opportunity to develop the cutting-edge technology that supports some of our nations fundamental defense services. GDAIS employees work closely with esteemed clients to develop solutions that allow them to carry out high-stakes national security missions. The selected candidate will work with collaborative teams to build and further advance GDAIS software systems and applications. In addition to receiving a competitive salary and generous health and personal benefits, the Senior Software Engineer will enhance their skill set by working among a talented and technically accomplished group of colleagues. The employee will also enjoy a flexible work environment where contributions are recognized and rewarded. Key Responsibilities Software Engineer - High Performance Computing Systems conduct or participate in the research, design and development of software systems and applications. Responsibilities also include enhancements, modifications and corrections to existing software. In addition, these employees are responsible for coding, testing, integrating and documenting software solutions.   The candidate should be familiar with emerging technologies and industry trends with recent experience in a software developer role.Additional Responsibilities Exercise creative thinking and ideation to advance our business performance.Deliver innovative, flexible, integrated solutions to meet customers changing business needs.Support and engage in programs, projects and practices behind the GDAIS culture and strategy, and comply with all policies and procedures.Follow industry and department trends and developments to ensure GDAISs services are consistent with, and/or superior to, industry best practices.Candidates must demonstrate a passion for innovation, a sophisticated understanding of software systems and applications, and the ability to effectively manage, grow and evolve GDAIS software solutions. The Software Engineer - High Performance Computing Systems position requires a bachelors degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, or equivalent field and two to five years of related experience; or masters degree and zero to two years of related experience.   Candidate should have experience with the following:  C/C++, scripting languages (ie. Python, Perl, BASH), operating systems (Linux, Unix), device drivers, file systems, networking applications, and benchmarking software.  Candidate should have good written, verbal and presentation communication skills.Department of Defense TS/SCI with Polygraph security clearance is required within 12 months of hire.  Applicants selected will be subject to a U.S. Government security investigation and must meet eligibility requirements for access to classified information. Due to the nature of work performed within our facilities, U.S. citizenship is required.
