Leveraging its knowledge of signals and data derived from signals, Information Solutions has attained a market-leading position in advanced information technology research, intelligence analysis and production, and geospatial exploitation software.People are the greatest asset in any Company ... BAE Systems is committed to a high performance culture and provides an environment that challenges our employees to be remarkable and obtain their full potential. We are an EEO/Affirmative Action Employer that understands the value of diversity and its impact on a high performance culture. Join us ...

Senior Project Manager  Big Data Analytics  Company DescriptionLeading Content Recommendations Engine for IPTV providers, Satellite and Cable. Founded with one mission in mind, to develop the best data mining technology in the world for business analysis and insight. The companys core technologies now lead the way in content recommendations, automated real-time predictive analytics and data mining. Based on best practice from a number of sources including customers, partners and industry experts, we offer customers a combination of advanced technology and industry expertise.  Job DescriptionAs a Senior Project Manager you will be working in a fast paced and professional environment in our Los Angeles development office, where you will be given full responsibility for the delivery of customized solutions of the recommendations engine to the North American market. To achieve this you will be managing all aspects of customer interaction, managing a number of local development teams, as well as coordinating planning activities with the Product management team. Desired Skills & Experience         At least 5 years Project Management experience in a Product driven environment         Possess an understanding of the content recommendations, real-time data-mining and predictive analytics market space         Ability to manage a number of concurrent projects through all stages of the systems lifecycle from project kick off, requirements gathering, hardware specification, development, documentation, testing through to project acceptance and ongoing support         Ability to manage project risks, issues and costs to deliver high quality releases on time and to budget          Ability to monitor and control team performance against plans, and to take corrective action when necessary         Possess first-class customer facing skills, including a positive attitude with clients at all times, as well as the ability to drive weekly progress calls, produce regular project reports/schedules and manage the reporting of all project issues, dependencies and milestones         Strong written, presentation, and verbal communication skills combined with high energy levels, resilience and an autonomous work style with the ability to take the initiative and deliver results         Ability to foster a high performance team culture. Ensuring that the context, rationale and purpose of the project is clear to all team members at all timesTravel as necessary to attend customer kick off and progress meetings.MS Word, Excel and ProjectUS citizenship requiredBSc in Computing Science or equivalent

Web Developer, Technical Escalation Specialist Responsibilities include Assist in monitoring and completing all incoming website requests from the client service teamMentor the client service team on internal web development best practices and techniquesWork closely with the client service team to troubleshoot live website issues and implement fixesParticipate in external client calls as a technical resourceWork with managers to identify training needs for individuals and groups based on recurring requests or new technologies. Intelligent information is a unique synthesis of human intelligence, industry expertise and innovative technology that provides decision-makers with the knowledge to act, enabling them to make better decisions faster. Physical Design EngineerJob Description: As a Physical Design Engineer, you will play a leading role in the physical design of digital circuits for image sensor and image processing products. You will work on RTL to GDS flow for layout, including synthesis, placement, clock tree insertion and routing. You will also participate in post GDS validation like DRC/LVS, timing closure sign-off, scan validation etc. You need to work closely with other groups like Analog Design, Systems, Applications and Production in determining architecture and specification of the products. Responsibilities: Analog Design, Systems, Applications and Production of productsWorking on RTL-to-GDS flow for layoutFunction as team member to support engineering project Requirements: Minimum 5 years experience in physical design, preferably related to imaging or image processing products.Solid knowledge of Magma Talus design tool.Solid knowledge of tcl scripting, timing constraints, and timing closureVerilog RTL design experience.Experience with DFT (Design for Test)Experience with sign-off tools like PrimeTime and Calibre.Experience in integrating 3rd party IPs.Experience with digital simulation, synthesis and timing sign-off tools.BS (or foreign equivalent) in Electronic Engineering, Computing Science, a Physical Science, Mathematics or a related discipline. MS preferred. Perks: The company will sponsor H1B visa transfer.Full benefitsSkills/Qualifications/Keywords: Design job, digital circuits job, image processing job, DFT job, career, salary,If you have a friend or colleague you would like to refer to this position, we offer an excellent referral bonus program.If interested in this excellent opportunity, please send your resume in a Word document to: daniel@fusion408.comDaniel Henry | Senior Technical Advisor ?xml:namespace prefix = o ns = "urn:schemas-microsoft-com:office:office" /Fusion408 | 107 West Main Street | Knoxville, TN 37902(408).298.9600 Voice Daniel@fusion408.com| www.Fusion408.com

descriptionThe Technical Services group is responsible for responding to technical enquiries on all Lab Essentials products and providing those customers with appropriate support promptly. The Technical Service representatives therefore work in a challenging but highly stimulating environment, and, are an important part of our service to, and interface with, our customers.-Handle incoming requests (phone, e mail, fax & web) from customers, end users & sales reps regarding technical questions, cross referencing and complaints using internal data sources - all with a high level of customer satisfaction.-Document any product complaints and take required course of action through credits, replacements & int / ext follow up to ensure full resolution of the complaint, including final letters to customers.-Implementation and management of product recalls.-Assist marketing and sales with relevant projects where necessary.-Actively identify areas of improvement to limit credits and improve the image and value of our products and services.-Develop, update and implement ISO SOP's for both the customer and Technical service.-Recommend changes to SOPs where appropriate.-Provide and document any ISO SOP training to customers and Technical service.-Arranging LE instrument servicing using relevant SOPs.-In conjunction with Sales Support Manager and/or Technical Manager evaluate the complaint to determine if it warrants investigation.-Decision made on material returns and credits to value of $500 cost.-Participates on Material review board to determine product recalls.This position will deal with all functional areas.This is a temporary to perm position, benefits, easy commute (on/off highway)Working hours: 9am-6pm or 1pm-8pmQualifications:BS in Chemistry is a minimum; MS in Chemistry would be an advantageExperience:Minimum 2 years working in a chemical laboratory, preferably QC, to include "hands on" familiarization with / routine use of instrumental techniques such as HPLC, GC, Spectroscopy, Mass Spectrometry etc. (for example Pharma QC lab). Knowledge related to Peptide synthesis is a plus. Knowledge and familiarization with safe laboratory practices is mandatory. Experience with cytology and hematology staining techniques would be an advantage. Good telephone and interpersonal skills are essential as a "customer centric attitude" is mandatory. Technical service experience would be a distinct advantage as would any customer service or other "customer interface" experience.BONUS: Flexible hours and possibility of working remotely!!! Flexibility to work between the hours of 8-6pm or 1pm-8pm!Contact: Elizabeth VincentElizabeth.Vincent@randstadusa.comRandstad is a world leader in matching great people with great companies. Our experienced agents will listen carefully to your employment needs and then work diligently to match your skills and qualifications to the right job and company. Whether you're looking for temporary, temporary-to-permanent or permanent opportunities, no one works harder for you than Randstad.

We are seeking a senior level Network Engineer who will be responsible for providing LAN and WAN implementations. They will provide low level design, document build and configuration sheets, migration plans and execute the implementations. They will also part of the level 3 escalation group  which provides 24X7 supports for globally deployed network.  Duties and responsibilities:Manage project work for network engineering tasks and core deliverables.Implement LAN and WAN technologies working with various ITS support and engineering teams.Work with network architecture and engineering for design  and planning phases24x7 oncall rotation support for L3 escalations.Administer and troubleshoot level 3 incidents for LAN and WAN.Lead project based deployment teams with an engineering team.Create and Maintain documentation of the environment and operational procedures. We are the leading source of intelligent information for the world's businesses and professionals, providing customers with competitive advantage. Intelligent information is a unique synthesis of human intelligence, industry expertise and innovative technology that provides decision-makers with the knowledge to act, enabling them to make better decisions faster. We deliver this must-have insight to the financial and risk, legal, tax and accounting, intellectual property and science and media markets, powered by the world's most trusted news organization.Required Skills and Experience:Minimum 6 years relevant experience in planning, design, implementation/engineering role on supporting large heterogeneous enterprise network infrastructureSenior level experience managing and trouble-shooting complex network infrastructure in LAN/WAN environment with expertise in Routers, Switches, wireless, Firewalls from Cisco, Bluecoat Proxy and Checkpoint, etc,.Should have a high degree of competency in technical areas: Networking Protocols/Services BGP, OSPF, IPSec, GRE, HSRP/VRRP, NAT/PAT, SNMP, MPLS, VPLS, QoS, Multicast, STP, 10GigE, GigE, 10/100 Ethernet, T1, DS3, SONET, GTM, LTM, DNS, Application Firewalls etc.Adequate project management skills and ability to manage time and complex tasksGood understanding of the MPLS technology and applications such as L3 VPN, L2 VPN and VPLS from a provider point of viewMust have documentation skills and be proficient with MS VisioFamiliar with the ITIL service modelPMP/PMI certification is a plusActive in pursuing learning opportunitiesAbility to convey a strong presence, professional image, and deal confidently with highly complex technical problemsStrong interpersonal and communication skills and the ability to work effectively with a wide range of constituencies in a diverse community and ability to communicate technical information to non-technical personnelStrong critical thinking and analytical skills.Excellent customer service and communication skills. Desired Skills and Experience:6- 8 years experience on network implementations or support. Certifications:CCNP preferred. At Thomson Reuters, we believe what we do matters. <![endif]  1.   Design and debug CMOS image sensor chips, perform chip integration and timing closures of multi-million gate state-of-the-art CMOS image sensor.  2.     Design and verify high speed communication interfaces and systems for image sensor.  3.     Implement image signal processing algorithm with hardware/software co-design.  4.     Conduct ASIC design flow for digital circuits in sensor chips, including RTL coding, simulation, synthesis, STA, formal verification and post simulation.  5.     Handle the system control of the image sensor design, interface with the sensor array/analog circuitry, integrate required IPs into the design, and deliver the whole sensor project.  6.     Build chip top of image sensor using schematic capture tools, develop new functional IPs and conduct ECOs.           Require M.S. in Electrical Engineering.         Require skills or coursework in ASIC flow with Cadence/Synopsys tools, low power CMOS design using schematic capture tools, Marvell.  Moving Forward Faster.Marvell offers revolutionary devices that touch every point of the communications infrastructure:  switching, transceivers, wireless, PC connectivity, communications controllers, and storage.  Our continuous cycle of innovations has enabled Marvell to consistently deliver the industrys gold standard, emerging as the market leader in virtually all of our product categories. Position Description:Marvell creates next generation SoC solutions using Marvells broad portfolio of system, imaging and communication IP. Our solutions have garnered numerous industry awards and lead many market segments in features and value. We are looking for a Senior Digital SoC system design & verification engineer who will contribute to all phases of SoC & Imaging systems development including SoC architecture, block level specifications, RTL coding in Verilog, simulation using SystemVerilog, FPGA emulation & silicon testing. Come be a part of a fast-paced, energetic development team and help us create tomorrows solutions today!This SoC system engineer will develop industry leading, optimized solutions and/or SoCs for imaging & communication consumer products. Responsibilities include all phases of development including planning, architecture, design, implementation, test, qualification, and release. Will work as part of a global team to deliver world-class solutions. To Apply Visit Marvell SemiconductorQualifications:Minimum: MS EE, CE, or equivalent with 5 years experience in SoC implementation. Demonstrated skills in SoC architecture and digital circuit system design and solid understanding of Verilog &/or VHDL, and SystemVerilog  Demonstrated skills in ASIC/FPGA design, simulation, and synthesis Must have excellent verbal and written communication skills Must be able to work independently Must be able to work effectively and effeciently with teams in other geographical areasPreferred: MS EE, CE or equivalent and 10 years experience in SoC system implementation Demonstrated experience defining and architecting electronic components for consumer products Demonstrated experience in SoC system design and hardware implementation of complex image/data processing algorithms, security solutions, Video/Audio solutions, and/or low power analysis & implementation Excellent analytical problem solving skills & the ability to work independently on challenging projects are required to excel in this position.

:Data Architect.  Location :Harrisburg, PA.  Duration :Permanent.  Sure Shot Placement.     IT Architect - Data Management:  The IT Data Architect is a key role in the Business Intelligence Technical Services and Architecture team and works closely with business leaders and users to define, develop and implement the data architecture for business intelligence applications. This includes working closely with business users to define data requirements, developing the data architecture design, logical data models (Dimensional Data Model Design, Star Schema, Snow Flake, etc.) and implementing and optimizing the physical data models. The IT Data Architect will also assist to define and document the technical architecture of the business intelligence platform, including the physical components and their functionality. This position will have broad knowledge of data sources, data integration and data flow. This position also designs processes to extract, transform, cleanse and load data. The IT Data Architect is a champion for data analysis, logical and physical data modeling, ETL Technical Architecture Design and provides technical mentoring to other IT staff to support skills development focused on the next generation TE Data Warehouse (TED 2.0) program.     Responsibilities & Qualifications:  Primary Responsibilities:  Data Management:  Developing and maintaining enterprise data strategy and roadmaps for Business Intelligence, Data Warehouse and Master Data Management.  Selection of new technology platforms to support the next generation data warehouse and facilitate development of proof of concept / prototypes.  Developing and maintaining guest/customer data management strategies, models and designs.  Work closely with business users to interpret the data needs of the business and translate those to logical / physical data models and data designs.  Develop entity-relationship / Dimensional data models for relevant projects with a focus on the next generation data warehouse.  Design the data integration architecture including selection of ETL Vendor products and implementation of ETL solutions using one of the leading ETL packages (e.g., SAP Data Integrator, Informatica.)  Design and implementation of an operational data store and data warehouse on one of the leading database platforms (e.g., Oracle, SAP HANA, Teradata.)  Document data management processes and mentor other IT staff to develop data analysis and data modeling skills.  Research new technologies in the Industry and make recommendations on the use of these technologies/ vendor products to support these business needs.  Provides input to management on accomplishing long-term goals and objectives for the TED 2.0 Program.  Drives results primarily through collaboration and influence within the team and across the TEIS Organization.  Collaborates with other colleagues and peers in the technical - business community.     Data Quality and Governance:  Ability to conduct discovery, perform root cause analysis, and make recommendations for the remediation of data quality issues.  The ability to design and recommend data policies and governance structures and control frameworks for the ongoing management of data.     REQUIRED TECHNICAL SKILLS:  Minimum of 12 plus years of experience in the IT Industry.  Minimum of 7 plus years of experience with Business Intelligence data architecture design for Data Warehouse / Datamart / Operational Data Store.  5 plus years in Dimensional Modeling (star schema) data modeling is required.  Expertise using data modeling tools ( For eg: ERwin, E/R Studio ..).  In-depth knowledge of BI Application development full life cycle.  Good understanding of data relationships in SAP modules such as MM, PP, QM, FI, Costing, APO would be a big plus.  Knowledge of business intelligence best practice processes, tools, standards and practices.  Strong analytical and conceptual design skills; strong problem-solving skills.  Demonstrated experience and success in facilitation of reporting and analytics business requirements would be desired.  Hands on experience in developing and implementing enterprise data architecture and complex data models for operational and data warehouse applications.  In depth knowledge of Data Integration concepts, approaches, and tools and the role of data architecture in successful implementation of data integration strategy.  Familiarity and preferably hands-on knowledge of Metadata Management and Master Data Management (MDM) concepts, approaches, and tools.  In depth knowledge of business processes and business information models in a data warehousing context preferably in a SAP BW Environment.     EDUCATION:  BS / BA in Computer Science, Business, Mathematics, Engineering or Equivalent with 12 Years IT Experience or Master's Degree with 10 Years plus experience in the IT Industry.        -------  Best Regards,  MD Javeed  Sr. Account Manager    _____     R&D International I, Inc.  6413 Gallery Street, Suite A  Bowie, MD 20720  Email: Javeed@randdcorp.com  Direct: 202-903-0391  Fax: (301) 262-4995  Website: www.randdcorp.com

experience with UML notation           Ability to translate requirements into Information Models (data models in UML notation), generate data dictionary and complete documentation for models experience on Configuration & Change Management process to enable                       a working knowledge on DoDAF Data Viewpoint (DIVs) - preferred           Familiar with CMMI and ISO 9001:2008 Job description The ideal candidate for this position has a computer science background and should have outstanding data analytics skills combined with an applied knowledge of human-computer interaction and a passion for building systems that apply analytics to real world applications. We are an interdisciplinary team, particularly interested in incorporating analytics into the mix, including but not limited to data mining, information retrieval, decision-making, predictive modeling, network analysis, machine learning, recommender and filtering systems. Ideally, the candidate will also have a record of designing, building, deploying, and studying systems and novel user interactions. Developing software for real users at various scales, small teams to enterprise-wide, is an integral part of what we do and is expected of the candidate. Having published in key conferences in the above areas is a plus (e.g. CHI, CSCW, CIKM, RecSys, UMAP, AAAI etc.).  Required  Master's Degree  Basic knowledge in Data mining, information retrieval, recommender systems, data modelling, predictive analytics, human computer interaction, social software  Readiness to travel 10% travel annually  English: Intermediate    Preferred  Doctorate Degree  English : Fluent    IBM is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status.

Adecco Engineering & Technical is a division of the world leader in the recruitment of engineering and information technology professionals.  Our office specializes in Direct Hire and Contract to Hire technical careers within the United States. Looking for an Information Program Director for a DIRECT HIRE opportunity with a top health system in the US.  Northeast Ohio Campus --Data Warehouse - Business Intelligence - Analytics—---Domain Expert, Process Owner, Business Analyst, Information Manager-- This person will play an integral role for the management of enterprise information to result in reduction of cost and legal issues, improved compliance, and value creation for the business.  The focus of the program will deal with revenue streams and critical care cycles within the EMR (Electronic Medical Records system). Functions/ResponsibilitiesParticipates in enterprises, department or group-wide document or information management and projects Involved with email archiving, records management projects and be present for requirements discussion about information access, retrieval, and policy developmentSupervise the systematic cataloging and retention work around legacy information and dataCreate and use templates and data models for management of information and link to other data management efforts in the companyWork with various individuals to ensure that local data and content stores conform to the uniform and consistent identifiers, formats, and protocols necessary for sharing and exchanging enterprise information Engage data modelers to help specify master data descriptions that work across structured and unstructured information stores Engage DBA’s SAN Administrators to coordinate physical storage requirementsConduct business-unit specific document and data inventories ad document the businesses processes around them Create templates and document metadata that allows lifecycle management of content Work with user groups, legal, compliance and finance depts to create and implement retention and destruction policiesMake presentations to the Board of Directors regularly Minimum QualificationsBachelors or Masters degree in a related fieldLeadership and IT Program Management experience focusing on Data Warehousing, BI and Analytics on a multi-year large system scale; including ERP system building and maintenance Scope development, requirements analysis, implementation, training, and ongoing maintenance of unstructured content management system (web content, records management, document imaging and workflow, email archiving) Healthcare industry and EPIC experience a plus, but not required.  Please send resume to danielle.wehner@adeccona.com   . EOE Relocation assistance available.  Must be eligible to work for an employer in the US.Apply Online

We are at the intersection of advertising and entertainment - where enjoyment meets solid business strategy. We marry the best strategists and creative minds with an army of in house experts in the fields of animation, design, film and video production, sound design, music and online programming. As technology changes, people change with it. Reaching your customer is no longer as easy as airing a 30-second spot in primetime - it requires breaking through filters. That's where we come in. This consists of data analysis and delivery of insight on a wide range of internal and external based data sets needed to drive development of fact-based business plans. Success is measured by the quality, effectiveness and timeliness of data retrieval, information analysis, insight generation and effective packaging of data to drive action. The role also includes leadership of key elements of the market planning process, direct support of marketing initiatives and effective incorporation of key marketing and enterprise tools. This role will be based out of our L.A office in Culver City, California. REQUIRED SKILLS & EXPERIENCE:In support of developing business plans, extract, analyze, and package key market data (e.g., opportunity data, demographics, sales execution, network data, competitor info, producer info)Serve as liaison with business development, technical teams, product development and senior managementManage flow of data from critical internal and external data sources.Create system for easy retrieval of most relevant information.Support the development and management of various data modelsSupport end-to-end data review initiative (competitor analysis, opportunity analysis, market evolution, etc.)Participate in prospect identification for targeted competitor marketing campaignsParticipates in business penetration assessment and development of recommendations for market engagement strategies QUALIFICATIONS:Bachelors Degree (Masters/MBA preferred)Marketing analytics and data mining experienceStrategic thinker with ability to connect processes end-to-endUnderstanding of marketing disciplineStrong communication skills (verbal, written), ability to communicate recommendations and findings effectivelyCollaborative team playerAnalytical skills, project management skills***U.S. Citizenship or green card required***

Why Agilex?We have experienced continuous growth and increased revenue since inception! Agilex is an employee-owned, privately held company where achievements are recognized and rewarded. Based in Chantilly, Virginia and founded in 2007, Agilex provides mission and technology consulting, software and solution development, and system integration services. Agilex was founded with the notion to bring together business expertise with the foremost database and IT knowledge to offer clients innovative thinking on leveraging advanced technologies within the Healthcare IT, Intelligence, Homeland Security and Government Services Sectors.  Employees are eligible to earn stock based on performance. Want to work with a group of professionals who have very successful track records and who expect, look forward to and value the ideas of others? If the answer is yes, please take a look at our career opportunities and contact us so that we can talk to you about taking your career to the next level.  Job Description:Agilexs Homeland Security team based in Washington D.C. and the surrounding Metropolitan area has opportunities for you to become part of their high-quality team that delivers innovative solutions to key Federal clients in risk management, enterprise systems development and business process improvement.  In this role, we are seeking a junior to mid-level quantitative analyst to conduct research in topics to statistics and machine learning. The analyst's primary focus would be developing and improving algorithms related to real world problems in the Justice and Homeland Security sector. The analyst would be responsible for implementing the proposed models into a broader suite of client applications and internal libraries. Job Qualifications:Basic responsibilities include the following:Data and model researchAlgorithm designData development and feature selectionModel testing and implementation Note that model implementation would include traditional software development activities such as building data models, using object oriented design principles, integrating with internal or external APIs and code optimization. Basic research acumenAbility to design and implement algorithms related to statistics and machine learningStrong knowledge of regression, classification, numerical linear algebra and statistical inferenceAbility to program in an object oriented language (ex. Java, C#, C++)Knowledge of SQL and common data structuresAbility to work in an unstructured and rapidly changing environmentMust be a United States Citizen and have the ability to obtain and hold a clearance Desired:Advanced knowledge of statistics including Bayesian methodsFamiliarity with natural language processing and information retrievalExperience with structured and unstructured data especially very large data setsKnowledge of object oriented design best practices and design patternsKnowledge of Agile development "2011 GREATER WASHINGTON GOVERNMENT CONTRACTOR OF THE YEAR ($25-75M category)Agilex Technologies, Inc. is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer. M/F/V/D.Agilex - Realize the Value of Information For more information, visit www.Agilex.com

Research Staff Member. IBM Corporation. Yorktown Heights, New York. Research state-of-the-art computer algorithms for extracting, searching and reasoning over information from natural language input and for answering cross-lingual natural language questions. Develop algorithms, tools and infrastructure for conducting large-scale statistical modeling, data extraction and mining. Manage and train an annotation team to produce quality annotation data for developing various statistical models. Perform role using techniques from Natural Language Processing, Information Retrieval, Machine Learning and Knowledge Representation. Utilize C/C++, Java/ PERL, Python, HTML, Javascript, UNIX Shells and Linux. Required: Master's degree or equivalent in Computer Science, Engineering or related and two (2) years of experience as a Research Staff Member, Engineering Intern, Research Assistant or related. Send resumes to IBM, box #F357, 71 Fifth Avenue, 5th Floor, NY, NY 10003.

Join BCBSNCs Information Management team and be a part of the exciting work to expand our Information Management capabilities.  We have a growing team of technical professionals focused on delivering our second generation data warehouse and a foundational Master Data Management solution.  Positions are available in Enterprise Information Modeling, ETL Development, Data Integration Architecture and BI Development.   We have aggressive goals and need self-starters willing to apply their expertise to help us make a real contribution to BCBSNC and the health of North Carolinians.Major Responsibilities:         This job exists for the purpose of data architecting transactional, master data management, and BI systems that support the enterprise data warehouse and all subsequent projects associated with that enterprise data warehouse structure.          Information Modeling -- Ensures that the logical enterprise information model (EIM) is updated with entity and attribute definitions that adequately represent the business and are made shareable across projects. Signs off on work done by Data Integration Architects in performance engineering the departments integration and presentation layers by following current Data Modeling Practice Standards & Guidelines and IM data warehousing architectural principles.          Requirements Analysis -- Determines virtualization versus physicalization of the EDW presentation layer based upon business and technical requirements to ensure that the best approach is used to deliver data to the business in order to meet their analysis and reporting needs.         Architecture  Accountable for Architect related deliverables to ensure all project goals are met within the project time lines by working closely with project team. Collaborates with IM Lead Information Architect in developing the overall data warehouse architecture. Resolves architecture related problems by developing cohesive solutions that benefit the project and the department.         Mapping -- Performs mapping between source and target data, as well as performing logical model to physical model mapping and mapping from third normal form to dimensional (presentation layer).         Standard Query Language -- Oversees the design of and tactical implementation of custom views to ensure optimization based on the RDBMS (Relational Database Management System) being used. Develops end user presentation layer physical structures to support end user reporting needs.          Documentation -- Creates, validates and updates the data dictionary by interviewing IS implementers, business users, querying data directly and analyzing documentation to make sure that the information captured is correct.         Standards & Process -- Provides Data Integration Architect estimates and refines as necessary throughout the system development life cycle to ensure that the Project Manager has the best information possible to create and maintain project schedules. Leads the timely resolution of data architectural issues and problems to reduce the impact on changes to a project. Creates and revises new and existing Data Integration Architect standards and guidelines to ensure that the data warehouse is aligned with the most current strategies, methodologies and architectural visions.         Knowledge Sharing -- Provides knowledge transfer to other data integration architects on staff (internal or external) to ensure that they understand existing architectural policies, procedures and standards. Mentors Data Integration Architects in understanding architectural designs to include advice, training and serving as point of contact for questions on tools and standards. Requirements:         Bachelors degree         5 years of IS data warehouse experience          In lieu of degree, 7 years of IS data warehouse experience 2 years of data warehousing architectural experience  Additional Critical Skills & Knowledge Needed for Job:         Working experience implementing large DBMSs (Teradata/UDB/Oracle)         Aptitude for understanding architectural concepts         Good understanding of project management methodologies         Strong working knowledge of ERWin or similar data modeling tool          Strong working knowledge of ER/Objects/Dimensional modeling concepts          Strong data analysis skill         Focus on customer needs, business processes and relationships of customer data          Ability to achieve and be accountable for timely delivery of architectural results that support business needs          Strong problem solving skills WE CURRENTLY HAVE MULIPLE DATA WAREHOUSE POSITIONS OPEN.  PLEASE VIST OUR US AT www.bcbsnc.com/careers AND REVIEW OTHER OPENINGS: 9882BR  Sr. Data Integration Architect10031BR  Sr. Data Integration ETL Developer9940BR  Sr. BI Developer/Analyst9988BR  BI Solutions Team Lead10054BR  Principle BI Developer Architect, data warehouse, Teradata, etl, ab initio, BI, business objects, developer, modelerArchitect, data warehouse, Teradata, etl, ab initio, BI, business objects, developer, modelerArchitect, data warehouse, Teradata, etl, ab initio, BI, business objects, developer, modelerArchitect, data warehouse, Teradata, etl, ab initio, BI, business objects, developer, modelerArchitect, data warehouse, Teradata, etl, ab initio, BI, business objects, developer, modeler

Note that the following is a general description of the Sales Engineering groups primary tasks and may not, therefore, contain all possible specific work assignments.The Sales Engineer provides pre-sales technical support for all Kofax IC&E products and associated applications. While assigned to a geographic area, Sales Engineers also collaborate with and backup peers from across the country to provide efficient pre-sales support nationwide.The Sales Engineer is responsible for:Preparing standard and custom demonstrations for Kofax Account Managers and resellersThe handling of all pre-sales technical issues professionally and efficientlyMaintaining in-depth knowledge of Kofax IC&E productsMaintaining a working knowledge of content repositoriesMaintaining a working knowledge of workflow systemsUnderstanding Kofax role in supporting business processesResponding to technical questions in RFI/P/QsSharing Best Practices with other SEsProviding feedback to Product Development regarding new features, improving product performance, and eliminating bugs in the productPreparing Kofax Professional Services for efficient installations  professionally managing the transition from pre-sales to post-salesPreparing resellers on the technical aspects of selling Kofax IC&E solutions Practices and proceduresServing as a point of contact for resellers on technical issuesResponding to resellers requests for pre-sale technical support                            Required Skills:                All Kofax Sales Engineers regardless of title or level must possess the following  skills and knowledge:Communications/Listening Skills(Internal & external)  including but not limited to professional writing, problem escalation, and good analysis skills as outlined below.Analysis/Discovery (ROI) -Ability to plan for and conduct an Interview with the prospect and/or customer to determine the true business requirements to help build a valid Return on Investment (ROI).Project ManagementCritical path analysis to do risk assessment, problem decomposition and resource estimation.  Not a concentrated focus on the tools available to manage projects but a working knowledge of the concepts and how they apply in sales situations i.e. knowledge of the theory, not the mechanics.Sales & Presentation SkillsProfessional presentation skills and experience in team selling, solution selling methodologies, and an understanding of and ability to utilize the Kofax Sales ProcessTime ManagementAbility to manage projects including preparation for presentations and demonstrations, training, scheduling, and reporting, and expense processing.  This is critical to the success of the Sales Opportunities as the Sales Engineer will be required to manage multiple sales campaigns at any given time. Industry/General Technology KnowledgeA high level understanding of basic networking and operating system concepts, Visual Basic development / scripting  Ability to develop, test and deploy custom VB/VBA scripts, Java and Java Scripting, Industry specific business pain points with active paper processing, storage, and retrieval, and an understanding of J2EE, XML, .NET, OCR, ICR and their use in business processing.Kofax Technology KnowledgeA high level understanding of each of the suites that constitute the Kofax product line and the ability to fit the pieces together into the whole strategy - This includes the software solutions identified today (KC, KCS, KFS, KTM, VRS, and MarkView) as well as any additional applications and solutions added to the Kofax core moving forward.  This will align the Sales Engineers with the approach that marketing has set forth. By stating the requirement for a high level understanding, it is defined as the ability to:Position the Kofax SolutionUnderstand the components that make each the solution and whyDefine target marketsExplain the business value/value propositionDescribe sample use casesDescribe reference customersPosition and differentiate each solution from the other Kofax technologiesIdentify and Qualify potential opportunitiesUnderstand the applicability of the technology i.e. where the solution is a good fit and where it is a bad fitDeliver high-level presentation and associated click-thru demonstrationUnderstanding of the underlying technology concepts (e.g. Capture, OCR, ICR, lifecycle management, etc)Differentiate new product from current productGeneral Architecture  understanding of how all of the components fit together technically as well as how they integrate and work with external technologies.  This includes an understanding of:Foundation technologies including but not limited to J2EE, XML, IIS, .NET, OCR, ICR, Web ServicesKofax Networking ConstraintsKofax Components and Services                                        Required Experience:                The qualified applicant must demonstrate knowledge of the roles, responsibilities, processes, tools and techniques used by pre-sales technical support and sales departments, and have excellent people skills, communication and negotiation skills along with the ability to perform professional presentations, and extensive, up-to-date technical knowledge in document management and digital processing.Qualifications include:5 years experience supporting a solution sales team in the pre-sales technical roleBachelors degree in information systems, computer science, information technology or a related discipline, or equivalent years of experience.Professional presentation experienceBusiness analysis at both the IT and LOB levelExperience working with various partners/channel organization Ability to travel 50%Able to lift and carry at least 50 poundsKnowledge and experience with Visual Basic and JavaExperience in business process management/software industry is a plus.   Kofax, Inc. is an Equal Opportunity Employer, M/F/D/V

All applicants must have a minimum of 5 years industry experience in order to apply.  No 3rd party resumes accepted. JOB ID: 897740EJ LOCATION: Houston, TX (Downtown) DURATION: Long-term contract position JOB DESCRIPTION:The Technical Team will be responsible for collaborative design and development of an enterprise class multi-tier architecture, supporting both short and long-term rationalization and development initiatives. The Team will work to drive continuous improvements, consistency, and supportability throughout all development initiatives, ensuring alignment with IT Management/Program Office and Best Practices. The Development Database Administrator (Dev. DBA) will support the Technical Team in all database related development tasks and activities. The Dev. DBA will be responsible for managing and maintaining the SQL Server environments, ensuring availability, performance, and security.  The Dev. DBA must have in-depth skills in SQL Server database administration, Windows operating systems, TSQL programming, relational database design, problem solving, and communication.     Roles and Responsibilities:        Setup, Configure, Administer and Maintain: o        SQL Server 2012 Instances o        SQL Server Analysis Services o        SQL Server Reporting Services o        SQL Server CDC         Administer, maintain, support, optimize, and monitor multiple SQL Server database environments (i.e., Dev., Unit Test, User Acceptance Test).         Plan and implement database software upgrades including but not limited to new installations, critical patch upgrades, maintenance releases, and version upgrades.         Administer, maintain, and implement policies and procedures for ensuring the availability, security, and integrity of the databases in accordance with IT Security and Sarbanes-Oxley adherence policies.         Setup and Configure SQL Server High Availability. DescriptionHeadquartered in the heart of Orlando, FL, 4 Corner Resources is a professional recruiting firm specialized in providing technical, engineering, marketing, and administrative professionals for contract and permanent positions with companies throughout the United States. The company supplies consultants across all technical platforms for all stages of the systems development lifecycle. RequirementsThe position can be based in Orlando or LakelandThis position is responsible for engineering and operational activities such as build, test, and day-to-day support of web and PKI technologies used at MVW.Scope: Execution of technology integration tasks and day-to-day support or maintenance activities as directed.  Will provide tier-two support and troubleshooting services for web management products. Services are global in nature and will participate for on-call project support as assigned.Specific Expected Contributions Key Accountabilities: Work with project teams and other groups by performing operational activities relating to web and PKI technologies, including build, testing, monitoring/response, securing the environment, and troubleshooting defects.  Provide operational feedback to processes for infrastructure design, system analysis, research, testing, and integration of web technologies.  Provide triage services in relation to web and PKI technology including performance, functionality, and breach assessments. Provide feedback for, and ensure day-to-day environment alignment to infrastructure, security, and Web standards. Participate in developing, and ensure usage of, automation relating to web and PKI technology builds, installs, and incremental changes ensuring effective baseline management and operational repeatability. Follows all Middleware Administration, Change, Release, Incident, Problem, Security, and Configuration Management processes, policies, operating plans, and mandates. Work with external parties on matters relating to web and PKI technologies as requested. Works with vendors to resolve issues as requested. Completes tasks assigned and project work within scope, priority, timelines, and budget. Continually increases knowledge of web technologies and best practices for securing web environments.QualificationsEducation  AA/AS degree or equivalent technical certification and experienceExperience  Required 4-6 years work experience in similar technical administration position or having equivalent skills and experience. Experience must include 4 recent years working on up-to-date web products and PKI components and at least 4 years demonstrating competent abilities to independently handle day-to-day concurrent operational tasks in a web environment. Support experience must include a global multi-site environment with non-stop operations, scalable deployments, and hardened infrastructure with PCI requirements.Requires advanced experience in the following skill sets: IIS or equivalent web server technology (such as Apache and I.H.S.), working with highly available environments with non-stop operations, scale-out, and multi-site configurations. Web administration experience must include capacity planning, root cause analysis, system analysis, web security, developing technical documentation and procedures, and requirements gathering. Securing web technology against vulnerabilities and threats, as well as working in an environment that aligned to industry standards such as PCI, HIPPA, Sarbanes-Oxley, etc.  Primary support responsibilities for internal and external facing web sites, to include the understanding of upstream and downstream network equipment, load balancing, dns, and application server integration. Authentication and authorization technologies in a Web Service / SOA environments.  Integration, support, and requirements gathering for areas of certificate management with demonstrated understanding of topics such as Certificate Authority, PKI, LDAP, and 2-Factor Authentication Detailed understanding of the HTTP protocol as it pertains to various browsers and each major version of each browser: Internet Explorer, Firefox, Chrome, Safari, and Mobile Web Browsers Applying industry standard release and configuration management techniques for enterprise applications, with focus on build automation, validation, and scripting in an environment in relation to web technology products. Working independently with experiences demonstrating successful alignment to defined scope, budget, standards, and schedule.  Excellent Verbal and written communication, as well as, strong team collaboration. Experience working in an ITIL environment.Requires working experience in the following skills sets: Working knowledge of secure data transport and key generation with technologies such as SSH, SSL, SFTP, etc. Support and usage of content management / deployment toolsets. Windows / Linux administration, using web technologies on these platforms. Experience working with virtual server technologies. J2EE and/or OO programming experience a plus Proven experience and abilities working in Java or SOA environments, using technologies such as WAS, ESB, MQ, and DataPower experience a plus. Experience with enterprise monitoring tools in a web environment is a plusThis will be a 6 month to higher contractRates will be negotiated

Gallagher & Co., one of the world's largest insurance brokerage and risk management services firms, provides a full range of retail and wholesale property/casualty (P/C) brokerage and alternative risk transfer services globally, as well as employee benefit brokerage, consulting and actuarial services. Wherever your interests lie, we're sure you will agree on one thing: our continued prosperity hinges on our greatest resource --- our people. Operationally trouble shoots complex issues,  co-ordinates integration of various modules and ensures compliance with expected quality standards.Ensures optimum utilization of resources and meeting of budgetary targets.Responsible for growth and development of the team. U.S. Eligibility Requirements:Interested candidates must submit an application and resume/CV online to be considered Must be 18 years of age or older Must be willing to submit to a background investigation; any offer of employment is conditioned upon the successful completion of a background investigation Must have unrestricted work authorization to work in the United States.  For U.S. employment opportunities, Gallagher hires U.S. citizens, permanent residents, asylees, refugees, and temporary residents. Gallagher believes that all persons are entitled to equal employment opportunity and does not discriminate against nor favor any applicant because of race, color, religion, sex, age, veteran status, disability, national origin, or any other legally protected status.  Equal employment opportunity will be extended in all aspects of the employer-employee relationship, including, but not limited to, recruitment, hiring, training, promotion, transfer, demotion, compensation, benefits, layoff, and termination.  In addition, Gallagher will make reasonable accommodations to known physical or mental limitations of an otherwise qualified applicant with a disability, unless the accommodation would impose an undue hardship on the operation of our business.

Our group is developing cutting edge technology in the automotive space. We are integrating mobile phone connectivity for vehicles, enabling Toyota, Ford and other driving environments to safely access services like Pandora, iHeart Radio, Bing, Open Table, Movie Tickets, and more. Why work with us?   * Great team environment, flexible schedule  * Your input will be highly valued  * Collaboration with a broad mobile Client / Server development team  We are seeking a qualified Director of Infrastructure to lead operations teams in support of a 24x7 hosted internet service. You will be responsible for server operations, application management, security, production change, release management, infrastructure architecture, capacity planning, server incident management, and security. The successful candidate will have a proven track record of success in delivering complex projects, including coordinating and driving issues to resolution autonomously utilizing excellent project management skills. You should also have experience in building and managing a team of strong technical people. Prior ownership of the operation of a mission-critical support team is crucial to success. A passion for operational excellence, working with new technologies and pushing the envelope on existing technology is required. QUALIFICATIONS    * Bachelor's Degree or equivalent in Computer Science, Master's Degree preferred  * At least 4 years' experience managing in a large-scale enterprise environment required  * Consultative experience in related industry preferred  * 10 years' experience managing a staff of at least 7 direct or indirect reports  * 3+ years' experience managing a change control process  * 5+ years' demonstrated experience working with customer relationships during problem resolution  * Experience managing infrastructure projects using a structured methodology  * Experience in systems, network administration and design highly recommended  * Prior hands-on engineering experience or strong familiarity with one or more of the following technologies: Cisco switches and routers, Application load balancers, Network attached storage, Linux / Windows Systems, Firewalls, Campus wireless networks (802.11), Virtualization (host and storage), RDBMS (Oracle)  * Working familiarity with infrastructure design and modeling tools  * Working knowledge of emerging technologies and associated security implications  * Ability to produce and interpret visual requirements, strong analytical skills required  * Must demonstrate a high degree of organization and be very detail-oriented  * Excellent written and verbal communication skills and ability to interact well with peers and customers  * Must be able to interact and with and influence people at all levels  * Working knowledge of SLA definition and refinement  * Experience with quantitative measurement and improvement, passion and aptitude for data analysis  * Experience dealing with customers during problem resolution and operating under pressure  * Must be available 24x7 to assist with any critical problem or outage; scheduled to work in office full time, 5 days per week, travel to customer site as required

Job description This position is for 3rd shift and requires weekend hours and stand by rotations in support of an on-going 24X7 support model. The Server Support Specialist: Infrastructure Recovery Services will provide technical support for BCRS customer solutions. The applicant will be expected to work as a member of a team to provide problem resolution, technical support and implementation assistance of solutions using IBM and HP servers, including I/O devices such as tape libraries, communications devices, and consoles. The applicant will be expected to assist in system image builds, problem determination and setup / break down of customer environments in support of Disaster Recovery exercises. He/She will work closely across BCRS teams to assist with the preparation, support and execution of customer Disaster Recovery testing. The applicant will assist in the creation of quality documentation for use in the test environment. The ideal candidate will be a self starter with strong teaming skills. Job Title: Sr. Business Intelligence Analyst (PL/SQL, stored procedures)Max Salary: $95,000 per year plus full benefits, pension and perks.Location: Skokie, ILPosition type: Full time permanentMust be a US citizen or Green Card Holder Position OverviewThe Clinical Analytics Teams important and growing role is to provide Clinical Business Intelligence to our client organization, with a special focus on Quality and clinical standardization. We develop and implement methodologies to identify unwanted practice variation, support quality improvement workflows, and evaluate the effectiveness of interventions. We work closely with Enterprise Data Warehouse, Finance, Quality and clinical leadership teams, and have opportunities to use and develop novel informatics technologies, including predictive models, learning systems and natural language processing tools. Examples of projects include: Identifying Patients with Undiagnosed Hypertension  A series of algorithms were designed in order to identify patients with undiagnosed hypertension based on patterns in blood pressure readings in our Medical Group offices. Readmission Risk Predictive Modeling  A predictive model was designed using data collected from our client organizations Enterprise Data Warehouse that identifies patients at risk of readmission. Reporting mechanisms were also designed that leverage these models for clinical decision support by clinicians in both the inpatient and ambulatory setting. ResponsibilitiesIn this role you will: Be responsible for leading analytics-based quality improvement projects that leverage data collected from Client organizations electronic medical record tomeasure and predict patient outcomes. Serve as a liaison between clinical experts and IT professionals to determine feasibility, timelines, and costs of quality improvement projects. Gather business requirements by conducting meetings/interviews, and facilitating large group/cross-functional sessions with customers, while containing the scope of the initiative. Produce data sets and reports that will facilitate evidence-based clinical and financial decisions. Work with statisticians and mathematicians to design predictive models using statistical and machine learning methods that will predict patient outcomes. Work with clinical experts to analyze data that will help drive decisions on patient centered interventions and client organizations quality goals and performance. Work with IT and data warehouse experts to design and develop new summary tables and data marts in Client organizations Enterprise Data Warehouse. QualificationsOur ideal candidate will have: Strong intellectual curiosity. 4 year college degree in information systems, computer science, mathematics, finance, statistics, or related field. 4 years of experience with data warehousing, business intelligence, programming, or statistics experience. Demonstrated proficiency writing complex SQL, PL/SQL, stored procedures, or other database experience. Experience and understanding of data sources including 3rd party RDBMS, MS access, SQL server and oracle. Strong analytic, problem solving, negotiation, issue resolution and facilitation skills are required. Demonstrated strong written and verbal communication and decision making skills. Statistical or mathematical skills or experience working with statistics packages (SPSS, SAS, R, etc.) is a plus. Experience in leading projects that span cross-functional teams is a plus. Familiarity with healthcare industry or healthcare information systems is a plus  Thanks RegardsLalit DeoEmail: Lalit.deo@ngtechinc.comPhone: 847-454-0900 Ext 225

Job description We are seeking interested candidates for a Post Doctoral Researcher position at the IBM T. J. Watson Research Center, Yorktown Heights, NY. We are particularly looking for candidates who have experience in the areas of Systems Research. Experience in the areas of Solid-state Disks (SSD), Flash memories and Analytics oriented system or application design will be considered valuable.IBM Research conducts genuine scientific research and develops technologies and processes for use with IBM products and customer applications. IBM is a leading manufacturer of computer hardware and a leading provider of products and services that relate to the full software life cycle, including infrastructure, hosting, and consulting services. IBM Research fosters close partnerships with other IBM divisions thereby providing a real-world basis for our research.IBM's T. J. Watson Research Center offers a unique opportunity to work with top-notch Research Scientists on cutting-edge technologies. The Commercial Systems department performs state-of-the-art research in all areas of systems research spanning the entire computer system stack, from processor and memory architecture to commercial middleware for next generation systems. In addition to research, the department also has a strong track record of making significant contributions to IBM products.The Post Doctoral Program is highly-competitive and seeks applications from students world-wide. As a Post Doctoral Researcher, one is expected to independently conduct novel research, come up with innovative ideas, publish papers and translate them into IBM products. Area of Research: SSD-AnalyticsAnalytics is increasingly becoming an important requirement for businesses and organizations. Applications of analytics have touched almost every aspect of our lives including web-searches, movie and book preferences, health management, marketing optimizations, etc. Trend identification using dynamic data lies at the crux of the required real-time decision making here. Challenge to such decision making is not only handling data that is large and unstructured, but also noisy and uncertain. Adding to this, today's data generation speed, and demand to provide real-time solutions makes this analysis all the more complex. One of the key system stack technologies that facilitates handling large amounts of data (Big-Data) at faster speed is Solid-state Disk (SSD). Over the past few years, as the prices came down, SSDs have become very prominent on both personal and enterprise fronts. However, the implications of SSDs on Analytics (and vice-versa: SSD Design for Analytics) is not well understood. Novel research ideas here include investigating novel designs for SSDs for Analytics/Big-data workloads (considering both performance and endurance of SSDs), offloading Analytics work onto SSDs, use of SSDs in large scale and its implications, design of analytics applications on SSDs, etc. This Post Doctoral position is aimed at not only identifying such areas of research, but creating this new field of Flash-Analytics and conducting deep and thorough research. A good number of publications, patents and potentially product impact and leadership in the area are expected as outcome.  Required  Bachelor's Degree  At least 3 years experience in Performance Evaluation and Analysis  English: Intermediate    Preferred  Doctorate Degree in Information Technology  At least 4 years experience in Knowledge of Operating Systems, Device Drivers and Kernel-level software  At least 2 years experience in Storage systems knowledge (Solid-state disks and FLASH memories will be a plus)  At least 1 year experience in Familiarity with Analytics oriented frameworks such as Map-Reduce, Hadoop, etc.(Knowledge of Analytics algorithms will be a plus  English : Fluent    IBM is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status.

Job DescriptionAmazon Web Services' Elastic MapReduce (EMR) has started a brand new team with a mission to enable our web services infrastructure to support scientific and business analysis on large data sets with extreme ease of use. The team makes it easy and secure to use the massive scale of parallel computing by non specialized software programs, via multiple layers of abstractions, as well as development and deployment tools. The team aspires to work with the open source community and to contribute significant portion of its software to the open source. We are looking for a technical expert in web services and Big Data technologies to join the team as a Software Engineer. As an engineer, you will work independently and with other software engineers including Principal engineers as well as program/product managers to create distributed services and front-end APIs for developers to consume. You will help shape the overall structure of the Amazon's web service offerings.Key ResponsibilitiesTranslation of complex functional and technical requirements into detailed architecture and designBeing very hands-on; develop code using Java.Being part of the engineering team to manage the day-to-day development activities by leading architecture decisions, participating in designs, design review, code review, and implementation.Responsible for driving and shipping high quality code as part of a Scrum team, on-time and on-budget. Solutions developed by the team use Java, XML, HTTP, SOAP, Hadoop, Pig and other web technologies.Responsible for large portions of the systems architecture, scalability, reliability, and performance.Responsible for real-time operational support of the teams functional areas.Maintaining current technical knowledge to support rapidly changing technology, always on a look out for new technologies and work with management and development team in bringing new technologies.Basic QualificationsBachelor's degree in computer science or equivalent experience.2+ year's overall development experience.Preferred QualificationsProven results oriented person with a delivery focus  especially in the areas of writing high-performance, reliable and maintainable code.Ability to adapt to new development environments, changing business requirements and learning new systems highly desired.Core competencies in Java, XML, HTTP required; experience with other web technologies such as WS* and .Net is a plus.Strong knowledge of data structures, algorithms, enterprise systems, and asynchronous architectures.Understanding of web services software architectural and design issues.Master's degree in computer science is preferred.Experience with Hadoop, HBase and other cloud computing technologies is a strong plus.Background with traditional databases, ETL, and data warehousing is a plus.Exposure to data workflow and/or scheduling systems is a plus.Experience with large distributed services is a plus as is building/operating highly available systems.Works well in a team environment and be able to effectively drive cross-team solutions that have complex dependencies and requirements.Ability to handle multiple competing priorities in an agile, fast-paced environment.Excellent verbal and written communication skills.*** For more information on Amazon Web Services, please visit  http://aws.amazon.com  ****** For all open positions within EMR team, please visit:  http://aws.amazon.com/emr-jobs / ***

Our Cambridge, Massachusetts client is looking for a passionate applicant that works well in a fast paced environment and can quickly adapt to new software and technology. This is not a typical development job. As a Developer, you will have a chance to work with our client's products from start to finish; from defining new features to designing the structure of the code to implementing new functionality that customers will use every day. [if gte mso 9]><xml>  <o:OfficeDocumentSettings>   <o:RelyOnVML/>   <o:AllowPNG/>  </o:OfficeDocumentSettings> </xml><![endif]  Reporting to the Director of Imaging Services, the Manager of Imaging Informatics will play a key role in the development, implementation, and ongoing operation of an enterprise-wide imaging infrastructure performing over 200,000 procedures across multiple locations, and centering on the capture, repository, display, and integration of Imaging related data. The Manager of Imaging Informatics will be responsible for the oversight, development, implementation, and technical management of the Radiology and Cardiology Picture Archiving and Communication System (PACS) and the supporting subsystems such as the Radiology Information System (RIS), Mammography Reporting System (MRS), Powerscribe dictation system, i-CAD and Vital Images post processing systems and other ancillary systems present and future. Works with management to identify present and future systems and strategic technology needs. Provides project management for technology and related system implementations. Work is accomplished through self and subordinate staff, and frequent interaction with Physicians, Radiology Department managers and supervisors, PACS Administrators and Information Systems (IS) Departments.      Requires a Bachelor's Degree in Allied Health Sciences, Computer Science or computer engineering, medical informatics or a related field; Masters Degree preferred.      Experience: Requires a minimum of four years experience in information systems management (preferably healthcare in a comparably sized hospital setting) with at least two years supervisory experience. Requires work experience with PACS and Radiology Information Systems, Windows OS, networking infrastructure, database technology, image processing/compression technologies, computer hardware/software systems, interface specifications including HL7 and DICOM standards within medical imaging. Requires experience with voice recognition systems and structured reporting systems within a Radiology Department setting. Familiar with Virtualization and storage technologies.     CIIP preferred. Must have or be willing to obtain within 12 months of hire, certification as an Imaging Informatics Professional (CCIP-ABII) or PACS System Analyst (CPSA PARCS).      Primary Source Verification (if applicable):      Needs to be self-motivated with ability to work independently with minimal supervision. Should have  strong interpersonal relations, personnel management and communications (written and oral) skills. Strong analytical and creative problem solving skills; attention to details and demonstrated experience in IT Project Management.     Operational and in depth knowledge of all imaging related systems to serve as resource for clinical and technical and professional staff. Establishes and maintains expertise in application functionality.     We offer an excellent salary, an outstanding work environment, and comprehensive benefits including Medical, Prescription, Dental, Vision, Life Insurance, Long Term Disability, and Tuition Assistance. Interested candidates are invited to forward their resumes with salary requirements to:     Jarret Williams, Recruiter  JFK Health System  Ph: 732-321-7000, x61793  Fax: 732-548-4595  E-mail: JAwilliams@JFKHealth.org  EOE, M/F/D/V  Apply online at: www.JFKMC.org   [if gte mso 9]><xml>  <w:WordDocument>   <w:View>Normal</w:View>   <w:Zoom>0</w:Zoom>   <w:TrackMoves/>   <w:TrackFormatting/> Sutter Delta Medical Center has been providing health care services to eastern Contra Costa County since 1967. Providing services to nearly 250,000 residents, Sutter Delta Medical Center remains the communitys only not-for-profit, acute care hospital. Sutter Delta Medical Center affiliated with Sutter Health in 1990 and is fully accredited by the Joint Commission on Accreditation of Healthcare Organizations.Providing health care services to nearly 250,000 residents of eastern Contra Costa County, Sutter Delta Medical Center remains the community's only not-for-profit acute care hospital. Its comprehensive services include 24-hour emergency care, surgery, family centers, obstetrics, pediatrics, acute rehabilitation, diagnostic imaging, occupational health, physical therapy, intensive care and coronary care. Cardiac catheterization, sports rehabilitation and home health services are also among the medical center's areas of specialized care.The Radiologic Technologist produces quality diagnostic radiographs. The incumbent processes the film, prepares records of service performed, makes adjustments and minor repairs on equipment. The incumbent ensures effective communications/documentation. The technologist works with high risk and critically ill patients.Population served includes neonatal, pediatric, adolescent, adult and geriatrics.All postings are open to internal candidates only for the first 7 days. Graduation from a Joint Commission-approved School of Radiologic Technology required. Current CA Radiologic Tech licensure required. Previous experience as a Registered Radiologic Technologist is desirable. Prior work experience in an acute care facility is preferable. Must be knowledgeable of technical factors and radiographic views. Current RT fluoroscopy permit from the State of California is required. Current registration with ARRT preferred.  Curretn BCLS certification is required.

Expanding independent distributor of leading digital medical imaging solutions for hospitals,physician practices,chiropractors,veterinarians,imaging centers and podiatrists has a position for a sales professional. Territory will include Pennsylvania(100 mile radius of Philadelphia). Product training will be provided as well as ongoing sales support. Compensation package will include auto, health insurance and excellent commission program. Exciting opportunity with very well respected distribution/IT company with over 30 years experience serving customers in the healthcare industry. If interested in learning more, please email resume including compensation history to brxray@cs.com

Lantheus Medical Imaging is a global leader in developing, manufacturing and distributing innovative diagnostic imaging agents.  For more than 55 years, Lantheus has been dedicated to creating and providing pioneering medical imaging solutions to improve the treatment of human disease. The companys proven success in discovering, developing and commercializing innovative medical imaging agents provides a strong platform from which to bring forward new breakthrough tools for the diagnosis and management of disease.Lantheus imaging products include DEFINITY Vial for (Perflutren Lipid Microsphere) Injectable Suspension, the leading ultrasound contrast agent used in ultrasound exams of the heart, also known as echocardiographic exams; ABLAVAR (gadofosveset trisodium), a first-in-class magnetic resonance agent indicated for the evaluation of aortoiliac occlusive disease in adults with known or suspected peripheral vascular disease; Cardiolite (Kit for the Preparation of Technetium Tc99m Sestamibi for Injection), a cardiac imaging agent that is the most successful radiopharmaceutical ever introduced and; TechneLite (Technetium Tc99m Generator).Lantheus has approximately 600 employees worldwide with headquarters in North Billerica, Massachusetts, and offices in Puerto Rico, Canada and Australia. In this position the ideal candidate will oversee global pharmacovigilance (GPV) activities, ensuring entire process, program and all activities are conducted in compliance with all internal policies and full range of external regulatory requirements.  Responsibilities include:        Directs all global pharmacovigilance activities and safety reporting for all marketed products. Oversee internal work team activities, and external contractors, including global CRO(s), effectively marshalling resources in a matrix organization.         Ensures that Global Pharmacovigilance (GPV) processes receive, collect, analyze, follow-up and report all individual adverse events, according to local and international regulatory requirements, according to corporate SOPs, and according to good industry practices and all regulatory requirements. Maintain responsibility for drafting new SOPs and presenting these to the SOP review committee in a timely manner, and for appropriate training and documentation of pharmacovigilance staff accordingly.         Oversees management of our global CRO pharmacovigilance partner and associated staff, and ensure the training, education and performance of these contract staff, as well as internal staff. Collaborate with, and manage the Medical Research Associate(s) in pharmacovigilance.         Prepares and oversees the timely reporting of events to regulators, and review aggregate summaries and periodic reports (e.g. annual IND updates, PSURs etc.) of summary data. Develop and implement a risk management plan for all products in accordance with regulatory needs.         Manages the aggregation of data for safety signal detection, for its analysis and their appropriate reporting.         Stays abreast of current and emerging trends in medical imaging, cardiovascular medicine, and global pharmacovigilance.        Collaborates with, and maintain effective working relationships with the Medical Information group and the Medical Affairs Field Organization (MAFO) within Global Medical Affairs, as well as cross-departmentally with key stakeholders in Regulatory Affairs, R&D, and Marketing.        Aligns functional goals and objectives with larger organization goals and business strategy and take actions to achieve them.        Acts as consultant to the external physician and health care provider communities in communicating the safety profile in aggregate and in individual cases.         Drives the entire performance management of the GPV function to meet business objectives; allocating and realigning resources, identifying and responding to challenging circumstances.        Partners with Pre-clinical and with Clinical R&D to better assess and understand the safety profile of marketed products, and in the preparation of safety surveillance activities for pre-market products.         Leverages a current understanding of global pharmacovigilance regulations and processes, including safety signal detection and phamaco-interact with and work with external physicians and health care providers.        Maintains current knowledge of, and ensure all functional work team activities are conducted in compliance with the full range of related internal and external systems, technology, regulatory requirements and related policies and procedures.  The incumbent will actively promote safety rules and awareness, will demonstrate good safety practices at all times, and take initiative to correct safety hazards.  Additionally, the incumbent will actively demonstrate and promote the Lantheus values of accountability, communication, customer commitment, entrepreneurial spirit, integrity, safety and teamwork. Requirements include:         MD required with subspecialty training in cardiovascular medicine, radiology, or internal medicine with cardiovascular or imaging experience and 3+ years Global pharmacovigilance and safety surveillance training and experience, or equivalent.
