Job Summary:   The part time instructor facilitates meaningful learning of the course competencies in the curriculum and proactively supports all facets of the learning environment. S/He provides education through learning-centered instruction that will enable graduates to fulfill the evolving needs of the marketplace. S/He encourages a culture of learning that values mutual responsibility and respect, life-long learning and ethics as well as personal and professional development. This position is part time/adjunct only. Incumbent must assure that the EDMC philosophy: quality services to clients; development, growth, involvement, and recognition of employees; sound economic principles; and environment which is conducive to innovation, positive thinking and expansion - is considered in carrying out the duties and responsibilities of this position.      Key Job Elements:          Provides competency-based education which aligns with the EDMC model of curricula as well as supports the EDMC style of system delivery.      Designs and delivers class instruction through the development of instructional plans to meet course competencies, the development of activities which support lesson objectives, and (in the case of online instructors ONLY) delivers the instruction as approved.      Enables the achievement of pre-described exit competencies for student achievement and evaluation of learning by providing instruction which fosters competencies and establish student performance criteria and evaluation.      Delivers learning-centered instruction by establishing a classroom environment conducive to learning and student involvement as well as effectively planning and preparing for classes and student success.      Promotes student success by showing flexibility in style and work schedule as well as exhibiting a passion for teaching and students and engaging students in the learning process.      Manages the learning environment through keeping accurate records, submitting grades and other reports on time, and enforcing school/campus academic and attendance policies.      Contributes to a learning culture by participating on curriculum and system task forces, supporting local campus events such as orientation and graduation, and participating in various other workshops and meetings.      Relates professional/life/industry experience to learning by the continuation of professional/technical skills development, the introduction of industry perspective into courses, and the active awareness of professional/industry trends and opportunities.         Reports To:   Dean of System-Wide Programs, Academic Department Director   Directly Supervises:   None   Interacts With:   Academic affairs department, other school/campus functional areas, curriculum task force and other committees, other faculty, and students      Job Requirements:   Knowledge:         Master's degree in a field related to the classes to be taught    Zero to two years experience in instruction or formalized education process, preferably in a post-secondary or college institution.    Membership in a professional association tied to area of instruction preferred.     Skills:     Excellent verbal and written communication skills including the ability to build successful relationships with student populations.    Outstanding conflict resolution skills.    Demonstrated time management and detail-oriented skills    Computer based skills (i.e., software, analytical, and report writing skills )   Abilities:     Ability to work effectively under pressure and to meet frequently occurring deadlines.    Ability to develop a professional rapport with diverse school/campus constituents.    Ability to develop and complete projects without continued direct supervision    Ability to learn from students' participation, demonstrates fair and consistent behavior in all matters, and shows compassion without being ineffectual   Qualified candidates should submit current resume and cover letter addressing the qualifications and areas of expertise as they relate to the courses listed above. Candidates should also submit a rank ordering of the subjects they feel most qualified to teach.                                                  Job Requirements Work Environment  The work environment characteristics described here are representative of those an employee encounters while performing the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable qualified individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. The term "qualified individual with a disability" means an individual with a disability who, with or without reasonable accommodation, can perform the essential functions of the position. While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to communicate professionally in person, over the telephone, through email and other electronic means, move about the office or school, handle various types of media and equipment, and visually or otherwise identify, observe and assess. The employee is occasionally required to lift up to 10 pounds unless otherwise specified in the job description. Flowserve is the recognized world leader in supplying pumps, valves, seals, automation, and services to the power, oil, gas, chemical, and other industries. With more than 15,000 employees in more than 50 countries, we combine our global reach with a local presence.    1. Manufacturing Process Accountabilities  -Demonstrates a good working knowledge of machine equipment functions and servicing.   Able to perform preventive maintenance as assigned. -Demonstrates working knowledge of the process flow of parts through the manufacturing/repair process.- Minimum 3 years manual machining experience in the use of standard shop equipment (engine lathe, mill, drill, saw, etc.) -Must be able to read blueprints and set-up and operate manual machines.-Position requires inspection of parts to certify quality.-Positions are for 1st and 2nd shift.-Ensures that individual performance supports the QRC's efforts at maintaining performance standards in the areas of safety, cost of scrap/rework, on time performance, direct labor hours, manufacturing $/Hr and overtime $/day.2. Technical Skill Accountabilities  -Demonstrates a good working knowledge of machine tooling applications and servicing.   Works closely with other machinists to provide technical assistance to tooling related issues.-Demonstrate working knowledge of processes necessary to complete all assigned task within the production schedule and routing time.-Capable of reading prints and drawings.   Capable of creating a sketch of a customer part for drawing development.  3. Communication Skill Accountabilities  -Demonstrates an advanced ability to communicate all manufacturing processes to peers and supervisors.  -Capable of communicating suspected equipment or tool failure in a timely manner.  4. Quality Assurance Accountabilities  -Demonstrates a thorough understanding of inspection equipment, their functions and uses in order to ensure that all manufactured parts are machined within tolerance limitations.  -Supports and participates in CIP processes.   Takes on an active role in at least one CIP from start to finish when asked.-Capable of receiving in bar stock and verifying type, lengths and dimensions. Demonstrates a thorough understanding of QMS procedures and uses them to better manage work processes and identify problems.-Maintains minimal scrap and rework on all manufactured parts.   Reports all discrepancies to management immediately.  5. Safety   Accountabilities  -Demonstrates a thorough knowledge of issues in the workplace and able to perform detailed check list to resolve them when necessary.   Able to discuss workplace injuries and provide resolution to them.   Be aware of injuries and recommends improvements to reduce injuries.   Has an understanding of regulatory compliance in order to be aware of accident prevention.   Actively participates and completes all company sponsored training venues as scheduled.-Demonstrates thorough understanding of MSDS and how to locate them.   Capable of identifying PPE as related to one's job, and what application it is used for.-Consistently demonstrates the basic ability to clean up after self. Picks up trash and debris and dispose of it properly, or places it where it will not pose a hazard to others.-Keeps work area clean throughout the day.   Stacks materials and supplies orderly and secures them so they don't topple.   Disposes of combustibles and flammables properly.   Follows all planned housekeeping schedules communicated by the Lead.HS Diploma and/or GED equivalent    Join a company with the most comprehensive product lines and broadest applications experience in the world. You'll be part of a team known for its industry-leading talent, unparalleled portfolio and unmatched commitment to customer success. Our culture promotes recognition and rewards creativity, hard work and commitment. We invite you to put your talents and experience in motion with Flowserve. Flowserve is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

Location:  Alexandria, VA  Clearance:  SECRET Preferred.  Berico will sponsor highly qualified candidates for their clearance.  Description:    The Robust Operable Biometric Software (ROBS) is an established biometrics software system that is helping lead the effort to identify foes in the War on Terror. A worldwide system in use with the US military, ROBS utilizes biometrics to positively identify individuals in a shifting world of identities.  The Senior Software Engineer would lead and guide the development of the current ROBS program with an eye to the future.   The successful candidate will work collaboratively with a diverse team of software developers, engineers, and system administrators in a fast paced environment to evolve a mission critical intelligence system. The Software Engineer must have experience with the full software development lifecycle (SDLC) using an iterative (Waterfall) and agile methodology (Scrum) and have demonstrable skill executing engineering processes to include requirements gathering, design, build, test, delivery, integration and tuning.  Must be knowledgeable and stay current with .NET technologies and be comfortable mentoring the team on elegant and efficient coding techniques. The candidate must demonstrate a high degree of problem solving ability and be able to communicate effectively in written and spoken form.    The Software Engineer performs high-level systems analysis, evaluation, design, integration, documentation, and implementation of a very complex application that require a thorough knowledge of administrative and technical skills.  Works with the team responsible for designing and developing new software products or major enhancements to existing software.  Participates in all phases of system development with emphasis on planning, analysis, evaluation, integration, testing and acceptance phases (IV&V and DT&E) using Waterfall and Agile/Scrum process models.  Applies higher-level business or technical principles and methods to very difficult technical problems to arrive at automated engineering solution.  Prepares and delivers presentations and briefings as required.  Responsible for project completion.  Performs feasibility analysis on potential future projects to management.  Essential Functions:   The Software Engineer will be a key member of a development team building and deploying Microsoft-based products.  The Software Engineer must be capable of managing and executing the full software development lifecycle with limited supervision.   Recommend design changes and/or enhancements to the system; develop designs and document them using the Unified Modeling Language (UML).  Must be comfortable interfacing with the customer, articulating technical concepts to a non-technical audience.   Minimum Qualifications:   Bachelor's degree from an accredited university in computer science, software engineering, information systems, a physical science, engineering or a mathematics-intensive discipline.  Minimum of 2 years software engineering experience with the software development lifecycle.  Demonstrates experience with .NET 4 platform, including C#, Windows Forms, SQL Server, Entity Framework, object oriented fundamentals, design patterns.  Demonstrates experience with lifecycle development tools, including Version Control, Defect/Work Item Tracking, build management.  Experience with Team Foundation Server (TFS) strongly preferred.  Exposure to dependency injection models and test driven development is a plus.  Demonstrates experience with model driven development (UML).  Demonstrates experience with process centric environments development (Waterfall, Agile/Scrum).  Should be detail oriented, possess good verbal and written communications skills, and be a self-starter.  Should have experience with team based development.  US Citizenship  No clearance required on interview, but must be able to acquire and maintain a minimum Secret Clearance.    Desired Skills:   Experience with Visual Studio 2010 Ultimate with Feature pack 2.  Skills with Windows and RDBMS Systems   Experience working in a Waterfall and/or Agile environment.     Applicants selected will be subject to a government security investigation and must meet eligibility requirements for access to classified information. US CITIZENSHIP REQUIRED Berico Technologies is an Equal Opportunity Employer

Sr Java DeveloperDescription   The Global Editorial Operations organization within Thomson Reuters Professional is responsible for designing and delivering core technology platforms that make it possible for Thomson Reuters to deliver data to our customers via mobile, online, and print platforms. We are looking for a high energy and innovative individual with a passion for software development to join our team. The individual selected for this position will have an active role in the design and development on large-scale, enterprise-wide initiatives to build a platform that will be used for the acquisition, conversion and transformation of content on behalf of business units across Thomson Reuters. This individual will contribute to solutions across the entire architecture stack using the current technologies including Java, XML, Web Services, Spring, Hibernate, and Oracle. Our ideal candidate has 5 or more years of experience in OO design and development role on a large, enterprise-scale software program and background in coordinating with other teams to deliver an integrated solution.   Key technical challenges that this role will be involved with include high volume XML publishing, automating problems around text structuring and working across a global footprint with many business units. If you are interested in working in a fast-paced environment on really tough technical problems, this may be the career path for you!  Key Responsibilities: TechnicalThis individual will work closely with users, technical leads, project managers, and other cross-functional development teams to design and deliver software solutions. This includes writing software, making modifications to existing software and integrating applications within the core pathway. It may also include discovery of new technologies and techniques to meet business requirements.Active coding in key technology is required for this development position and includes: Java/J2EE, Tomcat, Web Services, REST, Spring, Hibernate, XML, Oracle and JavaScript.Develops middleware applications, Entity Relationship Modeling, systems integration.  The individual will also be responsible for applying working knowledge of OO design patterns to develop enterprise level solutions.Creates, reviews, and maintains all required technical documentation related to assigned software to ensure supportability and reuse.This individual must develops software using disciplined software development processes, adhering to team/company standards and software best practice guidelines, and corporate policies. QualityDelivering quality of the software to our QA team is an important function of this position and this individual will be responsible for creating and executing unit tests on the code that they write for their service. Project/Team:This team works in an agile environment and team members are responsible for participating in project planning sessions with team members to analyze development requirements, provide design options, and provide work breakdown and estimates of work.  Provides timely status updates for areas of individual responsibilities within projects to lead and manager.  Actively participates in team and daily standup meetings.   Provide demonstrations of working software at the end of iterations that tie into an overall release. Strong development methodology and understanding of agile/iterative development is required.The individual must also have working knowledge of OO design patterns and has applied them in enterprise level development.Implementing high performance, scalable software solutions.Expertise in SQL for Oracle Database.Extensive JUnit experience.Good understanding of Maven or Ant.Knowledgeable and comfortable working in an Agile Environment. The role of the Senior Engineer is to deploy EdgeServer, Open Access and HIE service oriented products. The senior engineer is also responsible for mentoring junior implementation engineers as well as providing peer review and deployment quality assurance. web services; SOAP; and/or XSDExperience or functional understanding with the application of SAML or XACML technologies to control and enforce access control policy, message security, user authentication / authorization, non-repudiation, message integrity, security, and privacy in a production environment (preferably related to Healthcare IT)Integrating Health Enterprise Infrastructure (IHE) Profiles such as XCA, XDS, PDQ, PIX, XDR, XCPD, etcFunctional understanding of Object Oriented Programming (OOP) and Representational State Transfer (REST) architectural designExperience with WebLogic and/or JBOSSWorking experience securing Internet services with one or more of the following: SSL/TLS protocols; PKI/X.509; digital signatures; issues of canonicalizationOptumInsight is part of the family of companies that make UnitedHealth Group one of the leaders across most major segments of the US health care system. OptumInsight is one of the largest and fastest growing health information companies. We specialize in improving the performance of the health system by providing analytics, technology and consulting services that enable better decisions and results. We integrate workflow solutions that deliver data in real-time, and create actionable insights - processing health information that relates directly to and affects one in four patients in the U.S, one in every three Medicaid dollars and one in every five emergency room visits. And we do it all with every action focused on our shared values of Integrity, Compassion, Relationships, Innovation & Performance.What can YOU do with the right information? At OptumInsight, the possibilities and the impact are limitless. The Sales Engineer 2 (SE2) supports the East Region Government sales teams with respect to voice and data products. As part of the sales team, the SE2 provides technical sales support and consulting to assure customer integration and implementation of established T- Mobile products and services. The SE2 is focused on pre-sales activities with both the Business Development Manager and the Account Manager Teams.  Typical pre-sales activities include gaining an understanding of the customer's business and analyzing the customer's mobile communication and data requirements. The SE2 provides technical support in sales presentations, product demonstrations, as well as providing answers to customer's technical inquiries. The SE2 is responsible for architecting wireless solutions utilizing the T-Mobile network that meet customer needs. The SE2 is the wireless data subject matter expert on current and future wireless technologies. He/she works closely with Marketing and Engineering in support of network development efforts, alpha and beta evaluation tests, as well as new product rollouts. SE2 key objectives are:*          Achieve sales by helping the Government sales channel strategize and present products and services to our customers*          Provide expert knowledge on data products and services offered T-Mobile through the Business Sales channel*          Support Product Development efforts by defining and implementing strategic solutions for enterprise data Responsibilities of the SE2 are as follows: Pre-Sales Opportunities*          Support Business Development Manager and Account Managers*          Business Partner Sales partnering*          Architect a solution that fits customer's security model*          Close technical hurdles*          Facilitate wide scale device adoption*          Understand nuances and drivers*          Prepare and present technical customer presentations*          Present roadmaps*          Facilitate coverage analysis*          Provide market specific RFP technical input*          Strategize with Sales team to improve sales*          Account reviews with existing customers*          In-building coverage solution management*          Owner of customer technical relationships*          Supports customer's pilots Technical Training*          Customer trainings*          Product and Network road-show/webinars*          Train TMO Sales force on Wireless data products in order to "sell the best solution" (i.e Tech Talks)*          GSM/GPRS and RIM certifications Product Testing*          Work with Product Development to ensure reliable enterprise focused products. This includes performing friendly user trials (FUTs) for device certification.*          Android, Window Mobile, iOS, and RIM devices and software Other*          Product updates*          Network coverage/Network build-out plans*          Technical SME/owner for specific topic/specialty*          High level support and troubleshooting*          Interface with RF and GPRS teams to resolve network issues and increase stability*          Usually counted on as an escalation point of contact for Care*          Work with Marketing to roll out new products    6-8 years in telecommunications, IT administration or network engineering roles with a professional track record of successful technical leadership involving network and application troubleshooting skills.  Mandatory ability to make technical presentations at senior executive management level; ability to clearly present technical concepts in a non- technical way; excellent written and oral communication skills; strong goal attainment, organizational, time management, prioritization and people skills are essential; and ability and willingness to multi-task, manage, and work hard in a fast-paced, team environment.  Understanding of and experience with the following:*          Domino/Exchange administration*          Routing protocols*          Remote access computing methods*          Layered communication protocols*          System administration roles*          Enterprise security architectures and principles*          IP and ATM networks*          Wi-Fi networks and design (802.11a/b/g)*          SMIME, Smartcard readers, secure voice and secure data Experience with J2EE and/or .NET web applications development is a plus. EDUCATION & EXPERIENCE*          BSEE or BSCSE preferred. MIS or MSEE desired.*          Selling solutions in the government sector strongly preferred.*          Professional certifications and/or practical knowledge in at least one of the following areas required:*          Security Administrator: experience in firewall design and administration; knowledge of Checkpoint, PIX, Nokia, PKI, RSA, DES, Encryption, security management, etc.*          UNIX Systems Administration: experience in Solaris, Linux, PERL, Shell scripting, RADIUS, DNS, DHCP, etc.*          Windows Systems Administrator:  experience in Exchange Server, Windows2000+Server, IIS, ISA, MIS, DHCP, DNS, etc.*          Corporate LAN Administrator: experience in routing and switching, LAN administration; certifications in MCP, MCP+1, MCSE, CNE, etc.*          WAN Network Engineering: experience in routing and switching, designing, building and optimizing layer 2 and 3 networks*          TDMA, GSM, GPRS, EDGE, UMTS, HSDPA, 1XRTT or CDMA training or experience.*          Desired certifications include CCNA, CCNP, CCDA, CCDP or related vendor-specific trainingReq Number: 12018109

ESSENTIAL RESPONSIBILITIES:  As a Lead Mobile Application and Platform Research Engineer, you will research and develop mobile/wireless solutions that will increase the productivity of various GE business units and customers. As a Lead Mobile Application and Platform Research Engineer, you will work in a multidisciplinary team to:   Lead technical knowledge to innovate, invent, develop, and implement in the areas of Fixed and Mobile Wireless solutions/applications/services   Be responsible for executing assignments in focused technical area; work on pre-defined activities with guidance  Utilize background in Wireless networks to execute and deliver on projects  Grow and contribute to new research projects through close interactions with the GE business units and their customers  Effectively communicate results by writing papers and giving presentations of your approaches, results achieved, and value obtained  Collaborate and work with fellow researchers to respond to customer needs in a timely manner    Qualifications/Requirements Bachelors or Masters or Ph.D. in Computer Science, CSE, Electrical Computer Engineering, Electrical Engineering with at least 5 years of relevant industrial experience  At least 5 years of mobile programming experience to deliver interactive multimodal (voice, touch, video, text) solutions using iOS, Android, RIM or Microsoft native or MEAP environments  Advanced level (at least 3 years) skills in HTML5, CSS3, JavaScript, Jquery, and any one of the Java/C++/Objective C Advanced level (at least 3 years) experience to build highly scalable web back end platforms, related REST/SOA APIs leveraging mashups with third party social APIs (e.g. Google, Twitter, Twillio, Yahoo, SFDC) to deliver mobile application solutionsProven ability to master one or more front-end and back-end technologies by using them in real life projects End2end lifecycle awareness of Mobile Applications, Mobile Platforms, APIs and related value chain Legal authorization to work in the U.S. is required. We will not sponsor individuals at or below the Masters level for employment visas, now or in the future, for this job opening Must be willing to work out of an office located in San Ramon, CAMust be willing to take a drug test and submit to a background investigation as part of the selection process.Must be 18 years or olderMust be willing to travelYou must submit your application for employment on the careers page at www.gecareers.com   www.gecareers.com   to be considered  Desired Characteristics Understanding of Wireless networks such as 3G/4G Voice and Data networks Have a good understanding of IoT (Internet of Things)Demonstrated understanding and developed mobile applications/services for Field Services, Operations Centers, Workforce Automation in different marketsAdditionally, we are also interested in Sr. researchers with proven skills and interest in creating solutions/prototypes to investigate research topics spanning M2M, Mobile HCI, Mobile Computing, Mobile Infrastructure, and Mobile Information Visualization preferably in an industrial engineering domain GRCSoftwareCASECTION 19: YOU MUST BE ABLE TO SATISFY THE REQUIREMENTS OF SECTION 19 OF THE FEDERAL DEPOSIT INSURANCE ACT                                                                        GE is an equal opportunity employer, offering a great work environment, challenging career opportunities, professional training and competitive compensation.

Duties & Responsibilities Provide frontline, system-level technical support to customers in during all phases of customer's product development and manufacturing Travel to the customer site as needed to provide technical support, demonstration, training, system installation and troubleshooting services, and liaison with AE resources to resolve issues Analyze customer's technical requirements and monitor industry trends Be alert to competitive products and product positionings Develop strong customer relations at a technical level, to gain further insight to direction and needs of the customer Basic Qualifications, Experience, Skills & Education Required  BSEE required, MSEE preferred 3-5 years test and measurement experience in the wireless telecom industry Applicants should have prior FAE/AE experience and/or enjoy working with people in a technical support role Experience developing and using automated RF/Wireless test systems Experience working with automated test programs and scripts in C, C++, VB, Python and Perl   Knowledge of the RF PHY requirements for the wireless communications standards such as:802.11abgn WLAN 802.15 Bluetooth 2.x, 3.x LTE/WCDMA/GSM/EDGE CDMA/EVDO Familiar with RF/system level test equipment such VSAs, VSGs, SAs, SGs, O-scopes, Power Meters, Vector and Scalar NA, Wireless Communication testers, etc. Good troubleshooting, analysis, and problem solving skills Effective presentation, written, and verbal skills This position involves travel domestically and internationally (10-20%) LitePoint is the leading provider of test solutions for the world's leading manufacturers of wireless modules and consumer electronics including smart phones, tablets and PCs.  We are a Silicon Valley company founded in 2000 and our products have been used to optimize and verify the operation of over 1.75 billion wireless devices worldwide. Raytheon is seeking a Wireless Engineer to fill the following Job Description:Raytheon is currently in search of a candidate with a strong technical and operational background to be part of our Wireless Engineering team.  Wireless Engineers provides continuity between Operations personnel (both in CONUS and OCONUS locations) and the engineering and development teams.  The Wireless Engineer's primary role is to be the voice of operations, advocating on their behalf to provide feedback and guidance to the engineering teams.  They are the "honest broker" who is an unbiased voice that can draw on both their technical expertise in wireless and radio frequency (RF) communications and operational experience to effectively evaluate systems, provide input to the Contracting Officer Technical Representative (COTR), and provide continuity throughout the development cycle.  Wireless Engineers are an integral part of the customer organization, ensuring that operations personnel have the tools to successfully, safely and efficiently complete their operational objectives.  The Customer organization reaches across multiple Intelligence Community (IC) Agencies and internal offices; Wireless Engineers must be dynamic, with outstanding interpersonal skills and the ability to work in diverse teams easily building a rapport with those around them.Wireless Engineers are expected to keep on the forefront of wireless/RF technology.  The exponential rate of technological developments in this area creates an ever challenging array of possible changes.  Innovative ideas are encouraged by all members of the office.The importance of the client mission will at times require candidates to work outside their area of expertise and learn new skills.Security Clearance:  Minimum TS with PolyTravel:  10 to 15% primarily CONUS but some OCONUS TDYs will be required.Required Skills: 8+ years of practical experience Demonstrated ability translating operational needs into technical requirements Demonstrated operational/field experience Must be able to work in multi-discipline teams Attention to detail and the ability to operate in a dynamic environment Excellent written and verbal skills Outstanding interpersonal skills Willing to learn new skills and continue to expand current knowledge of Wireless and RF Technologies Understanding of the Intelligence Community (IC) Strong written and oral communications skills.  Ability to author technical documents and provide briefings Proficient understanding of Radio Frequency (RF) propagation theory and the differences in communication over varies frequencies Familiarity with the Program Management Framework (PMF) Demonstrated knowledge of the systems engineering lifecycle process to include control gates, technical documentation and requirements gathering Must be willing to support CONUS and OCONUS temporary duty (TDY) stations as needed by the customer.  TDYs will typically be short in duration, less than 1 week and no more than 2 weeks. Proficient in at least two (2) of the following Wireless Radio Frequency (RF) areas:o   At least 8 years relevant experience in telecommunications with 3G Cellular and 4G Cellular data technologies to include LTE and WiMaxo   EDGE/HSPA/HSPA+o   Terrestrial short-to-mid range VHF/UHF Communications (i.e. Push to Talk and tactical communications methods)o   High Frequency (HF) Communicationso   Satellite Communications (SATCOM)o   Wifi protocolso   Nano/Femto/Pico/Macro cellso   Mandatory experience - at least five years experience with cellular technologies including GSM, CDMA, HSPA+, UMTS, and LTEDesired Skills: Operational experience and familiarity with customer's tools and equipment for wireless missions Familiarity with signal and communications exploitation Background in SIGINT  Knowledge of IC mission functions by Agency Ability to train others Operational experience that has utilized/leveraged customer systems Experience interfacing with high level officials (GS15 and higher)Desired Experience: At least 8 years relevant experience in telecommunicationsRequired Education (Including Major):BS degree in a technical field - Bachelor of Science degree in Electrical Engineering, Computer Science, or Telecommunications related disciplines    Raytheon Company (NYSE: RTN), with 2011 sales of $25 billion, is a technology and innovation leader specializing in defense, homeland security and other government markets throughout the world. With a history of innovation spanning 90 years, Raytheon provides state-of-the-art electronics, mission systems integration and other capabilities in the areas of sensing; effects; and command, control, communications and intelligence systems, as well as a broad range of mission support services. With headquarters in Waltham, Mass., Raytheon employs 71,000 people worldwide.At Raytheon Intelligence and Information Systems (IIS), we transform data into knowledge. IIS is a leading provider of intelligence and information solutions, specializing in ground processing, unmanned ground systems, cybersecurity operations, homeland security and other markets to resolve the most complex problems for our customers worldwide. IIS employs more then 8,300 people worldwide with major hubs in the Mid Atlantic Region, Aurora, CO, and national Headquarters in Garland, TX, IIS generated $3 billion in 2011 revenues.    Raytheon is an equal opportunity employer and considers qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, color, creed, religion, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity and expression, age, disability, or Vietnam era, or other eligible veteran status, or any other protected factor.

Be an RF Transmission Systems Specialist in the Hawaii Air National GuardJob SummaryAs a member of the Air National Guard, you will deploy, maintain, troubleshoot and repair standard radio frequency transmission devices, including wireless, line-of-sight, wideband, and ground-based satellite and encryption transmission equipment. To qualify, youll need a high school diploma. Additional coursework in physics and mathematics is desirable. Knowledge of electronics, computers and communications devices also a plus. BenefitsServing part-time in the Air Guard, youll receive a regular monthly paycheck, along with low-cost life insurance, a military retirement plan, and eligibility for VA home loans. Youll also get money for college that is now transferable to your dependents through the Montgomery G.I. Bill. Plus, you may be able to serve where you live, without interrupting your civilian career. And as an Air Guard member, youll have access to Base Exchange and Commissary shopping as well as free, space available air travel.Learn More TodayVisit GoANG.com/HI or call 1-800-TO-GO-ANG to find out how you can experience the excitement and adventure of the Air Guard.

Primary Job Responsibilities:   To sell mobility application solutions and wireless data products and related services in a defined territory. To proactively identify, close and deliver wireless data and application solutions with particular emphasis in the customer's lines of business working with sales teams and account managers. Manage the assigned region or territory to drive mobility application solutions and wireless data products to assigned targets/quotas. Apply the wireless data line of business sales framework within the context of the region supported and ensure this framework is executed by the front line Account Execute. Proactively utilize in depth technical and sales expertise while leveraging the value proposition, case studies, work flow and ROI tools to drive wireless application sales and mobilizing customers business processes. In collaboration with assigned Sales Teams (Director, Sales Manager and Account Managers) develop plans to optimize wireless data sales in territory by proactively prioritizing targeted accounts and or solutions. Position self as the wireless data solutions and mobility applications Subject Matter Expert (SME) in territory. Proactively participate in wireless data and mobility application account and opportunity reviews with Sales management Provides responsive, timely and thorough responses to customers and sales people supported. Drive knowledge transfer to the sellers and customers on new wireless data solutions as needed. Build alliances, both internal and external with the mobility partner ecosystem and execute programs across functional organizations to successfully implement wireless data and application solutions. Develop, document and share best practices for selling wireless data and application solutions. Serve as the data and application lead on responses to RFX's and unsolicited proposals. Stay current and maintain a comprehensive knowledge of complex data products and AT&T Mobility Applications solutions and pricing. Demonstrate an understanding of key business and profit drivers for customers and identify solutions which complement their business objectives and mobilize their business. Utilize sales automation tools as appropriate. Provide timely and accurate account status reports, forecasts, opportunity funnel and business plans to sales leadership and operational teams as required. 5-7 years experience with demonstrated success in selling technology, applications and solutions sales  Excellent verbal, written, presentation and interpersonal skills. Proven ability to transfer knowledge to others. Well organized with attention to detail. Passion for winning. Ability to comfortably interact with senior leadership, customer executives and Presents professional image of self and Company. Strong technical knowledge in the following areas: Mobility Applications, Mobility Platforms and Operating Systems, VPN, WLAN, WWAN, LAN, TCP/IP, Routers, IP SEC, CDMA, GSM, GPRS, EDGE, UMTS, HSPA, LTE, 802.11, Application Demonstrated ability to quickly learn a technical product or service. History of success in consultative/applications selling to large accounts. Proven quota achievement acting in a solution sales and or sales support role. Versatile relationship skills in order to maintain strong bonds with people from a variety of backgrounds including technical, legal, marketing, product development, project management and sales. Excellent organizational skills which provide the ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously.

Looking for a dynamic and motivated software engineer to join the Connected Devices team.  We are the Internets leading provider of spoken audio programming  including books of any genre, magazines, radio shows, daily newspapers, and more. As a member of the team you will have the opportunity to help deliver our next generation of mobile products and content delivery platform. Titles downloaded are compatible with hundreds of mobile devices, including the Apple iPod, iPhone, iPad, Amazon Kindle, Android, Blackberry, Palm and more than 500 digital player and devices.  If you are a sharp, experienced software engineer with a creative edge, strong problem-solving skills, a solid software development foundation and the desire to be an individual contributor to our next generation technology, we want to talk with you.  The position requires a strong engineer with experience in architecting, development deployment and support of next generation applications and services for iPhone and iPad devices.  The ideal candidate should exhibit strong leadership qualities including excellent judgment, relentlessly high standards, can dive deep and remain in touch with business details, drives innovation in their teams, invokes passion in others, can think big, and delivers results. Responsibilities         Architect, Design, Build and operate scalable software systems and services for iOS devices, other connected devices, cloud services and client applications.         Propose, prototype and evaluate multiple areas of optimization in digital content delivery to a variety of clients, digital rights management, cloud based technologies, digital lockers, digital content discovery and digital fulfillment systems.         Build and deliver high availability/high reliability software on time.         Build and deliver secure, scalable, and low-latency services and applications for different mobile platforms.         Hands-on code contribution and shipping responsibility - libraries, API's, documentation.          Coordinate with other product teams for integration into their products.          Lead significant technical initiatives involving cross-functional teams.Qualifications          BS in Computer Science (MS preferred) plus significant experience (5+ years) with commercial software engineering experience, preferable in digital media or mobile applications and devices.         Proven track record of building and delivering mobile applications and services for iPhone, iPad or iTouch devices         In addition, candidate should posses solid experience programming in Java or C/C++, good current knowledge of Unix/Linux environments, mastering SOA principles with solid experience in code optimization and high performance computing         Strong knowledge of data structures, algorithms, and designing for performance, scalability, availability, and internet and mobile OS security fundamentals          Strong problem solving skills, adaptable, proactive and willing to take ownership.          Solid coding practices including good design documentation, unit testing, peer code-reviews, and a preference for agile methods.          Extensive knowledge of network protocols and internet/web technologies: HTML 5, Java Script, Flash, RTP/RTSP and in-depth familiarity with wireless networks architecture and technologies         Builds software solutions where the problem is not well defined. Capable of understanding the interaction between the components in a distributed system in order to ensure they are functioning properly.         Knowledge of modern best practices for professional software development including coding standards, code reviews, source control management, build processes, testing, and operations         Demonstrated ability to identify real-world user problems and build technology solutions to solve them         Experience in communicating with users, other technical teams, and management to collect requirements, describe software product features, and technical designs         Exhibits strong leadership qualities including excellent judgment, relentlessly high standards, can dive deep and remain in touch with business details, drives innovation in their teams, invokes passion in others, can think big, and delivers results         Management and execution of project plans and meeting delivery commitments.

!*!Sales Engineer 2The Sales Engineer 2 (SE2) supports regional Business sales teams with respect to voice and data products. As part of the sales team, the SE2 provides technical sales support and consulting to assure customer integration and implementation of established T- Mobile products and services.The SE2 is focused on pre-sales activities with both the Business Development Manager and the Account Manager Teams. Typical pre-sales activities include gaining an understanding of the customer's business and analyzing the customer's mobile communication requirements. The SE2 provides technical support in sales presentations, product demonstrations, as well as providing answers to customer's technical inquiries. The SE2 is responsible for architecting wireless solutions utilizing the T-Mobile network that meet customer needs. The SE2 is the wireless data subject matter expert on current and future wireless technologies. He/she works closely with Marketing and Engineering in support of network development efforts, alpha and beta evaluation tests, as well as new product rollouts.SE2 key objectives are:*   Achieve sales by helping the Business sales channel strategize and present products and services to enterprise customers*   Provide expert knowledge on data products and services offered T-Mobile through the Business Sales channel*   Support Product Development efforts by defining and implementing strategic solutions for enterprise dataResponsibilities of the SE2 are as follows:Pre-Sales Opportunities*   Support Business Development Manager and Account Managers*   Business Partner Sales partnering*   Architect a solution that fits customer's security model*   Close technical hurdles*   Facilitate wide scale device adoption*   Understand nuances and drivers*   Prepare and present technical customer presentations*   Present roadmaps*   Facilitate coverage analysis*   Provide market specific RFP technical input*   Strategize with Sales team to improve Regional/National sales*   Account reviews with existing customers*   In-building coverage solution management*   Owner of customer technical relationships*   Supports customer's pilotsTechnical Training*   Customer trainings*   Product and Network road-show/webinars*   Train TMO Sales force on Wireless data products in order to "sell the best solution" (i.e Tech Talks)*   GSM/GPRS and RIM certificationsProduct Testing*   Work with Product Development to ensure reliable enterprise focused products. This includes performing friendly user trials (FUTs) for device certification.*   RIM, Android and Window Mobile devices and software6-8 years in telecommunications, IT administration or network engineering roles with a professional track record of successful technical leadership involving network and application troubleshooting skills. Mandatory ability to make technical presentations at senior executive management level; ability to clearly present technical concepts in a non- technical way; excellent written and oral communication skills; strong goal attainment, organizational, time management, prioritization and people skills are essential; and ability and willingness to multi-task, manage, and work hard in a fast-paced, team environment.*   Understanding of and experience with the following:*   Domino/Exchange administration*   Routing protocols*   Remote access computing methods*   Layered communication protocols*   System administration roles*   Enterprise security architectures and principles*   IP and ATM networks*   Wi-Fi networks and design (802.11a/b/g)*   Experience with J2EE and/or .NET web applications development is preferred.    !*!Education & Experience:*   BSEE or BSCSE preferred. MIS or MSEE desired.*   Professional certifications and/or practical knowledge in at least one of the following areas required:*   Security Administrator: experience in firewall design and administration; knowledge of Checkpoint, PIX, Nokia, PKI, RSA, DES, Encryption, security management, etc.*   UNIX Systems Administration: experience in Solaris, Linux, PERL, Shell scripting, RADIUS, DNS, DHCP, etc.*   Windows Systems Administrator: experience in Exchange Server, Windows2000+Server, IIS, ISA, MIS, DHCP, DNS, etc.*   Corporate LAN Administrator: experience in routing and switching, LAN administration; certifications in MCP, MCP+1, MCSE, CNE, etc.*   WAN Network Engineering: experience in routing and switching, designing, building and optimizing layer 2 and 3 networks; desired certifications include CCNA, CCNP, CCDA, CCDP or related vendor-specific training*   TDMA, GSM, GPRS, EDGE, UMTS, HSDPA, 1XRTT or CDMA training or experience*   A valid driver's license and satisfactory driving record is mandatory.Based in Bellevue, Washington, T-Mobile USA, Inc. is a subsidiary of Deutsche Telekom AG (NYSE: DT) and one of the nation's leading companies in mobile communications. We serve more than 30 million customers nationwide on America's Largest 4G network and have more than 40,000 employees who work together to keep our customers connected through the quality of our service, the span of our coverage, the reliability of our network and the value of our plans. At T-Mobile, we pride ourselves on providing wireless communications that allow our customers to stick together with the people who mean the most to them.You can also expect that it will be high energy from day one at T-Mobile: career growth, personal recognition, and diversity are all part of the mix. You'll enjoy competitive pay, special employee phone plans, generous paid time off, tuition assistance, medical and dental coverage, a great company-matched 401 plan, advanced training, and more.T-Mobile is an equal opportunity employer (EOE). We strongly support diversity in the workforce.Req Number: 12004707

The Principal Technical Architect (PTA) is responsible for the end-to-end architecture for new Advanced Mobility Solutions products supporting business customers.
